Synonyms: Decreased number of large peripheral myelinated nerve fibres, Depletion of large myelinated fibers, Depletion of large myelinated fibres, Loss of large myelinated fibers, Loss of large myelinated fibres, Loss of larger myelinated nerve fibers, Loss of larger myelinated nerve fibres

Definition: Increased susceptibility to fatigue.
An axonal neuropathy of peripheral sensory nerves.
Synonyms: Axonal sensory neuropathy

Definition: A phenomenon whereby patients are not able to stand up without the use of the hands owing to weakness of the proximal muscles of the lower limbs.
Synonyms: Gower sign, Positive Gower sign, Positive Gowers sign

Definition: Wasting of thenar muscles, which are located on palm of the hand at the base of the thumb.
Synonyms: Thenar atrophy

Definition: Sudden and involuntary contractions of one or more muscles.
Synonyms: Muscle cramps

Definition: Dilated, glial-lined cavity in spinal cord. This cavity does not communicate with the central canal, and usually is between the dorsal columns unilaterally or bilaterally along the side of the cord.
Synonyms: Fluid-filled cyst in spinal cord, Syrinx

Term: Generalized hypotonia due to defect at the neuromuscular junction
Synonyms: Generalised hypotonia due to defect at the neuromuscular junction

Term: Abnormal synaptic transmission at the neuromuscular junction
Definition: Any abnormality of the neuromuscular junction, which is the synapse between the motor end plate of a motor neuron and the skeletal muscle fibers.
A type of onion bulb formation prominently affecting the area of the basal lamina.
Synonyms: Basal lamina 'onion bulb' formations on nerve biopsy

Definition: Abnormal sensations such as tingling, pricking, or numbness of the skin with no apparent physical cause.
Synonyms: Paresthesias, Pins and needles feeling, Tingling

Definition: An abnormal reduction in the amplitude of the miniature endplate potentials, i.e. the postsynaptic response to transmitter released from an individual vesicle at the neuromuscular junction.
Synonyms: Decreased MEPP, Small miniature endplate currents, Small miniature endplate potentials

Term: EMG: decremental response of compound muscle action potential to repetitive nerve stimulation
Definition: A compound muscle action potential (CMAP) is a type of electromyography (EMG). CMAP refers to a group of almost simultaneous action potentials from several muscle fibers in the same area evoked by stimulation of the supplying motor nerve and are recorded as one multipeaked summated action potential. This abnormality refers to a greater than normal decrease in the amplitude during the course of the investigation.
Synonyms: EMG: decremental response of CMAP to repetitive nerve stimulation

Term: Distal sensory impairment of all modalities
Definition: Reduced ability to sense pain, temperature, touch, vibration stimuli in the distal regions of the extremities.
Synonyms: Distal sensory loss to all modalities

Definition: Irregularity of the normally smooth surface of the proximal metaphysis of the femur.
Synonyms: Irregular proximal femoral metaphyses

Definition: An anomaly of the atlantoaxial joint, i.e., of the joint between the first (atlas) and second (axis) cervical vertebrae.
Partial dislocation of the atlantoaxial joint.
Synonyms: Atlanto-axial subluxation, Atlantoaxial subluxation

Definition: An abnormal narrowing of the spinal canal.
Synonyms: Narrow spinal canal, Spinal stenosis

Definition: Frontal schisis (cleft or cleavage) of vertebral bodies.
Synonyms: coronal cleft of vertebrae, Coronal clefts, Coronal vertebral clefts, Vertebral coronal clefts

Definition: An unpleasant sensation characterized by physical discomfort (such as pricking, throbbing, or aching) localized to the back.
Synonyms: Back pain

Definition: An unpleasant sensation characterized by physical discomfort (such as pricking, throbbing, or aching) localized to the lower back.
Synonyms: Lower back pain

Definition: An abnormality related to a defect of vertebral separation during development.
Synonyms: Abnormal spinal segmentation
Dorsolumbar kyphosis

Definition: Reduced amount of myelin in the central nervous system resulting from defective myelinogenesis.
A type of decreased nerve conduction velocity that affects the motor neuron.
Synonyms: Decreased motor NCV, Decreased motor nerve conduction velocities, Reduced motor nerve conduction velocity

Definition: An abnormal prolongation of the miniature endplate potentials, i.e. the postsynaptic response to transmitter released from an individual vesicle at the neuromuscular junction.
Synonyms: Prolonged MEPC, Prolonged MEPP, Prolonged miniature endplate potentials

Definition: Absence of the Achilles reflex (also known as the ankle jerk reflex), which can normally be elicited by tapping the tendon is tapped while the foot is dorsiflexed.
Synonyms: Absent ankle reflexes

Definition: A reduction in the size of nerve terminals.
Evidence of chronic denervation on electromyography.
The presence of characteristic findings of denervation on electromyography (fibrillations, positive sharp waves, and giant motor unit potentials).
Synonyms: EMG: neurogenic abnormalities, EMG: neurogenic changes, EMG: neurogenic findings

Definition: A reduction in the number of axons in the peripheral nervous system.
Reduced speed of conduction of the action potential along a sensory nerve.
Synonyms: Decreased sensory NCV, Decreased sensory nerve conduction velocities

Definition: Sudden and involuntary contractions of one or more muscles brought on by exposure to cold temperatures.
The presence of axonal regeneration following a previous axonal lesion.
Synonyms: Regenerative activity on nerve biopsy

Term: Increased rate of premature chromosome condensation
Definition: An increased rate of premature chromosome condensation.
The presence of autoantibodies in the serum that react against neutrophils.
Synonyms: Antineutrophil antibodies, Neutrophil antibody positive

Definition: The presence in the serum of autoantibodies directed against thrombocytes.
Synonyms: Platelet antibody

Term: Elevated circulating long chain fatty acid concentration
Definition: Increased concentration of long-chain fatty acids in the blood circulation.
Synonyms: Elevated long chain fatty acids, Elevated serum long-chain fatty acids, Increased serum long-chain fatty acids

Term: Low urinary cyclic AMP response to PTH administration

Definition: Abnormal results of investigations using electromyography (EMG).
Synonyms: Abnormal electromyography finding, Abnormal EMG, Electromyogram abnormal, EMG abnormalities

Definition: The presence of abnormal electromyographic patterns indicative of myopathy, such as small-short polyphasic motor unit potentials.
Synonyms: EMG: myopathic changes, EMG: myopathy, Myopathic electromyogram

Definition: A heterogeneous increase in IgM immunoglobulins characterized by a diffuse band on serum electrophoresis.
Undetectable serum immunoglobulin A level at a value < 5 mg/dL (0.05 g/L).
Synonyms: Decreased total IgA in blood, Total immunoglobulin A deficiency

Definition: Excretion of peptides conjugated to sialic acid in the urine.

Lipofuscin, a generic term applied to autofluorescent lipopigment, is a mixture of protein and lipid that accumulates in most aging cells, particularly those involved in high lipid turnover (e.g., the adrenal medulla) or phagocytosis of other cell types (e g., the retinal pigment epithelium or RPE; macrophage). This term pertains if there is an increase in the extraneuronal accumulation of lipofuscin (also known as autofluorescent lipoprotein) more than expected for the age of the patient.

Term: Paradoxical increased cortisol secretion on dexamethasone suppression test

Definition: Abnormally increased movement at the junction between the first cervical (atlas) and the second cervical (axis) vertebrae as a result of either a bony or ligamentous anomaly.
An abnormality of one or more of the vertebrae.
Synonyms: Abnormal vertebrae, Abnormality of the vertebrae, Vertebral anomalies

Definition: Defective structure and function of myelin sheaths. Dysmyelination is distinguished from demyleination where there is destruction or damage of previously normal myelination.

Paralysis of voluntary muscles means loss of contraction due to interruption of one or more motor pathways from the brain to the muscle fibers. Although the word paralysis is often used interchangeably to mean either complete or partial loss of muscle strength, it is preferable to use paralysis or plegia for complete or severe loss of muscle strength, and paresis for partial or slight loss. Motor paralysis results from deficits of the upper motor neurons (corticospinal, corticobulbar, or subcorticospinal). Motor paralysis is often accompanied by an impairment in the facility of movement.
Synonyms: Inability to move, Paralysis

Definition: Hyperexcitability of the neuromuscular system related to abnormally low level of calcium in the blood, resulting in carpopedal or generalized spasms.
A type of weakness that occurs after a muscle group is used and lessens if the muscle group has some rest. That is, there is diminution of strength with repetitive muscle actions.
Synonyms: Fatigable weakness of limb muscles, Generalised muscle weakness due to defect at the neuromuscular junction, Generalized muscle weakness due to defect at the neuromuscular junction, Myasthenia, Myasthenic weakness, Proximal muscle weakness due to defect at the neuromuscular junction

Definition: An abnormality of the primary sensation that is mediated by peripheral nerves (pain, temperature, touch, vibration, joint position). The word hypoesthesia (or hypesthesia) refers to a reduction in cutaneous sensation to a specific type of testing.
Synonyms: Sensory impairment

Definition: An abnormality characterized by disruption of the normal functioning of peripheral axons.
Synonyms: Axonal neuropathy, Axonal peripheral neuropathy

Definition: A segmental pattern of demyelination and regeneration (remyelination) affecting peripheral nerves.
Synonyms: Segmental demyelination/remyelination

Definition: Electromyographic (EMG) findings characteristic of axonal neuropathy, with normal or slightly decreased nerve conduction velocities, normal or slightly prolonged distal latencies, but significantly reduced motor potentials and sensory amplitudes. There may be spontaneous activity upon needle EMG studies, such as increased insertional activity, positive sharp waves, and fibrillation potentials.
Weakness of the muscles of the arms.
Synonyms: Decreased arm strength, Weak arm

Definition: Upturning of the big toe (and sometimes fanning of the other toes) in response to stimulation of the sole of the foot. If the Babinski sign is present it can indicate damage to the corticospinal tract.
Synonyms: Extensor plantar reflexes, Extensor plantar response, Extensor plantar responses, Positive Babinski sign

Definition: An abnormally increased diphosphate(4-) concentration in the urine. Diphosphate(4-), as ester with two phosphate groups, is also known as pyrophosphate.
An elevated concentration of a gonadotropin hormone (stimulating hormone or luteinizing hormone) in the urine, consistent with the diagnosis of primary hypogonadism.
The presence of autoantibodies in the serum that react against nuclei or nuclear components.
Synonyms: Antinuclear antibodies, Antinuclear antibody positive, Elevated antinuclear antibody, Serum antinuclear antibody

Definition: Cellular accumulation of GM2 gangliosides.
An abnormally increased level of immunoglobulin M in blood.
Synonyms: Increased IgM levels, Increased levels of IgM

Definition: A kind of short stature in which different regions of the body are shortened to differing extents.
Synonyms: Short stature, disproportionate

Definition: A mild degree of short stature, more than -2 SD but not more than -3 SD from mean corrected for age and sex.
Synonyms: short stature, mild

Definition: A kind of short stature in which different regions of the body are shortened to a comparable extent.
Synonyms: Proportionate small stature, Short stature, proportionate

Definition: A severe degree of short stature, more than -4 SD from the mean corrected for age and sex.
Synonyms: Dwarfism, Proportionate dwarfism, Severe short stature, Short stature, extreme, Short stature, severe

Term: Reduced ratio of renal calcium clearance to creatinine clearance
Definition: A reduction of the ratio of renal calcium clearance to creatinine clearance to below 0.01.
Synonyms: Reduced ration of kidney calcium clearance to creatinine clearance, Reduced ration of renal Ca clearance to creatinine clearance, Reduced ration of renal Ca2+ to creatinine clearance

Term: Deficiency or absence of cytochrome b(-245)
Synonyms: Deficiency or absence of cytochrome b
Fetal overgrowth, Foetal overgrowth

Definition: A type of disproportionate short stature characterized by a short trunk but a average-sized limbs.
Synonyms: Disproportionate short-trunked dwarfism, Disproportionate short-trunked short stature, Short-trunked dwarfism

Definition: A reduction in methionine synthase activity.
Synonyms: Decreased activity of methionine synthase, Methionine synthase activity decreased, Methionine synthase deficiency, Reduced methionine synthase activity

Definition: Formation of crystals owing to an increased concentration of orotic acid in the urine.
An increased concentration of prostaglandin in the urine.
Synonyms: High urine prostaglandin levels
Elevated calcitonin

Term: Parathormone-independent increased renal tubular calcium reabsorption
Definition: An increase in the reabsorption of calcium by the renal tubulus that is not associated with increased parathormone levels.
Synonyms: Parathormone-independent increased renal tubular Ca reabsorption, Parathormone-independent increased renal tubular Ca2+ reabsorption

Definition: An increased concentration of glutaric acid in the blood.
Synonyms: Glutarate acidemia, Glutaric acidemia

Definition: An increased concentration of ornithine in the urine.
Decreased level of acetaldehyde dehydrogenase (ALDH). ALDH and alcohol dehydrogenase (ADH) are the primary enzymes involved in alcohol metabolism.
Synonyms: Delayed oxidation of acetaldehyde

Definition: An abnormal reduction in xanthine dehydrogenase level.
An increased amount of 3-methylglutaconic acid in the urine.
Synonyms: 3-Methylglutaconicaciduria

Definition: An abnormality of Krebs cycle metabolism that is characterized by a decreased rate of fumarate hydratase activity.
An abnormally low level of uric acid in the blood.
Synonyms: Low blood uric acid levels

Definition: An increased level of iduronate-2-sulfatase activity in the blood.
Synonyms: Increased serum iduronate sulfatase level

Definition: An impairment in the rate and degree to which platelets aggregate after the addition of an agonist that stimulates platelet clumping. Platelet aggregation is measured using aggregometer to measure the optical density of platelet-rich plasma, whereby platelet aggregation causes the plasma to become more transparent.
Synonyms: Defective platelet aggregation, Deficient platelet aggregation, Platelet aggregation defect

Definition: Excretion of glycosaminoglycan in the urine. Glycosaminoglycans are long unbranched polysaccharides consisting of a repeating disaccharide unit.
An increased concentration of pyruvate in the blood.
Synonyms: Increased serum pyruvic acid

Definition: A functional motor deficit where individuals whose responses to the challenges of exercise fail to achieve levels considered normal for their age and gender.
Synonyms: Decreased ability to exercise, Inability to exercise, Low exercise endurance, Poor exercise tolerance

Definition: The shoulder, or pectoral, girdle is composed of the clavicles and the scapulae. Shoulder-girdle weakness refers to lack of strength of the muscles attaching to these bones, that is, lack of strength of the muscles around the shoulders.
Synonyms: Muscle weakness, shoulder-girdle, Shoulder girdle weakness, Shoulder weakness, Weak shoulder muscles

Term: Subsarcolemmal accumulations of abnormally shaped mitochondria
Definition: An abnormally increased number of mitochondria in the cytoplasma adjacent to the sarcolemma (muscle cell membrane), whereby the mitochondria also possess an abnormal morphology.
Any abnormality of the soft tissues, including both connective tissue (tendons, ligaments, fascia, fibrous tissues, and fat).
Localized fluid retention and tissue swelling caused by a compromised lymphatic system, affecting mainly the legs.
Reduced ability to climb stairs.
Synonyms: Difficulty walking up stairs

Definition: A condition in which muscles cannot be moved quickly without accompanying pain or spasm.
Atrophy (wasting) affecting primary type 2 muscle fibers. This feature in general can only be observed on muscle biopsy.
Synonyms: Type 2 fiber atrophy, Type 2 fibre atrophy, Type 2 muscle fibre atrophy

Definition: Fiber splitting or branching is a common finding in human and rat skeletal muscle pathology. Fiber splitting refers to longitudinal halving of the complete fiber, while branching originates from a regenerating end of a necrotic fiber as invaginations of the sarcolemma. In fiber branching, one end of the fiber remains intact as a single entity, while the other end has several branches.
Synonyms: Fiber splitting, Fibre splitting, Muscle fibre splitting

Term: Increased variability in muscle fiber diameter
Definition: An abnormally high degree of muscle fiber size variation. This phenotypic feature can be observed upon muscle biopsy.
Synonyms: Increased fiber size variation, Increased fibre size variation, Increased variability in muscle fiber size, Increased variability in muscle fibre diameter, Increased variability in muscle fibre size, Increased variation in fiber size, Increased variation in fibre size, Increased variation in muscle fiber size, Increased variation in muscle fibre size, Variation in muscle fiber size, Variation in muscle fibre size

Definition: Rhabdomyolysis induced by a viral infection.

The term dystrophy means abnormal growth. However, muscular dystrophy is used to describe primary myopathies with a genetic basis and a progressive course characterized by progressive skeletal muscle weakness and wasting, defects in muscle proteins, and histological features of muscle fiber degeneration (necrosis) and regeneration. If possible, it is preferred to use other HPO terms to describe the precise phenotypic abnormalities.

Synonyms: Birth length < 3rd percentile, Birth length <3rd percentile

Definition: An decreased concentration of low-density lipoprotein cholesterol in the blood.
Synonyms: Decreased circulating low-density lipoprotein levels, Decreased LDLc concentration, Hypobetalipoproteinemia

Definition: The presence of a folate sensitive fragile site at chromosome Xq28.

An increased erythrocyte sedimentation rate (ESR). The ESR is a test that measures the distance that erythrocytes have fallen after one hour in a vertical column of anticoagulated blood under the influence of gravity. The ESR is a nonspecific finding. An elevation may indicate inflammation or may be caused by any condition that elevates fibrinogen.
Synonyms: Elevated ESR, Elevated sedimentation rate, High erythrocyte sedimentation rate, High ESR, Increased erythrocyte sedimentation rate, Raised erythrocyte sedimentation rate

Definition: An increased concentration of prostaglandin E2 in the blood.
Synonyms: Elevated prostaglandin E2

Definition: A decreased level of glucose-6-phosphate isomerase.
Synonyms: Decreased glucose phosphate isomerase activity, Glucosephosphate isomerase deficiency, Phosphohexose isomerase deficiency

Definition: Absence of molybdenum cofactor(2-), a cofactor for enzymes including sulfite oxidase, xanthine oxidoreductase, and aldehyde oxidase.
Increased concentration of proprionic acid in the blood circulation.
A decreased concentration of citrulline in the blood.
Increased concentration of total (conjugated and unconjugated) bilirubin in the blood.
Synonyms: High bili total, Increased bilirubin

Definition: A positive response to the regitine blocking test consisting of a substantial reduction in blood pressure following administration of regitine, indicative of the presence of increased levels of epinephrine and norepinephrine in the circulation, which is seen in pheochromocytoma-associated hypertension.
An abnormally increased sodium concentration in the cytosol.
Synonyms: High intracellular Na, Increased intracellular Na+ levels

Definition: A phenotypic abnormality that is present at birth.
Synonyms: Onset at birth, Symptoms present at birth

Definition: Onset of disease manifestations in adulthood, defined here as at the age of 16 years or later.
Synonyms: Onset in adulthood, Onset in early adulthood, Symptoms begin in adulthood

Definition: A type of adult onset with onset of symptoms after the age of 60 years.
Gradual, very slow onset of disease manifestations.
Synonyms: Gradual onset

Definition: Onset of signs or symptoms of disease between 28 days to one year of life.
Synonyms: Infantile onset, Onset in first year of life, Onset in infancy

Definition: A type of adult onset with onset of symptoms at the age of 40 to 60 years.
Lack of urothione (the urinary metabolite of molybdenum cofactor) in the urine.
Increased concentration of 4-hydroxyphenylacetic acid in the urine.
Synonyms: Elevated urine 4-hydroxyphenylacetic acid level

Term: Foam cells with lamellar inclusion bodies
Definition: The presence of foam cells that contain lamellar inclusion bodies.
Increased cytoplasmic staining of fibroblasts with toluidine blue.
If positive, the ferric chloride test indicates an increased concentration of phenols in the urine or blood.
Synonyms: Positive FeCl3 test

Definition: The presence of circulating autoantibodies to phospholipids.
Synonyms: Antiphospholipid antibodies, Antiphospholipid antibody, Phospholipid antibody positivity

Definition: Increased concentration of trimethylamine in the urine.
Synonyms: High urine trimethylamine levels

Definition: Onset of signs or symptoms of disease between the age of 5 and 15 years.
Synonyms: Signs and symptoms begin before 15 years of age

Definition: Onset of signs or symptoms of disease within the first 28 days of life.
Synonyms: Neonatal onset, Onset in first weeks of life, Onset in neonatal period

Definition: Congenital lack of development of the muscles, which are then replaced by a mixture of dense fat and fibrous tissue.
Synonyms: Absent muscles since birth, Congenital absence of muscles

Term: Loss of subcutaneous adipose tissue in limbs
Definition: Loss (disappearance) of previously present subcutaneous fat tissue in arm or leg.
Synonyms: Loss of fat tissue below the skin in limbs, Loss of subcutaneous adipose tissue from extremities

Definition: An abnormal reduction in 4-hydroxyphenylpyruvate dioxygenase level.
Synonyms: Reducted HPPD activity

Definition: An increased concentration of adrenaline in the urine.
Synonyms: Increased urinary epinephrine

Definition: The presence of foam cells, a type of macrophage that localizes to fatty deposits on blood vessel walls, in the central nervous system.
The presence of free hemoglobin in the urine.
Synonyms: Haemoglobin in urine, Hemoglobin in urine

Definition: Abnormal transferrin isoform profile consistent with a type I congenital disorder of glycosylation. In the traditional nomenclature for congenital disorders of glycosylation, absence of entire glycans was designated type I, and loss of one or more monosaccharides as type II.
Synonyms: Abnormal isoelectric focusing of serum transferrin, type I pattern, Isoelectric focusing of serum transferrin consistent with CDG type I, Type 1 transferrin isoform profile

Definition: Abnormally reduced sulfite oxidase level.

Increased time to coagulation in the partial thromboplastin time (PTT) test, a measure of the intrinsic and common coagulation pathways. Phospholipid, and activator, and calcium are mixed into an anticoagulated plasma sample, and the time is measured until a thrombus forms.
Synonyms: Abnormal partial thromboplastin time, Delayed thromboplastin generation, Partial thromboplastin time prolonged, Prolonged activated partial thromboplastin time, Prolonged PTT

Definition: Abnormally increased concentration of hydrogencarbonate in the urine.
Synonyms: Increased urine bicarbonate concentration, Increased urine HCO3 concentration

Definition: A deficiency of the electron transfer flavoprotein-ubiquinone oxidoreductase.
An increased concentration of lactic acid in the urine.
Synonyms: High urine lactic acid levels, Increased urine lactate

Definition: Abnormality of glycoside metabolism.

The presence of foam cells, a type of macrophage that localizes to fatty deposits on blood vessel walls, where they ingest low-density lipoproteins and become laden with lipids, giving them a foamy appearance.
Synonyms: Foamy histiocytes, Foamy macrophages, Lipid-laden histiocytes, Presence of foam cells

Definition: Recurring episodes of myoglobinuria, i.e., of the presence of myoglobin in the urine. This is usually a consequence of rhabdomyolysis, i.e., of the destruction of muscle tissue.
Synonyms: Myoglobinuria, episodic, Myoglobinuria, recurrent

Definition: Metachromasia (also known as metachromacy) is a characteristic color change which certain aniline dyes exhibit when bound to particular substances or when concentrated in solution. For example, the basic dye toluidine blue becomes distinctly pink when bound to cartilage matrix. In the sense used here, the metachromasia refers to a change in color not observed with normal tissues, anomalous staining with the cationic dyes toluidine blue O and Alcian blue resulting from excessive amounts of the polyanionic glycosaminoglycans.
An abnormal reduction in dihydropyrimidine dehydrogenase (NADP+) level.
An abnormality of glycoprotein metabolism related to a decreased level of alpha-1,6-mannosylglycoprotein 2-beta-N-acetylglucosaminyltransferase activity.
Synonyms: Deficient N-acetylglucosaminyltransferase II

Definition: Reduced level of the enzyme beta-glucosidase, an enzyme that catalyzes the hydrolysis of glucosylceramide into ceramide and glucose.
Synonyms: Decreased lysosomal acid glucosylceramidase activity

Definition: A decreased concentration of methionine in the blood.
Synonyms: Decreased plasma methionine, Decreased serum methionine

Term: Amyotrophy of the musculature of the pelvis
Definition: Muscular atrophy affecting the muscles of the pelvis.
The age group in which disease manifestations appear.
Synonyms: Age of onset, Age symptoms begin

Definition: Applies to a disease manifestation that increases in scope or severity over the course of time, i.e., that worsens with age.
Synonyms: Worsens with time

Definition: Applies to a disease manifestation that only slowly increases in scope or severity over the course of time.
Synonyms: Signs and symptoms worsen slowly with time, Slow disease progression, Slow progression, Slowly progressive disorder

Definition: Applies to a disease manifestation that quickly increases in scope or severity over the course of time.
Synonyms: Rapid progression, Worsening quickly

Definition: Applies to a disease manifestation that does not increase in scope or severity over the course of time, i.e., that does not worsen with age.
Synonyms: Does not worsen, Non-progressive, Nonprogressive course, Nonprogressive disorder, Stationary

Definition: Applies to a disease manifestation that quickly increases in scope or severity with a rate that varies. For instance, progression may be slow in one time period and rapid in another.
An abnormality in which the nuclei of sarcomeres take on an abnormally central localization (or in which this feature is found in an increased proportion of muscle cells).
Synonyms: Central nuclei, Centralised nuclei, Centralised sarcomeric nuclei, Centralized nuclei, Centralized sarcomeric nuclei, Centrally nucleated skeletal muscle fibres

Definition: An abnormally reduced activity of the enzyme cytochrome C oxidase in muscle tissue.
Synonyms: Cytochrome c oxidase deficiency in skeletal muscle, Cytochrome C oxidase-negative muscle fibres, Decreased activity of cytochrome C oxidase in muscle tissue, Decreased skeletal muscle cytochrome c oxidase activity

Definition: The presence of multiple deletions of mitochondrial DNA (mtDNA).
Synonyms: Multiple mtDNA deletions

Definition: Reduced strength and weakness of the muscles of the arms and legs.
Synonyms: Limb muscle weakness, Limb weakness

Definition: Abnormal protrusion of the scapula away from the surface of the back.
Synonyms: Scapula alata, Winged scapulae, Winged scapulas, Winged shoulder blade

Definition: Muscular atrophy affecting muscles in the distal portions of the extremities.
Synonyms: Amyotrophy of distal limb muscles, Distal amyotrophy, especially of the hands and feet, Distal limb muscle atrophy, Distal muscle atrophy, Distal muscle atrophy, upper and lower limbs, Distal muscle degeneration, Distal muscle wasting, Distal muscular atrophy, Muscle atrophy, distal

Definition: Lack of strength of the proximal musculature occurring late in the clinical course.

Term: Absent epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the 5th finger
Definition: Absence of the epiphysis located at the proximal end of the distal phalanx of the 5th finger.
Synonyms: Absent end part of the outermost bone of the little finger, Absent end part of the outermost bone of the pinkie finger, Absent end part of the outermost bone of the pinky finger

Definition: Muscular atrophy in the distribution of shoulder girdle and peroneal muscles.
Synonyms: Scapuloperoneal atrophy
Difficulty in standing, Standing instability

Definition: Generalized (diffuse, unlocalized) amyotrophy (muscle atrophy) affecting multiple muscles.
Synonyms: Diffuse amyotrophy, Diffuse muscle atrophy, Diffuse muscle wasting, Diffuse skeletal muscle wasting, Generalised amyotrophy, Generalised muscle atrophy, Generalised muscle degeneration, Generalized muscle atrophy, Generalized muscle degeneration, Muscle atrophy, diffuse, Muscle atrophy, generalised, Muscle atrophy, generalized, Muscular atrophy, generalised, Muscular atrophy, generalized

Definition: A lack of strength of the proximal muscles.
Synonyms: Muscle weakness, proximal, Proximal limb muscle weakness, Proximal limb weakness, Weakness in muscles of upper arms and upper legs
Neurogenic scapuloperoneal syndrome

Definition: Enlargement of the muscles of the calf due to their replacement by connective tissue or fat.
Synonyms: Pseudohypertrophy of the calves

Definition: Sudden and involuntary contractions of one or more muscles brought on by physical exertion.
Synonyms: Exercise-induced muscle cramping, Exercise-induced muscle cramps, Muscle cramps following exercise, Muscle cramps on exercise, Muscle cramps on exertion, Muscle cramps with exertion

Definition: Abnormal increase in muscle size and mass not due to training.
Synonyms: Hypertrophic muscles, Increased skeletal muscle cells, Muscle hypertrophy, Muscular hypertrophy

Definition: Abnormal cell death involving muscle fibers usually associated with break in, or absence of, muscle surface fiber membrane and resulting in irreversible damage to muscle fibers.
Synonyms: Muscle fibre necrosis

Definition: Myofibrillar structural changes characterized by abnormal intracellular accumulation of the intermediate filament desmin and other proteins.
Synonyms: Myofibrillar changes
Generalised muscular appearance from birth
Minimal fat below the skin

Definition: Percussion-induced, local prolonged contractions (mounding) in muscle persisting for several seconds.
Hypertrophy (increase in size) of muscle tissue in a generalized (not localized) distribution.
Synonyms: Generalised increase in muscle cell size, Generalised muscle hypertrophy, Generalized increase in muscle cell size

Definition: Weakness of the muscles involved in neck flexion (sternocleidomastoid, longus capitus, longus colli, and scalenus anterior).
Synonyms: Neck flexion weakness, Neck flexor muscle weakness

Definition: Amyotrophy affecting the muscles of the shoulder girdle.
Synonyms: Shoulder girdle atrophy, Shoulder girdle muscle wasting, Shoulder-girdle muscle atrophy

Definition: Spontaneous, repetitive electrical activity demonstrated by electromyography (EMG).
Weakness of the quadriceps muscle (that is, of the muscle fasciculus of quadriceps femoris).
Synonyms: Quadriceps weakness

Definition: Muscle hypertrophy affecting the thighs.
Synonyms: Increased thigh size

Definition: The lysosomal-vacuolar pathway has a role in the controlled intracellular digestion of macromolecules such as protein complexes and organelles. This feature refers to the presence of an abnormally increased number of autophagic vacuoles in muscle tissue.
A type of myopathy associated with mitochondrial disease and characterized by findings on biopsy such as ragged red muscle fibers.
The occurrence of an unusually high amount of muscle pain following exercise.
Synonyms: Exercise-induced muscle pain, Muscle pain on exercise, Muscle pain with exercise, Muscle pain, exercise-induced

Definition: Myotonia that occurs after a period of rest and decreases with continuing exercise.

Synonyms: Muscular dystrophy, congenital

Definition: A type of autosomal dominant inheritance involving a gene that exhibits anticipation, the increase in severity and/or an earlier age of onset in subsequent generations.
Synonyms: Autosomal dominant with genetic anticipation

Term: Genetic anticipation with paternal anticipation bias
Definition: A type of genetic anticipation observed predominantly upon transmission from affected males.
Cases of the disease in question occur without a previous family history, i.e., as isolated cases without being transmitted from a parent and without other siblings being affected.
Synonyms: Isolated cases, No previous family history

Definition: Weakness of the muscles of the pelvic girdle (also known as the hip girdle), that is, lack of strength of the muscles around the pelvis.
Synonyms: Hip girdle muscle weakness, Hip girdle weakness, Hip-girdle muscle weakness, Pelvic girdle weakness

Definition: An abnormal, increased fatiguability of the musculature.
Recurrent episodes of muscle flaccidity, a type of paralysis in which a muscle becomes soft and yields to passive stretching.

Term: Type 1 fibers relatively smaller than type 2 fibers
Definition: The presence of abnormal muscle fiber size such that type 1 fibers are smaller than type 2 fibers.
Synonyms: Type 1 fibres relatively smaller than type 2 fibres

Definition: A reduced amount of fat tissue in the lowest layer of the integument. This feature can be appreciated by a reduced skinfold thickness.
Synonyms: Decreased subcutaneous adipose tissue, Decreased subcutaneous fat, Reduced fat tissue below the skin, Reduced subcutaneous fat, Scanty adipose tissue

Definition: Congenital underdevelopment of lymph vessels.
Synonyms: Underdeveloped lymphatic vessels

Definition: Mechanical percussion (i.e., striking a muscle with a reflex hammer) leads to spreading waves of muscle contractions that begin proximally and spread laterally across the muscle.
Formation of calcium deposits in any soft tissue.
Synonyms: Calcium buildup in soft tissues of body

Definition: A malformation of the uterus in which the uterus is present as a paired organ as a result of the failure of fusion of the mullerian ducts during embryogenesis.
Bruxism is characterized by the grinding of the teeth including the clenching of the jaw and typically occur during sleep, but also can occcur while the affected individual is awake.
Synonyms: Teeth grinding

Definition: A nevus is a type of hamartoma that is a circumscribed stable malformation of the skin.
Synonyms: Mole, Naevus

Definition: A skin abnormality characterized by redness and irritation, with thick, red skin that displays flaky, silver-white patches (scales).
Synonyms: Psoriasis

Definition: Episodes of muscle weakness.
Synonyms: Episodic paralysis

Definition: Pulp calcifications may appear as punctate calcifications, irregular, roughly spherical mineralized masses in any part of the pulp. It may occur isolated or associated to calcifications elsewhere such as the carotid arteries and kidneys. The diagnosis pulp calcifications can be established using radiological studies.
Synonyms: Pulp calcifications, Pulp denticles, Pulp stones, Pulpoliths

Definition: A degree of kidney failure severe enough to require dialysis or kidney transplantation for survival characterized by a severe reduction in glomerular filtration rate (less than 15 ml/min/1.73 m2) and other manifestations including increased serum creatinine.
Synonyms: Chronic renal failure, End stage renal disease, End stage renal failure, End-stage renal disease, End-stage renal failure, Stage 5 chronic kidney disease

Definition: Pili (from Latin pilus, hair) torti (from Latin tortus, twisted) refers to short and brittle hairs that appear flattened and twisted when viewed through a microscope.
Synonyms: Flattened and twisted hair
Short body and ramus of mandible, Short mandibular ramus, Underdeveloped mandibular rami
Deep antegonial notch of mandible, Large antegonial notch of mandible

Definition: Excessive production of saliva.
Synonyms: Excessive production of saliva, Excessive salivation, Hypersalivation, Mouth watering, Oversalivation, Ptyalism, Watery mouth

Definition: A body habitus that is tall, slim and underweight, with long legs and long arms (i.e., arm span exceeds height by 5 cm or more).
Decreased concentration of homovanillic acid (HVA) in the cerebrospinal fluid. HVA is a metabolite of dopamine.

Term: Type 1 and type 2 muscle fiber minicore regions
Definition: Multiple small zones of sarcomeric disorganization and lack of oxidative activity (known as minicores) in type 1 and type 2 muscle fibers.
Synonyms: Type 1 and type 2 muscle fibre minicore regions

Definition: Multiple small zones of sarcomeric disorganization and lack of oxidative activity (known as minicores) in muscle fibers.
Developmental hypoplasia (shortening) of middle phalanx of toe.
Synonyms: Short middle bones (feet), Short middle phalanges of toes

Definition: Irregularity of the iliac crest, which is the superior border of the wing of the ilium.
Muscular atrophy affecting the muscles of the limb girdle.
Synonyms: Wasting of limb-girdle muscle

Definition: Nemaline rods are abnormal bodies that can occur in skeletal muscle fibers. The rods can be observed on histological analysis of muscle biopsy tissue or upon electron microscopy, where they appear either as extensions of sarcomeric Z-lines, in random array without obvious attachment to Z-lines (often in areas devoid of sarcomeres) or in large clusters localized at the sarcolemma or intermyofibrillar spaces.
Synonyms: Nemaline rods
Marked delay in bone age, Marked retardation in skeletal maturation, Markedly retarded bone age

Term: Muscle abnormality related to mitochondrial dysfunction

Definition: An abnormal predominance of type I muscle fibers (in general, this feature can only be observed on muscle biopsy).
Synonyms: Type 1 muscle fibre predominance, Type I muscle fiber predominance, Type I muscle fibre predominance

Definition: Presence of abnormal vacuoles (membrane-bound organelles) in the sarcolemma. On histological staining with hematoxylin and eosin, rimmed vacuoles are popcorn-like clear vacuoles with a densely blue rim. The vacuoles are often associated with cytoplasmic and occasionally intranuclear eosinophilic inclusions.
Synonyms: Rimmed vacuoles on biopsy
Abnormal muscle tone

Definition: An abnormally reduced amount of adipose tissue in the thoracic cavity.
Death within the first 28 days of life.
Synonyms: Neonatal lethal

Definition: A variability of phenotypic features.
Synonyms: Clinical heterogeneity, Highly variable clinical phenotype, Highly variable phenotype, Highly variable phenotype and severity, Highly variable phenotype, even within families, Variable phenotype, Variable phenotypic severity

Definition: Death in during childhood, defined here as between the ages of 2 and 10 years.

Definition: Death of the fetus in utero after at least 22 weeks of gestation.
Synonyms: Late fetal death, Stillbirth, Stillborn

Definition: A variable severity of phenotypic features.
Synonyms: Variable severity

Definition: Description of conditions in which not all individuals with a given genotype exhibit the disease. Penetrance is the proportion that develop disease given a lifespan of 80 years.
Synonyms: Incomplete penetrance, Reduced penetrance

Definition: Description of conditions in which age of onset is typically later in life and in which penetrance is dependent on the age of the subject.
Synonyms: Age dependent penetrance, Age-dependent penetrance, Typified by age-related penetrance

Definition: A partial dislocation of the shoulder joint.

Definition: Formation of calcified tissue in the soft tissues surrounding the shoulder.

Definition: Deviated fingers is a term that should be used if one or more fingers of the hand are deviated from their normal position, either to the radial or ulnar side. Definition: Any abnormality of the skeletal muscle cell. Muscle fibers are subdivided into two types. Type I fibers are fatigue-resistant and rich in oxidative enzymes (they stain light with the myosin ATPase reaction), and type II fibers are fast-contracting, fatigue-prone, and rich in glycolytic enzymes (these fibers stain darkly). Normal muscle tissue has a random distribution of type I and type II fibers.
Synonyms: Abnormal muscle fibre morphology, Abnormal skeletal muscle fiber morphology, Abnormal skeletal muscle fibre morphology, Abnormality of muscle fibers, Abnormality of muscle fibres

Definition: Involuntary contractions of muscle leading to involuntary movements of extremities, neck, trunk, or face.
Synonyms: Involuntary movements, Involuntary muscle contractions

Definition: An abnormality of the endocardium.
Synonyms: Abnormality of the endocardium, Abnormality of the endomycoardium

Term: Abnormal anatomic location of the heart
Definition: Developmental defect characterized by an anomalous anatomic location of the heart.

Synonyms: Ventricular arrhythmias

Definition: An abnormality in which the cardiac ventricles depolarize too early as a result of an abnormality of cardiac conduction pathways such as an accessory pathway.
Synonyms: Pre-excitation syndrome, Preexcitation, Ventricular pre-excitation

Definition: An abnormality of macrophages.
Synonyms: Abnormality of histiocytes, Abnormality of macrophages

Definition: A reticulocyte abnormality.
Synonyms: Abnormality of reticulocytes

Definition: An abnormally decreased level of immunoglobulin in blood.
Synonyms: Decreased antibody level in blood, Decreased immunoglobulin level, Decreased serum immunoglobulin, Hypogammaglobulinemia, Immunoglobulin deficiency, Reduced immunoglobulin levels

Definition: An abnormally decreased level of immunoglobulin G (IgG) in blood.
Synonyms: Decreased gamma-globin expression, Decreased IgG level, Decreased IgG level in blood, Decreased immunoglobulin G, Decreased serum IgG, IgG deficiency, Reduced IgG levels

Definition: Abnormally reduced levels of aldosterone.
Synonyms: Decreased aldosterone, Decreased aldosterone production, Decreased serum aldosterone, Hypoaldosteronism, Low blood aldosterone level, Mineralocorticoid insufficiency

Definition: The presence of a fistula of the vagina.
The presence of a fistula connecting the urinary bladder to another organ or the skin. The fistula can involve the bowel, the vagina, or rarely, the skin.

A height below that which is expected according to age and gender norms. Although there is no universally accepted definition of short stature, many refer to "short stature" as height more than 2 standard deviations below the mean for age and gender (or below the 3rd percentile for age and gender dependent norms).
Synonyms: Decreased body height, Height less than 3rd percentile, Short stature, Small stature, Stature below 3rd percentile

Definition: An abnormal increase or decrease of weight or an abnormal distribution of mass in the body.
Synonyms: Abnormality of body weight

Definition: Abnormally increased body weight.
Synonyms: Increased body weight

Definition: Abnormally low body weight.
Synonyms: Decreased body weight, Decreased weight, Low body weight, Low weight, Weight less than 3rd percentile

Definition: Severe weight loss, wasting of muscle, loss of appetite, and general debility related to a chronic disease.
Synonyms: Wasting syndrome

Definition: Any structural anomaly of the vitreous body.
Synonyms: Abnormal vitreous humour morphology

Definition: An abnormality of the anterior segment of the eyeball (which comprises the structures in front of the vitreous humour: the cornea, iris, ciliary body, and lens).
Synonyms: Abnormal anterior segment morphology, Abnormality of the anterior segment of the eye, Abnormality of the anterior segment of the eyeball, Abnormality of the anterior segment of the globe

Abnormal morphology of the posterior segment of the globe, Abnormality of the posterior segment of the eye, Abnormality of the posterior segment of the eyeball, Abnormality of the posterior segment of the globe

Definition: An increase in the magnitude or amount of ossification of the skull.
Synonyms: Hyperossification of skull, Hyperostosis of skull, Sclerosis of bones of skull, Sclerosis of skull

Definition: A reduction in the magnitude or amount of ossification of the skull.
Synonyms: Decreased bone formation of skull, Deficient skull ossification, Hypoossification of skull, Ossification defect of skull, Poorly mineralized skull, Poorly ossified skull, Poorly ossified skull bones

Definition: An abnormality of lymphocytes.
Synonyms: Abnormal lymphocytes, Abnormality of cells of the lymphoid lineage

Definition: The presence of foam cells in the bone marrow, generally demonstrated by bone-marrow aspiration or biopsy. Foam cells have a vacuolated appearance due to the presence of complex lipid deposits, giving them a foamy or soap-suds appearance.
Synonyms: Bone marrow foam cells, Large vacuolated foam cells ('NP cells') on bone marrow biopsy, Large vacuolated foam cells on bone marrow biopsy

Definition: Partial or complete wasting (atrophy) of the skin.
Synonyms: Atrophic skin, Skin atrophy, Skin degeneration

Definition: The presence of excessive redundant myelin in the peripheral nerve sheath.
Synonyms: Excessive focal folding of myelin sheaths, Irregular myelin foldings

Definition: Abnormality of an amino acid metabolic process.

Term: Abnormal circulating aromatic amino acid concentration
Definition: Any deviation from the normal concentration of a aromatic amino acid in the blood circulation.
Synonyms: Abnormality of aromatic amino acid family metabolism

Term: Abnormal circulating sulfur amino acid concentration
Definition: Any deviation from the normal concentration of a sulfur amino acid in the blood circulation.
Synonyms: Abnormal circulating sulphur amino acid concentration, Abnormality of sulfur-containing amino acids
Abnormality of B-vitamin metabolism
Abnormality of the vitamin B12 metabolism

Definition: Abnormality of galactoside metabolism. A galactoside is a glycoside (a suger moiety bound to some other moiety) containing galactose.
An abnormality of glycosphingolipid metabolism.
Synonyms: Abnormality of glycosphingolipid metabolism

Definition: Defects in the lysosomal glycosidases or specific co-activators, result in accumulation of the substrates, such as glycosphingolipids, including gangliosides in GM1 gangliosidosis (Tay-Sachs disease) and GM2 gangliosidosis (Sandhoff disease).

Reduced function of the muscles required to generate subatmospheric pressure in the thoracic cavity during breathing: the diaphragm, the external intercostal and the interchondral part of the internal intercostal muscles.

This term applies to all changes in bone mineral density which (depending on severity) can be seen on x-rays as a change in density and or structure of the bone. Changes may affect all bones of the organism, just certain bones or only parts of bones and include decreased mineralisation as may be seen in osteoporosis or increased mineralisation and or ossification as in osteopetrosis, exostoses or any kind of atopic calicfications of different origin and distribution. The overall amount of mineralization of the bone-organ can be measured as the amount of matter per cubic centimeter of bones, usually measured by densitometry of the lumbar spine or hip. The measurements are usually reported as g/cm3 or as a Z-score (the number of standard deviations above or below the mean for the patient's age and sex). Note that measurement with this method does not reflect local changes in other bones, and as such might not be correct with regard the hole bone-organ.
Synonyms: Abnormality of bone mineralisation and ossification

Definition: A reduction of bone mineral density, that is, of the amount of matter per cubic centimeter of bones.
Synonyms: Decreased bone mineral density, Decreased bone mineral density Z score, Low solidness and mass of the bones

Definition: Any deviation from the normal concentration of a purine in the blood circulation.
Synonyms: Abnormal circulating purine level

Definition: Any deviation from the normal concentration of a pyrimidine in the blood circulation.
Any deviation from the normal concentration of a carboxylic acid in the blood circulation.
Any deviation from the normal circulation of leucine in the blood circulation.
A deviation from the normal concentration of a fatty acid in the blood circulation.
Synonyms: Abnormality of fatty acid metabolism

Definition: An abnormality of the balance or maintenance of the balance of acids and bases in bodily fluids, resulting in an abnormal pH.
An abnormal concentration of leptin in the blood.
Synonyms: Abnormality of circulating leptin level

Definition: An abnormality of the enteric nervous system, which comprises two types of ganglia, the myenteric (Auerbach's) and submucosal (Meissner's) plexuses. The enteric nervous system functions to control gut movement, fluid exchange between the gut and its lumen, and local blood flow.
Any deviation from the normal concentration of calcium in the blood circulation.
Synonyms: Abnormal blood calcium concentration, Abnormal blood calcium levels, Abnormal circulating Ca concentration, Abnormal circulating Ca2+ concentration

Definition: Any deviation from the normal concentration of a nitrogen compound in the blood circulation.
Any deviation from the normal concentration of tryptophan in the blood circulation.
Synonyms: Abnormality of tryptophan metabolism

Definition: An abnormality of glycolysis.

Abnormally elevated concentration of a purine compound. Purine compounds are aromatic heterocyclic compounds containing a purine moiety, which is formed a pyrimidine-ring ring fused to an imidazole ring.
Synonyms: Increased purine level, Increased purine levels

Definition: Abnormally reduced concentration of a purine compound. Purine compounds are aromatic heterocyclic compounds containing a purine moiety, which is formed a pyrimidine-ring ring fused to an imidazole ring.
Synonyms: Decreased purine level, Decreased purine levels

Definition: An abnormality of temperature homeostasis.
Synonyms: Abnormality of temperature regulation, Poor temperature regulation

Definition: Abnormality of glycosaminoglycan metabolism.

Synonyms: Disturbances of consciousness, Lowered consciousness, Reduced consciousness/confusion

Definition: A type of dystonia that is localized to a specific part of the body.

Loss of strength in the arm, leg, and sometimes face on one side of the body. Hemiplegia refers to a severe or complete loss of strength, whereas hemiparesis refers to a relatively mild loss of strength.
Synonyms: Paralysis or weakness of one side of body

Definition: A tumor (abnormal growth of tissue) of the nervous system.
Synonyms: Tumor of the nervous system, Tumour of the nervous system

Definition: A family of tumours arising in the embryonal remnants of the sympathetic nervous system, which includes neuroblastoma, ganglioneuroblastoma, and ganglioneuroma.
Synonyms: Neuroblastic tumour

Definition: Neoplasms located in the blood and blood-forming tissue (the bone marrow and lymphatic tissue).
Synonyms: Haematological neoplasm

Definition: Abnormality of the anal canal.
Synonyms: Abnormality of the anus

Definition: An abnormality of alkaline phosphatase level.
Synonyms: Abnormality of alkaline phosphatase activity, Abnormality of ALP level

Definition: Deposition of calcium salts in the aortic valve.
A pathological narrowing in the region above the aortic valve associated with restricted left ventricular outflow.
Abnormal calcification of the mitral valve.
Underdevelopment of the left side of the heart. May include atresia of the aortic or mitral orifice and hypoplasia of the ascending aorta.
Synonyms: Heart left ventricle hypoplasia, Left ventricular hypoplasia, Underdeveloped left heart

Definition: Truncus arteriosus (single great artery leaving the base of the heart, giving rise to the coronary, pulmonary, and systemic arteries) with a short pulmonary trunk arises from the truncus arteriosus, giving rise to both pulmonary arteries.
Synonyms: Persistent truncus arteriosus type I, Type 1 truncus arteriosus
Protracted diarrhoea

Definition: Inflammation of the alimentary part of the gastrointestinal system.
Synonyms: Gastrointestinal inflammation, GI inflammation

Definition: An inflammation of the colon and small intestine. However, most conditions are either categorized as Enteritis (inflammation of the small intestine) or Colitis (inflammation of the large intestine).
A colon of abnormally small caliber.

A functional rather than mechanical obstruction of the intestines, associated with manifestations that resemble those caused by an intestinal obstruction, including distension, abdominal pain, nausea, vomiting, constipation or diarrhea, in an individual in whom a mechanical blockage has been excluded.
Synonyms: Intestinal pseudoobstruction

Definition: Polyp-like protrusions which are histologically hamartomas. These can occur throughout the gastrointestinal tract. Hamartomatous polyps are composed of the normal cellular elements of the gastrointestinal tract, but have a markedly distorted architecture.
Synonyms: Gastrointestinal hamartoma, Hamartomatous polyps

Definition: A kind of congenital defect of the anterior abdominal wall in which the intestines are evident through the thin, lax, and protruding abdominal wall in affected infants.
Synonyms: Prune belly

Definition: A deficiency in the intake of energy and nutrients.
Synonyms: Malnutrition

Definition: A reduced desire to eat.
Synonyms: Decreased appetite, Loss of appetite, Poor appetite

Definition: Abnormal displacement or malposition of the anus.
Synonyms: Abnormal anus position, Anus malposition

Definition: The term peptic ulcer refers to acid peptic injury of the digestive tract, resulting in mucosal break reaching the submucosa. Peptic ulcers are usually located in the stomach or proximal duodenum, but they can also be found in the oesophagus or Meckel's diverticulum. Infection with Helicobacter pylori and the use of non steroidal antiinflammatory drugs (NSAIDs) or aspirin are the main risk factors of both gastric and duodenal peptic ulcers.
Synonyms: Sore in the lining of gastrointestinal tract

Definition: Congenital atresia of the pylorus.
An abnormality of the pylorus.
Obstruction of the intestine due to abnormally thick meconium.
Synonyms: Meconium ileus in neonates

Definition: An abnormality of the nipple.
Synonyms: Abnormality of the nipple
Prominent nipples
Recurrent epistaxes, Recurrent epistaxis, Recurring nosebleed, Spontaneous, recurrent nosebleed

Term: Abnormality of the sense of smell
Definition: An anomaly in the ability to perceive and distinguish scents (odors).
Synonyms: Abnormal sense of smell, Abnormality of olfaction, Abnormality of the sense of smell, Smell defect

Definition: A decreased sensitivity to odorants (that is, a decreased ability to perceive odors).
Synonyms: Decreased smell sensation, Sense of smell impaired

Definition: Positioning of the nasal septum to the right or left in contrast to the normal midline position of the nasal septum.
Synonyms: Crooked nasal septum, Crooked septum of nose, Deviated nasal septum, Deviated septum of nose

Definition: An abnormality of the pulmonary artery.
Synonyms: Abnormality of lung artery

Definition: An abnormal narrowing or constriction of the pulmonary artery, in the main pulmonary artery and/or in the left or right pulmonary artery branches.
Synonyms: Narrowing of lung artery
Premature atherosclerosis

Definition: Intermittent claudication is a symptom of peripheral arterial occlusive disease. After having walked over a distance which is individually characteristic, the patients experience pain or cramps in the calves, feet or thighs which typically subsides on standing still.
Inflammation of a vein associated with venous thrombosis (blood clot formation within the vein).
Repeated episodes of inflammation of a vein associated with venous thrombosis (blood clot formation within the vein).
Synonyms: Recurrent phlebitis, Recurrent thrombosis

Definition: The formation of a blood clot inside an artery.
Synonyms: Blood clot in artery

Definition: Abnormal increase in systolic blood pressure.
Synonyms: Elevated systolic BP

Definition: A narrowing of the biparietal diameter (i.e., of the transverse distance between the protuberances of the two parietal bones of the skull).

Cranium bifidum occultum, also known as Catlin mark, is a congenital midline skull defect presenting as an enlarged posterior fontanelle in the upper posterior angle of the parietal bone close to the intersection of the sagittal and lambdoid sutures.1, 2, 3 Cranium bifidum occultum occurs due to a defect in intramembranous ossification, a process through which skull bones (frontal, parietal, squamous temporal and occipital bones superior to the mendosal suture) ossify under a vascularized membrane toward the midline to cover the brain.1, 4, 5 Unlike cranium bifidum cysticum, cranium bifidum occultum does not have herniation of intracranial contents. As the skull grows, the midline cranium bifidum occultum defect is separated into bilateral enlarged parietal foramina (EPF) by a midline osseous bridge.
A forehead with abnormal flatness.
Synonyms: Flat forehead, Flattened forehead, Frontal flattening

Definition: An abnormality of the cheek- one of two bilateral soft tissue facial structures in the region of the face inferior to the eyes and between the nose and the ear. "Buccal" means relating to the cheek. The cheek is part of the midface
Synonyms: Abnormality of the cheek, Abnormality of the cheeks

Definition: This is a description previously used to describe a facial form characterized by a short, upturned nose, wide mouth, widely spaced eyes, and full cheeks. Because of the imprecision in this definition it is preferable to describe these features precisely. This term is retained because it was often used in the past, but it should not be used for new annotations.
Synonyms: Elf-like facial appearance, Elf-like facial features

Definition: Increased susceptibility to viral infections, as manifested by recurrent episodes of viral infection.
A type of primary immune deficiency that is characterized by a more severe defect in both the T- and B-lymphocyte systems.
Synonyms: Immunodeficiency, severe combined

Definition: An immunodeficiency defined by the absent or suboptimal functioning of one of the complement system proteins.
A lasting absence of total IgG and total IgA and total IgM in the blood circulation, whereby at most trace quantities can be measured.
Synonyms: Agammaglobulinaemia

Definition: Deficiency of secretory IgA (polymers of 2-4 IgA monomers are linked by two additional chains) and is the primary antibody response at the mucosal level, where it forms immune complexes with pathogens and allergens.
A reduced level of the complement component C8 in circulation.
Synonyms: C8 deficiency

Definition: Excessive growth of the bones of cranium, i.e., of the skull.
Synonyms: Hyperostosis of cranial bones, Hyperostosis of cranial vault, Increased ossification of cranial bones

Definition: Bony overgrowth of the internal (endosteal) surface of the frontal bone.
Synonyms: Excessive growth of inner surface of the frontal bone, Hyperostosis of the internal surface of the frontal bone, Overgrowth of the inner surface of the frontal bone

Definition: A characteristic appearance resulting from defective ossification of craniofacial bones.
Synonyms: Crouzon syndrome

Definition: Premature closure of the coronal suture of skull.
Synonyms: Coronal suture craniosynostosis, Coronal suture synostosis, Craniosynostosis of coronal suture

Definition: A kind of craniosynostosis affecting the sagittal suture.

Definition: A kind of craniosynostosis affecting the lambdoidal suture.
Synonyms: Lambdoid suture craniosynostosis, Lambdoid suture synostosis

Definition: The presence of erythrocytes that are sphere-shaped.
The presence of elliptical, cigar-shaped erythrocytes on peripheral blood smear.
Synonyms: Ovalocytes, Ovalocytosis

Definition: The presence of erythrocytes with a mouth-shaped (stoma) area of central pallor on peripheral blood smear.
Synonyms: erythrocyte stomatocytes, Red cell stomatocytosis

Definition: The presence of abnormally shaped erythrocytes.

Hepatic failure refers to the inability of the liver to perform its normal synthetic and metabolic functions, which can result in coagulopathy and alteration in the mental status of a previously healthy individual. Hepatic failure is defined as fulminant if there is onset of encephalopathy within 4 weeks of the onset of symptoms in a patient with a previously healthy liver.
A groove of the skin immediately in front of the ear.
Synonyms: Preauricular skin furrows, Preauricular skin groove, Preauricular skin sulcus, Skin groove in front of the ear, Skin sulcus in front of the ear

Definition: A rudimentary tag of ear tissue often containing a core of cartilage and located just in back of the auricle (outer part of the ear).
Synonyms: Postauricular acrochordon, Postauricular fibroepithelial polyp, Skin tag behind the ear

Term: Abnormality of the middle ear ossicles
Definition: An abnormality of the middle-ear ossicles (three small bones called malleus, incus, and stapes) that are contained within the middle ear and serve to transmit sounds from the air to the fluid-filled labyrinth (cochlea).
Synonyms: Malformed ossicles, Ossicular malformation

Definition: A condition in which the superior portion of the helix is folded over to a greater degree than normal.
Synonyms: Overfolding of superior helix

Definition: The presence of a dilated inner part of external acoustic meatus.
Synonyms: Bulbous internal auditory canal, Enlarged internal auditory canal

Term: Exostosis of the external auditory canal
Definition: A benign bony growth projecting outward from a bone surface within the external auditory canal.
Synonyms: External auditory canal exostoses

Definition: Pits in the earlobes at the location where ears are typically pierced for earrings.
Lack of measurable response to stimulation of auditory evoked potentials.
Synonyms: No auditory brainstem response

Definition: Benign congenital lesion of the postauricular soft tissue consisting of a blind-ending narrow tube or pit.
Synonyms: Pit behind the ear, Postauricular earpits, Postauricular fistula, Posterior auricular pit, Posterior auricular sinus

Definition: Small indentation anterior to the insertion of the ear.
Synonyms: Ear pit, Pit in front of the ear, Preauricular earpits, Preauricular fistulas, Preauricular pits, Preauricular sinus

Definition: An abnormality of the C-shaped rings of hyaline cartilage, normally 16 to 20 in number, that occupy the anterior two-thirds of the circumference of the trachea (the posterior portion of the ring is completed by fibrous and smooth muscle tissue).
Synonyms: Abnormal tracheal cartilaginous ring

Definition: Chronic inflammation of the bronchi.
A congenital defect in the occipital region of the skull, covered by skin of the scalp and containing meninges or remnants of glial or neural tissues.

Term: Aplasia cutis congenita over the scalp vertex
Definition: A developmental defect resulting in the congenital absence of skin on the scalp vertex, often just lateral to the midline.
Synonyms: Absent cutis congenita of vertex, Aplasia cutis congenita of vertex

Definition: Hyperostosis (bony overgrowth) of the mandible.
Synonyms: Hyperostosis of lower jaw, Hyperostosis of mandibular bone, Increased ossification of mandibular bone

Definition: The anterior fontanelle generally ossifies by around the 18th month of life. A persistent open anterior fontanelle is diagnosed if closure is delayed beyond this age.
Synonyms: Front fontanelle stays open, Persistent, open anterior fontanel

Term: Aplasia cutis congenita over parietal area
Definition: A developmental defect resulting in the congenital absence of skin on the scalp in the parietal area.
Synonyms: Absent cutis congenita over parietal area

Definition: The progressive development of an abnormally large skull.
Synonyms: Macrocephaly, progressive, Progressively abnormally enlarging cranium, Progressively abnormally enlarging skull

Definition: A relatively mild degree of macrocephaly in which the head circumference is not above two standard deviations from the mean, but appears dysproportionately large when other factors such as body stature are taken into account.
Synonyms: Disproportionately large head, Macrocephaly, relative, Relatively large head

Definition: Asymmetry of the bones of the skull and the face.
Synonyms: Uneven craniofacial structures

Definition: Stagnation of head growth seen as flattening of the head circumference curve.
Synonyms: Cranium stopped growing, Head stopped growing

Definition: An abnormality of head shape characterized by the presence of a short, wide head as well as a pointy or conical form of the top of the head owing to premature closure of the coronal and lambdoid sutures.
The presence of an abnormally large skull with onset at birth.
Synonyms: Big cranium present at birth, Big cranium present since birth, Big skull present at birth, Big skull present since birth, Congenital large cranium, Congenital large skull, Congenital macrocephaly, Head circumference large for gestational age, Large cranium present at birth, Large cranium present since birth, Large skull present at birth, Large skull present since birth

Definition: Excessive growth of the calvaria.
Synonyms: Hyperostosis of calvarial bones, Increased ossification of calvarial bones, Overgrowth of skullcap

Definition: An enlargement of the posterior fontanelle relative to age-dependent norms.

Definition: An abnormally increased width of the cranial fontanelles and sutures.
Synonyms: Widely patent fontanels and sutures

Definition: Excessive growth of the craniofacial bones.
Synonyms: Excessive bone growth of the skull and face, Hyperostosis of craniofacial bones, Increased ossification of craniofacial bones

Term: Chronic rhinitis due to narrow nasal airway
Synonyms: Chronic nasal inflammation due to narrow nasal airway

Definition: Bilateral absence (atresia) of the posterior nasal aperture (choana).
Synonyms: Bilateral blockage of the rear opening of the nasal cavity, Bilateral obstruction of the rear opening of the nasal cavity

Definition: Hyperplasia of the islets of Langerhans, i.e., of the regions of the pancreas that contain its endocrine cells.
Synonyms: Hyperplastic islets of langerhans, Hypertrophic pancreatic islets, Islet of Langerhans hyperplasia, Islets of langerhans hypertrophy, Pancreatic islet-cell hypertrophy

Definition: Reduced or lacking hair growth in the temporal region (i.e., around the temples on the side of the skull).

Term: Large clumps of pigment irregularly distributed along hair shaft
Synonyms: Large clumps of pigment irregularly distributed along hair shaft

Definition: Reduced or lacking hair growth in a generalized distribution.

Definition: A confluent, generalized overgrowth of silvery blonde to gray lanugo hair at birth.
Synonyms: Congenital generalised hypertrichosis, Congenital generalized hypertrichosis, Congenital, generalised hypertrichosis, Hypertrichosis universalis

Definition: Generalized excessive, abnormal hairiness.
Synonyms: Generalised hypertrichosis

Definition: A flattened vertebral body shape with reduced distance between the vertebral endplates affecting the cervical spine.

Definition: Increased bone density affecting the bones of the spine (vertebral column).
Synonyms: Increased density of spinal bone, Ivory spinal bone
platyspondyly, extreme

Definition: Bulbous appearance of the anterior vertebral bodies, such that the vertebral bodies have the greatest vertical height anteriorly as well as bulbous anterior superior-inferior contours.
Synonyms: Pear-shaped vertebral bodies

Definition: Anterior tongue-like protrusions of the vertebral bodies.
Synonyms: anterior beaking, Anterior beaking of vertebrae, Anterior beaking of vertebral bodies, Beaked vertebral bodies, Vertebral tongue-like protrusion

Definition: Increased top to bottom height of vertebral bodies.
Synonyms: Tall vertebral bodies

Definition: An abnormality of the shape of the thoracic vertebra T11 such that it is wedge-shaped (narrow towards the front).
Synonyms: Anterior wedging of the 11th thoracic vertebra, Wedge-shaped 11th thoracic vertebra

Definition: Sclerosis (increased density) affecting vertebral end plates.

Definition: An excessive concavity of the anterior surface of one or more vertebral bodies.
Exaggerated concavity of the anterior or posterior surface of the vertebral body, i.e., the upper and lower vertebral endplates are hollowed inward.
Synonyms: Biconcave 'codfish' vertebrae, Biconcave vertebrae, Codfish vertebrae, Fish vertebrae, Scalloping of vertebral bodies
Small sacrum

Definition: A flattened vertebral body shape with reduced distance beween the vertebral endplates affecting the thoracic spine.

Term: Hump-shaped mound of bone in central and posterior portions of vertebral endplate

Definition: Three ossification sites are present in typical vertebral bodies (C3-L5): a single ossification center in the vertebral body, and one each in the two neural arches. This term applies if there are additional vertebral ossification centers present during the development and maturation of the spine.
Synonyms: Supernumerary vertebral ossification centres

Term: Absent or minimally ossified vertebral bodies

Definition: The closed form of spina bifida with incomplete closure of the vertebra L5 with intact overlying skin.

Fusion of cervical vertebrae at C2 and C3, caused by a failure in the normal segmentation or division of the cervical vertebrae during the early weeks of fetal development, leading to a short neck with a low hairline at the back of the head, and restricted mobility of the upper spine.
Synonyms: Fusion of cervical vertebrae c2-3, Klippel-Feil anomaly, Klippel-Feil syndrome

Definition: A lack of bone mineralization of the vertebral bodies.
A lack of ossification of the vertebral bodies.

Term: Anterior beaking of lower thoracic vertebrae
Definition: Anterior tongue-like protrusions of the lower thoracic vertebral bodies.
Anterior mislocalization of the dens of the axis.
An abnormal narrowing of the lumbar spinal canal.
Synonyms: Lumbar spinal stenosis, Narrow lumbar spinal canal
Anteriorly concave vertebrae

Definition: The closed form of spina bifida with incomplete closure of S1 with intact overlying skin.
A discontinuity of the vertebral arch, i.e., of the posterior part of a vertebra.
Butterfly vertebrae have a cleft through the body of the vertebrae and a funnel shape at the ends.
Increased size of the vertebral pedicle.
Synonyms: Hyperplastic vertebral pedicles

Definition: A progressive form of decreased height of the intervertebral disk.
Presence of abnormal convexity of the upper and lower end plates of the vertebrae, i.e., an exaggerated bulging out of the upper and lower vertebral end plates.
Reduced size of cervical vertebrae.
Synonyms: Small cervical vertebrae

Definition: Anterior tongue-like protrusions of thoracic vertebral bodies.

Term: Decreased cervical spine flexion due to contractures of posterior cervical muscles
Synonyms: Contracture of post-cervical muscles

Definition: An abnormality related to a defect of vertebral separation of cervical vertebrae during development.
Synonyms: Cervical spine segmentation defect

Definition: Over curvature of the lower thoracic region, leading to a round back or if sever to a hump.

Definition: Fusion of the C5 and C6 cervical vertebrae.

Definition: An elevation of alpha-feto protein measured in the amniotic fluid.
Synonyms: Elevated amniotic fluid alpha fetal protein, Elevated amniotic fluid alpha foetal protein, Elevated amniotic fluid alpha-1-fetoprotein, Elevated amniotic fluid alpha-fetoglobulin

Definition: Underdevelopment of the nasal bone.

Definition: Underdevelopment of one or more muscles innervated by the facial nerve (the seventh cranial nerve).

Definition: Reduced strength of the frontalis muscle (which is located on the forehead).
Synonyms: Weak frontalis muscle, Weakness of forehead muscle

Definition: Hemangioma, a benign tumor of the vascular endothelial cells, occurring in the midline region of the face.
A reduced degree of voluntary and involuntary facial movements involved in responded to others or expressing emotions.

Large ankle bones

Definition: Narrow, paramedian longitudinal depressions in the plantar skin of the forefoot.
Synonyms: Longitudinal groove on soles

Underdevelopment of the Third metatarsal bone leading to a short (hypoplastic) third metatarsal bone.
Synonyms: Hypoplasia of the 3rd metatarsal bone, Short 3rd long bone of foot

Definition: Short fourth metatarsal bone.
Synonyms: Bilateral fourth metatarsal shortening, Short 4th long bone of foot, Short fourth metatarsus

A type of atrial arrhythmia characterized by atrial rates of between 240 and 400 beats per minute and some degree of atrioventricular node conduction block. Typically, the ventricular rate is half the atrial rate. In the EKG; atrial flutter waves are observed as sawtooth-like atrial activity. The term Maturity-onset diabetes of the young (MODY) was initially used for patients diagnosed with fasting hyperglycemia that could be treated without insulin for more than two years, where the initial diagnosis was made at a young age (under 25 years). Thus, MODY combines characteristics of type 1 diabetes (young age at diagnosis) and type 2 diabetes (less insulin dependence than type 1 diabetes). The term MODY is now most often used to refer to a group of monogenic diseases with these characteristics. Here, the term is used to describe hyperglycemia diagnosed at a young age with no or minor insulin dependency, no evidence of insulin resistence, and lack of evidence of autoimmune destruction of the beta cells.
Synonyms: Maturity onset diabetes of the young

Aortic dilatation refers to a dimension that is greater than the 95th percentile for the normal person age, sex and body size. In contrast, an aneurysm is defined as a localized dilation of the aorta that is more than 150 percent of predicted (ratio of observed to expected diameter 1.5 or more). Aneurysm should be distinguished from ectasia, which represents a diffuse dilation of the aorta less than 50 percent of normal aorta diameter.
