Term: Gait instability, worse in the dark
Synonyms: Unstable walking, worse in the dark

Definition: Periventricular leukomalacia is characterized by diffuse injury of deep cerebral white matter, accompanied in its most severe form by focal necrosis. The neuropathologic hallmarks of PVL are microglial activation and focal and diffuse periventricular depletion of premyelinating oligodendroglia.
Synonyms: PVL

Definition: A type of encephalopathy (brain disease, damage, or malfunction accompanied by an altered mental state) that is characterized by evidence of necrosis of brain tissue.

Synonyms: Grammar-specific speech disorder

Definition: Any abnormal alteration of an individual's circadian rhythm that affects the timing of sleeping and being awake.
Synonyms: Sleep-wake cycle disturbance

Definition: Leukoencephalopathy that gets more severe with time.
Synonyms: Leukoencephalopathy, progressive
Uncontrollable movement in upper arms

Definition: A type of holoprosencephaly characterized by the presence of a single ventricle and no separation of the cerebral hemisphere. The single midline ventricle is often greatly enlarged.

Dysplasia and dysgenesis of the corpus callosum are nonspecific descriptions that imply defective development of the corpus callosum. The term dysplasia is applied when the morphology of the corpus callosum is altered as a congenital trait. For instance, the corpus callosum may be hump-shaped, kinked, or a striped corpus callosum that lacks an anatomically distinct genu and splenium.
Synonyms: Dysgenesis of corpus callosum, Dysplasia of corpus callosum

Definition: A type of gliosis that occurs in the vicinity of injured neurons.
Focal proliferation of glial cells in the basal ganglia.
Synonyms: Gliosis in the basal ganglia

Term: Loss of Purkinje cells in the cerebellar vermis

Definition: Progressive impairment of function of motor axons with muscle weakness, atrophy, and cramps. The deficits are length-dependent, meaning that muscles innervated by the longest nerves are affected first, so that for instance the arms are affected at a later age than the onset of deficits involving the lower leg.
The formation of small cavities in the tissue of the basal ganglia.

Synonyms: CNS degeneration

Definition: An abnormality of the ability (skills) to perform a precise movement of small muscles with the intent to perform a specific act. Fine motor skills are required to mediate movements of the wrists, hands, fingers, feet, and toes.
Synonyms: Fine motor disability, Fine motor impairment, Fine motor skill dysfunction, Impaired fine motor skills

Definition: Paralysis of the fourth cranial (trochlear) nerve manifested as weakness of the superior oblique muscle which causes vertical diplopia that is maximal when the affected eye is adducted and directed inferiorly.
Synonyms: Trochlear nerve palsy

Definition: An abnormality of the ability (skills) to perform a precise movement of large muscles with the intent to perform a specific act. Gross motor skills are required to mediate movements of the arms, legs, and other large body parts.

Definition: Attention deficit hyperactivity disorder (ADHD) manifests at age 2-3 years or by first grade at the latest. The main symptoms are distractibility, impulsivity, hyperactivity, and often trouble organizing tasks and projects, difficulty going to sleep, and social problems from being aggressive, loud, or impatient.
Synonyms: ADHD, Attention deficit, Attention deficit disorder, Attention deficit-hyperactivity disorder, Attention deficits, Childhood attention deficit/hyperactivity disorder

Definition: Inability to perceive painful stimuli.
Synonyms: Absence of pain sensation

Definition: Cerebral hemorrhage that occurs before birth.
Synonyms: Antenatal intracerebral haemorrhage

Definition: Bilateral impairment of the function of the cranial nerves 9-12, which control musculature involved in eating, swallowing, and speech. Pseudobulbar paralysis is characterized clinically by dysarthria, dysphonia, and dysphagia with bifacial paralysis, and may be accompanied by Pseudobulbar behavioral symptoms such as enforced crying and laughing.
Synonyms: Pseudobulbar palsy, Pseudobulbar syndrome

Definition: A morphological abnormality of the metencephalon.
A small, sac-like aneurysm (outpouching) of a cerebral blood vessel.
Synonyms: Cerebral saccular aneurysm

Definition: Cerebellar dysplasia (abnormal growth or development) is defined by abnormal cerebellar foliation, white matter arborization, and gray-white matter junction. Cerebellar dysplasia is a neuroimaging finding that describes abnormalities of both the cerebellar cortex and white matter and is associated with variable neurodevelopmental outcome. Dysplasia may globally involve the cerebellum or affect only one cerebellar hemisphere. In addition, cerebellar dysplasia may be associated with cortical/subcortical cysts.

Synonyms: Generalised hyperreflexia
Underdeveloped olfactory tract

Term: Symmetric lesions of the basal ganglia

Definition: Meningitis that persists for more than 4 weeks, and lymphocytes are present in the cerebrospinal fluid (CSF).
Partial or complete wasting (loss) of dentate nucleus.
Increased size of the basal ganglia.
Hyperactive stretch reflexes of muscles that move proximal joints (elbow, knee).
Synonyms: Hyperreflexia proximally

Definition: Generalized atrophy or hypoplasia of the cerebrum.
Synonyms: Generalised cerebral atrophy/hypoplasia, Generalised cerebral degeneration/underdevelopment, Generalized cerebral degeneration/underdevelopment

Definition: A form of gray matter heterotopia were the mislocalized gray matter is typically located periventricularly, also sometimes called subependymal heterotopia. Periventricular means beside the ventricles. This is by far the most common location for heterotopia. Subependymal heterotopia present in a wide array of variations. There can be a small single node or a large number of nodes, can exist on either or both sides of the brain at any point along the higher ventricle margins, can be small or large, single or multiple, and can form a small node or a large wavy or curved mass.

Definition: An atypical absence seizure is a type of generalised non-motor (absence) seizure characterised by interruption of ongoing activities and reduced responsiveness. Although not always available, an EEG often demonstrates slow (<3 Hz), irregular, generalized spike-wave activity.

An abnormality of somatosensory evoked potentials (SSEP), i.e., of the electrical signals of sensation going from the body to the brain in response to a defined stimulus. Recording electrodes are placed over the scalp, spine, and peripheral nerves proximal to the stimulation site. Clinical studies generally use electrical stimulation of peripheral nerves to elicit potentials. SSEP testing determines whether peripheral sensory nerves are able to transmit sensory information like pain, temperature, and touch to the brain. Abnormal SSEPs can result from dysfunction at the level of the peripheral nerve, plexus, spinal root, spinal cord, brain stem, thalamocortical projections, or primary somatosensory cortex.
Synonyms: Abnormality of SSEPs

Definition: The term collodion baby applies to newborns who appear to have an extra layer of skin (known as a collodion membrane) that has a collodion-like quality. It is a descriptive term, not a specific diagnosis or disorder (as such, it is a syndrome). Affected babies are born in a collodion membrane, a shiny waxy outer layer to the skin. This is shed 10-14 days after birth, revealing the main symptom of the disease, extensive scaling of the skin caused by hyperkeratosis. With increasing age, the scaling tends to be concentrated around joints in areas such as the groin, the armpits, the inside of the elbow and the neck. The scales often tile the skin and may resemble fish scales.

Definition: A congenital defect of development characterized by absence of the lacrimal gland.
Synonyms: Absent tear gland

Definition: Opacity of the entire lens nucleus.

Synonyms: Decreased central vision, Decreased clarity of vision, Decreased visual acuity, Poor visual acuity

Definition: Abnormally curly or curved eyelashes.
Synonyms: Curly eyelashes

Definition: Degenerative changes of the peripheral retina consisting of close-packed tiny cystic spaces at the outer plexiform/inner nuclear retinal level. The degeneration is very common in adult eyes and starts adjacent to the ora serrata and extends circumferentially and posteriorly.
Synonyms: Cystic retinal degeneration, Peripheral cystoid degeneration

Definition: An abnormality of the vestibulo-ocular reflex (VOR). The VOR attempts to keep the image stable on the retina. Ideally passive or active head movements in one direction are compensated for by eye movements of equal magnitude.
Synonyms: Abnormal vestibuloocular reflex
Progressive night blindness

Definition: Congenital underdevelopment of the iris.
Synonyms: Hypoplastic iris, Iris hypoplasia, Underdeveloped iris

Definition: Vitelliform maculopathy is a sharply demarcated lesion caused by the accumulation of material, often lipofuscin in the subretinal space underlying the macula.
Synonyms: Vitelliform macular lesions

Definition: Narrowing of a tear duct (lacrimal duct).
Synonyms: Narrowing of the tear duct, Nasolacrimal duct stenosis

Definition: A functional abnormality of the pupil.
A unilateral form of ptosis.
Synonyms: Dropping of one upper eyelid

Definition: Absence of the combined rod-and-cone response on electroretinogram.
Synonyms: Absent cone and rod functions by electroretinogram, Absent rod-and cone-mediated responses on ERG

Definition: An abnormality of the reflex that controls the diameter of the pupil, in response to the intensity of light that falls on the retina of the eye.
Underdevelopment of the lower eyelid.
Synonyms: Decreased size of lower eyelid, Underdevelopment of lower eyelid

Definition: Abnormal development (dysgenesis) of the anterior segment of the eye globe. These structures are mainly of mesenchymal origin.
Synonyms: Anterior chamber cleavage defect, Anterior chamber cleavage disorder, Anterior chamber malformation, Anterior chamber mesodermal anomalies, Anterior segment developmental abnormality, Anterior segment dysgenesis, Anterior segment mesencyhmal dysgenesis, Anterior segment ocular dysgenesis
Abnormal retinal pigmentation, Abnormality of retinal pigment epithelium, Abnormality of RPE, Retinal pigmentary anomaly

Definition: Sudden-onset episode of abnormal, involuntary eye movements.
Synonyms: Abnormal eye movements, paroxysmal

Definition: Absence of the crystalline lens of the eye as a result of a developmental defect.
Synonyms: Lens agenesis
Absent inner eyelashes

Definition: A type of genetically determined disease of the cornea with corneal lesions with a band-like shape.
A malignant melanoma originating within the eye. The tumor originates from the melanocytes in the uvea (which comprises the iris, ciliary body, and choroid).
Synonyms: Intraocular melanoma

Definition: A chronic irritative conjunctivitis, which commonly presents with general irritation and redness of the eyes, with a burning, dry, or foreign-body sensation of the eyes.

Cornea plana is an abnormally flat shape of the cornea such that the normal protrusion of the cornea from the sclera is missing. The reduced corneal curvature can lead to hyperopia, and a hazy corneal limbus and arcus lipoides may develop at an early age.
Synonyms: Cornea plana

Definition: Presence of multiple dilatations (sac-like outpouchings) in the blood vessels of the conjunctiva.
Atrophy (loss or wasting) of the retinal pigment epithelium observed on fundoscopy or fundus imaging.
Lack of transparency of the corneal epithelium.
Synonyms: Superficial corneal opacities

Definition: Abnormal (non-physiological) constriction of the pupil of congenital onset.
An abnormal reduction in the amount of pigmentation of the iris.
Synonyms: Light eye color, Light eye colour, Reduced iris pigmentation

Definition: Abnormal development of the choroid and retina.
Underdevelopment of the lacrimal gland.
Synonyms: Hypoplastic lacrimal gland, Underdeveloped tear gland

Definition: Abnormally big lacrimal glands.
Synonyms: Enlarged tear gland

Term: Bone spicule pigmentation of the retina
Definition: Pigment migration into the retina in a bone-spicule configuration (resembling the nucleated cells within the lacuna of bone).
Synonyms: Bone corpuscle fundus pigmentation, Fundus with peripheral bony spicules, Retinal bone corpuscle pigmentation, Retinal pigmented bone spicules
Long eyelashes in irregular rows

Definition: Underdevelopment of the fovea centralis.
Synonyms: Foveal hypoplasia

Definition: Macular dystrophy is a nonspecific term for premature retinal cell aging and cell death, generally confied to the macula in which no clear extrinsic cause is evident.
Reduced transparency of the stroma of cornea.
Synonyms: Cloudy cornea, Corneal stromal opacity

Definition: A scotoma (area of diminished vision within the visual field) that surrounds the central fixation point.
Dilatation of small blood vessels of the retina.
Increased depth of the anterior chamber, i.e., the anteroposterior distance between the cornea and the iris is increased.
Underdevelopment of the optic disc, that is of the optic nerve head, where ganglion cell axons exit the eye to form the optic nerve.
Synonyms: Hypoplastic optic discs, Hypoplastic optic disks

Definition: The presence of an increased number of twists and turns of retinal blood vessels (arteries, arterioles, veins, venules).
Synonyms: Tortuosity of main retinal vessels
Retinal hypoplasia, Underdeveloped retina

Definition: An impairment of the ability to track objects with the ocular smooth pursuit system, a class of rather slow eye movements that minimizes retinal target motion.
Synonyms: Abnormality of visual tracking, Impairment of visual pursuit

Definition: Ocular abnormality characterised by premature degeneration of the vitreous and the retina that may be associated with increased risk of retinal detachment.
Synonyms: Vitreoretinal abnormality, Vitreoretinal degeneration

Definition: Underdevelopment of the ciliary body.

Synonyms: Hypotrichosis of lower eyelashes, Partial absence of lower eyelashes, Scanty lower eyelashes, Sparse lower eyelashes, Thin lower eyelashes

Definition: Fibrous connective tissue resulting from incomplete healing of a wound (i.e., a scar) located in the choroid and retina or the eye.
A type of retinal neovascularization that affects the posterior pole of the retina.
Synonyms: Neovascularization of peripheral and posterior retina, Posterior retinal neovascularisation

Definition: A type of cataract characterized by punctate, dust-like opacities within the cortical region of the lens.
Synonyms: Cataracts, cortical pulverulent

Definition: A type of cataract affecting the posterior pole of lens immediately adjacent to ('beneath') the Lens capsule.
Synonyms: Posterior subcapsular opacities of the lens

Term: Patchy atrophy of the retinal pigment epithelium
Definition: Wasting (atrophy) of the retinal pigment epithelium present in small, isolated areas.
Mottled (spotted or blotched with different shades) pigmentary abnormality of the macula lutea.
Synonyms: Macular retinal pigment epithelial mottling

Definition: A cataract that affects the anterior part of the cortex of the lens.
The presence of whitish deposits in the conjunctiva resembling salt. May be related to calcinosis.

Term: Increased axial length of the globe
Definition: Abnormal largeness of the eye with an axial length > 2.5 standard deviations from population mean.
Synonyms: Globe elongated, Increased axial globe length, Increased front to back length of eyeball

Definition: The presence of central, fine, whitish granular lesions in the stroma of the cornea. This type of corneal dystrophy is usually asymptomatic and begins in childhood and shows a slow progression. Later in the course, the corneal epithelium and Bowman's layer may be affected. Histologically, the cornea shows a uniform deposition of hyaline material.
Complete color blindness, a complete inability to distinguish colors. Affected persons cannot perceive colors, but only shades of gray.
Synonyms: Complete achromatopsia

Definition: Nystagmus consisting of horizontal to-and-fro eye movements of equal velocity.

The presence of one or more dendritic corneal epithelial ulcers characterized by a treelike branching linear pattern with feathery edges and terminal bulbs. Herpetiform corneal ulcers can be identified by fluorescein staining.
Synonyms: Dendritic corneal epithelial ulcer, Herpetiform corneal ulcers

Definition: A form of uveitis that is not associated with the formation of granulomas.

Mottling (spots or blotches with different shades) of the retinal pigment epithelium, i.e., localized or generalized fundal pigment granularity associated with processes at the level of the retinal pigment epithelium.
Synonyms: Focal hypopigmentation of the retinal pigment epithelium, Retinal pigment epithelium irregularity, RPE irregularity, RPE mottling, Salt and pepper retinal pigmentation, Salt and pepper retinopathy

Term: Abnormal distribution of retinal arterioles and venules

Definition: A supranuclear gaze palsy is an inability to look in a horizontal direction as a result of cerebral impairment. There is a loss of the voluntary aspect of eye movements, but, as the brainstem is still intact, all the reflex conjugate eye movements are normal.
The presence of distinct colors in the central (pupillary) zone of the iris than in the mid-peripheral (ciliary) zone.
Synonyms: Ring iris heterochromia

Definition: Presenile cataract is a kind of cataract that occurs in early adulthood, that is, at an age that is younger than usual.
Synonyms: Presenile cataract

Definition: Congenital absence or closure of the opening of the lacrimal punctum.
Synonyms: Atretic lacrimal puncta, Atretic lacrimal punctum

Definition: Paralysis of both the extrinsic and intrinsic ocular muscles.
Synonyms: Complete ophthalmoplegia, Global paralysis of gaze, Total internal and external ophthalmoplegia

Definition: Inability to see well at night or in poor light with onset in adulthood.
Synonyms: Adult-onset night blindness

Definition: Nonprogressive restriction of movement of the external ocular muscles such that the eyes of affected individuals are partially or completely fixed in a strabismic position. Residual eye movements are significantly limited.
A kind of cataract that progresses with age.
Synonyms: Cataract, progressive
S-shaped eyes, S-shaped opening between the eyelids

Definition: A progressive form of ptosis.
Synonyms: Progressive drooping of upper eyelid

Definition: Increased length of the upper eyelashes.
Synonyms: Ciliary trichomegaly of upper eyelashes, Increased length of upper eyelashes, Long upper eyelashes

Term: Amyloid deposition in the vitreous humor
Definition: Deposition of hyaline extracellular material (amyloid) into the vitreous humor, which can manifest as vitreous opacities and reduced visual acuity.
Synonyms: Amyloid deposition in the vitreous humour, Vitreous amyloid deposits
Narrowing of blood vessels in back of eye

Definition: Punctate opacification (reduced transparency) of the corneal stroma.
Synonyms: Punctate corneal opacities

Definition: Punched out lesions in the pigmented layer of the retina.
Horizontal nystagmus dating from or present at birth.
Synonyms: Nystagmus, congenital horizontal

Definition: Deposition of calcium salts in the retina.
Fibrosis of only some of the external ocular muscles such that the eyes of affected individuals are partially or completely fixed in a strabismic position.
The presence of multiple hemangiomas in the choroid. These are generally reddish or orange or can have increased pigmentation maiking them difficult to distinguish from choroidal melanomas.

Synonyms: Prominent Schwalbe lines

Definition: A shape created by an acute downward arching of the upper eyelid and upward arching of the lower eyelid, toward the medial canthus, which gives the outline of the palpebral fissures the configuration of an almond. Thus, the maximum distance between the fissures is offset from, and medial to, the center point.
Synonyms: Almond shaped eyes, Almond-shaped opening between the eyelids

Definition: Blindness with onset at birth.
Synonyms: Blindness present at birth, Congenital amaurosis

Definition: Allergic Conjunctivitis is an allergic inflammation of the conjunctiva.
An abnormally slow velocity of horizontal saccadic eye movements.
Congenital absence of the extraocular muscles.
Synonyms: Missing eye muscles

Definition: A type of posterior subcapsular cataract characterized by an iridescent color.
Synonyms: Cataracts, posterior, subcapsular, iridescent

Definition: Underdevelopment of the lacrimal puncta.
Synonyms: Hypoplasia of the lacrimal puncta, Hypoplastic lacrimal puncta

Definition: Reduced pigmentation of the fundus, typically generalised. Fundoscopy may reveal a low level pigment in both RPE and choroid with clear visibility of choroidal vessels (pale/albinoid) or low pigment level in the RPE with deep pigment in choroid so that visible choroidal vessels are separated by deeply pigmented zones (tesselated/tigroid).
Synonyms: Decreased fundus pigmentation, Fundus hypopigmentation

Definition: Failure of attachment of the retina during development.
Synonyms: Congenital retinal non-attachment
Underdeveloped tear duct

Definition: Bleeding within the vitreous compartment of the eye.
Synonyms: Vitreous haemorrhage

Definition: Chorioretinal atrophy along the retinal veins.

Synonyms: Abnormality of iris blood vessels

Definition: Intraocular pressure that is 2 standard deviations above the population mean.
Synonyms: Elevated intraocular pressure, Elevated IOP, High eye pressure, Increased intraocular pressure, Increased IOP, Raised intraocular pressure, Raised IOP
Congenital drooping of both upper eyelids, Ptosis, bilateral congenital, Ptosis, congenital bilateral

Definition: A type of of patterned retinal dystrophy that shows a reticular pattern of pigmentation.

This corneal dystrophy affects the posterior limiting membrane of the cornea and is characterized by polymorphous plaques of calcium deposits in the deep stromal layers of the cornea, and occasionally by vesicular lesions of the endothelium and edema of the deep corneal stroma.

A type of retinal detachment arising due to a combination of contracting retinal membranes, abnormal vitreoretinal adhesions, and vitreous changes. It is usually seen in the context of diseases that induce a fibrovascular response, e.g. diabetes.

Synonyms: Hypermyelinated retinal nerve fibres, Retinal striation
Slow decrease in sharpness of vision, Subacute deterioration of visual acuity

Definition: A congenital defect resulting in absence of the lacrimal duct.
Synonyms: Absent tear duct

Definition: Anomaly of the visual evoked potentials elicited by a flash stimulus, generally a flash of light subtending an angle of at least 20 degrees of the visual field and presented in a dimly lit room.
Separation of the inner layers of the retina (neural retina) from the pigment epithelium occuring near the outer limit (periphery) of the retina.
Congenital abnormal dilation of the pupil on both sides.
Regional increase in the width (height) of the lateral eyebrow.
Synonyms: Wide lateral eyebrow

Definition: Fibrosis of the external ocular muscles such that the eyes of affected individuals are partially or completely fixed in a strabismic position. Residual eye movements are significantly limited.
Synonyms: Restrictive ophthalmoplegia

Definition: A type of retinal reticular pigmentation that forms a polygonal, netlike arrangement of hyperpigmented lines forming geometric patterns in the fundus.
Synonyms: Fishnet retinal pigmentation, Honeycomb retinal degeneration

Definition: A form of monochromacy in which vision is derived from the remaining preserved blue (S) cones and rod photoreceptors.
Synonyms: Blue cone monochromatism, Incomplete achromatopsia, S-cone monochromacy

Definition: Limited mobility of the eye within its socket.
Synonyms: Limited extraocular movement

Definition: Paralysis of the iris and ciliary apparatus.
A form of stapes ankylosis with congenital onset.
A fixed reduction in the vertical distance between the upper and lower eyelids with short palpebral fissures on one side only.
Synonyms: Narrow palpebral fissure, unilateral

Definition: A subtype of retinitis pigmentosa in which, instead of the pathology starting in the mid-periphery like typical retinitis pigmentosa, the disease starts in the near periphery closer to the vascular arcades and tends to spare the far periphery.
A type of posterior cortical cataract characterized by dense lenticular opacities.
Chorioretinal atrophy concentrated around the optic papilla (i.e., the optic nerve head).
A reduction of corneal clarity.
Synonyms: Corneal clouding, Corneal opacities, Reduction of corneal clarity, Scarring or clouding of the cornea of the eye

Term: Optic atrophy from cranial nerve compression

Definition: A spectrum of fundoscopic appearances characterized by the development of a variety of patterns of deposits predominantly in the macular area. The deposits are typically bilateral, relatively symmetrical, yellow/white and associated with changes at the level of the retinal pigment epithelium. With time, retinal atrophy may occur. A number of pattern dystrophy subtypes have been described including butterfly-shaped dystrophy, reticular dystrophy (net-like pattern) and fundus pulverulentus (granular, mottled pigmentation).

Synonyms: Absence of visual evoked potentials, Non-detectable VEP, Undetectable VEP

Term: Remnants of the hyaloid vascular system
Definition: Persistence of the hyaloid artery, which is the embryonic artery that runs from the optic disk to the posterior lens capsule may persist; the site of attachment may form an opacity. The hyaloid artery is a branch of the ophthalmic artery, and usually regresses completely before birth. This features results from a failure of regression of the hyaloid vessel, which supplies the primary vitreous during embryogenesis and normally regresses in the third trimester of pregnancy, leading to a particular form of posterior cataract.
Synonyms: Congenital retinal septum, Persistent fetal vasculature, Persistent foetal vasculature, Persistent hyperplasia of primary vitreous, Persistent hyperplastic primary vitreous, Persistent hypertrophic primary vitreous, Persistent posterior fetal fibrovascular sheath of the lens, Persistent posterior foetal fibrovascular sheath of the lens, Persistent tunica vasculosa lentis
Congenital drooping upper eyelid

Definition: A congenital cataract in which opacity is limited to layers of the lens external to the nucleus (i.e., the perinuclear region), i.e., between the nuclear and cortical layers of the lens.
The presence of developmental dysplasia of the retina.
Synonyms: Retinal dysgenesis

Definition: Saccadic undershoot of horizontal saccadic eye movements, i.e., a horizontal saccadic eye movement that has less than the magnitude that would be required to gain fixation of the object.

Cerulean cataracts are a kind of congenital cataract having peripheral bluish and white opacifications in concentric layers with occasional central lesions arranged radially. Although the opacities may be observed during fetal development and childhood, usually visual acuity is only mildly reduced until adulthood, when lens extraction is generally necessary.
Synonyms: Cataracts, congenital, cerulean

Definition: Horizontal nystagmus made apparent by looking to the right or to the left.
Synonyms: Nystagmus, horizontal, gaze-evoked

Definition: A dark-adapted bright flash electroretinogram in which the b-wave that is of markedly lower amplitude than the associated a-wave (source: Holder GE., Inherited Chorioretinal Dystrophies: A Textbook and Atlas; 2014; p.17; ISBN 978-3-540-69466-3).
Synonyms: Electronegative ERG, Electroretinogram: reduced b-wave amplitude, Reduced amplitude of dark-adapted bright flash electroretinogram b-wave, Reduced electroretinogram rod b-wave, Reduced ERG amplitude of b-wave

Definition: Blockage of retinal arteriole, generally associated with interruption of blood flow and oxygen delivery to affected regions of the retina.
Synonyms: Blocked retinal artery

Definition: Decreased amount of pigmentation in the macula lutea.
Retinal exudate within the retinal tissue itself.
Underdevelopment of the stroma of iris.
Synonyms: Hypoplastic iris stoma, Iris stromal hypoplasia, Underdeveloped iris stroma

Definition: Congenital malformation of the lacrimal duct associated with incomplete development of the bony nasolacrimal canal or craniofacial anomalies.
Synonyms: Malformed tear ducts

Definition: Loss of peripheral vision with retention of central vision, resulting in a constricted circular tunnel-like field of vision.
Synonyms: Kalnienk vision, Loss of peripheral vision

Definition: An abnormally reduced response to stimulation of the cornea (by touch, foreign body, blowing air). The corneal reflex (also known as the blink reflex, normally results in an involuntary blinking of the eyelids.
Synonyms: Decreased blink reflex, Reduced corneal reflex

Definition: Increased amount of pigmentation in the fovea centralis.
Abnormality of macular or foveal pigmentation.

Synonyms: Jerky smooth pursuit
Three rows of eyelashes, Triple row of eyelashes

Definition: Reduced transparency of the peripheral region of the cornea.
Synonyms: Peripheral corneal opacity

Definition: Microscopic aneurysms of the retinal arterioles near the central part of the fundus, visible as small round dark red dots on the retinal surface (not arising from visible vessels) that are by definition less than the diameter of the major optic veins as they cross the optic disc.
Partial dislocation of the lens in a superior direction.
Synonyms: Superior subluxated lens

Definition: Inherited progressive cone degeneration.
Synonyms: Progressive cone degeneration, Progressive cone dystrophy

Definition: A form of macular degeneration characterized by the presence of multiple cysts in the macula.
Synonyms: Cystic macular degeneration

Definition: A type of sutural cataract in which the opacity follows the posterior Y suture.
Synonyms: Posterior Y-sutural cataracts

Definition: Abnormal pigmentation of the iris.

Retinitis pigmentosa inversa is form of retinal degeneration characterized by areas of retinal/chorioretinal degeneration with pigment migration in the macular area (in contrast to retinitis pigmentosa which, at early disease stages, predominantly affects the retinal periphery).
Synonyms: Central retinitis pigmentosa

Term: Absent anterior chamber of the eye
Definition: Absence of the anterior chamber of the eye owing to a developmental defect.
Absence or underdevelopment of the lacrimal gland.
Synonyms: Absent/underdeveloped lacrimal glands, Absent/underdeveloped tear glands

Definition: Decreased retinal arteriolar diameters, which may decrease blood flow and slow oxygen delivery to regions of the retina.
Synonyms: Constricted retinal arterioles, Narrow retinal arterioles, Retinal arteriolar narrowing
High flash visual evoked potentials

Definition: A structural abnormality of retinal vasculature.
Synonyms: Abnormality of retina blood vessels, Abnormality of the retinal vasculature

Term: Abnormality of the vasculature of the eye
Synonyms: Abnormality of eye blood vessels

Definition: An abnormality of the line of Schwalbe.
Synonyms: Abnormality of the line of Schwalbe

Definition: An abnormality of an extraocular muscle.
An anomaly of the space between the medial and lateral canthi of the two open eyelids.
Synonyms: Abnormality of the opening between the eyelids, Abnormality of the palpebral fissures

Definition: A wrinkle of retinal tissue projecting outward from the surface of the retina and visible as a line on fundoscopy.
Synonyms: Retinal folds

Definition: Absence or underdevelopment of the iris.
Synonyms: Absent/small iris, Absent/underdeveloped iris

Term: Abnormal morphology of the conjunctival vasculature
Definition: Any abnormality of the blood vessels of the conjunctiva.
Synonyms: Abnormal morphology of the conjunctiva vasculature, Abnormal vasculature of the conjunctiva morphology, Abnormality of the vasculature of the conjunctiva

Definition: Absence or underdevelopment of the uvea, the pigmented middle layer of the eye consisting of the iris and ciliary body together with the choroid.
Synonyms: Absent/underdeveloped uvea
Absent/small eye, Absent/underdeveloped eye
Absent/small fundus
Absent/small optic nerve, Absent/underdeveloped optic nerve
Absent/underdeveloped macula

Definition: Congenital absence or underdevelopment of the fovea centralis.
Synonyms: Absent/underdeveloped fovea
Absent/small retina, Absent/underdeveloped retina

Term: Aplasia/Hypoplasia affecting the anterior segment of the eye
Definition: Absence or underdevelopment of the anterior segment of the eye.
Absence or underdevelopment of the lens.
Synonyms: Absent/small lens, Absent/underdeveloped lens

Definition: An abnormality of the skin characterized the presence of excessive amounts of dry surface scales on the skin resulting from an abnormality of keratinization.
Synonyms: Ichthyosiform abnormality of the skin, Ichthyotic skin
Absent/small skin, Absent/underdeveloped skin

Definition: The presence of one or more bullae on the skin, defined as fluid-filled blisters more than 5 mm in diameter with thin walls.
Synonyms: Abnormal blistering of the skin, Blister, Blistering, generalised, Blistering, generalized, Blisters, Skin bullae
Abnormally loose or hyperelastic skin, Abnormally loose or stretchable skin

Definition: A tumor (abnormal growth of tissue) of the skin.
Synonyms: Dermatological tumors, Dermatological tumours, Skin tumors, Skin tumours, Tumor of the skin, Tumour of the skin

Definition: Reduced density of hairs.
Synonyms: Decreased hair growth, Decreased hair growth on body, Hypotrichosis, Marked hypotrichosis, Sparse hair, Sparse hair since birth

Definition: Increased blood pressure during a pregnancy.
Virilization (deepening of voice, facial hirsutism and scalp hair loss) with onset during pregnancy (usually towards the end of the first trimester) and regression several months post-partum.
An abnormally low concentration of serum conjugated estriol as compared to normal values for gestational-age.
Synonyms: Low maternal serum estriol

Definition: The development of Pes cavus that is progressive with age.
Reduction in bone mineral density affecting any or all of the tarsal bones, seven bones of the foot comprising the calcaneus, talus, cuboid, navicular, and the cuneiform bones.
A developmental abnormality characterized by the absence of the fifth metatarsal bone.
Synonyms: Absent 5th long bone of foot, Absent 5th metatarsals, Aplasia of the fifth metatarsal bone

Definition: Medial deviation of the great toe owing to a deformity of the great toe joint causing the hallux to deviate medially.
Synonyms: Medially deviated halluces

Definition: An outward deviation of the foot at the talocalcaneal or subtalar joint.
Synonyms: Valgus foot deformity
Underdeveloped 2nd-5th middle toe bones

Definition: The presence of a fifth metatarsal bone that has not undergone ossification at an age when ossification is usually visible.

Term: Abnormality of the fifth metatarsal bone
Definition: An anomaly of the fifth metatarsal bone.
Synonyms: Abnormality of the 5th long bone of foot

Definition: Underdevelopment (hypoplasia) of the fourth toe.
Synonyms: Short 4th toe, Short fourth toe

Definition: An overall widening of the spaces between the digits.
Synonyms: Widely spaced toes

Definition: Osteolysis affecting the talus.
Synonyms: Osteolysis of tali

Definition: Medial deviation of the second toe.

Term: Expanded metatarsals with widened medullary cavities

Definition: Delayed maturation and calcification of any of the tarsal bones, seven bones of the foot comprising the calcaneus, talus, cuboid, navicular, and the cuneiform bones.
Synonyms: Tarsal delayed ossification

Term: Plantar crease between first and second toes
Definition: The presence of unusually deep creases (ridges/wrinkles) on the skin of sole of foot located between the first and second toe.
Precocious (accelerated) maturation and calcification of any of the tarsal bones, seven bones of the foot comprising the calcaneus, talus, cuboid, navicular, and the cuneiform bones.
Synonyms: Precociously ossified tarsal bones
Broad distal big toe

Definition: Osteosclerosis of the endosteal surface of the diaphyses (shafts) of the metatarsal bones.
Bending or curvature of a third toe in the tibial direction (i.e., towards the big toe).
Synonyms: 3rd toe clinodactyly

Definition: Limitation of the ability to bend the toes.

Synonyms: Deformed ankle bones

Definition: Synostosis of the calcaneus with the navicular bone.
A congenital deformity characterized by a dorsiflexed, inverted, and adducted foot, i.e., a combination of talipes calcaneus and talipes varus.
A two-part calcaneus, a finding that probably results from delayed coalescence of two primary calcaneal centers of ossification.
Synonyms: Delayed coalescence of bipartite calcanei, Delayed coalescence of calcaneal ossification centers, Delayed coalescence of calcaneal ossification centres, Delayed fusion of bipartite calcanei, Double calcaneal ossification center, Double calcaneal ossification centre, Extra calcaneal ossification center, Extra calcaneal ossification centre

Definition: The presence of abnormal punctate (speckled, dot-like) calcifications in one or more tarsal bones.
Synonyms: Punctate calcifications of tarsals, Punctate tarsal calcification

Term: Medial rotation of the medial malleolus

Definition: Defective ossification in an irregular pattern of the seven bones of the foot comprising the calcaneus, talus, cuboid, navicular, and the cuneiform bones.
Synonyms: Irregular tarsal centers, Irregular tarsal centres

Definition: Abnormal plantar flexion of the calcaneus relative to the longitudinal axis of the tibia. This results in the angle between the long axis of the tibia and the long axis of the heel bone (calcaneus) being greater than 90 degrees.
Synonyms: Equinus deformity of the calcaneus, Hindfoot equinus
Dislocation of toes

Definition: Delayed maturation and calcification of the calcaneus.
Abnormal response to epinephrine as manifested by reduced or lacking aggregation of platelets upon addition of epinephrine.
Elevations of the levels of SGOT (serum glutamic oxaloacetic transaminase) and SGPT (serum glutamic pyruvic transaminase) that occur during infections.

Increased time to coagulation in the prothrombin time test, which is a measure of the extrinsic pathway of coagulation. The results of the prothrombin time test are often expressed in terms of the International normalized ratio (INR), which is calculated as a ratio of the patient's prothrombin time (PT) to a control PT standardized for the potency of the thromboplastin reagent developed by the World Health Organization (WHO) using the formula: INR is equal to Patient PT divided by Control PT.
Synonyms: Increased INR, Increased international normalised ratio, increased international normalised ratio, Increased international normalized ratio, Low factor II activity, Prolonged PT, Reduced factor II activity, Reduced prothrombin activity

Definition: Episodes of muscle weakness associated with reduced levels of potassium in the blood.
Synonyms: Hypokalemic periodic paresis

Definition: Excessive amounts of mucopolysaccharide in the urine.
Hyperapobetalipoproteinemia is defined as the combination of a normal low density lipoprotein (LDL) cholesterol in the face of an increased LDL apolipoprotein B (apoB) protein.
An increase in the level of 3-hydroxydicarboxylic acid in the urine.
Alkaline phosphatase levels measured within leukocytes is below detectable levels.
Synonyms: Absent leukocyte ALP

Definition: An increased concentration of ammonia in the blood not associated with symptoms such as encephalopathy.
Synonyms: Hyperammonemia, asymptomatic

Definition: Abnormally reduced concentration of cortisol in the blood.
Synonyms: Decreased cortisol production, Glucocorticoid insufficiency, Hypocortisolemia, Low blood cortisol level, Low to undetectable plasma cortisol, Plasma cortisol low

Definition: Reduced proportion of helper T cells relative to the total number of T cells.
Synonyms: Decreased proportion circulating T-helper cells, Reduced helper T cell proportion

Definition: Abnormally decreased rate of beta-galactosidase activity. Beta-galactosidase activity can be measured in leukocyte, fibroblast, or plasma.
Synonyms: Beta-galactosidase deficiency in fibroblasts and white blood cells, Beta-galactosidase-1 deficiency, Decreased beta galactosidase activity

Term: Very long chain fatty acid accumulation

Definition: Reduced activity of coagulation factor VII. Factor VII is part of the extrinsic coagulation pathway, which is initiated at the site of injury in response to the release of tissue factor (fIII). Tissue factor and activated factor VII catalyze the activation of factor X.
An abnormal reduction in the Arden ratio, which is the ratio between the light peak and the dark trough of the smoothed (physiologic) EOG record.
Synonyms: Decreased Arden ratio of EOG

The ossification process begins in the center of the body about the ninth week, and extends toward either extremity. The center for the base of the first metatarsal appears about the third year, and the centers for the heads of the other bones between the fifth and eighth years. They join the bodies between the eighteenth and twentieth years.
Synonyms: Abnormal ossification involving metatarsal bones

In a fetus with laryngeal atresia, the lungs are either normal or hyperplastic, not hypoplastic. Mortality is reported as 100%. At obstetric US examination, views of the fetal neck demonstrate a dilated trachea filled with trapped fluid. Views of the fetal chest show enlarged, hyperechoic lungs, with dilated fluid-filled bronchi. Fetal ascites is usually present.

Term: Triangular shaped middle phalanx of the 5th finger

Definition: Chronic loss of joint motion in the 5th finger due to structural changes in non-bony tissue. The term camptodactyly of the 5th finger is used if the distal and/or proximal interphalangeal joints are affected.

Term: Contracture of the distal interphalangeal joint of the 5th finger
Definition: Chronic loss of joint motion of the distal interphalangeal joint of the 5th finger due to structural changes in non-bony tissue.

Term: Contracture of the proximal interphalangeal joint of the 5th finger
Definition: Proximal interphalangeal (PIP) flexion deformity of the little finger. That is, the PIP joint of a little finger is bent (flexed) and cannot be straightened actively or passively. It is thus a chronic loss of joint motion due to structural changes in muscle, tendons, ligaments, or skin that prevents normal movement.

Term: Contracture of the metacarpophalangeal joint of the 5th finger
Definition: Chronic loss of joint motion of the metacarpophalangeal joint of the 5th finger due to structural changes in non-bony tissue.

Term: Bracket epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the 5th finger
Definition: An abnormality of the distal phalanx of the fifth finger in which the epiphysis surrounds a phalangeal bone, having a bracket-like form and reaching from the proximal side of a phalanx to the distal side.
Synonyms: Bracket shaped end part of the outermost little finger bone, Bracket shaped end part of the outermost pinkie finger bone, Bracket shaped end part of the outermost pinky finger bone

Term: Pseudoepiphysis of the distal phalanx of the 5th finger
Definition: A secondary ossification center in the distal phalanx of the fifth finger that is distinct from the normal epiphysis that does not contribute to the longitudinal growth of a tubular bone.

Definition: A triangular appearance of the epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the ring finger of the hand. This epiphysis is located at the proximal end of the phalanx and is normally nearly flat.
Synonyms: Delta-shaped epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the 4th finger, Triangular end part of the outermost bone of ring finger

Term: Absent epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the 4th finger
Definition: Absence of the epiphysis located at the proximal end of the proximal phalanx of the 4th finger.
Synonyms: Absent end part of the innermost bone of the ring finger

Term: Bracket epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the 4th finger
Definition: An abnormality of the proximal phalanx of the fourth finger in which the epiphysis surrounds a phalangeal bone, having a bracket-like form and reaching from the proximal side of a phalanx to the distal side.
Synonyms: Bracket proximal epiphysis of the ring finger, Bracket shaped end part of the innermost bone of the ring finger

Term: Cone-shaped epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the 4th finger
Definition: A cone-shaped appearance of the epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the ring finger of the hand, producing a 'ball-in-a-socket' appearance. This epiphysis is located at the proximal end of the phalanx and is normally nearly flat. The related entity 'angel-shaped' epiphysis refers to a pronounced cone-shaped epiphysis in combination with a pseudoepiphysis at the distal end of the phalanx.
Synonyms: Cone-shaped end part of the innermost bone of the ring finger

Term: Enlarged epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the 4th finger
Definition: Abnormally large size of the epiphysis located at the proximal end of the proximal phalanx of the 4th finger with respect to age-dependent norms.
Synonyms: Enlarged end part of the innermost bone of the ring finger

Term: Fragmentation of the epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the 4th finger
Definition: Fragmented appearance of the epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the 4th finger.
Synonyms: Fragmentation of end part of the innermost bone of the ring finger

Term: Irregular epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the 4th finger
Definition: Irregular radiographic opacity of the epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the 4th finger.
Synonyms: Irregular end part of the innermost bone of the ring finger

Term: Ivory epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the 4th finger
Definition: Sclerosis of the epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the ring finger, leading to an increased degree of radiopacity (white or ivory appearance) in X-rays.
Synonyms: Increased bone density of end part of the innermost ring finger bone

Term: Pseudoepiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the 4th finger
Definition: A secondary ossification center in the proximal phalanx of the fourth finger that is distinct from the normal epiphysis that does not contribute to the longitudinal growth of a tubular bone.

Term: Small epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the 4th finger
Definition: Abnormally small size of the epiphysis located at the proximal end of the proximal phalanx of the 4th finger with respect to age-dependent norms.
Synonyms: Small end part of the innermost bone of the ring finger

Term: Stippling of the epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the 4th finger

Term: Triangular epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the 4th finger

Definition: A small/hypoplastic or absent/aplastic 4th (ring) finger.

Definition: Displacement of the 4th finger from its normal position.

Definition: Chronic loss of joint motion in the 4th finger due to structural changes in non-bony tissue. The term camptodactyly of the 4th finger is used if the distal and/or proximal interphalangeal joints are affected.

Term: Contracture of the distal interphalangeal joint of the 4th finger
Definition: Chronic loss of joint motion of the distal interphalangeal joint of the 4th finger due to structural changes in non-bony tissue.

Term: Contracture of the proximal interphalangeal joint of the 4th finger
Definition: Chronic loss of joint motion of the proximal interphalangeal joint of the 4th finger due to structural changes in non-bony tissue. That is, the PIP joint of a fourth finger is bent (flexed) and cannot be straightened actively or passively. It is thus a chronic loss of joint motion due to structural changes in muscle, tendons, ligaments, or skin that prevents normal movement.
Synonyms: 4th finger camptodactyly, Camptodactyly of the 4th finger, Camptodactyly of the ring finger

Synonyms: Patchy sclerosis of the phalanges of the 2nd finger, Uneven increase in bone density in index finger bone

Term: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the phalanges of the 2nd finger
Synonyms: Absent/small index finger bone, Absent/underdeveloped index finger bone

Definition: The hairline refers to the outline of hair of the head. An abnormality of the hairline can refer to an unusually low or high border between areas of the scalp with and without hair or to abnormal projections of scalp hair.
Synonyms: Abnormality of the hairline

Definition: An tongue-like extension of hair towards the cheeks, in which hair growth extends in front of the ear to the lateral cheekbones.
Synonyms: Hair displacement, preauricular, towards lateral cheekbone, Hair growing down to cheek, Projection of scalp hair onto lateral cheek

Definition: Underdevelopment of the pharynx.
Synonyms: Decreased size of pharynx, Underdevelopment of pharynx

Definition: Absence of the tibia.
Synonyms: Absent shankbone, Absent shinbone, Aplasia of the tibia

Term: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the distal phalanx of the 2nd finger
Synonyms: Absent/small outermost index finger bone, Absent/underdeveloped outermost index finger bone

Term: Broad distal phalanx of the 2nd finger
Definition: Increased width of the distal phalanx of the 2nd finger.
Synonyms: Wide outermost bone of the index finger

Term: Bullet-shaped distal phalanx of the 2nd finger
Definition: Bullet-shaped phalanx refers to a short and wide phalanx that tapers distally . Bullet-shaped phalanges lack the normal diaphyseal constriction. This term is used if the distal phalanx of the 2nd finger is affected.
Synonyms: Bullet-shaped outermost bone of the index finger

Term: Curved distal phalanx of the 2nd finger
Definition: Curved appearance of the distal phalanx of the 2nd finger.
Synonyms: Curved outermost bone of the index finger

Term: Osteolytic defects of the distal phalanx of the 2nd finger
Definition: Dissolution or degeneration of bone tissue of the distal phalanx of the 2nd finger.
Synonyms: Acro-osteolysis of index finger, Acro-osteolysis of terminal index finger phalanx, Osteolytic defects of the outermost bone of the 2nd finger

Term: Patchy sclerosis of the distal phalanx of the 2nd finger
Definition: Uneven (irregular) increase in bone density of the distal phalanx of the second finger.
Synonyms: Uneven increase in bone density in the outermost bone of the 2nd finger

Definition: Fusion of the terminal/distal and middle phalanges of the 2nd finger.
Synonyms: Fused outermost and middle index finger bones, Symphalangism of the distal and middle phalanges of the 2nd finger

Term: Triangular shaped distal phalanx of the 2nd finger
Definition: Triangular shaped distal phalanx of the 2nd finger. A triangular or so called delta shaped phalanx is a typical result after a bracket epiphysis of the affected phalanx.
Synonyms: Triangular shaped outermost bone of the 2nd finger

Term: Aplasia of the distal phalanx of the 2nd finger
Synonyms: Absent outermost index finger bone, Absent terminal index finger phalanx

Term: Short distal phalanx of the 2nd finger
Definition: Hypoplasia (congenital reduction in size) of the distal phalanx of the second finger.
