Synonyms: Absent/hypoplastic middle phalanx of 2nd finger, Absent/small middle index finger bone, Absent/underdeveloped middle index finger bone, Hypoplastic/aplastic middle phalanx of index finger

Term: Broad middle phalanx of the 2nd finger
Definition: Increased width of the middle phalanx of the second finger.
Synonyms: Broad middle bone of the index finger

Term: Bullet-shaped middle phalanx of the 2nd finger
Definition: Bullet-shaped phalanx refers to a short and wide phalanx that tapers distally. Bullet-shaped phalanges lack the normal diaphyseal constriction. This term is used if the middle phalanx of the 2nd finger is affected.
Synonyms: Bullet-shaped middle bone of index finger

Term: Curved middle phalanx of the 2nd finger
Definition: Curved appearance of the middle phalanx of the 2nd finger.
Synonyms: Curved middle bone of the index finger

Term: Osteolytic defects of the middle phalanx of the 2nd finger
Definition: Dissolution or degeneration of bone tissue of the middle phalanx of the 2nd finger.
Synonyms: Lytic defects of middle index finger phalanx

Term: Patchy sclerosis of the middle phalanx of the 2nd finger
Definition: Uneven (irregular) increase in bone density of the middle phalanx of the second finger.
Synonyms: Uneven increase in bone density in the middle bone of the index finger

Term: Symphalangism of middle phalanx of 2nd finger
Definition: Fusion of the middle phalanx of the 2nd finger with another bone.
Synonyms: Fused middle bone of index finger

Term: Triangular shaped middle phalanx of the 2nd finger
Definition: Triangular shaped middle phalanx of the 2nd finger. A triangular or so called delta shaped phalanx is a typical result after a bracket epiphysis of the affected phalanx.
Synonyms: Triangular shaped middle bone of index finger

Definition: Absence of the middle phalanx of the index (2nd) finger.
Synonyms: Absent middle bone of index finger, Absent middle phalanx of index finger, Aplasia of the middle phalanx of the 2nd finger

Term: Short middle phalanx of the 2nd finger
Definition: Hypoplasia (congenital reduction in size) of the middle phalanx of the second finger, also known as the index finger.
Synonyms: Brachymesophalangy II (finger), Hypoplastic middle index finger phalanx, Hypoplastic/small middle phalanx of the 2nd finger, Short middle bone of index finger

Definition: Fusion of the proximal and middle phalanges of the 2nd finger.
Synonyms: Fused innermost and middle index finger bones

Term: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the proximal phalanx of the 2nd finger
Synonyms: Absent/small innermost index finger bone, Absent/underdeveloped innermost index finger bone

Term: Broad proximal phalanx of the 2nd finger
Definition: Increased width of the proximal phalanx of the 2nd finger.
Synonyms: Wide innermost bone of index finger, Wide/broad proximal index finger phalanx

Term: Bullet-shaped proximal phalanx of the 2nd finger
Definition: Bullet-shaped phalanx refers to a short and wide phalanx that tapers distally. Bullet-shaped phalanges lack the normal diaphyseal constriction. This term is used if the proximal phalanx of the 2nd finger is affected.
Synonyms: Bullet-shaped innermost bone of index finger

Term: Curved proximal phalanx of the 2nd finger
Definition: Curved appearance of the proximal phalanx of the 2nd finger.
Synonyms: Curved innermost bone of index finger

Term: Osteolytic defects of the proximal phalanx of the 2nd finger
Definition: Dissolution or degeneration of bone tissue of the proximal phalanx of the 2nd finger.
Synonyms: Lytic defects of proximal index finger phalanx

Term: Patchy sclerosis of the proximal phalanx of the 2nd finger
Definition: Uneven (irregular) increase in bone density of the proximal phalanx of the second finger.
Synonyms: Uneven increase in bone density in innermost index finger bone

Term: Symphalangism affecting the proximal phalanx of the 2nd finger
Definition: Fusion of the proximal phalanx of the 2nd finger with another bone.
Synonyms: Fused innermost bone of index finger

Term: Triangular shaped proximal phalanx of the 2nd finger
Definition: Triangular shaped proximal phalanx of the 2nd finger. A triangular or so called delta shaped phalanx is a typical result after a bracket epiphysis of the affected phalanx.
Synonyms: Triangular proximal index finger phalanx, Triangular shaped innermost bone of index finger

Definition: A vestibular schwannoma (also known as acoustic neuroma, acoustic neurinoma, or acoustic neurilemoma) is a benign, usually slow-growing tumor that develops from the VIIIth cranial nerve supplying the inner ear.
Synonyms: Acoustic Neuroma, Vestibular neurilemmoma, Vestibular neurinoma, Vestibular neurolemmoma, Vestibular Schwann cell tumor, Vestibular Schwann cell tumour

Definition: A bilateral vestibular Schwannoma (acoustic neurinoma).
Synonyms: Bilateral acoustic neuromas

Definition: A unilateral vestibular Schwannoma (acoustic neurinoma).
Abnormality of the vestibulocochlear nerve, the eighth cranial nerve, which is involved in transmitting sound and equilibrium information from the inner ear to the brain.
Synonyms: Abnormality of the eighth cranial nerve, Abnormality of the VIIIth cranial nerve

Definition: Astrocytoma is a neoplasm of the central nervous system derived from astrocytes. Astrocytes are a type of glial cell, and thus astrocytoma is a subtype of glioma.
The presence of a peripheral schwannoma.
A hamartoma (a benign, focal malformation consisting of a disorganized mixture of cells and tissues) of the retina.
Neurofibromas present in a smaller number than usually seen in neurofibromatosis type 1.

Term: Aplasia of the proximal phalanx of the 2nd finger
Definition: Absence of the proximal phalanx of the 2nd finger.
Synonyms: Absent innermost bone of index finger

Term: Short proximal phalanx of the 2nd finger
Definition: Hypoplasia (congenital reduction in size) of the proximal phalanx of the second finger.
Synonyms: Hypoplastic/small proximal phalanx of the 2nd finger, Short proximal index finger phalanx, Short proximal phalanx of the second finger

Term: Symphalangism of the proximal phalanx of the 2nd finger with the 2nd metacarpal
Definition: Fusion of the proximal phalanx of the 2nd finger with the 2nd metacarpal.
Synonyms: Fused innermost bone of index finger with 2nd long bone of hand

Definition: Abnormality of one or all of the epiphyses of the proximal, and distal phalanges of the thumb and/or the 1st metacarpal.
Synonyms: Abnormality of end part of thumb long bone, Abnormality of the epiphyses of the thumb, Abnormality of thumb epiphyses

Definition: Chronic loss of joint motion in the thumb due to structural changes in non-bony tissue. The term camptodactyly is used if the distal and/or proximal interphalangeal joints are affected.
Synonyms: Contracture of thumb, Flexion deformities of thumbs, Joint contractures of the thumb

Definition: Hypoplastic/small or absent thumb.
Synonyms: Absent or hypoplastic thumbs, Absent/hypoplastic thumb, Absent/hypoplastic thumbs, Absent/small thumb, Absent/underdeveloped thumb, Aplasia/hypoplasia of thumbs, Aplastic/hypoplastic thumbs, Hypoplastic to aplastic thumbs, Hypoplastic/absent thumb, Thumb aplasia/hypoplasia

Definition: A structural anomaly of one or more phalanges of the thumb.
Synonyms: Abnormality of the thumb bones, Abnormality of thumb phalanges

Definition: Displacement of the thumb from its normal position.
Synonyms: Abnormal thumb placement, Deviated thumb, Displacement of the thumb

Term: Complete duplication of distal phalanx of the thumb
Definition: Complete duplication of the distal phalanx of the thumb. On x-ray two separate bones appear side to side.
Synonyms: Complete duplication of outermost bone of the thumb

Term: Complete duplication of proximal phalanx of the thumb
Definition: Complete duplication of the proximal phalanx of the thumb. On x-ray two separate bones appear side to side. In contrast to the proximal phalanges of the digits 2-5, the proximal phalanx of the thumb is embryologically equivalent to the middle phalanges of the other digits, whereas the first metacarpal is embryologically of phalangeal origin and as such equivalent to the proximal phalanges of the other digits.
Synonyms: Complete duplication of the innermost bone of the thumb

Definition: Partail or complete duplication of the first metacarpal bone.
Synonyms: Partial/complete duplication of the 1st long bone of hand, Partial/complete duplication of the 1st metacarpal

Term: Bifid distal phalanx of the thumb
Definition: Partial duplication of the distal phalanx of the thumb. Depending on the severity, the appearance on x-ray can vary from a notched phalanx (the duplicated bone is almost completely fused with the phalanx) to a partially fused appearance of the two bones.
Synonyms: Bifid distal phalanx of thumb, Bifid terminal phalanges of thumbs, Bifid thumb distal phalanx, Incipient distal thumb phalanx duplication, Notched outermost bone of the thumb, Notched outermost bone of thumb, Notched terminal thumb phalanx

Term: Duplication of the distal phalanx of the thumb
Definition: Complete or partial duplication of the distal phalanx of the thumb. Depending on the severity, the appearance on x-ray can vary from a notched phalanx (the duplicated bone is almost completely fused with the phalanx), a partially fused appearance of the two bones, or two separate bones appearing side to side.
Synonyms: Double thumb distal phalanges, Duplicated terminal phalanx of thumb, Duplication of distal thumb phalanx, Duplication of terminal thumb phalanx, Duplication of the outermost bone of the thumb, Partial/complete duplication of the distal phalanx of the thumb

Term: Duplication of the proximal phalanx of the thumb
Definition: Complete or partial duplication of the proximal phalanx of the thumb. Depending on the severity, the appearance on x-ray can vary from a notched phalanx (the duplicated bone is almost completely fused with the phalanx), a partially fused appearance of the two bones, or two separate bones appearing side to side. In contrast to the proximal phalanges of the digits 2-5, the proximal phalanx of the thumb is embryologically equivalent to the middle phalanges of the other digits, whereas the first metacarpal is embryologically of phalangeal origin and as such equivalent to the proximal phalanges of the other digits.
Synonyms: Notched innermost bone of thumb, Partial/complete duplication of the proximal phalanx of the thumb

Term: Bifid proximal phalanx of the thumb
Definition: This term applies if the proximal phalanx of the thumb is partially duplicated. Depending on the severity, the appearance on x-ray can vary from a notched phalanx (the duplicated bone is almost completely fused with the phalanx) to a partially fused appearance of the two bones. In contrast to the proximal phalanges of the digits 2-5, the proximal phalanx of the thumb is embryologically equivalent to the middle phalanges of the other digits, whereas the first metacarpal is embryologically of phalangeal origin and as such equivalent to the proximal phalanges of the other digits.
Synonyms: Notched thumb bone

Term: Complete duplication of the first metacarpal
Definition: Complete duplication of the first metacarpal bone.
Synonyms: Complete duplication of the first long bone of hand

Definition: Partial duplication of the first metacarpal bone.
Synonyms: Notched first long bone of hand, partial duplication of the first metacarpal

Term: Abnormality of the distal phalanx of the thumb
Definition: Any anomaly of the distal phalanx of thumb.
Synonyms: Abnormality of terminal thumb phalanx, Abnormality of the outermost bone of the thumb

Term: Abnormality of the proximal phalanx of the thumb
Definition: An anomaly of the shape or form of the proximal phalanx of the thumb.
Synonyms: Abnormal innermost thumb bone, Abnormality of proximal thumb phalanx

Definition: Insertion of thumb at a more distal location than normal.
Proximal mislocalization of the thumb.
Synonyms: Attachment of thumb close to wrist, Low implantation of the thumb, Low-set thumb, Proximally placed thumbs

Term: Contractures of the carpometacarpal joint of the thumb
Definition: Chronic loss of joint motion of the carpometacarpal joint of the thumb due to structural changes in non-bony tissue. This joint is formed by the first metacarpal and the trapezial bone and is also called Articulatio carpometacarpalis pollicis, carpometacarpal articulation of thumb, carpometacarpal joint of thumb or first carpometacarpal articulation. Seldom referred to as thumb saddle joint.

Term: Contractures of the metacarpophalangeal joint of the thumb
Definition: Chronic loss of joint motion of the metacarpophalangeal joint of the thumb due to structural changes in non-bony tissue. This joint is also called Articulatio metacarpophalangealis pollicis.

Term: Contractures of the interphalangeal joint of the thumb
Definition: Chronic loss of joint motion of the interphalangeal joint of the thumb due to structural changes in non-bony tissue. This joint is also called Articulatio interphalangealis pollicis.
Synonyms: Interphalangeal extension contractures of thumbs

Term: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the proximal phalanx of the thumb
Definition: This term applies if the proximal phalanx of the thumb is either small/hypoplastic or absent. In contrast to the proximal phalanges of the digits 2-5, the proximal phalanx of the thumb is embryologically equivalent to the middle phalanges of the other digits, whereas the first metacarpal is embryologically of phalangeal origin and as such equivalent to the proximal phalanges of the other digits.
Synonyms: Absent/small innermost thumb bone, Absent/underdeveloped innermost thumb bone

Term: Broad proximal phalanx of the thumb
Definition: Increased width of the proximal phalanx of the thumb. In contrast to the proximal phalanges of the digits 2-5, the proximal phalanx of the thumb is embryologically equivalent to the middle phalanges of the other digits, whereas the first metacarpal is embryologically of phalangeal origin and as such equivalent to the proximal phalanges of the other digits.
Synonyms: Broad innermost thumb bone

Term: Bullet-shaped proximal phalanx of the thumb
Definition: Bullet-shaped phalanx refers to a short and wide phalanx that tapers distally. Bullet-shaped phalanges lack the normal diaphyseal constriction. This term is used if the proximal phalanx of the thumb is affected.
Synonyms: Bullet-shaped innermost thumb bone

Term: Curved proximal phalanx of the thumb
Definition: A deviation from the normal straight shape of the proximal phalanx of the thumb.
Synonyms: Curved innermost thumb bone

Term: Osteolytic defect of the proximal phalanx of the thumb
Definition: Dissolution or degeneration of bone tissue of the proximal phalanx of the thumb.
Synonyms: Osteolytic defects of the proximal phalanx of the thumb

Term: Patchy sclerosis of the proximal phalanx of the thumb
Definition: An uneven increase in bone density of the proximal phalanx of the thumb.
Synonyms: Uneven increase in bone density in the innermost thumb bone

Definition: Fusion of a phalanx of the thumb with another bone.
Synonyms: Fusion of thumb bone

Term: Triangular shaped proximal phalanx of the thumb
Definition: Triangular shaped proximal phalanx of the thumb.
Synonyms: Triangular innermost thumb bone, Triangular proximal thumb phalanx

Definition: Absence of the proximal phalanx of the thumb. In contrast to the proximal phalanges of the digits 2-5, the proximal phalanx of the thumb is embryologically equivalent to the middle phalanges of the other digits, whereas the first metacarpal is embryologically of phalangeal origin and as such equivalent to the proximal phalanges of the other digits.
Synonyms: Absent innermost thumb bone, Absent ossification/absent proximal thumb phalanx, Aplasia of the proximal phalanx of the thumb

Definition: Hypoplastic (short) proximal phalanx of the thumb. In contrast to the proximal phalanges of the digits 2-5, the proximal phalanx of the thumb is embryologically equivalent to the middle phalanges of the other digits, whereas the first metacarpal is embryologically of phalangeal origin and as such equivalent to the proximal phalanges of the other digits.
Synonyms: Hypoplastic/small proximal phalanx of the thumb, Short proximal phalanges of thumb, Short proximal thumb bone, Short proximal thumb phalanx

Term: Synostosis of the proximal phalanx of the thumb with the 1st metacarpal
Definition: Fusion of the proximal phalanx of the thumb with the 1st metacarpal.
Synonyms: Ankylosis of the metacarpophalangeal joint of the thumb, Fusion of the innermost bone of the thumb with the 1st long bone of hand

Term: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the distal phalanx of the thumb
Synonyms: Absent/small outermost thumb bone, Absent/underdeveloped outermost thumb bone

Term: Broad distal phalanx of the thumb
Definition: Increased width of the distal phalanx of thumb.
Synonyms: Broad outermost bone of the thumb, Broad terminal thumb phalanx, Wide distal phalanx of thumb, Wide outermost bone of thumb

Term: Bullet-shaped distal phalanx of the thumb
Definition: Bullet-shaped phalanx refers to a short and wide phalanx that tapers distally. Bullet-shaped phalanges lack the normal diaphyseal constriction. This term is used if the distal phalanx of the thumb is affected.
Synonyms: Bullet-shaped outermost bone of the thumb

Term: Curved distal phalanx of the thumb
Definition: A deviation from the normal straight shape of the distal phalanx of the thumb.
Synonyms: Curved outermost bone of the thumb

Term: Osteolytic defect of the distal phalanx of the thumb
Definition: Dissolution or degeneration of bone tissue of the distal phalanx of the thumb.
Synonyms: Osteolytic defects of the distal phalanx of the thumb, Osteolytic defects of the outermost bone of the thumb

Term: Patchy sclerosis of the distal phalanx of the thumb
Definition: An uneven increase in bone density of the distal phalanx of the thumb.
Synonyms: Uneven increase in bone density in the outermost bone of the thumb

Term: Triangular shaped distal phalanx of the thumb
Definition: Triangular shaped distal phalanx of the thumb. A triangular or so called delta shaped phalanx is a typical result after a bracket epiphysis of the affected phalanx.
Synonyms: Triangular shaped outermost bone of the thumb

Term: Aplasia of the distal phalanx of the thumb
Definition: Absence of the distal/terminal phalanx of the thumb.
Synonyms: Absence of the outermost bone of the thumb, Absent ossification/absent terminal thumb phalanx, Aplasia of the outermost bone of the thumb

Term: Short distal phalanx of the thumb
Definition: Hypoplastic (short) distal phalanx of the thumb.
Synonyms: Hypoplastic terminal thumb phalanx, Hypoplastic/small distal phalanx of the thumb, Short outermost bone of the thumb, Short terminal thumb phalanx, Short thumb terminal phalanx, Small terminal thumb phalanx

Definition: An abnormal morphology of one or more phalanges of the thumb, with a short and wide phalanx that tapers distally. Bullet-shaped phalanges lack the normal diaphyseal constriction.
Synonyms: Bullet-shaped phalanges of the thumb, Bullet-shaped thumb bone

Definition: A deviation from the normal straight shape of a thumb phalanx.
Synonyms: Curved phalanges of the thumb, Curved thumb bone

Definition: Dissolution or degeneration of bone tissue of one or more phalanges of the thumb.
Synonyms: Osteolytic defects of the phalanges of the thumb

Definition: An uneven increase in bone density of one or more of the phalanges of the thumb.
Synonyms: Patchy sclerosis of the phalanges of the thumb, Uneven increase in bone density in thumb bone

Definition: Congenital fusion (ankylosis) of the interphalangeal joint of the thumb.
Synonyms: Fused thumb bones, Fused thumb phalanges, Symphalangism of the distal and proximal phalanges of the thumb

Definition: Abnormal shape of one or more phalanges of the thumb such that affected phalanges resemble a triangle.
Synonyms: Triangular shaped phalanges of the thumb, Triangular shaped thumb bone, Triangular thumb phalanges

Term: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the phalanges of the thumb
Synonyms: Absent/small thumb bones, Absent/underdeveloped thumb bones

Definition: The absence of a phalangeal segment of a thumb.
Synonyms: Partial absence of thumb

Definition: Hypoplastic (short) thumb phalanx.
Synonyms: Hypoplastic thumb phalanges, Hypoplastic/small phalanges of the thumb, Short thumb bone, Short thumb phalanges

Term: Abnormality of the epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the thumb
Definition: Abnormality of the epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the thumb. This epiphysis is located on the proximal end of the phalanx.
Synonyms: Abnormality of terminal thumb epiphysis, Abnormality of the end part of the outermost bone of the thumb

Term: Abnormality of the epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the thumb
Definition: This term applies if the epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the thumb, which is located at the proximal end of the phalanx, does not appear in concordance with gender and age dependant norms as seen on x-rays. In contrast to the proximal phalanges of the digits 2-5, the proximal phalanx of the thumb is embryologically equivalent to the middle phalanges of the other digits, whereas the first metacarpal is embryologically of phalangeal origin and as such equivalent to the proximal phalanges of the other digits.
Synonyms: Abnormality of end part of thumb innermost long bone

Term: Absent epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the thumb
Definition: Absence of the epiphysis located at the proximal end of the proximal phalanx of the thumb. In contrast to the proximal phalanges of the digits 2-5, the proximal phalanx of the thumb is embryologically equivalent to the middle phalanges of the other digits, whereas the first metacarpal is embryologically of phalangeal origin and as such equivalent to the proximal phalanges of the other digits.
Synonyms: Absent end part of thumb innermost long bone

Term: Bracket epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the thumb
Definition: An abnormality of the proximal phalanx of the thumb in which the epiphysis surrounds a phalangeal bone, having a bracket-like form and reaching from the proximal side of a phalanx to the distal side.
Synonyms: Bracket shaped end part of thumb innermost long bone

Term: Cone-shaped epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the thumb
Definition: A cone-shaped appearance of the epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the thumb of the hand, producing a 'ball-in-a-socket' appearance. This epiphysis is located at the proximal end of the phalanx and is normally nearly flat. The related entity 'angel-shaped' epiphysis refers to a pronounced cone-shaped epiphysis in combination with a pseudoepiphysis at the distal end of the phalanx. In contrast to the proximal phalanges of the digits 2-5, the proximal phalanx of the thumb is embryologically equivalent to the middle phalanges of the other digits, whereas the first metacarpal is embryologically of phalangeal origin and as such equivalent to the proximal phalanges of the other digits.
Synonyms: Cone-shaped end part of thumb innermost long bone

Term: Enlarged epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the thumb
Definition: Abnormally large size of the epiphysis located at the proximal end of the proximal phalanx of the thumb with respect to age-dependent norms. In contrast to the proximal phalanges of the digits 2-5, the proximal phalanx of the thumb is embryologically equivalent to the middle phalanges of the other digits, whereas the first metacarpal is embryologically of phalangeal origin and as such equivalent to the proximal phalanges of the other digits.
Synonyms: Enlarged end part of thumb innermost long bone

Term: Fragmentation of the epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the thumb
Definition: Epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the thumb having multiple bony fragments.
Synonyms: Fragmentation of end part of thumb innermost long bone

Term: Irregular epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the thumb
Definition: Irregular radiographic opacity of the epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the thumb. In contrast to the proximal phalanges of the digits 2-5, the proximal phalanx of the thumb is embryologically equivalent to the middle phalanges of the other digits, whereas the first metacarpal is embryologically of phalangeal origin and as such equivalent to the proximal phalanges of the other digits.
Synonyms: Irregular end part of thumb innermost long bone

Term: Ivory epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the thumb
Definition: Sclerosis of the epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the thumb, leading to an increased degree of radiopacity (white or ivory appearance) in X-rays.
Synonyms: Increased bone density of end part of the innermost bone of the thumb

Term: Pseudoepiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the thumb
Definition: A pseudoepiphysis (which is a secondary ossification center distinct from the normal epiphysis) of the proximal phalanx of the thumb.

Term: Small epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the thumb
Definition: Abnormally small size of the epiphysis located at the proximal end of the proximal phalanx of the thumb with respect to age-dependent norms.
Synonyms: Small end part of thumb innermost long bone

Term: Stippling of the epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the thumb
Definition: The presence of abnormal punctate (speckled, dot-like) calcifications in the epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the thumb. In contrast to the proximal phalanges of the digits 2-5, the proximal phalanx of the thumb is embryologically equivalent to the middle phalanges of the other digits, whereas the first metacarpal is embryologically of phalangeal origin and as such equivalent to the proximal phalanges of the other digits.
Synonyms: Speckled calcifications in end part of thumb innermost long bone

Term: Triangular epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the thumb
Definition: A triangular appearance of the epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the thumb of the hand. This epiphysis is located at the proximal end of the phalanx and is normally nearly flat. In contrast to the proximal phalanges of the digits 2-5, the proximal phalanx of the thumb is embryologically equivalent to the middle phalanges of the other digits, whereas the first metacarpal is embryologically of phalangeal origin and as such equivalent to the proximal phalanges of the other digits.
Synonyms: Triangular end part of thumb innermost long bone

Term: Absent epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the thumb
Definition: Absence of the epiphysis located at the proximal end of the distal phalanx of the thumb.
Synonyms: Absent end part of thumb outermost long bone

Term: Bracket epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the thumb
Definition: An abnormality of the distal phalanx of the thumb in which the epiphysis surrounds a phalangeal bone, having a bracket-like form and reaching from the proximal side of a phalanx to the distal side.
Synonyms: Bracket shaped end part of thumb outermost long bone

Term: Cone-shaped epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the thumb
Definition: A cone-shaped appearance of the epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the thumb of the hand, producing a 'ball-in-a-socket' appearance. This epiphysis is located at the proximal end of the phalanx and is normally nearly flat. The related entity 'angel-shaped' epiphysis refers to a pronounced cone-shaped epiphysis in combination with a pseudoepiphysis at the distal end of the phalanx.
Synonyms: Cone-shaped end part of thumb outermost long bone, Cone-shaped terminal thumb phalanx epiphysis

Term: Enlarged epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the thumb
Definition: Abnormally large size of the epiphysis located at the proximal end of the distal phalanx of the thumb with respect to age-dependent norms.
Synonyms: Enlarged end part of thumb outermost long bone, Large terminal thumb phalanx epiphysis

Term: Fragmentation of the epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the thumb
Definition: Epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the thumb having multiple bony fragments.
Synonyms: Fragmentation of end part thumb outermost long bone

Term: Irregular epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the thumb
Definition: Uneven radiographic opacity of the epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the thumb.
Synonyms: Irregular end part of thumb outermost bone

Term: Ivory epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the thumb
Definition: Sclerosis of the epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the thumb, leading to an increased degree of radiopacity (white or ivory appearance) in X-rays.
Synonyms: Increased bone density of end part of the outermost bone of the thumb

Term: Pseudoepiphysis of the distal phalanx of the thumb
Definition: A pseudoepiphysis (which is a secondary ossification center distinct from the normal epiphysis) of the distal phalanx of the thumb.
Synonyms: Pseudoepiphysis of the outermost bone of the thumb

Term: Small epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the thumb
Definition: Abnormally small size of the epiphysis located at the proximal end of the distal phalanx of the thumb with respect to age-dependent norms.
Synonyms: Small end part of thumb outermost bone

Term: Stippling of the epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the thumb
Definition: The presence of abnormal punctate (speckled, dot-like) calcifications in the epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the thumb.
Synonyms: Speckled calcifications in the end part of the outermost thumb bone

Term: Triangular epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the thumb
Definition: A triangular appearance of the epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the thumb of the hand. This epiphysis is located at the proximal end of the phalanx and is normally nearly flat.
Synonyms: Triangular end part of thumb outermost bone, Triangular epiphysis of the outermost bone of the thumb

Definition: Absence of one or more epiphyses of the thumb.
An abnormality of the thumb in which the epiphysis surrounds a phalangeal bone, having a bracket-like form and reaching from the proximal side of a phalanx to the distal side.
Synonyms: Bracket shaped end part of the thumb bone

Definition: A cone-shaped appearance of the epiphyses of the thumb, producing a 'ball-in-a-socket' appearance. The related entity 'angel-shaped' epiphysis refers to a pronounced cone-shaped epiphysis in combination with a pseudoepiphysis at the distal end of a phalanx.
Synonyms: Cone-shaped end part of thumb long bone, Cone-shaped epiphyses of the thumb, Cone-shaped thumb epiphyses

Definition: Abnormally large size of the epiphyses of the thumb with respect to age-dependent norms.
Synonyms: Enlarged end part of thumb long bone, Enlarged epiphyses of the thumb

Definition: Epiphysis of the thumb having multiple bony fragments.
Synonyms: Fragmentation of end part of long bone of thumb, Fragmentation of the epiphyses of the thumb

Definition: Uneven radiographic opacity of the one or more epiphyses of the thumb.
Synonyms: Irregular end part of thumb long bone, Irregular epiphyses of the thumb

Definition: Sclerosis of one or more of the epiphyses of the thumb, leading to an increased degree of radiopacity (white or ivory appearance) in X-rays.
Synonyms: Increased bone density of end part of the thumb, Ivory epiphyses of the thumb

Definition: A pseudoepiphysis (which is a secondary ossification center distinct from the normal epiphysis) of one or more phalanges of the thumb.
Synonyms: Pseudoepiphyses of the thumb

Definition: Abnormally small size of one or more of the epiphyses of the thumb with respect to age-dependent norms.
Synonyms: Small end part of thumb long bone, Small epiphyses of the thumb

Definition: The presence of abnormal punctate (speckled, dot-like) calcifications in one or more of the epiphyses of the thumb.
Synonyms: Speckled calcifications in end part of thumb bone, Stippling of the epiphyses of the thumb
Triangular end part of the thumb bone

Term: Contracture of the distal interphalangeal joint of the fingers
Definition: Chronic loss of joint motion in one or more distal interphalangeal joints of the fingers.

Term: Osteolytic defects of the hand bones
Synonyms: Lytic defects of hand bones

Definition: An abnormal union between bones or parts of bones of the fingers. The synonymous term "symphalangism of the hand" may be translated as fusions of bones of varying digree, that involve at least one phalangeal bone of the hand. If bony fusions are referred to as "Symphalangism" the fusion occurs in a proximo-distal axis. Fusions of bones of the fingers in a radio-ulnar axis are referred to as "bony" Syndactyly.
Synonyms: Fused finger bones, Symphalangism of the hand, Synostosis involving bones of the fingers

Definition: Fusion involving two or more metacarpal bones (A synostosis of the first metacarpal and the proximal phalanx of the thumb can also be observed, note that the first metacarpal bone corresponds to a proximal phalanx).
Synonyms: Fused long bones of hand, Synostosis involving metacarpal bones, Synostosis involving the metacarpal bones

Definition: Synostosis (bony fusion) involving one or more bones of the carpus (scaphoid, lunate, triquetrum, trapezium, trapezoid, capitate, hamate, pisiform).
Synonyms: Carpal bone fusion, Carpal fusion, Fused carpal bones, Fusion of carpal bones, Synostosis involving the carpal bones

Definition: Fusion of the 1st metacarpal with another bone. In contrast to the proximal phalanges of the digits 2 to 5, the proximal phalanx of the thumb is embryologically equivalent to the middle phalanges of the other digits, whereas the first metacarpal is embryologically of phalangeal origin and as such equivalent to the proximal phalanges of the other digits.
Synonyms: First metacarpophalangeal joint synostosis, Fusion involving 1st long bone of hand, Symphalangism affecting the 1st metacarpal

Definition: Chronic cerebrospinal fluid (CSF) lymphocytosis is defined as the finding, in at least two serial CSF examinations, of more than 5 cells per cubic millimeter.
Synonyms: Chronic cerebrospinal fluid lymphocytosis
Fusion involving the 2nd long bone of hand
Fusion involving the 3rd long bone of hand
Fusion involving the 4th long bone of hand
Fusion involving the 5th long bone of hand

Definition: Increased concentration of interferon alpha in the cerebrospinal fluid (CSF).

Chilblains, also called perniosis, are an inflammatory skin condition related to an abnormal vascular response to the cold. We are unaware of a reliable estimate of incidence. It typically presents as tender, pruritic red or bluish lesions located symmetrically on the dorsal aspect of the fingers, toes, ears and nose. Less commonly, reports describe involvement of the thighs and buttocks. The lesions present hours after exposure to cold and usually resolve spontaneously in one to three weeks.
Synonyms: Chilblain lesions

Definition: A benign vascular tumor of the retina without any neoplastic characteristics.
Synonyms: Retinal hemangioblastoma

Definition: A hemangioblastoma of the spinal cord.
An abnormality of the epididymis.
Synonyms: Abnormality of the epididymis

Definition: A cystadenoma, an epithelial tumor, that originates within the head of the epididymis.
Small nodular masses which originate in the subependymal region of the lateral ventricles and protrude into the ventricular cavity. They may represent subependymal hamartomas of tuberous sclerosis.

Cortical tubers in the brain are hamartomatous lesions typically located at the gray-white matter interface, commonly in the frontal and parietal lobes. Cortical tubers are composed of abnormal glial and neural cells, and the size, number, and location vary among patients.

A demarcated, largely intraventricular tumor in the region of the foramen of Monro composed of spindle to large plump or ganglion-like cells with eosinophilic to amphophilic cytoplasm and somewhat pleomorphic nuclei with occasional prominent nucleoli. These tumors are almost always associated with tuberous sclerosis.

Hypomelanotic macules ("ash leaf spots") are white or lighter patches of skin that may appear anywhere on the body and are caused by a lack of melanin. White ash leaf-shaped macules are considered to be characteristic of tuberous sclerosis.
Synonyms: Hypomelanotic macules

Definition: The presence of a sebaceous adenoma with origin in the sebum secreting cells of the skin.
Synonyms: Facial angiofibromas, Sebaceous adenoma

Definition: A plaque representing a connective-tissue nevus. Connective tissue naevi are uncommon skin lesions that occur when the deeper layers of the skin do not develop correctly or the components of these layers occur in the wrong proportion. Shagreen patches are oval-shaped and nevoid, skin-colored or occasionally pigmented, smooth or crinkled. The word shagreen refers to a type of roughened untanned leather.
The presence of small depressions in the dental enamel.
Synonyms: Dental enamel pits, Dental enamel pitting, Pitting of tooth enamel, Tooth enamel pits

Definition: A lesion located beneath a fingernail or toenail.
The presence of fibromata beneath finger or toenails.
The presence of a neoplasm of the urinary bladder.
Synonyms: Bladder cancer

Definition: The presence of a neoplasm of the kidney.
Synonyms: Neoplasia of the kidneys, Renal tumors, Renal tumours

Definition: Areas of the retina lacking pigmentation. Punched out areas of chorioretinal hypopigmentation less than 1 disc diameter in size and tending to be located in the midperiphery of the retina.
Synonyms: Punched out areas of chorioretinal hypopigmentation

Definition: A benign or malignant neoplasm (tumour) originating in striated muscle, either skeletal muscle or cardiac muscle.
Synonyms: Tumors of striated muscle, Tumours of striated muscle

Definition: A benign tumor of cardiac striated muscle.
A benign tumor of striated muscle.
The presence of a hamartoma of the cerebrum.
Synonyms: Cerebral hamartomata

Definition: A neurofibroma in which Schwann cells proliferate inside the nerve sheath, producing an irregularly thickened, distorted, tortuous structure.
The presence of a glioma, which is a neoplasm of the central nervous system originating from a glial cell (astrocytes or oligodendrocytes).
A glioma originating in the optic nerve or optic chiasm.
Synonyms: Optic glioma

Definition: Neurofibromas originating in the spine.

Pseudarthrosis, or "false joint" of the tibia is the result of a developmental failure in the tibia progressing to spontaneous fracture and subsequent fibrous nonunion. The fracture is rarely present at birth but commonly develops during the first 18 months of life.
Synonyms: Tibial pseudoarthrosis

Definition: The presence of pigmented, oval and dome-shaped raised hamartomatous nevi of the iris..
Synonyms: Iris hamartomas

Definition: An abnormality of the antihelix.
Synonyms: Abnormal antehelix, Abnormal anthelix, Abnormal antihelix

Definition: Developmental hypoplasia of the antihelix.
Synonyms: Hypoplastic antihelix

Definition: Absence of the parotid gland.
Synonyms: Abnormally small parotid gland, Underdevelopment of parotid gland

Definition: Nephrosclerosis refers to thickening or scarring ("sclerosis") resulting from damage to the renal arterioles, also referred to as arteriosclerosis of the kidney arteries.
Synonyms: Scarring of kidney arteries, Thickening of kidney artiries

Definition: Shoulder joint stiffness is a perceived sensation of tightness in shoulders when attempting to move them after a period of inactivity.
Synonyms: Stiff shoulders

Definition: Double rows of eyelashes.
Synonyms: Distichiasis of eyelid eyelashes

Definition: An abnormality of the spinal dura mater, which is the outermost of the three layers of the meninges surrounding the spinal cord.
Synonyms: Abnormality of the spinal dura mater

Definition: Presence of arachnoid cysts of the spinal canal extradurally in the epidural space.
Synonyms: Epidural arachnoid cysts of the spinal canal

Definition: Abnormally increased thickness of the nasal septum.
Synonyms: Broad nasal septum, Broad septum of nose, Thick nasal septum, Thick septum of nose, Wide nasal septum, Wide septum of nose

Definition: Abnormally increased hair growth in the lumbosacral region.
Increased volume of the earlobe, that is, abnormally prominent ear lobules.
Synonyms: Fleshy earlobe, Fleshy earlobes, Large earlobe, Prominent ear lobes, Prominent ear lobules

Term: Aplasia of the pectoralis major muscle
Definition: Absence of the pectoralis major muscle.
Synonyms: Absent pectoralis major muscle

Definition: A bony defect in the skull base.
Synonyms: Cleft in cranial base, Cleft in skull base

Definition: Complete or nearly complete soft tissue fusion of the alveolar ridges.
Synonyms: Alveolar synechiae, Fusion of the alveolar ridges

Definition: Partial fusion of the upper and lower eyelid margins by single or multiple bands of tissue.
Synonyms: Adhesion of eyelids, Ankyloblepharon filiforme adnatum, Eyelid synechiae, Eyelids stuck together

Definition: A pterygium (or pterygia) occurring in the popliteal region (the back of the knee).
A pterygium (or pterygia) in the intercrural (groin) region.

Term: Pyramidal skinfold extending from the base to the top of the nails
Definition: Pyramidal skinfold extending from the base to the top of the nails is a rare and distinctive anomaly seen in popliteal pterygia syndrome.
Pterygia affecting the neck.
Synonyms: Neck pterygium

Definition: Pterygium affecting the elbow. This is a cutaneous web that can lead to severe flexion contracture of the elbow joint. Antecubital pterygium can be unilateral, bilateral, symmetric, or asysmmetric.
Synonyms: Pterygium cubitale, Webbed elbow

Definition: Anterior schisis (cleft or cleavage) of vertebral bodies.
Excessive wrinkling of the skin of the face.
Synonyms: Facial wrinkling

Definition: Chronic pain in the limbs with no clear focal etiology.
Synonyms: Limb pain

Definition: Columella extending inferior to the level of the nasal base, when viewed from the side.
Synonyms: Columella, low, Columella, low hanging, Extension of the columella below the ala nasi, Low-hanging columella

Term: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the phalanges of the hand
Definition: Small or missing phalangeal bones of the fingers of the hand.
Synonyms: Aplastic/hypoplastic phalanges, Aplastic/hypoplastic phalanges of the hand, Hypoplastic/absent phalanges

Definition: Increased width of the phalanges of the hand.
Synonyms: Wide hand bones, Widening of phalanges of the hand

Definition: The presence of short and wide phalanges which taper distally ("bullet shaped").
Synonyms: Bullet-shaped hand bones, Bullet-shaped phalanges of the hands, Conical bullet-shaped distal ends of phalanges
Curved hand bones

Term: Osteolytic defects of the phalanges of the hand
Definition: Dissolution or degeneration of bone tissue of the phalanges of the hand.
Synonyms: Acro-osteolysis, Acroosteolysis, Breakdown of small bones of fingers

Definition: Uneven (irregular) increase in bone density of one or more of the phalanges of the hand.
Synonyms: Patchy sclerosis of the phalanges of the hand, Phalangeal sclerosis, Uneven increase in bone density in finger bone

Term: Symphalangism affecting the phalanges of the hand
Definition: Fusion of two or more phalangeal bones of the hand.
Synonyms: Fused finger bones of the hand, Synostosis involving phalanges of the hand

Term: Triangular shaped phalanges of the hand
Synonyms: Delta phalanx/delta-like phalanx, Triangular shaped hand bones

Definition: Annular constrictions around the digits, limbs, or trunk, occurring congenitally (sometimes causing intrauterine autoamputation) and also associated with a wide variety of disorders. Constrictive amniotic bands are the result of primary amniotic rupture, which can lead to entanglement of fetal tissue (especially limbs) in fibrous amniotic strands.
Synonyms: Amniotic bands, Congenital constriction band sequence, Pseudoainhum

Definition: The absence of all phalanges of all the digits of a limb and the associated soft tissues.
Synonyms: Aphalangy

Definition: Absent thumb, i.e., the absence of both phalanges of a thumb and the associated soft tissues.
Synonyms: Absent thumb, Absent thumbs, Aplasia of the thumb, Thumb aplasia

Definition: Hypoplasia (congenital reduction in size) of the thumb.
Synonyms: Hypoplastic thumb, Hypoplastic thumbs, Hypoplastic/small thumb, Short thumb, Short thumbs, Small thumbs, Thumb brachydactyly, Thumb hypoplasia

Definition: Syndactyly with fusion of toes three and four.
Synonyms: syndactyly of 3rd - 4th toes, Webbed 3rd-4th toes

Definition: Horn-like malformations of the iliac crests with symmetrical bilateral central posterior iliac processes. A characteristic finding in the Nail-Patella syndrome. Iliac horns are visible on X-ray and may be palpable, but are asymptomatic.
A zone of darker pigmentation around the central part of the iris with a roughly cloverleaf or flower shape.
Absence or underdevelopment of the biceps muscle.
Synonyms: Absent/small biceps, Absent/underdeveloped biceps

Definition: Absence of the biceps muscle.
Synonyms: Absent biceps

Definition: Absence or underdevelopment of the triceps muscle.
Synonyms: Absent/small triceps, Absent/underdeveloped triceps

Definition: Absence of the triceps muscle.
Synonyms: Absent triceps

Term: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the musculature of the thigh
Definition: Absence or underdevelopment involving the musculature of the thigh.
Synonyms: Absent/small thigh muscles, Absent/underdeveloped thigh muscles

Definition: Absence or underdevelopment of the quadriceps muscle.
Synonyms: Absent/small quadriceps, Absent/underdeveloped quadriceps

Definition: Absence of the quadriceps muscle.
Synonyms: Absent quads

Definition: The presence of an abscess located around the anus.
A hemisacral defect involving the sacral vertebrae S2 to S5. In hemisacrum, the first sacral vertebra is intact and there is agenesis involving only S2-S5.
Presence of a bifid sacral bone.
The presence of a teratoma.
A type of sacrococcygeal teratoma located anterior to the sacrum and entirely inside the body (Altman type IV).
Synonyms: Altman type IV sacrococcygeal teratoma, Retrorectal teratoma

Definition: Congenital developmental defect arising from the primitive branchial apparatus.
Synonyms: Abnormality of branchial apparatus, Abnormality of branchial arch, Branchial abnormality, Branchial anomalies

Definition: A congenital fistula in the neck resulting from incomplete closure of a branchial cleft.
Synonyms: Branchial cleft fistula

Definition: A branchial cyst is a remnant of embryonic development resulting from a failure of obliteration of a branchial cleft and consists of a subcutaneous cystic mass. Cysts are located anterior or posterior to the ear or in the submandibular region.
Synonyms: Branchial cysts

Definition: Cholesteatoma is a benign but potentially destructive growth consisting of keratinizing epithelium located in the middle ear and/or mastoid process. In cholesteatoma, a skin cyst grows into the middle ear and mastoid. The cyst is not cancerous but can erode tissue and cause destruction of the ear.
A goiter that is not associated with functional thyroid abnormalities.
Synonyms: Euthyroid goitre

Definition: The presence of two or more accessory spleens.
Synonyms: Extra spleen

Definition: Maternal diabetes can either be a gestational, mostly type 2 diabetes, or a type 1 diabetes. Essential is the resulting maternal hyperglycemia as a non-specific teratogen, imposing the same risk of congenital malformations to pregnant women with both type 1 and type2 diabetes.
Synonyms: gestational diabetes, Maternal diabetes

Term: Aplasia of the phalanges of the hand
Definition: Absence of one or more of the phalanges of the hand.
Short (hypoplastic) phalanx of finger, affecting one or more phalanges.
Synonyms: Hypoplastic phalanges, Hypoplastic phalanges of hands, Hypoplastic/small phalanges of the hand, Phalangeal hypoplasia, Rudimentary phalanges, Short finger bones, Short phalanges, Shortened phalanges

Definition: The absence of one or more teeth from the normal series by a failure\nto develop
Synonyms: Decreased tooth count, Dental agenesis, Failure of development of some teeth, Reduced number of teeth, Teeth, agenesis

Definition: A form of heart failure characterized by reduced cardiac output. This may be seen in patients with heart failure owing to ischemic heart disease, hypertension, cardiomyopathy, and other causes.
A form of diabetes insipidus caused by failure of the kidneys to respond to vasopressin (AVP).

Term: Anomaly of the upper limb diaphyses
Definition: A structural abnormality of a diaphysis of the arm.
Synonyms: Abnormality involving the diaphyses of the upper limbs, Abnormality of shaft of long bone of the upper limbs, Diaphyseal abnormality of the upper limbs

Definition: An anomaly of one or more metaphyses of the arms.
Synonyms: Abnormality of the wide portion of upper limb bone, Abnormality of upper limb metaphysis, Metaphyseal abnormality of the upper limbs
Abnormality of the joints of the upper limbs, Abnormality of upper limb joint

Definition: An anomaly of the joint that connects the upper and the lower arm.
Synonyms: Abnormality of the elbow, Abnormality of the elbows

Definition: Amelia of one or both upper limbs.

Missing or malformed long bones of the upper limbs with the distal parts (the hands) connected to the variably shortened or even absent upper extremity, leading to a flipper-like appearance, as opposed to other forms of limb malformations were either the whole limb is missing (such as amelia), or the distal part of a limb is absent (peromelia).
Peromelia affecting only the upper limbs. That is, the distal parts of the arm are missing leading to stump formation.
Absence (due to failure to form) or underdevelopment of the extremities.
Synonyms: Absent/small extremities, Absent/underdeveloped extremities, Short or absent limbs, Shortened limbs

Definition: Leg shortening because of underdevelopment of one or more bones of the lower extremity.
Synonyms: Hypoplasia involving bones of the lower limbs, Hypoplasia of the lower limbs, Lower limb undergrowth, Underdeveloped lower limb bones

Term: Aplasia involving bones of the lower limbs
Synonyms: Absent bones of the lower limbs

Definition: Amelia of one or both legs.
Phocomelia affecting only the lower limbs.
Peromelia affecting only the lower limbs. That is, the distal parts of the leg are missing leading to stump formation.
Forearm shortening because of underdevelopment of one or more bones of the forearm.
Synonyms: Forearm undergrowth, Hypoplasia involving forearm bones, Short forearm bones, Short forearms, Shortened forearm
Absent forearm bones

Term: Aplasia involving bones of the upper limbs
Synonyms: Absent bones of the upper limbs

Definition: Arm shortening because of underdevelopment of one or more bones of the upper extremity.
Synonyms: Hypoplasia involving bones of the upper limbs, Short arms, Shortening of the arms, Upper limb undergrowth

Term: Aplasia involving bones of the extremities
Synonyms: Absent bones of the extremities

Definition: Limb shortening because of underdevelopment of one or more bones of the extremities.
Synonyms: Hypoplasia involving bones of the extremities, limb shortening, Limb undergrowth, Short limb, Short limbs

Definition: Congenital absence (aplasia) of one or more limbs.
The distal parts of the limbs are missing leading to a stump formation.

Missing or malformed long bones of the extremities with the distal parts (such as hands and/or feet) connected to the variably shortened or even absent extremity, leading to a flipper-like appearance, as opposed to other forms of limb malformations were either the hole limb is missing (such as amelia), or the distal part of a limb is absent (peromelia).

Peripheral neuropathy is a general term for any disorder of the peripheral nervous system. The main clinical features used to classify peripheral neuropathy are distribution, type (mainly demyelinating versus mainly axonal), duration, and course.
Synonyms: Peripheral nerve damage, Peripheral neuritis

Definition: A focal lesion of a single peripheral nerve. Damage to a sensory nerve is accompanied by sensory impairment of all modalities in the affected anatomic distribution.
Synonyms: Single damaged nerve

Term: Abnormal distal phalanx morphology of finger
Definition: Any anomaly of distal phalanx of finger.
Synonyms: Abnormal terminal phalanges of the hand, Abnormality of the distal phalanges of the hand, Abnormality of the distal phalanx of finger, Abnormality of the outermost finger bone

Term: Abnormal middle phalanx morphology of the hand
Definition: An anomaly of middle phalanx of finger.
Synonyms: Abnormality of the middle finger bones of the hand, Abnormality of the middle phalanges of the hand

Term: Abnormal proximal phalanx morphology of the hand
Synonyms: Abnormality of the innermost finger bones of the hand, Abnormality of the proximal phalanges of the hand

Term: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the distal phalanges of the hand
Definition: Absence or underdevelopment of the distal phalanges.
Synonyms: Absent/hypoplastic distal phalanges, Absent/small outermost finger bone of the hand, Absent/underdeveloped outermost finger bone of the hand, Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the distal phalanges, Aplastic/hypoplastic distal phalanges, Hypoplastic to absent terminal phalanges, Hypoplastic/aplastic distal phalanges, Hypoplastic/aplastic distal phalanx

Definition: Abnormally wide (broad) distal phalanx of finger.
Synonyms: Broad distal phalanges, Broad distal phalanges of the hand, Broad distal phalanx, Broad outermost finger bone, Broad terminal phalanges, Broad, square ends of distal phalanges, Spatulate terminal phalanges

Term: Bullet-shaped distal phalanges of the hand
Definition: Short and wide distal phalanges that taper distally. Bullet-shaped phalanges lack the normal diaphyseal constriction.
Synonyms: Bullet-shaped outermost finger bone of the hand

Term: Curved distal phalanges of the hand
Synonyms: Curved outermost finger bone of the hand

Term: Osteolytic defects of the distal phalanges of the hand
Synonyms: Acro-osteolysis of distal phalanges, Acroosteolysis of distal phalanges, Osteolytic defects of the outermost finger bone of the hand

Term: Patchy sclerosis of distal phalanx of finger
Definition: Uneven (irregular) increase in bone density of the distal phalanges of the hand.
Synonyms: Patchy sclerosis of the distal phalanges of the hand, Uneven increase in bone density in outermost finger bone

Term: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the middle phalanges of the hand
Synonyms: Absent/hypoplastic middle phalanges, Absent/small middle finger bone of the hand, Absent/underdeveloped middle finger bone of the hand, Aplasia/hypoplasia of middle phalanges, Aplastic/hypoplastic middle phalanges, Hypoplastic/aplastic middle phalanx, Short to absent middle phalanges, Short/absent middle phalanges

Definition: Increased width of the middle phalanx of finger.
Synonyms: Broad middle finger bones, Broad middle phalanges of finger, Broad middle phalanges of the hand

Term: Bullet-shaped middle phalanges of the hand
Definition: Any of the middle phalanges with short and wide phalanx that tapers distally. Bullet-shaped phalanges lack the normal diaphyseal constriction.

Term: Curved middle phalanges of the hand
Synonyms: Curved middle finger bonds of the hand

Term: Osteolytic defects of the middle phalanges of the hand
Patchy sclerosis of middle phalanx of finger
Definition: Uneven (irregular) increase in bone density of one or more of the middle phalanges of the hand.
Synonyms: Patchy sclerosis of the middle phalanges of the hand, Uneven increase in bone density in the middle finger bones of the hand

Term: Symphalangism of middle phalanx of finger
Definition: Fusion of a middle phalanx of a finger with another bone.
Synonyms: Fused middle finger bone

Term: Triangular shaped middle phalanges of the hand
Synonyms: Triangular shaped middle finger bones of the hand

Term: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the proximal phalanges of the hand
Synonyms: Absent/small innermost finger bones of the hand, Absent/underdeveloped innermost finger bones of the hand

Term: Broad proximal phalanges of the hand
Definition: Increased width of the proximal phalanges of the finger.
Synonyms: Broad innermost finger bones of the hand, Wide innermost finger bones of the hand

Term: Bullet-shaped proximal phalanges of the hand
Definition: Short and wide proximal phalanges that taper distally . Bullet-shaped phalanges lack the normal diaphyseal constriction.
Synonyms: Bullet-shaped innermost finger bones of the hand

Term: Curved proximal phalanges of the hand
Synonyms: Curved innermost finger bones of the hand

Term: Osteolytic defects of the proximal phalanges of the hand
Synonyms: Proximal phalanges osteolysis

Term: Patchy sclerosis of proximal phalanx of finger
Definition: Uneven increase in bone density of the proximal phalanges of the hand.
Synonyms: Patchy sclerosis of the proximal phalanges of the hand, Uneven increase in bone density in innermost finger bone

Term: Symphalangism affecting the proximal phalanges of the hand
Synonyms: Fused innermost hand bones

Term: Triangular shaped proximal phalanges of the hand
Triangular shaped distal phalanges of the hand
Synonyms: Triangular shaped outermost bone of the hand

Term: Cerebellar ataxia associated with quadrupedal gait
Definition: The presence of cerebellar signs and symptoms such as lack of balance associated with quadrupedal gait (locomotion on all four extremities with a 'bear-like' gait with the legs held straight).
An abnormality of the cerebral cortex with fewer gyri but with normal cortical thickness. This pattern is usually often associated with congenital microcephaly.
Synonyms: Cortical gyral simplification

Term: Broad distal phalanges of all fingers
Definition: Abnormally wide (broad) distal phalanx of finger of all fingers.
Synonyms: Broad outermost hand bones

Term: Aplasia of the distal phalanges of the hand
Synonyms: Absent distal phalanges of the hand, Absent outermost hand bone, Aplasia of outermost hand bone

Definition: Short distance from the end of the finger to the most distal interphalangeal crease or the distal interphalangeal joint flexion point. That is, hypoplasia of one or more of the distal phalanx of finger.
Synonyms: Brachytelophalangy, Distal phalangeal hypoplasia, Hypoplasia of the distal phalanges, Hypoplasia of the distal phalanges of the hand, Hypoplasic terminal phalanges, Hypoplastic distal phalanges, Hypoplastic terminal phalanges, Short distal phalanges, Short outermost finger bone, Terminal phalangeal hypoplasia of hand

Term: Duplication of the distal phalanx of hand
Definition: This term applies if one or more of the distal phalanges of the hand are either partially duplicated, depending on severity leading to a broad or bifid appearance of the phalanges, or completely duplicated.
Synonyms: Bifid terminal phalanges, Duplication of the outermost bone of hand, Notched outermost bone of hand, Partial/complete duplication of the distal phalanges of the hand

Definition: A reduction in diameter of the distal phalanx of finger towards the distal end.
Synonyms: Tapered distal phalanges, Tapered distal phalanges of the hand, Tapered outermost finger bone

Definition: Trichorrhexis nodosa is the formation of nodes along the hair shaft through which breakage readily occurs. It is thus a focal defect in the hair fiber that is characterized by thickening or weak points (nodes) that cause the hair to break off easily. The result is defective, abnormally fragile hair.
An abnormality of hair pigmentation (color).
Synonyms: Abnormality of hair color, Abnormality of hair colour, Abnormality of hair pigmentation

Definition: Abnormality of the growth of secondary sexual hair, which normally ensues during puberty. In males, secondary sexual hair usually comprises body hair, including underarm, abdominal, chest, and pubic hair. In females, secondary sexual hair usually comprises a lesser degree of body hair, most prominently underarm and pubic hair.
Synonyms: Abnormality of secondary sexual hair

Definition: Abnormally increased hair growth with a localized distribution.
Synonyms: Localised abnormal hair growth, Localised hirsutism, Localized abnormal hair growth

Definition: Distance between the hairline (trichion) and the glabella (the most prominent point on the frontal bone above the root of the nose), in the midline, more than two SD above the mean. Alternatively, an apparently increased distance between the hairline and the glabella.
Synonyms: High frontal hairline

Definition: Flatness of the supraorbital portion of the frontal bones.
Synonyms: Depressed supraorbital margins, Depressed supraorbital ridge, Flat supraorbital margins, Flat supraorbital ridge, Flattened bony protrusion above eyes, Hypoplasia of supraorbital margins, Hypoplasia of the supraorbital ridges, Hypoplastic supraorbital ridges, Shallow orbital ridges, Shallow supraorbital ridge

Definition: Complete absence of any auricular structures.
The presence of telangiectasia of the ear.
Increased thickness of the external ear.
Synonyms: Thickened ears

Term: Abnormality of the crus of the helix
Definition: An abnormality of the crus of the helix, which is the horizontal piece of cartilage located outside the ear canal that divides the upper and lower parts of the ear.
Synonyms: Abnormality of the crus of the ear

Definition: An abnormality of the antitragus, which is a small tubercle opposite to the tragus of the ear. The antitragus and the tragus are separated by the intertragic notch.

An abnormal horizontal axis orientation of the crus of the helix. That is, the main axis of the crus of the helix is perpendicular to the medial longitudinal axis of the ear, instead of sloping inferoposteriorly.
Synonyms: Helix, crus, horizontal, Horizontal orientation of the crus of helix, Horizontal orientation of the ear crus

Definition: Developmental hypoplasia of the crus of the helix. That is, flatter and/or shorter crus helix than average.
Synonyms: Hypoplasia of the crus of the ear, Underdeveloped crus of the ear

Definition: The presence of an abnormally prominent of the crus of the helix. That is, development of the crus helix to the same degree as an average antihelix stem or helix.
Synonyms: Abnormal prominence of the crus of the ear, Helix, crus, prominent, Hyperplastic helix crus, Hypertrophic helix crus

Definition: A unilateral absence of sensory perception of sound.
Synonyms: Deafness in one ear, Deafness, unilateral

Definition: Distortion of the course of the normal folds of the ear and the appearance of supernumerary crura and folds.
Synonyms: Crumpled ear

Definition: A notched form of the helix of the ear. That is, a defect in the continuity of the helix, which may occur at any point along its length.
Synonyms: Notched helix, Notching of the ear helix

Definition: Presence of nodules in the conjunctiva of the eye.
Abnormally prominent ear helix.
Decreased thickness of the helix of the ear.
Absence or underdevelopment of the ear lobes.
Synonyms: Absent/small ear lobes, Absent/underdeveloped ear lobes

Definition: Attachment of the lobe to the side of the face at the lowest point of the lobe without curving upward.
Synonyms: Adherent earlobe, Attached earlobe

Definition: Sharply demarcated, typically linear and approximately horizontal, indentations in the outer surface of the ear lobe.
Synonyms: Earlobe crease, Transverse earlobe creases

Definition: An abnormal orientation of the earlobes such that they point out- and upward. That is, the lateral surface of ear lobe faces superiorly.
Synonyms: Fleshy upturned lobules, Lobe, uplifted, Uplifted earlobe, Upturned earlobe

Term: Aplasia of the middle ear ossicles
Definition: Absence of the middle ear ossicles, malleus, incus, and stapes.
Synonyms: Absent middle ear bones, Absent middle ear ossicles

Definition: Abnormality of the temporal bone of the skull, which is situated at the sides and base of the skull roughly underlying the region of the face known as the temple.
Synonyms: Abnormality of the temporal bone

Definition: An abnormality of the tragus.
Synonyms: Abnormality of the tragus

Definition: Aplasia or developmental hypoplasia of the tragus.
Synonyms: Absent/small tragus, Absent/underdeveloped tragus

Definition: Cyclopia is a congenital abnormality in which there is only one eye. That eye is centrally placed in the area normally occupied by the root of the nose.
Synonyms: Cyclops eye, Single central eye

Definition: The presence of a size difference between the left and right cornea.
Synonyms: Asymmetry of the corneas

Definition: Anisocoria, or unequal pupil size, may represent a benign physiologic variant or a manifestation of disease.
Synonyms: Asymmetric pupil sizes, Asymmetry of the pupils, Unequal pupil dilatation, Unequal pupil size

Definition: The presence of remnants of a fetal membrane that persist as strands of tissue crossing the pupil.
A malposition of the pupil owing to a developmental defect of the iris.
Synonyms: Corectopia, Displaced pupil

Definition: A tumor of the eye originating from cells of the retina.
A dermal melanocytic hamartoma that presents as bluish hyperpigmentation on the face along the first or second branches of the trigeminal nerve. Nevus of Ota may involve the sclera.
Synonyms: Congenital melanosis bulbi, Naevus fuscoceruleus ophthalmomaxillaris, Nevus fuscoceruleus ophthalmomaxillaris, Oculodermal melanocytosis

Definition: A condition associated with a limitation of the horizontal ocular movement with retraction of the globe and narrowing of the palpebral fissure on adduction
Synonyms: Limited eye motility from Duane anomaly, Limited eye movement from Duane anomaly

Term: Vascular remnant arising from the disc
Definition: Persistence of the hyaloid artery, which is the embryonic artery that runs from the optic disk to the posterior lens capsule may persist; the site of attachment may form an opacity. The hyaloid artery is a branch of the ophthalmic artery, and usually regresses completely before birth.
Synonyms: Persistence of the hyaloid artery, Persistent hyaloid artery

Definition: Underdevelopment or absence of the nose or parts thereof.
Synonyms: Decreased nasal size, Decreased size of nose

Definition: Abnormally increased lacrimation, that is, excessive tearing (watering eye).
Synonyms: Increased lacrimation, Increased tears, Tearing, Watery eyes

Definition: Complete absence of all nasal structures.
Synonyms: Absent nose, Arrhinia, Failure of development of nose, Nasal underdevelopment, Underdevelopment of nose

Definition: Increase in bulk of the ala nasi.
Synonyms: Ala nasi, thick, Thickening of the alae nasi

Definition: A structural abnormality of the columella.
Synonyms: Abnormality of the columella, Anomaly of the columella

Definition: Asymmetry or size difference between the left and right nostril.
Synonyms: Asymmetry of nostrils, Crooked nostrils, Unequal nostril shape, Unequal nostril size, Uneven nostril shape, Uneven nostril size

Definition: Increased aperture of the nostril.
Synonyms: Broad nostril, Dilated nares, Dilated nostril, Enlarged nares, Enlarged nostril, Increased diameter of nares, Increased diameter of nostril, Increased width of nares, Large nares, Naris, broad, Naris, enlarged, Wide nares, Wide nostril

Definition: The presence of only a single nostril.
Synonyms: Mono nostril, One nostril, Single nare, Single nostril

Definition: Slender, slit-like aperture of the nostril.
Synonyms: Naris, narrow, Naris, slit-like, Narrow nares, Narrow nostrils, Slit-like nostrils, Small nostrils, Thin nares, Thin nostrils

Definition: The presence of more than two nostrils.
Synonyms: Accessory nares, Accessory nostril, Extra nostril, Supernumerary nares, Supernumerary nostrils

Definition: Absence or underdevelopment of the nasal septum.
Synonyms: Ageneis of nasal septum, Underdevelopment of nasal septum

Definition: Abnormally narrow nasal septum.
Synonyms: Decreased width of nasal septum, Narrow nasal septum, Narrow septum of nose, Thin nasal septum, Thin septum of nose

Definition: Excess facial hair.
Lack or loss of the soft tissues between the zygomata and mandible.
Synonyms: Depressed cheeks, Hollow cheeks, Sunken cheeks

Definition: Absence of the mandible.
Synonyms: Absence of lower jaw, Absence of lower jaw bone, Absence of mandible, Absent mandible, Agenesis of the mandible, Aplasia of the lower jaw bone, Failure of development of lower jaw, Failure of development of mandible, Missing lower jaw

Definition: Lack of symmetry between the left and right mandible.
Synonyms: Asymmetry of lower jaw, Canted lower jaw, Canted mandible, Crooked lower jaw, Deviation of lower jaw, Deviation of mandible, Lower jaw shifted to one side, Tilted lower jaw, Uneven lower jaw, Uneven mandible

Definition: The presence of an asymmetric mouth.
Synonyms: Asymmetry of the mouth, Canted mouth, Crooked mouth, Tilted mouth, Uneven mouth

Definition: Complete or partial duplication of the phalanges of the thumb. Depending on the severity, the appearance on x-ray can vary from a notched phalanx (the duplicated bone is almost completely fused with the phalanx), a partially fused appearance of the two bones (bifid), two separate bones appearing side to side, or completely duplicated phalanges (proximal and distal phalanx of the thumb and/or 1st metacarpal). In contrast to the phalanges of the digits 2-5 (proximal, middle and distal), the proximal phalanx of the thumb is embryologically equivalent to the middle phalanges of the other digits, whereas the first metacarpal is embryologically of phalangeal origin and as such equivalent to the proximal phalanges of the other digits.
Synonyms: Complete/partial duplication of phalanges of the thumb, Duplicated thumbs, Duplication of phalanx of thumb

Definition: A complete duplication affecting one or more of the phalanges of the thumb. As opposed to a partial duplication were there is still a variable degree of fusion between the duplicated bones, a complete duplication leads to two separate bones appearing side to side (radio-ulnar axis) as seen on x-rays. A duplication leading to an accesory bone appearing in the proximo-distal axis on x-rays, this is actually a different entity called a Pseudoepiphyses (see according terms) sometimes also referred to as Hyperphalangism.
Synonyms: Complete duplication of the phalanges of the thumb, Complete duplication of thumb bones, Digitalization of thumb, Digitalization of thumbs

Definition: A partial duplication, depending on severity leading to a broad or bifid appearance, affecting one or more of the phalanges of the thumb. As opposed to a complete duplication there is still a variable degree of fusion between the duplicated bones.
Synonyms: Bifid thumb, Notching of thumb phalanges, Partial duplication of the phalanges of the thumb, Partial duplication of the thumb bones

Definition: This term applies if one or more of the phalanges of the 2nd finger are either partially duplicated, depending on severity leading to a broad or bifid appearance of the phalanges, or completely duplicated.
Synonyms: Duplication of the bones of index finger, Partial/complete duplication of phalanges of the 2nd finger
Extra index finger

Definition: Partial or complete duplication of the second proximal phalanx of hand.

Definition: Partial or complete duplication of the distal phalanx of index finger.

Definition: Partial duplication of the second proximal phalanx of hand, seen on x-rays as a broad and/or bifid phalanx.

Definition: A partial duplication, depending on severity leading to a broad or bifid appearance, affecting one or more of the phalanges of the 2nd finger. As opposed to a complete duplication there is still a variable degree of fusion between the duplicated bones.

Definition: A complete duplication affecting one or more of the phalanges of the 2nd finger. As opposed to a partial duplication were there is still a variable degree of fusion between the duplicated bones, a complete duplication leads to two separate bones appearing side to side (radio-ulnar axis) as seen on x-rays. A duplication leading to an accesory bone appearing in the proximo-distal axis on x-rays, is a different entity called a Pseudoepiphyses (see according terms) sometimes also referred to as Hyperphalangism.
