Term: Abnormality of the epiphysis of the 1st metacarpal
Definition: In contrast to the metacarpals 2-5, the first metacarpal is embryologically of phalangeal origin and as such equivalent to the proximal phalanges of the digits 2-5 (whereas the proximal phalanx of the thumb is equivalent to the middle phalanges of the other digits). The epiphysis of the first metacarpal is localized at the proximal end (as seen in the proximal phalanges of the other digits), whereas the epiphyses of the other metacarpal bones are located at the distal end. This term applies if the epiphysis of the 1st metacarpal is in any way abnormal, referring to age and gender depending norms, as seen on x-rays.
Synonyms: Abnormality of the end part of the 1st long bone of hand
Absent end part of the 1st long bone of hand

Definition: An epiphysis that curves around from its transverse orientation to a longitudinal one from proximal to distal along one side of the phalanx, thus resembling the letter 'C' and forming a bracket around the diaphysis. This results in a so called delta phalanx characterized by a triangular or trapezoidal shaped bone with a C-shaped epiphyseal plate.
Synonyms: Bracket shaped end part of 1st long bone of hand

Definition: A cone-shaped appearance of the epiphysis of the 1st metacarpal, producing a 'ball-in-a-socket' appearance.
Synonyms: Cone-shaped end part of the 1st long bone of hand

Definition: Abnormally large size of the epiphyses of the 1st metacarpal with respect to age-dependent norms.
Synonyms: Enlarged end part of the 1st long bone of hand

Term: Fragmentation of the epiphysis of the 1st metacarpal
Definition: Epiphysis of the 1st metacarpal having multiple bony fragments.
Synonyms: Fragmentation of the end part of the 1st long bone of hand

Definition: Uneven radiographic opacity of the epiphysis of the 1st metacarpal.
Synonyms: Irregular end part of the 1st long bone of hand

Definition: The epiphysis of the 1st metacarpal appears hard and dense like ivory. An ivory epiphysis has a uniformly dense appearance on radiographs.
Synonyms: Increased bone density of end part of the 1st long bone of hand

Definition: The epiphysis of the first metacarpal is localized at the proximal end of the metacarpal bone although an accessory epiphysis may be located at the distal end of the metacarpal.
Abnormally small size of the epiphysis of the 1st metacarpal with respect to age-dependent norms.
Synonyms: Small end part of the 1st long bone of hand

Term: Epiphyseal stippling of the first metacarpal
Definition: The presence of abnormal punctate (speckled, dot-like) calcifications in the epiphyses of the first metacarpal bone.
Synonyms: Speckled calcifications in the end part of the first long bone of hand, Stippling of the epiphysis of the 1st metacarpal
Triangular end part of the 1st long bone of hand

Definition: Aplasia or Hypoplasia affecting the 1st metacarpal. In contrast to the metacarpals 2-5, the first metacarpal is embryologically of phalangeal origin and as such equivalent to the proximal phalanges of the digits 2-5 (whereas the proximal phalanx of the thumb is equivalent to the middle phalanges of the other digits).
Synonyms: Absent/small 1st long bone of hand, Absent/underdeveloped 1st long bone of hand

Definition: Increased width of the 1st metacarpal. In contrast to the proximal phalanges of the digits 2-5, the proximal phalanx of the thumb is embryologically equivalent to the middle phalanges of the other digits, whereas the first metacarpal is embryologically of phalangeal origin and as such equivalent to the proximal phalanges of the other digits.
Synonyms: Wide 1st long bone of hand

Definition: The presence of short and wide 1st metacarpal which tapers distally ("bullet shaped").
Synonyms: Bullet-shaped 1st long bone of hand

Definition: A deviation from the normal straight shape of the first metacarpal.
Synonyms: Curved 1st long bone of hand

Definition: Dissolution or degeneration of bone tissue of the 1st metacarpal.
Uneven increase in bone density within the 1st metacarpal.
Synonyms: Uneven increase in bone density in 1st long bone of hand

Definition: This term applies to a triangular shaped 1st metacarpal.
Synonyms: Triangular shaped 1st long bone of hand

Definition: A developmental defect characterized by reduced length of the first metacarpal (long bone) of the hand.
Synonyms: First metacarpal hypoplasia, First metacarpals hypoplastic, Hypoplastic 1st metacarpal, Short first metacarpal, Short first metacarpals, Shortened 1st long bone of hand

Definition: Absent first metacarpal (long bone) of the hand.
Synonyms: Absent 1st long bone of hand, Absent first metacarpal

Definition: Aplasia or Hypoplasia affecting the 2nd metacarpal.
Synonyms: Absent/small 2nd long bone of hand, Absent/underdeveloped 2nd long bone of hand

Definition: Absence of the second long bone of the hand.
Synonyms: Absent 2nd long bone of hand

Definition: Short second metacarpal bone because of developmental hypoplasia.
Synonyms: Rudimentary 2nd metacarpal, Shortened 2nd long bone of hand

Definition: Aplasia or Hypoplasia affecting the 3rd metacarpal.
Synonyms: Absent/small 3rd long bone of hand, Absent/underdeveloped 3rd long bone of hand

Definition: Absence of the third long bone of the hand.
Synonyms: Absent 3rd long bone of hand

Definition: Short third metacarpal bone.
Synonyms: Hypoplastic 3rd metacarpal, Short third metacarpals, Shortened 3rd long bone of hand, Small 3rd metacarpals

Definition: Aplasia or Hypoplasia affecting the 4th metacarpal.
Synonyms: Absent/small 4th long bone of hand, Absent/underdeveloped 4th long bone of hand

Definition: Absence of the fourth long bone of the hand.
Synonyms: Absent 4th long bone of hand

Definition: Short fourth metacarpal bone.
Synonyms: Hypoplastic fourth metacarpal, Short 4th metacarpals, Short fourth metacarpals, Shortened 4th long bone of hand

Definition: Aplasia or Hypoplasia affecting the 5th metacarpal.
Synonyms: Absent/small 5th long bone of hand, Absent/underdeveloped 5th long bone of hand

Definition: Absence of the fifth long bone of the hand.
Synonyms: Absent 5th long bone of hand, Absent 5th metacarpal

Definition: Short fifth metacarpal bone.
Synonyms: Fifth metacarpal hypoplasia, Hypoplastic 5th metacarpal, Short fifth metacarpal, Short fifth metacarpals, Shortened 5th long bone of hand

Definition: Developmental defect associated with absence of one or more metacarpal bones.
Synonyms: Absent long bone of hand, Absent metacarpal, Absent metacarpals

Definition: Diminished length of one or more metacarpal bones in relation to the others of the same hand or to the contralateral metacarpal.
Synonyms: Brachymetacarpalia, Hypoplastic metacarpal, Metacarpal hypoplasia, Short metacarpals, Shortened long bone of hand, Shortened long bones of hand, Shortened metacarpals, Shortening of metacarpals

Definition: Displacement of the big toe from its normal position.
Synonyms: Displacement of big toe, Displacement of the hallux

Term: Abnormal morphology of the proximal phalanx of the hallux
Definition: An abnormal shape or form of the proximal phalanx of the big toe.
Synonyms: Abnormal innermost big toe bone, Abnormality of the proximal phalanx of the hallux

Term: Abnormality of the distal phalanx of the hallux
Synonyms: Abnormality of the outermost bone of the big toe

Term: Abnormality of the first metatarsal bone
Definition: An anomaly of the first metatarsal bone.

Definition: A deviation from the normal straight form of one or more phalanges of the big toe.

Term: Osteolytic defects of the phalanges of the hallux

Term: Triangular shaped phalanges of the hallux
Synonyms: Triangular shaped bones of big toe

Definition: Absence or underdevelopment of the first metatarsal bone.

Definition: Increased side-to-side width of the first metatarsal bone.
Synonyms: Broad 1st metatarsal, Enlarged first metatarsal, Wide 1st long bone of foot

Definition: An abnormal morphology of the firstmetatarsal bone, which is short and wide and tapers distally, and lacks the normal diaphyseal constriction.

Definition: A deviation from the normal straight shape of a proximal phalanx of the 1st metatarsal bone.

Synonyms: Bullet-shaped innermost toe bone, Bullet-shaped proximal phalanges of the toes, Bullet-shaped proximal phalanges of toe

Definition: A deviation from the normal straight shape of a proximal phalanx of one or more toes.
Synonyms: Curved innermost toe bones, Curved proximal phalanges of the toes

Term: Osteolytic defect of the proximal toe phalanx
Definition: Dissolution or degeneration of bone tissue of the proximal toe phalanx.
Synonyms: Osteolytic defects of the proximal phalanges of the toes

Term: Patchy sclerosis of proximal toe phalanx
Definition: Patchy (irregular) increase in bone density of one or more of the proximal phalanges of the toes. This can take on many forms depending on severity and distribution as can be seen on x-rays.
Synonyms: Patchy sclerosis of the proximal phalanges of the toes, Uneven increase in bone density in innermost toe bone

Term: Symphalangism affecting the proximal phalanges of the toes
Synonyms: Fused innermost bones of toes

Term: Triangular shaped proximal phalanges of the toes
Synonyms: Triangular shaped innermost toe bones

Term: Duplication of proximal phalanx of toe
Definition: Partial/complete duplication of a proximal phalanx of toe.
Synonyms: Duplication of innermost toe bones, Partial/complete duplication of the proximal phalanges of the toes

Definition: One or more bent (flexed) joints of the first (big) toe that cannot be straightened actively or passively.
Synonyms: Joint contracture of the big toe, Joint contracture of the hallux

Term: Contracture of the tarsometatarsal joint of the hallux
Definition: Chronic loss of joint motion in the tarsometatarsal joint of the hallux due to structural changes in non-bony tissue. The tarsometatarsal joints of the feet are also called Lisfranc's joints.

Term: Contracture of the interphalangeal joint of the hallux
Definition: The interphalangeal joint of the big toe cannot be straightened actively or passively.

Term: Contractures of the metatarsophalangeal joint of the hallux
Definition: The joint between the first metatarsal and the proximal phalanx of the first (big) toe cannot be straightened actively or passively.

A foot deformity resulting due to an abnormality affecting the bones of the foot (as well as muscle and soft tissue). In contrast if only the muscle and soft tissue are affected the term positional foot deformity applies.

Term: Abnormality of the epiphysis of the 2nd metacarpal
Definition: Any abnormality of the epiphysis of the second metacarpal bone.
Synonyms: Abnormality of the end part of the 2nd long bone of hand

Term: Abnormality of the epiphysis of the 3rd metacarpal
Definition: Any abnormality of the epiphysis of the third metacarpal bone.
Synonyms: Abnormality of the end part of the 3rd long bone of hand

Definition: The normal epiphysis of the third metacarpal is localised at the distal end of the metacarpal bone. This term aplies if an accesory epiphysis, located at the proximal end of the metacarpal bone, is present.

Term: Abnormality of the epiphysis of the 4th metacarpal
Definition: Any abnormality of the epiphysis of the 4th metacarpal bone.
Synonyms: Abnormality of the end part of the 4th long bone of hand

Definition: The normal epiphysis of the fourth metacarpal is localised at the distal end of the metacarpal bone. This term aplies if an accesory epiphysis, located at the proximal end of the metacarpal bone, is present.

Term: Abnormality of the epiphysis of the 5th metacarpal
Definition: Any abnormality of the epiphysis of the fifth metacarpal bone.
Synonyms: Abnormality of the end part of the long bone of little finger, Abnormality of the end part of the long bone of pinkie finger, Abnormality of the end part of the long bone of pinky finger

Definition: The normal epiphysis of the fifth metacarpal is localised at the distal end of the metacarpal bone. This term aplies if an accesory epiphysis, located at the proximal end of the metacarpal bone, is present.

Term: Absent epiphyses of the phalanges of the hand
Definition: Absence of one or more epiphyses of the phalanges of the fingers.
Synonyms: Absent end part of fingers, Absent epiphyses of the fingers

Term: Bracket epiphyses of the phalanges of the hand
Definition: Bracket epiphysis refers to an abnormality in which the epiphysis surrounds a phalangeal bone, having a bracket-like form and reaching from the proximal side of a phalanx to the distal side.
Synonyms: Bracket epiphyses of the fingers, Bracket shaped end part of finger bones

Term: Cone-shaped epiphyses of the phalanges of the hand
Definition: A cone-shaped appearance of the epiphyses of the fingers of the hand, producing a 'ball-in-a-socket' appearance. The related entity 'angel-shaped' epiphysis refers to a pronounced cone-shaped epiphysis in combination with a pseudoepiphysis at the distal end of a phalanx.
Synonyms: Cone-shaped end part of finger bones, Cone-shaped epiphyses of hand, Cone-shaped epiphyses of the fingers, Coned epiphyses of hands, Conical phalangeal epiphyses

Term: Enlarged epiphyses of the phalanges of the hand
Definition: Abnormally large size of the epiphyses of the phalanges of the fingers with respect to age-dependent norms.
Synonyms: Enlarged end part of finger bones, Enlarged epiphyses of the fingers, Enlarged phalangeal epiphyses

Term: Fragmentation of the epiphyses of the phalanges of the hand
Definition: Fragmented appearance of the epiphyses of the phalanges of the fingers.
Synonyms: Fragmentation of end part of finger bones, Fragmentation of the epiphyses of the fingers

Term: Irregular epiphyses of the phalanges of the hand
Definition: Irregular radiographic opacity of the epiphyses of the phalanges of the fingers.
Synonyms: Irregular end part of finger bones, Irregular epiphyses of the fingers

Term: Ivory epiphyses of the phalanges of the hand
Definition: Sclerosis of the epiphyses of the phalanges of the fingers, leading to an increased degree of radiopacity (white or ivory appearance) in X-rays.
Synonyms: Increased bone density of end part of the hand bones, Ivory epiphyses of the fingers, Sclerotic ivory phalangeal epiphyses

Term: Pseudoepiphyses of the phalanges of the hand
Definition: A secondary ossification center in the phalanges of the hand that is distinct from the normal epiphysis that does not contribute to the longitudinal growth of a tubular bone.
Synonyms: Pseudoepiphysis of the fingers

Term: Small epiphyses of the phalanges of the hand
Definition: Abnormally small size of the epiphyses of the phalanges of the fingers with respect to age-dependent norms.
Synonyms: Small end part of finger bones, Small epiphyses of the fingers

Definition: The presence of abnormal punctate (speckled, dot-like) calcifications in the epiphyses of phalanges of the fingers.
Synonyms: Speckled calcifications in end part of finger bones, Stippling of the epiphyses of the fingers, Stippling of the epiphyses of the phalanges of the hand

Term: Triangular epiphyses of the phalanges of the hand
Definition: A triangular appearance of the epiphyses of the phalanges of the fingers of the hand.
Synonyms: Delta-shaped epiphyses of the fingers, Triangular end part of finger bones, Triangular epiphyses of the fingers

Term: Aplasia of the middle phalanx of the hand
Definition: Absence of one or more middle phalanx of a finger.
Synonyms: Absent middle bones of hand, Absent middle phalanges, Missing middle phalanges

Definition: Congenital hypoplasia of one or more proximal phalanx of finger.
Synonyms: Hypoplasia of the proximal phalanges of the hand, Short innermost finger bones, Short proximal phalanges, Short proximal phalanx of finger, Shortening in proximal phalanges

Term: Aplasia of the proximal phalanges of the hand
Synonyms: Absent innermost bones, Absent proximal phalanges

Term: Abnormality of the epiphyses of the distal phalanx of finger
Definition: Any anomaly of distal epiphysis of phalanx of finger.
Synonyms: Abnormality of the end part of the outermost bone of finger

Term: Abnormality of the epiphyses of the middle phalanges of the hand

Term: Abnormality of the epiphyses of the proximal phalanges of the hand
Synonyms: Abnormality of the end part of the innermost hand bones

Definition: Distal epiphyses of the hand are hard and dense like ivory. Such an epiphysis has a uniformly dense appearance on radiographs.
Synonyms: Eburnated epiphyses of distal phalanges, Increased bone density of end part of the outermost hand bones

Term: Pseudoepiphyses of the distal phalanges of the hand

Definition: Stomatitis is an inflammation of the mucous membranes of any of the structures in the mouth.
Synonyms: Inflammation of the mouth

Definition: A gap in the lower lip.
Synonyms: Cleft lower lip, Cleft of the lower lip, Lower labial cleft

Definition: Height of the vermilion of the medial part of the lower lip more than 2 SD below the mean. Alternatively, an apparently reduced height of the vermilion of the lower lip in the frontal view (subjective).
Synonyms: Decreased height of lower lip vermilion, Decreased volume of lower lip, Decreased volume of lower lip vermilion, Thin lower lip, Thin vermilion border of lower lip

Definition: Increased pigmentation, either focal or generalized, of the mucosa of the mouth.
Synonyms: Hyperpigmentation of oral mucosa, Oral mucosa melanin pigmentation, Oral racial pigmentation

Definition: Fibrous band between the mucosal surfaces of the upper and lower alveolar ridges.
Synonyms: Synechiae of the mouth

Definition: Any abnormality of the salivary glands, the exocrine glands that produce saliva.
Synonyms: Abnormality of the salivary glands

Definition: Any abnormality of the submandibular glands, which are the salivary glands that are located beneath the floor of the mouth, superior to the digastric muscles.
Synonyms: Abnormality of the submaxillary glands

Definition: Any abnormality of the sublingual glands, which are the salivary glands that are located beneath the floor of the mouth anterior to the submandibular glands.

Term: Cleft of alveolar ridge of maxilla
Definition: A gap (cleft) affecting one of the alveolar ridges, which are the protuberances in the mouth that contain the sockets (alveoli) of the teeth. An alveolar cleft can affect all structures of the alveolar ridge, including the gingiva, other mucosa, periosteum, alveolar bone, and teeth.
Synonyms: Alveolar ridge cleft, Cleft of gum ridge, Notch of alveolar ridge, Notch of gum ridge

Definition: Distance between the labial point of the incisive papilla to the midline junction of the hard and soft palate more than 2 SD below the mean (objective) or apparently decreased length of the hard palate (subjective).
Synonyms: Decreased length of hard palate

Definition: Increased size and/or number of soft tissue folds on the palatal side of the maxillary alveolar ridge.
Synonyms: Large lateral palatal folds, Large lateral palatal ridges, Prominent lateral palatal folds, Prominent lateral palatal ridges, Prominent palatine folds

Definition: Lack of the uvula.
Synonyms: Absent palatine uvula, Congenital absence of uvula, Missing uvula, Uvula aplasia

Definition: Underdevelopment or absence of the uvula.
Synonyms: Aplasia/hypoplasia of palatine uvula

Definition: A fistula which connects the oral cavity and the pharyngeal area via the aspects of the soft palate.
Absence or underdevelopment of the tongue.
Synonyms: Lingual aplasia/hypoplasia

Definition: Short or anteriorly attached lingual frenulum, associated with limited mobility of the tongue.
Synonyms: Tongue tied

Definition: Tongue with a median apical indentation or fork.
Synonyms: Bifurcated tongue, Bilobed tongue, Cleft tongue, Forked tongue, Split tongue

Definition: Glossy appearance of the entire tongue surface.
Synonyms: Smooth lingual surface, Smooth surface of tongue, Smooth tongue

Definition: Any abnormality of dentin.
Synonyms: Abnormal dentin, Abnormality of dentin, Abnormality of dentine, Dentin anomaly

Definition: An abnormally low-pitched voice.
A heterogeneous group of congenital spinal anomalies that result from defective closure of the neural tube early in fetal life.
Synonyms: Incomplete closure of the vertebral arch

Definition: A neoplasm affecting the spinal cord.
Synonyms: Spinal cord tumor, Spinal cord tumour, Tumor of the spinal cord, Tumour of the spinal cord

Definition: Any abnormality of the spinal meninges, the system of membranes (dura mater, the arachnoid mater, and the pia mater) which envelops the spinal cord.
Synonyms: Abnormality of the spinal meninges

Definition: An outpouching of the spinal meninges.
Absence (aplasia) of the sacrum.
Synonyms: Absent sacrum, Sacral agenesis

Definition: Reduced inferior to superior extent of the thorax.
Synonyms: Shorter than typical length between neck and abdomen

Definition: Stridor is a high pitched sound resulting from turbulent air flow in the upper airway.
The congenital absence of the sternum.
Synonyms: Aplasia of the sternum, Breast bone aplasia

Definition: The sternal cleft is a rare congenital anomaly resulting from a fusion failure of the sternum.
Synonyms: Sternal cleft

Definition: Accumulation of excessive amounts of lymphatic fluid (chyle) in the pleural cavity.
Absence or underdevelopment of the breasts.
Synonyms: Absent/small breasts, Absent/underdeveloped breasts

Definition: The presence of asymmetrical breasts.
The presence of hypertrophy of the breast.
Synonyms: Breast enlargement, Breasts enlarged, Gigantomastia, Hypertrophy of the breasts, Large breast, Macromastia

Definition: Premature development of the breasts.
Synonyms: Premature breast development

Definition: Absence or underdevelopment of the diaphragm.
Synonyms: Absent/small diaprhagm, Absent/underdeveloped diaprhagm

Term: Ebstein anomaly of the tricuspid valve
Definition: Ebstein's anomaly refers to an abnormally placed and deformed tricuspid valve characterized by apical displacement of the septal and posterior tricuspid valve leaflets, leading to atrialization of the right ventricle with a variable degree of malformation and displacement of the anterior leaflet.
Synonyms: Ebstein's anomaly, Ebstein's anomaly of the tricuspid valve, Ebstein's malformation

Definition: Absence of the scapulae.
Synonyms: Absent scapula, Absent shoulder blade

Term: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the abdominal wall musculature
Definition: Absence or underdevelopment of the abdominal musculature.
Synonyms: Absent/small abdominal wall muscles, Absent/underdeveloped abdominal wall muscles

An anomaly of the third toe.

Term: Duplication of the phalanges of the 5th toe
Definition: Partial or complete duplication of one or more phalanx of little toe.
Synonyms: Duplication of the bones of the little toe, Duplication of the bones of the pinkie toe, Duplication of the bones of the pinky toe, Duplication of the phalanges of the fifth toe, Partial/complete duplication of the phalanges of the 5th toe

Term: Abnormality of the distal phalanx of the 5th toe
Synonyms: Abnormality of the outermost bone of the little toe, Abnormality of the outermost bone of the pinkie toe, Abnormality of the outermost bone of the pinky toe

Term: Abnormality of the middle phalanx of the 5th toe
Synonyms: Abnormality of the middle bone of the little toe, Abnormality of the middle bone of the pinkie toe, Abnormality of the middle bone of the pinky toe

Term: Abnormal morphology of the proximal phalanx of the 5th toe
Synonyms: Abnormality of the innermost bone of the little toe, Abnormality of the innermost bone of the pinkie toe, Abnormality of the innermost bone of the pinky toe

Term: Aplasia/hypoplasia of the proximal phalanx of the 2nd toe
Definition: Absence (agenesis) or underdevelopment of the proximal phalanx of the 2nd toe.
Synonyms: Absent/small innermost 2nd toe bone, Absent/underdeveloped innermost 2nd toe bone

Term: Broad proximal phalanx of the 2nd toe
Synonyms: Broad innermost bone of 2nd toe

Term: Bullet-shaped proximal phalanx of the 2nd toe
Definition: An abnormal morphology of the proximal phalanx of the 2nd toe, with a short and wide phalanx that tapers distally. Bullet-shaped phalanges lack the normal diaphyseal constriction.
Synonyms: Bullet-shaped innermost bone of 2nd toe

Term: Curved proximal phalanx of the 2nd toe
Definition: A deviation from the normal straight form of the proximal phalanx of the 2nd toe.
Synonyms: Curved innermost bone of 2nd toe

Term: Osteolytic defects of the proximal phalanx of the 2nd toe
Patchy sclerosis of the proximal phalanx of the 2nd toe
Synonyms: Uneven increase in bone density in the innermost bone of the 2nd toe

Term: Symphalangism affecting the proximal phalanx of the 2nd toe
Synonyms: Fused innermost bone of the 2nd toe

Term: Triangular shaped proximal phalanx of the 2nd toe
Synonyms: Triangular shaped innermost 2nd toe bone

Term: Duplication of the proximal phalanx of the 2nd toe
Definition: Partial or complete duplication of proximal phalanx of second toe.
Synonyms: Duplication of innermost 2nd toe bone, Duplication of the proximal phalanx of the second toe, Partial/complete duplication of the proximal phalanx of the 2nd toe

Term: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the middle phalanx of the 2nd toe
Synonyms: Absent/small middle bone of 2nd toe, Absent/underdeveloped middle bone of 2nd toe

Term: Broad middle phalanx of the 2nd toe
Synonyms: Broad middle bone of 2nd toe

Term: Bullet-shaped middle phalanx of the 2nd toe
Definition: An abnormal morphology of the middle phalanx of the second toe, with a short and wide phalanx that tapers distally. Bullet-shaped phalanges lack the normal diaphyseal constriction.
Synonyms: Bullet-shaped middle bone of 2nd toe

Term: Curved middle phalanx of the 2nd toe
Definition: A deviation from the normal straight form of the middle phalanx of the 2nd toe.
Synonyms: Curved middle bone of 2nd toe

Term: Osteolytic defects of the middle phalanx of the 2nd toe
Patchy sclerosis of the middle phalanx of the 2nd toe
Synonyms: Uneven increase in bone density in the middle bone of the 2nd toe

Term: Symphalangism affecting the middle phalanx of the 2nd toe
Synonyms: Fused middle bone of 2nd toe

Term: Triangular shaped middle phalanx of the 2nd toe
Synonyms: Triangular shaped middle bone of 2nd toe

Term: Duplication of the middle phalanx of the 2nd toe
Definition: Partial or complete duplication of middle phalanx of second toe.
Synonyms: Duplication of middle bone of 2nd toe, Partial/complete duplication of the middle phalanx of the 2nd toe

Term: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the distal phalanx of the 2nd toe
Synonyms: Absent/small outermost 2nd toe bone, Absent/underdeveloped outermost 2nd toe bone

Term: Broad distal phalanx of the 2nd toe
Synonyms: Broad outermost bone of the 2nd toe, Wide outermost bone of the 2nd toe

Term: Bullet-shaped distal phalanx of the 2nd toe
Definition: An abnormal morphology of the distal phalanx of the second toe, with a short and wide phalanx that tapers distally. Bullet-shaped phalanges lack the normal diaphyseal constriction.
Synonyms: Bullet-shaped outermost bone of the 2nd toe

Term: Curved distal phalanx of the 2nd toe
Definition: A deviation from the normal straight form of the distal phalanx of the 2nd toe.
Synonyms: Curved outermost bone of the 2nd toe

Term: Osteolytic defects of the distal phalanx of the 2nd toe
Patchy sclerosis of the distal phalanx of the 2nd toe
Synonyms: Uneven increase in bone density in the outermost bone of the 2nd toe

Term: Symphalangism affecting the distal phalanx of the 2nd toe
Synonyms: Fused outermost bone of the 2nd toe

Term: Triangular shaped distal phalanx of the 2nd toe
Synonyms: Triangular shaped outermost 2nd toe bone

Term: Duplication of the distal phalanx of the 2nd toe
Definition: Partial or complete duplication of the distal phalanx of second toe.
Synonyms: Duplication of the outermost bone of the 2nd toe, Partial/complete duplication of the distal phalanx of the 2nd toe

Term: Complete duplication of the proximal phalanx of the 2nd toe
Definition: Complete duplication of proximal phalanx of second toe.
Synonyms: Complete duplication of the innermost 2nd toe bone, Complete duplication of the proximal phalanx of the second toe

Term: Partial duplication of the proximal phalanx of the 2nd toe
Definition: Partial duplication of proximal phalanx of second toe.
Synonyms: Partial duplication of the innermost 2nd toe bone, Partial duplication of the proximal phalanx of the second toe

Term: Complete duplication of the distal phalanx of the 2nd toe
Definition: Complete duplication of the distal phalanx of second toe.
Synonyms: Complete duplication of the outermost bone of the 2nd toe

Term: Partial duplication of the distal phalanx of the 2nd toe
Definition: Partial duplication of the distal phalanx of second toe.
Synonyms: Partial duplication of the outermost bone of the 2nd toe

Term: Complete duplication of the middle phalanx of the 2nd toe
Definition: Complete duplication of middle phalanx of second toe.
Synonyms: Complete duplication of the middle bone of the 2nd toe

Term: Partial duplication of the middle phalanx of the 2nd toe
Definition: Partial duplication of middle phalanx of second toe.
Synonyms: Partial duplication of the middle bone of the 2nd toe

Term: Partial duplication of phalanx of the 2nd toe
Definition: Partial duplication of a phalanx of second toe.
Synonyms: Partial duplication of 2nd toe bone

Term: Complete duplication of the phalanges of the 2nd toe
Definition: Complete duplication of a phalanx of second toe.
Synonyms: Complete duplication of the 2nd toe bones

Term: Aplasia of the phalanges of the 2nd toe
Synonyms: Absent 2nd toe bones

Definition: Reduced length of one or more phalanx of second toe as a result of developmental hypoplasia.
Synonyms: Hypoplastic/small phalanges of the 2nd toe, Short 2nd toe bone, Short phalanx of the second toe

Term: Absent distal phalanx of the 2nd toe
Definition: Absence of distal phalanx of the second toe as a result of developmental aplasia.
Synonyms: Absent distal phalanx of the second toe, Absent outermost bone of the 2nd toe, Aplasia of the distal phalanx of the 2nd toe

Term: Short distal phalanx of the 2nd toe
Definition: Reduced length of the distal phalanx of the second toe as a result of developmental hypoplasia.
Synonyms: Hypoplastic/small distal phalanx of the 2nd toe, Short distal phalanx of the second toe, Short outermost bone of the 2nd toe

Term: Aplasia of the middle phalanx of the 2nd toe
Synonyms: Absent middle bone of 2nd toe

Term: Short middle phalanx of the 2nd toe
Definition: Reduced length of the middle phalanx of second toe as a result of developmental hypoplasia.
Synonyms: Hypoplastic/small middle phalanx of the 2nd toe, Short middle 2nd toe bone, Short middle phalanx of the second toe

Term: Aplasia of the proximal phalanx of the 2nd toe
Synonyms: Absent innermost 2nd toe bone

Term: Short proximal phalanx of the 2nd toe
Definition: Reduced length of the proximal phalanx of second toe as a result of developmental hypoplasia.
Synonyms: Hypoplastic/small proximal phalanx of the 2nd toe, Short innermost 2nd toe bone, Short proximal phalanx of the second toe

Definition: A structural abnormality of the interventricular septum.
Synonyms: Abnormal interventricular septum morphology, Abnormality of the ventricular septum, Ventricular septum abnormality

Definition: In contrast to forms of polydactyly where the supernumerary digit (this can either be a rudimentary or a completely 'normal' digit) is either located postaxial (on the fibular side of the foot, next top the little toe), preaxial (on the tibial side of the foot, next to the big toe) or mesoaxial (somewhere central, between big and little toe), a supernumerary digit may also be placed ectopically, meaning anywhere else except post-,meso- or preaxial. In the literature this is sometimes referred to as Disorganisation-like Syndrome (OMIM223200).

In contrast to forms of polydactyly where the supernumerary digit (this can either be a rudimentary or a completely 'normal' digit) is either located postaxial (on the ulnar side of the hand, next to the little finger), preaxial (on the radial side of the hand, next to the thumb) or mesoaxial (somewhere central, between thumb and little finger), a supernumerary digit may also be placed ectopically, meaning anywhere else except post-,meso- or preaxial. In the literature this is sometimes referred to as Disorganisation-like Syndrome (OMIM223200).
A congenital anomaly characterized by the presence of supernumerary fingers or toes.
Synonyms: More than five fingers or toes on hands or feet

Definition: A bifid or bifurcated appearance of the femur as seen on x-rays, possible appearing as a more or less severe bowing of the upper leg. Might be associated with hip dysplasia on the affected side.
Synonyms: Notched thighbone, Split thighbone

Definition: The retrograde (backwards) flow of blood through the pulmonary valve into the right ventricle during diastole.
Synonyms: Pulmonary incompetence, Pulmonary valve regurgitation, Pulmonic regurgitation, Puolmonary valve insufficiency

Definition: An ostium primum atrial septal defect is located in the most anterior and inferior aspect of the atrial septum. The ostium primum refers to an anterior and inferior opening (ostium) within the septum primum, which divides the rudimentary atrium during fetal development. The ostium primum is normally sealed by fusion of the superior and inferior endocardial cushions around 5 weeks' gestation. Ostium primum defects result from a failure of the fusion of the embryologic endocardial cushion and septum primum.
Synonyms: Atrial septal defect, primum type, Ostium primum atrial septal defect, Primum atrioventricular canal defect, Septum primum defect

Definition: A narrowing of the orifice of the tricuspid valve of the heart.
An abnormal connection between the epithelialised surface of the anal canal and the perianal skin.
Synonyms: Fistula in ano

Definition: A developmental defect resulting in complete obliteration of the lumen of the colon. That is, there is an abnormal closure, or atresia of the tubular structure of the colon.
Synonyms: Atresia of the large intestine, Large intestinal atresia

Definition: An abnormal narrowing of the lumen of the esophagus.
Synonyms: Narrowing of the esophagus, Narrowing of the oesophagus

Definition: Absence or underdevelopment of the spleen.
Synonyms: Absent/small spleen, Absent/underdeveloped spleen

Definition: An abnormal (non-anatomic) location of the spleen.
Synonyms: Abnormal spleen location, Ectopic spleen

Definition: Pelvic asymmetry refers to asymmetric positioning of landmarks on the two sides of the pelvis and may have a structural or functional etiology.
Synonyms: Asymmetric pelvis

Definition: The presence of osteophytes (bone spurs), i.e., of bony projections originating from the acetabulum.
An exaggeration of the normal arched form of the acetabular roof such that it takes on a steep appearance.
An abnormality of the sacrosciatic notch, i.e., the deep indentation in the posterior border of the hip bone at the point of union of the ilium and ischium.
Synonyms: Abnormality of greater sciatic notch, Abnormality of the greater sacrosciatic notch, Abnormality of the sacroiliac notch

Definition: Hermaphroditism refers to a discrepancy between the morphology of the gonads and that of the external genitalia. In female pseudohermaphroditism, the genotype is female (XX) and the gonads are ovaries, but the external genitalia are virilized.
The presence of both ovarian and testicular tissues either in the same or in opposite gonads. Affected persons have ambiguous genitalia and may have 46,XX or 46,XY karyotypes or 46,XX/XY mosaicism.
Synonyms: Testicular and ovarian tissue present

Definition: Abnormality of the female genital system.
Abnormality of the male genital system.
Synonyms: Abnormal male genitals, Abnormality of the male genitalia

Definition: Aplasia or developmental hypoplasia of the ovary.
Synonyms: Absent/small ovary, Absent/underdeveloped ovary

Definition: Aplasia, that is failure to develop, of the ovary.
Synonyms: Absent ovary

Definition: A developmental disorder characterized by the progressive loss of primordial germ cells in the developing ovaries of an embryo, leading to hypoplastic ovaries composed of wavy connective tissue with occasional clumps of granulosa cells, and frequently mesonephric or hilar cells.
The onset of puberty before the age of 8 years in girls.
Absence or underdevelopment of the testes.
Synonyms: Absent/small testes, Absent/underdeveloped testes

Definition: Testis not palpable in the scrotum or inguinal canal.
Synonyms: Absence of palpable testicules, Absent testes, Aplasia of the testes

Definition: The presence of more than two testes.
Synonyms: Extra testes, Polyorchidism

Definition: Increased urinary excretion of oligosaccharides (low molecular weight carbohydrate chains composed of at least three monosaccharide subunits), derived from a partial degradation of glycoproteins.

An abnormality in the synthesis or catabolism of heme. Heme is composed of ferrous iron and protoporphyrin IX and is an essential molecule as the prosthetic group of hemeproteins such as hemoglobin, myoglobin, mitochondrial and microsomal cytochromes.
Abnormally increased excretion of porphyrins in the urine.
Buildups of minerals that form in the urinary bladder.
Cloacal exstrophy is a severe anterior abdominal wall defect in which the two hemibladders are visible and are separated by a midline intestinal plate, an omphalocele, and an imperforate anus.
Absence or underdevelopment of the urinary bladder.
Synonyms: Absent/small bladder, Absent/underdeveloped bladder

Definition: Aplasia (absence) of the urinary bladder.
Synonyms: Absent bladder

Definition: Abnormality of the urachus.
Persistence of the urachal canal resulting in a canal between the bladder and the umbilicus.
Synonyms: Persistent urachus

Definition: The presence of an abnormal connection between the urethra and another organ or the skin.
The presence of an abnormal membrane obstructing the urethra.
Shortening of the arms predominantly affecting terminal parts of the arm in relation to the upper and middle limb segments.
Amniotic constriction rings affecting the arms.
Abnormal increase in size of the upper limbs (due to an increase of the size of cells).
Synonyms: Increased size of upper limb

Definition: The ability of the elbow joint to move beyond its normal range of motion.
An abnormality of the hypothenar eminence, i.e., of the muscles on the ulnar side of the palm of the hand (i.e., on the side of the little finger).
Reduced muscle mass on the ulnar side of the palm, that is, reduction in size of the hypothenar eminence.
Synonyms: Hypoplasia of the hypothenar eminence, Hypothenar hypoplasia

Definition: Absence or underdevelopment of the palmar creases.
Synonyms: Absent/small palm crease, Absent/underdeveloped palm crease

Definition: The absence of the major creases of the palm (distal transverse crease, proximal transverse crease, or thenar crease).
Synonyms: Absence of the palmar creases, Absent palm lines, Aplasia of the palmar creases

Definition: An abnormality of the creases of the skin of palm of hand.
Synonyms: Abnormality of the palm lines

Definition: A narrow segment of significantly reduced circumference of a digit.
Synonyms: Amniotic constriction rings of digits

Definition: Webbing or fusion of the fingers, involving soft parts and including fusion of individual finger bones. Bony fusions are referred to as "bony" Syndactyly if the fusion occurs in a radio-ulnar axis. Fusions of bones of the fingers in a proximo-distal axis are referred to as "Symphalangism".
Synonyms: Osseous syndactyly of the fingers

Definition: An abnormally increased length of the metacarpal bones.
Synonyms: Elongated long bone of hand, Increased length of metacarpals

Definition: Shortening of the legs predominantly affecting terminal parts of the leg in relation to the upper and middle arm segments.
Amniotic constriction rings affecting the legs.
Abnormal increase in size of the lower limbs (due to an increase of the size of cells).
A developmental defect in which the legs are fused together.
A developmental defect that occurs if the two halves of the patella fail to fuse in early childhood.

The kneecap normally is located within the groove termed trochlea on the distal femur and can slide up and down in it. Patellar subluxation refers to an unstable kneecap that does not slide centrally within its groove, i.e., a partial dislocation of the patella.
Synonyms: Partial knee cap dislocation, Subluxation of patella

Definition: The ability of the knee joint to extend beyond its normal range of motion (the lower leg is moved beyond a straight position with respect to the thigh).
An abnormal limitation of knee joint mobility.
Synonyms: Limitation of knee mobility, Limited knee movement

Definition: A bending or abnormal curvature of the fibula.
Synonyms: Bowed calf bone

Definition: Duplication of the fibula. This may occur as a part of diplopodia (accessory tarsal or metatarsal bone). Diplopodia with double fibula is an extremely rare condition.
Synonyms: Duplicated calf bone

Definition: An abnormal increase in the length of the tibia.
Synonyms: Increased length of shankbone, Increased length of shinbone

Definition: An abnormal limitation of the mobility of the ankle joint.
An abnormality of dermatoglyphs on the toes and soles, i.e., an abnormality of the patterns of ridges of the skin of sole of foot.
Synonyms: Abnormal dermatoglyphics on feet, Abnormal prints on feet

Definition: A difference in size or shape between the left and right foot.
A condition in which the anterior part of the foot rotates outward away from the midline of the body and the heel remains straight.
Absence of the tarsal bones.
Synonyms: Absent ankle bone, Absent tarsals

Definition: An ability of the toe joints to move beyond their normal range of motion.
Toes that appear disproportionately long compared to the foot.
Synonyms: Increased length of toes, Long toe, Long toes

Definition: Calcification within the adrenal glands.
Deposition of calcium salts in the pituitary gland.

Hypersecretion of one or more pituitary hormones. This can occur in conditions in which deficiency in the target organ leads to decreased hormonal feedback, or as a primary condition most usually in connection with a pituitary adenoma.
Absence or underdevelopment of the thymus.
Synonyms: Absent/small thymus, Absent/underdeveloped thymus

Definition: Enlargement of the thymus.
Synonyms: Enlarged thymus, Thymic hyperplasia

Definition: The presence of ectopic thymus tissue. Normally, cells of the ventral bud of the third pharyngeal pouch detach and migrate in the eighth gestational week caudally and medially towards the location of the mature thyroid. They migrate further retrosternally into the superior mediastinum. There are two main ways ectopic thymus tissue can develop. Either cells detach along the descensus path and proliferate, thereby forming accessory thymus tissue, or the entire gland fails to descend.
Synonyms: Abnormal thymus position

Definition: An abnormality of the thyroid gland owing to the presence of a fibrous cyst resulting from the persistence of the thyroglossal duct.
Synonyms: Thyroglossal duct cyst

Definition: An abnormal increase in quantity or strength of fetal movements.
Synonyms: Fetal hyperkinesia, Foetal hyperkinesia, Increased foetal movement

Definition: Gait apraxia affecting the ability to make walking movements with the legs.

A learning disorder characterized primarily by difficulties in learning to read and spell. Dyslectic children also exhibit a tendency to read words from right to left and to confuse letters such as b and d whose orientation is important for their identification. Children with dyslexia appear to be impaired in phonemic skills (the ability to associate visual symbols with the sounds they represent).
Synonyms: Reading disability

Definition: An acquired type of sensory aphasia where damage to the brain leads to the loss of the ability to read.
Synonyms: Text blindness, Word blindness

Definition: Inability to recognize objects not because of sensory deficit but because of the inability to combine components of sensory impressions into a complete pattern. Thus, agnosia is a neurological condition which results in an inability to know, to name, to identify, and to extract meaning from visual, auditory, or tactile impressions.
An inability or difficulty differentiating among the fingers of either hand as well as the hands of others.

A writing disability in the absence of motor or sensory deficits of the upper extremities, resulting in an impairment in the ability to write regardless of the ability to read and not due to intellectual impairment.

Inability to recognize the form of objects by touch without visual input. That is, an impairment in the recognition of objects based only on the texture, size, weight and three-dimensional form of the object in the absence of any major somatosensory deficit.
Synonyms: Astereognosis, Somatosensory agnosia

Definition: Inability to recognize faces of familiar persons.
Synonyms: Face blindness, Facial agnosia

Definition: The tendency to repeat vocalizations made by another person.
Synonyms: Echoing another person's speech, Echologia, Echophrasia

Definition: Palatal tremor (PT) is an involuntary, rhythmic and oscillatory movement of the soft palate. PT is a rare type of tremor involving the soft palate. It can be unilateral or bilateral.
Synonyms: Palatal myoclonus

Definition: Spinal myoclonus is generally due to a tumor, infection, injury, or degenerative process of the spinal cord, and is characterized by involuntary rhythmic muscle contractions, usually at a rate of more than one per second. Myoclonus occurs synchronously in several muscles and can be increased in severity and frequency by fatigue or stress, but is usually unaffected by sensory stimuli. Spinal myoclonus ceases during sleep or anesthesia.
Paroxysmal episodes of vertigo.
The combination of pendular nystagmus, head nodding, and torticollis.
A paroxysmal, transient loss of memory function with preservation of immediate recall and remote memory but with a severe impairment of memory for recent events and ability to retain new information.

An intermittent cessation of airflow at the mouth and nose during sleep. Apneas of at least 10 seconds are considered important, but persons with sleep apnea may have apneas of 20 seconds to up to 2 or 3 minutes. Patients may have up to 15 events per hour of sleep.
Synonyms: Pauses in breathing while sleeping, Sleep apnoea

Definition: Sleep apnea resulting from a transient abolition of the central drive to the ventilatory muscles.
Synonyms: Central sleep apnoea

Definition: An abnormally increased width of the cranial sutures for age-related norms (generally resulting from delayed closure).
Synonyms: Broad cranial sutures, Large cranial suture, open cranial sutures, Persistent open cranial sutures, Widened cranial sutures

Definition: An abnormally small sella turcica.
Synonyms: Hypoplasia of sella turcica

Definition: The presence of an abnormally thin calvarium.
Synonyms: Thin cranial bone

Definition: A degree of pneumatization that is increased compared to age-related norms.

The presence of convoluted folds and furrows formed from thickened skin of the scalp, resembling cerebriform pattern. The scalp has convoluted and elevated folds, 1 to 2 cm in thickness. The convolutions generally cannot be flattened by traction.
Synonyms: Cutis verticis gyrata, Furrows in thickened skin on top of scalp, Scalp rugae, Thickened folds on top of scalp

Definition: Nystagmus due to disturbance of the vestibular system; eye movements are rhythmic, with slow and fast components.
Bursts of large-amplitude multidirectional saccades without intersaccadic interval

Vertical nystagmus may present with either up-beating or down-beating eye movements or both. When present in the straight-ahead position of gaze it is referred to as upbeat nystagmus or downbeat nystagmus.
Downbeat nystagmus is a type of fixation nystagmus with the fast phase beating in a downward direction. It generally increases when looking to the side and down and when lying prone.

Fine, rapid twitching of individual muscle fibers with little or no movement of the muscle as a whole. If a motor neuron or its axon is destroyed, the muscle fibers it innervates undergo denervation atrophy. This leads to hypersensitivity of individual muscle fibers to acetyl choline so that they may contract spontaneously. Isolated activity of individual muscle fibers is generally so fine it cannot be seen through the intact skin, although it can be recorded as a short-duration spike in the EMG.
Synonyms: EMG: fibrillations on electromyogram

Definition: A type of paralysis in which a muscle becomes soft and yields to passive stretching, which results from loss of all or practically all peripheral motor nerves that innervated the muscle. Muscle tone is reduced and the affected muscles undergo extreme atrophy within months of the loss of innervation.
A localized myotonic contraction in a muscle in reaction to percussion (tapping with the examiner's finger, a rubber percussion hammer, or a similar object).
Synonyms: Transient swelling of muscle induced by percussion

Term: Weakness due to upper motor neuron dysfunction
Definition: Paralysis of voluntary muscles means loss of contraction due to interruption of one or more motor pathways from the brain to the muscle fibers. Although the word paralysis is often used interchangeably to mean either complete or partial loss of muscle strength, it is preferable to use paralysis or plegia for complete or severe loss of muscle strength, and paresis for partial or slight loss. Paralysis due to lesions of the principle motor tracts is related to a lesion in the corticospinal, corticobulbar or brainstem descending (subcorticospinal) neurons.
Synonyms: Paralysis due to lesions of the principle motor tracts

Definition: Severe or complete weakness of both lower extremities with sparing of the upper extremities.
Synonyms: Leg paralysis

Definition: Weakness of both lower extremities with sparing of the upper extremities. Paraplegia refers to a severe or complete loss of strength, whereas paraparesis refers to a relatively mild loss of strength.

An acute dystonic reaction with blepharospasm, periorbital twitches, and protracted fixed staring episodes. There may be a maximal upward deviation of the eyes in the sustained fashion. Oculogyric crisis can be triggered by a number of factors including neuroleptic medications.

A soft tissue continuity in the A/P axis between two fingers that extends distally to at least the level of the proximal interphalangeal joints, or a soft tissue continuity in the A/P axis between two fingers that lies significantly distal to the flexion crease that overlies the metacarpophalangeal joint of the adjacent fingers.
Synonyms: Cutaneous syndactyly of fingers, Cutaneous syndactyly of hands, Webbed fingers, Webbed skin of fingers

Definition: A finger resting on the dorsal surface of an adjacent digit when the hand is at rest.
An abnormality of the clivus, which is the inclined bony region of the posterior cranial fossa located between the sella turcica and the foramen magnum.
An abnormal vertical orientation of the clivus (which normally forms a kind of slope from the sella turcica down to the region of the foramen magnum).
An abnormally wavy surface or edge of the clavicles.
Synonyms: Wavy clavicles, Wavy collarbone

Definition: An abnormally wavy surface or edge of the ribs.
Synonyms: Wavy ribs

Definition: A midline anterior-posterior cleft of the epiglottis that involves at least two-thirds of the epiglottic leaf. It is a useful feature for clinical diagnosis because it appears to be very rare in syndromes other than Pallister-Hall-Syndrome and is also rare as an isolated malformation.
This term applies if the Epiglottis is absent or hypoplastic.

A disordered proliferation of mature tissues that is native to the site of origin, e.g., exostoses, nevi and soft tissue hamartomas. Although most hamartomas are benign, some histologic subtypes, e.g., neuromuscular hamartoma, may proliferate aggressively such as mesenchymal cystic hamartoma, Sclerosing epithelial hamartoma, Sclerosing metanephric hamartoma.

Y-shaped metatarsals are the result of a partial fusion of two metatarsal bones, with the two arms of the Y pointing in the distal direction. Y-shaped metatarsals may be seen in combination with polydactyly.
Synonyms: Y-shaped long bone of foot

Definition: A hamartoma (disordered proliferation of mature tissues) which can originate from any tissue of the eye.
Elevated 7-dehydrocholesterol levels.
Synonyms: Elevated levels of cholesta-5,7-dien-3beta-ol

Definition: An abnormally low concentration of serum alpha-fetoprotein as compared to normal values for gestational-age.
Synonyms: Low maternal serum alpha-fetoprotein

Definition: An abnormal elevation of phytanic acid.
Synonyms: Elevated level of phytanic acid, Elevated levels of phytanic acid

Term: Abnormality of the epiphysis of the femoral head
Definition: Any abnormality of the proximal epiphysis of the femur.
Synonyms: Abnormality of the end part of the innermost thighbone, Abnormality of the proximal femoral epiphysis

Definition: The presence of developmental dysplasia of the femoral head.
Synonyms: Dysplastic femoral head

Definition: A cystic lesion originating within the brain.
Synonyms: Cerebral cystic malformation
Absent end part of bone
Bracket shaped end part of long bone

Definition: Cone-shaped epiphyses (also known as coned epiphyses) are epiphyses that invaginate into cupped metaphyses. That is, the epiphysis has a cone-shaped distal extension resulting from increased growth of the central portion of the epiphysis relative to its periphery.
Synonyms: Cone-shaped end part of bone, Cone-shaped epiphyses, Coned epiphyses

Definition: Increased size of epiphyses.
Synonyms: Large end part of bone, Large epiphyses, Widened, distorted epiphyses

Definition: An alteration of the normally smooth contour of the epiphysis leading to an irregular appearance.
Synonyms: Irregular end part of long bone

Definition: Sclerosis of the epiphyses, leading to an increased degree of radiopacity (white or ivory appearance) in X-rays.
Synonyms: Epiphyseal sclerosis, Increased bone density in end part of bone

Definition: Reduction in the size or volume of epiphyses.
Synonyms: Small end part of bone
Triangular end part of bone

Definition: Stop of growth at the epiphyseal plate the hyaline cartilage plate in the metaphysis at each end of a long bone, at an earlier than normal age, resulting in growth arrest and shortening of the involved bone.
Synonyms: Premature closure of epiphyses

Term: Abnormality of the distal femoral epiphysis
Definition: Any abnormality of the distal epiphysis of the femur.
Synonyms: Abnormality of the end part of the outermost thighbone

Term: Abnormality of the proximal tibial epiphysis
Definition: Any abnormality of the proximal epiphysis of the tibia.
Synonyms: Abnormality of the end part of innermost shankbone, Abnormality of the end part of innermost shinbone

Term: Abnormality of the distal tibial epiphysis
Synonyms: Abnormality of the end part of outermost shankbone, Abnormality of the end part of outermost shinbone
Abnormality of the end part of the calf bone

Term: Abnormality of the proximal fibular epiphysis
Definition: Any abnormality of the proximal epiphysis of the fibula.
Synonyms: Abnormality of the innermost end part of calf bone

Term: Abnormality of the distal fibular epiphysis
Definition: Any abnormality of the distal epiphysis of the fibula.
Synonyms: Abnormality of the outermost end part of calf bone

Term: Abnormality of the proximal radial epiphysis
Definition: Any abnormality of the proximal epiphysis of the radius.

Term: Abnormality of the distal radial epiphysis
Definition: Any abnormality of the distal epiphysis of the radius.

Term: Abnormality of the proximal humeral epiphysis
Definition: Any abnormality of the proximal epiphysis of the humerus.
Synonyms: Abnormality of the end part of the innermost long bone in upper arm

Term: Abnormality of the distal humeral epiphysis
Definition: Any abnormality of the distal epiphysis of the humerus.
Synonyms: Abnormality of the end part of the outermost long bone in upper arm

Definition: Any abnormality of the distal epiphysis of the ulna.
Synonyms: Abnormality of the distal ulnar epiphysis

Definition: Any abnormality of the proximal epiphysis of the ulna.
Synonyms: Abnormality of the proximal ulnar epiphysis

Definition: An abnormal predominance of type II muscle fibers (in general, this feature can only be observed on muscle biopsy).
Synonyms: Type 2 muscle fibre predominance, Type II muscle fiber predominance, Type II muscle fibre predominance

Definition: A benign uni- or multicystic, intraosseous tumor of odontogenic origin, with a characteristic lining of parakeratinized stratified squamous epithelium and potential for aggressive, infiltrative behaviour.
Synonyms: Keratocystic odontogenic tumor, Keratocystic odontogenic tumour, Keratocysts of the jaw
Cyst of the eyelid, Eyelid bump, Eyelid mass

Definition: A chronic epithelioid cell granulomatous inflammation of the meibomian gland caused by inflammation of a blocked meibomian gland. A chalazion or meibomian cyst appears as a painless tuberous swelling in the upper lid without loss of eyelashes.
Synonyms: Meibomian gland lipogranuloma

Definition: An acute purulent infection of the sebaceous glands of Zeis at the base of the eyelashes, of the apocrine sweat glands of Moll or the meibomian sebacious glands often caused by staphylococcus infections. Hordeola can either occur as Hordeola externa affecting the sebaceous glands of Zeis or the apocrine sweat glands of Moll or as Hordeola interna affecting the meibomian sebacious glands. In contrast to chalazia, hordeola are extremely painful and can cause extreme local swelling.
Synonyms: Stye of eyelid

Definition: Hordeola externa are acute purulent infections affecting the sebaceous glands of Zeis or the apocrine sweat glands of Moll, often caused by staphylococcus infections. In contrast to chalazia, hordeola are extremely painfull and can cause extreme local swelling.

Hordeola interna are acute purulent infections affecting the meibomian sebacious glands, often caused by staphylococcus infections. In contrast to chalazia (chronic epithelioid cell granulomatous inflammation of the meibomian gland caused by inflammation of a blocked meibomian gland), hordeola are extremely painfull and can cause extreme local swelling.
Synonyms: Stye of inner eyelid

Definition: Cutaneous skin tags also known as acrochorda or fibroepithelial polyps are small benign tumours that may either form secondarily over time primarily in areas where the skin forms creases, such as the neck, armpit or groin or may also be present at birth, in which case they usually occur in the periauricular region.
Synonyms: Acrochorda

Definition: The presence of multiple pits (small, pinpoint-large indentations on the surface of the skin) located on the skin of sole of foot.

Benign tumors that are composed of fibrous or connective tissue. They can grow in all organs, arising from mesenchyme tissue. The term "fibroblastic" or "fibromatous" is used to describe tumors of the fibrous connective tissue. When the term fibroma is used without modifier, it is usually considered benign, with the term fibrosarcoma reserved for malignant tumors.
Angiofibroma consist of many often dilated vessels.
The presence of a lung fibroma, a benign neoplasm that can present as a mass causing airway obstruction, cough, and hemoptysis, or present without symptoms as a solitary pulmonary nodule.
A fibroma of the heart.
The presence of a fibroma of the ovary.
A benign biphasic tumor of the breast with epithelial and stromal components.
Synonyms: Breast fibroadenoma, Breast fibroadenomas, Breast fibroadenosis, Fibroadenosis - breast, Fibroadenosis of breast

Definition: Prominence of the malar process of the maxilla and infraorbital area appreciated in profile and from in front of the face.
Synonyms: Malar excess, Malar hyperplasia, Prominent malar region

Definition: A soft tissue continuity in the anteroposterior axis between adjacent foot digits that involves at least half of the proximodistal length of one of the two involved digits; or, a soft tissue continuity in the A/P axis between two digits of the foot that does not meet the prior objective criteria.
Synonyms: Cutaneous syndactyly of feet, soft tissue syndactyly of toes, Webbed skin of toes

Definition: A tumor (abnormal growth of tissue) of the skeleton.
Synonyms: Skeletal tumor, Skeletal tumour

Definition: Absence or underdevelopment of the toenail.
Synonyms: Absent/small toenails, Absent/underdeveloped toenails, Aplastic/hypoplastic toenails, Hypoplastic-absent toenails

Definition: Absence or underdevelopment of the anterior pituitary gland, also known as the adenohypophysis.
Synonyms: Adenohypophysis

Definition: Absence of the anterior pituitary gland resulting from a developmental defect.
Synonyms: Absent pituitary gland, Aplasia of the pituitary gland

Definition: Underdevelopment of the anterior pituitary gland.
Synonyms: Underdeveloped pituitary gland

Definition: Facial nerve palsy is a dysfunction of cranial nerve VII (the facial nerve) that results in inability to control facial muscles on the affected side with weakness of the muscles of facial expression and eye closure. This can either be present in unilateral or bilateral form.
Synonyms: Bell's palsy, Cranial nerve VII palsy, Facial nerve palsy, Facial nerve paralysis, Facial palsy, unilateral or bilateral, Seventh cranial nerve palsy, VII th cranial nerve palsy

Term: Abnormal morphology of the cortex of the humerus
Definition: Any abnormality affecting the cortex of the humerus.
Any abnormality of a metatarsal bone epiphysis.
Synonyms: Abnormality of end part of long bone of foot, Abnormality of the epiphyses of the metatarsals

Term: Abnormality of the epiphyses of the feet
Definition: Any abnormality of the epiphyses of the feet.
Synonyms: Abnormality of the end part of the foot bone

Definition: Inability to detect any qualitative olfactory sensation.
Inability to perceive certain odorants (implies that the sense of smell is maintained for other classes of odorants).
Reduced ability to detect any qualitative olfactory sensation.
Reduced ability to perceive certain odorants (implies that the sense of smell is maintained for other classes of odorants).
The presence of a cleft in the cerebral cortex unilaterally or bilaterally, usually located in the frontal area.
A form of amyloidosis that affects the conjunctiva.

Term: Elevated alkaline phosphatase of hepatic origin
Definition: An abnormally increased level of liver isoforms of alkaline phosphatase, tissue-nonspecific isozyme in the blood.
Synonyms: Elevated ALP of hepatic origin

Term: Elevated alkaline phosphatase of bone origin
Definition: An abnormally increased level of bone isoforms of alkaline phosphatase, tissue-nonspecific isozyme in the blood.
Synonyms: Elevated alkaline phosphatase of bone origin, Elevated ALP of bone origin, Increased serum bone-specific alkaline phosphatase

Definition: Abnormality of the nasal cavity (the cavity includes and starts at the nares and reaches all the way through to the and includes the choanae, the posterior nasal apertures).
Abnormality of the midnasal cavity which includes the cavity between the nares and the choanae.
Absence or abnormal closure of the midnasal cavity.
Abnormal narrowing (stenosis) of the midnasal cavity, i.e., of the middle nasal meatus, which in neonates can cause respiratory distress.
Synonyms: Midnasal atresia or stenosis

Term: Aplasia of the distal phalanges of the toes
Definition: Absence of the distal phalanges of the toes.
Synonyms: Absent outermost bone of the toes

Definition: An abnormal lack of stability of the cervical spine.
Any abnormal increase or reduction in skin elasticity.
An abnormally increased ability of the skin to permit light to pass through (translucency) such that subcutaneous structures such as veins display an increased degree of visibility.
Synonyms: Translucent skin

Definition: An abnormal degree of flatness of the Ala of nose, which can be defined as a reduced nasal elevation index (lateral depth of the nose from the tip of the nose to the insertion of the nasal ala in the cheek x 100 divided by the side-to-side breadth of the nasal alae).
Synonyms: Depressed nasal alae

Definition: An abnormality of the premaxilla (the embryonic structure that forms the anterior part of the maxilla) causing it to appear relatively small in size compared to the other parts of the maxilla or other facial structures.
Synonyms: Decreased size of premaxilla, Decreased size of the primary palate bone, Hypoplasia of the intermaxillary bone, Hypoplasia of the primary palate bone, Premaxillary bone deficiency, Premaxillary underdevelopment, Primary palate bone deficiency, Small premaxilla, Small primary palate bone, Underdevelopment of premaxilla, Underdevelopment of the premaxilla, Underdevelopment of the primary palate bone

Definition: An abnormality of the Meninges, including any abnormality of the Dura mater, the Arachnoid mater, and the Pia mater.
Synonyms: Abnormality of the meninges

Definition: An abnormality of the Dura mater.
Synonyms: Abnormality of the dura mater

Definition: An abnormality of the Falx cerebri.
Synonyms: Abnormality of the cerebral falx

Definition: A developmental defect characterized by aplasia of the Falx cerebri.
Synonyms: Absent cerebral falx

Definition: The presence of abnormal punctate (speckled, dot-like) calcifications in one or more epiphyses.
Synonyms: Epiphyseal punctate calcifications, Speckled calcifications in end part of bone, Stippled epiphyses, Stippling of the epiphyses

Definition: An abnormality of the formation and mineralization of an epiphysis.
Synonyms: Abnormality of the mineralisation or ossification of the epiphyses

Term: Patchy reduction of bone mineral density
Definition: Patchy (irregular) reduction in bone density. This can take on many forms depending on severity and distribution as can be seen on x-rays.

Term: Patchy changes of bone mineral density
Definition: Patchy (irregular) changes in bone mineral density. These changes can either be patchy reduction or increase of mineral density as seen on x-rays. Depending on the pathomechanism and the underlying disease, these changes can either appear solely as reduction or increase or as a combination of both (patches of bone showing an increased density while others are affected by reduction of mineral density).

Term: Patchy variation in bone mineral density
Definition: Patchy (irregular) changes in bone mineral density with patches of bone showing an increased density side to side with patches that are affected by reduction of mineral density. This is sometimes referred to as a moth-eaten appearance on x-rays.
Synonyms: Patchy increased and decreased bone mineral density

Definition: An abnormality of the formation and mineralization of any bone of the skeleton of hand.
Synonyms: Abnormal ossification of hand bones, Abnormality of the mineralisation and ossification of bones of the hand

Term: Absence of the third cerebral ventricle
Definition: A developmental defect characterized by the absence of the third ventricle.
An abnormality of the Diencephalon, which together with the cerebrum (telencephalon) makes up the forebrain.
An abnormality of the thalamus.
Synonyms: Abnormal shape of thalamus, Abnormality of the thalamus

Term: Fusion of the left and right thalami
Definition: A developmental defect characterized by fusion of the left and right halves of the thalamus.
Synonyms: Fused thalami, Undivided thalami

Definition: The presence of bilateral coxa valga.

Term: Hypoplasia of the anterior nasal spine
Definition: Underdevelopment of the anterior nasal spine of maxilla.
Synonyms: Decreased projection of anterior nasal spine, Decreased size of anterior nasal spine, Small anterior nasal spine, Underdevelopment of anterior nasal spine

Definition: A congenital defect characterized by absence of the Maxilla.
Synonyms: Absence of the maxilla, Absence of upper jaw bones, Agenesis of the maxilla, Aplasia of the upper jaw bones, Failure of development of maxilla

Definition: An abnormality of the zygomatic bone.
Synonyms: Abnormal malar bone morphology, Abnormality of the cheekbone, Abnormality of the zygomatic bone

Definition: Underdevelopment of the zygomatic bone. That is, a reduction in size of the zygomatic bone, including the zygomatic process of the temporal bone of the skull, which forms part of the zygomatic arch.
Synonyms: Cheekbone underdevelopment, Decreased size of cheekbone, Decreased size of zygomatic bone, Hypoplasia of cheekbone, Underdevelopment of cheekbone, Underdevelopment of zygomatic bone

Term: Abnormality of the third metatarsal bone
Definition: An abnormality of the third metatarsal bone.
Synonyms: Abnormality of the 3rd long bone of foot

Term: Abnormality of the curvature of the vertebral column
Definition: The presence of an abnormal curvature of the vertebral column.
Synonyms: Abnormal curve of the backbone, Abnormal curve of the spine, Abnormal curving of the spine, Curvature of spine, Curved spine

Definition: An abnormality of the formation and mineralization of any bone of the skeleton of foot.
Synonyms: Abnormality of the mineralisation and ossification of bones of the feet

Definition: Enuresis occurring during sleeping hours.
Synonyms: Nocturnal enuresis

Definition: Enuresis occurring during waking hours of the day.
An abnormally increased level of alkaline phosphatase, tissue-nonspecific isozyme in the blood.
Synonyms: Elevated alkaline phosphatase, liver/bone/kidney, Elevated tissue non-specific ALP

Term: Elevated alkaline phosphatase of renal origin
Definition: An abnormally increased level of kidney isoforms of alkaline phosphatase, tissue-nonspecific isozyme in the blood.
Synonyms: Elevated ALP of renal origin

Definition: An abnormally increased level of alkaline phosphatase, intestinal type in the blood.
Synonyms: Elevated intestinal ALP

Definition: An abnormally increased level of alkaline phosphatase, placental type in the blood.
Synonyms: Elevated placental ALP

Definition: An abnormally reduced level of alkaline phosphatase, tissue-nonspecific isozyme in the blood.
Synonyms: Low tissue non-specific ALP

Term: Low alkaline phosphatase of bone origin
Definition: An abnormally reduced level of bone isoforms of alkaline phosphatase in the blood.
Synonyms: Low ALP of bone origin

Term: Low alkaline phosphatase of renal origin
Definition: An abnormally reduced level of kidney isoforms of alkaline phosphatase in the blood.
Synonyms: Low ALP of renal origin

Term: Low alkaline phosphatase of hepatic origin
Definition: An abnormally reduced level of liver isoforms of alkaline phosphatase in the blood.
Synonyms: Low ALP of hepatic origin

Definition: An abnormally reduced level of alkaline phosphatase, intestinal type in the blood.
Synonyms: Low intestinal ALP

Definition: An abnormally reduced level of alkaline phosphatase, placental type in the blood.
Synonyms: Low placental ALP

Definition: A hand or foot with more than five digits that has a recognizable A/P axis of symmetry. The axis can lie within a normally formed or partially duplicated digit resembling a middle finger, index finger, thumb, toe, or hallux. Alternatively, the axis can be in an interdigital space with a flanking pair of digits that resemble a middle finger, index finger, thumb, toe or hallux. The most lateral digits on each side of the hand/foot typically resemble fifth fingers/toes.
Synonyms: Mirror image duplication of digits

Definition: Mirror image duplication of digits affecting the hands only.
Synonyms: Mirror image dupliction of fingers

Definition: Mirror image duplication of digits affecting the feet.
Synonyms: Mirror image dupliction of toes

Definition: Syndactyly with fusion of fingers two to five.
Synonyms: Webbed 2nd-5th fingers, Webbed index, middle and little finger, Webbed index, middle and pinkie finger, Webbed index, middle and pinky finger

Definition: A kind of congenital cataract that is characterized by a hollow sphere of punctate opacities involving the fetal nucleus and that usually occurs bilaterally.
Synonyms: Pulverulent cataract

Definition: A Lamellar cataract with a pulverulent (punctate, "dust-like" opacities) appearance.
A type of congenital cataract in which the opacity follows the anterior or posterior Y suture.
A type of Congenital cataract in which the opacities occupy the subcapsular cortex at the anterior or posterior pole of the lens.
A type of anterior polar cataract which projects as a conical opacity into the anterior chamber.
A type of nuclear cataract involving congenital dust-like (pulverulent) opacity of the embryonal and fetal nucleus.
Synonyms: cataracta pulverulenta centralis, Central pulverulent cataract, Coppock-like cataract, Pulverulent nuclear cataract

Definition: A nuclear cataract with a triangular form.
An abnormal deviation from normal levels of immunoglobulins in blood.
Synonyms: Abnormal immunoglobulin concentration, Abnormal serum immunoglobulin concentration, Abnormal serum immunoglobulin levels, Abnormal serum level of immunoglobulin, Immunoglobulin abnormality

Definition: An increased level of gamma globulin (immunoglobulin) in the blood.
Synonyms: Elevated immunoglobulin levels, Hypergammaglobulinaemia, Hypergammaglobulinemia, Hyperglobulinemia, Increased antibody level in blood, Increased gamma globulin, Increased immunoglobulin level, Increased serum gamma globulin, Raised immunoglobulin levels

Definition: Syndactyly with fusion of fingers one and two.
Synonyms: Webbed 1st-2nd finger, Webbed thumb and index finger

Definition: Syndactyly with fusion of fingers four and five.
Synonyms: Webbed 4th-5th finger

Definition: Syndactyly with fusion of fingers one to three.
Synonyms: Webbed 1st-3rd finger

Definition: Syndactyly with fusion of fingers one to four.
Synonyms: Webbed 1st-4th finger

Definition: Syndactyly with fusion of fingers one to five (complete syndactyly of all fingers of the hand).
Synonyms: Webbed 1-5 fingers, Webbed 1st-5th fingers

Definition: Syndactyly with fusion of the fingers two to four.
Synonyms: Syndactyly of second to fourth fingers, Webbed index through ring fingers

Definition: Syndactyly with fusion of fingers three to five.
Synonyms: Webbed third, fourth and fifth toes

Definition: Syndactyly with fusion of toes one and two.
Synonyms: Webbed 1st-2nd toes, Webbed first and second toes

Definition: Syndactyly with fusion of toes one to four.
Synonyms: Webbed first through fourth toes

Definition: Syndactyly with fusion of toes one to five (complete syndactyly of all toes of the foot).
Synonyms: Syndactyly of all toes, Webbed 1st-5th toes

Definition: Syndactyly with fusion of toes two to four.
Synonyms: Syndactyly of toes 2, 3 and 4, Syndactyly toes 2-4, Webbed 2nd-4th toes

Definition: Syndactyly with fusion of toes two to five.
Synonyms: Webbed 2nd-5th toes

Definition: Syndactyly with fusion of toes three to five.
Synonyms: Webbed 3rd-5th toes

Definition: Webbing or fusion of the toes, involving soft parts and including fusion of individual bones of the toes. Bony fusions are referred to as "bony" Syndactyly if the fusion occurs in a tibial-fibular axis. Fusions of bones of the toes in a proximo-distal axis are referred to as "Symphalangism".
Synonyms: Osseous syndactyly of the toes

Definition: An abnormality of the texture of the hair.
Synonyms: Abnormality of hair texture

Definition: An abnormality of the distribution of hair growth.
Synonyms: Abnormal distribution of hair, Abnormal hair pattern

Definition: An abnormal hair whorl (that is, a patch of hair growing in the opposite direction of the rest of the hair).
Synonyms: Abnormal hair whorl, Abnormal hair whorls, Abnormal whorl of hair

Definition: An asymmetriy, i.e., difference in size, shape or position between the left and right ear.
Synonyms: Asymmetric ears

Term: Advanced pneumatization of the mastoid process
Definition: An abnormally advanced degree of pneumatization (i.e., formation of air cells) in the mastoid process with respect to age-dependent norms.
Abnormal prominence of the corneal nerve fibers.
Synonyms: Prominent corneal nerve fibres, Visible corneal nerve fibers, Visible corneal nerve fibres

Definition: Rupture of the eyeball not due to trauma.
A developmental defect characterized by absence of the retina.
Synonyms: Absent retina

Term: Cherry red spot of the macula
Definition: Pallor of the perifoveal macula of the retina with appearance of a small circular reddish choroid shape as seen through the fovea centralis due to relative transparancy of the macula.
Synonyms: Macular cherry red spot

Definition: This may present as a partial or complete duplication of the eyebrows.
Synonyms: Double eyebrow, Duplication of eyebrow

Term: Extension of eyebrows towards upper eyelid
Definition: The eyebrows extend towards - or even all the way down to - the margin of the upper eyelid.
Synonyms: Extension of eyebrows towards upper eyelid

Definition: Nodular changes affecting the eyelids may have many different causes such as cystic lesions (chalaziae, hordeolae), lipogranulomas, melanomas, infectious diseases (Molluscum contagiosum) and many more.
Synonyms: Eyelid nodules

Definition: Naevus flammeus localised in the skin of the eyelid.
Synonyms: Port-wine stain on eyelid

Definition: Tumor-like growths that consist of replacement of the medullary bone with fibrous tissue, causing the expansion and weakening of the areas of bone involved. Especially when involving the skull or facial bones, the lesions can cause externally visible deformities. The skull is often, but not necessarily, affected, and any other bone or bones may be involved. Fibrous dysplasia can either effect isolated bones (Monostotic fibrous dysplasia) or also generalized all bones of the body (Polyostotic fibrous dysplasia).
Fibrous dysplasia of the bones were lesions are localized in many bones throughout of the body. Polyostotic fibrous dysplasia is a cardinal feature of McCune-Albright syndrome.
Fibrous dysplasia of the bones were lesions are localized in only one bone.

Osteopoikilosis is a benign, asymptomatic sclerotic dysplasia of the bones. It affects both male and female and may be seen at any age. Radiographically sclerotic circular or ovoid lesions are usually symmetrically distributed in a periarticular location. Lesions can increase or decrease in size and number in serial radiographs or even disappear and do not have increased bone radiotracer uptake.

A lamellar pattern visible on radiographs and mainly localized at the metaphyses of the long tubular bones. Pathologic-anatomical studies revealed that these benign signs on x-rays are the result of a juvenile metaphyseal bone necrosis. Calcifications in the necrotic marrow lead to this lamellar or lattice-like appearance.
An abnormal accumulation of excess fluid in the lower extremity resulting in swelling of the feet and extending upward to the lower leg.
