Synonyms: Edema of the lower limbs, Fluid accumulation in lower limbs, Leg edema, Leg oedema, Lower leg swelling, Oedema of the lower limbs, Pedal oedema, Peripheral edema of lower extremity, Peripheral oedema of lower extremity

Definition: An abnormal accumulation of fluid beneath the skin of the arms.
Synonyms: Fluid accumulation in upper limbs, Oedema of the upper limbs

Definition: Diminished length of a metatarsal bone, with resultant proximal displacement of the associated toe.
Synonyms: Hypoplasia of the metatarsal bones, Hypoplastic metatarsals, Short long bone of foot, Short metatarsal bone, Short metatarsals, Shortened metatarsals

Definition: A developmental abnormality characterized by the absence (aplasia) of a metatarsal bone.
Synonyms: Absent long bone of foot, Aplasia of the metatarsal bones

Term: Aplasia of the phalanges of the toes
Definition: Absence of a digit or of one or more phalanges of a toe.
Synonyms: Absent bones of the toes, Aphalangia of the toes

Term: Hypoplasia of the phalanges of the toes
Synonyms: Small toe bones

Definition: An abnormal distribution of eyebrow hair growth in the medial direction.
Synonyms: Medially flared eyebrows

Definition: Positioning of a lacrimal punctum other than at the medial margins of the eyelid.
Synonyms: Abnormal position of the lacrimal punctum

Definition: Blepharochalasis is characterized by recurrent, non-painful, nonerythematous episodes of eyelid edema. It has been divided into hypertrophic and atrophic forms. In the hypertrophic form recurrent edema results in orbital fat herniation through a weakened orbital septum. Most patients who have blepharochalasis present in an atrophic condition with atrophy of redundant eyelid skin and superior nasal fat pads.
Synonyms: Saggy upper eyelid skin

Definition: Loss of elasticity of the upper and lower eyelids causing the skin to sag and bulge.
Synonyms: Baggy eyes, Droopy eyelid skin, Extra eyelid skin, Eyelid dermatochalasia, Redundant eyelid skin

Definition: A persistent midline depression of the skin over the fat pad of the chin.
Synonyms: Chin butt, Chin dent, Chin dimple, Chin skin dimple, Dimple chin, Gelasin of chin, Indentation of chin

Definition: Midline deficiency of the mandible and some or all overlying tissues.
Synonyms: Cleft lower jaw, Mandibular cleft
Midline cleft of mandible

Definition: An anomaly of the temporomandibular joint.
Synonyms: Abnormality of the jaw joint, Anomaly of the temporomandibular joint, Deformity of the jaw joint, Malformation of jaw joint

Definition: Asymmetry between the left and right sides of the maxilla.
Synonyms: Asymmetry of right and left side of the maxilla, Canted maxilla, Canted upper jaw, Crooked maxilla, Tilted maxilla, Tilted upper jaw, Unequal sides of maxilla, Uneven maxilla, Uneven upper jaw

Definition: Absence or underdevelopment of the premaxilla.
Synonyms: Aplasia/hypoplasia of the intermaxillary bone, Aplasia/hypoplasia of the primary palate bone

Definition: Absence of the premaxilla, which is the embryonic structure that forms the anterior part of the maxilla.
Synonyms: Absence of the intermaxillary bone, Absence of the premaxilla, Absence of the primary palate bone, Aplasia of the intermaxillary bone, Aplasia of the primary palate bone, Failure of development of premaxilla, Failure of development of the primary palate bone, Missing premaxilla, Missing primary palate bone

Definition: An abnormality of the premaxilla, the most anterior part of the maxilla that usually bears the central and lateral incisors and includes the anterior nasal spine and inferior aspect of the piriform rim. The premaxilla contains the bone and teeth of the primary palate.
Synonyms: Abnormality of the intermaxillary bone, Abnormality of the intermaxillary segment of the maxilla, Abnormality of the premaxillary bone, Abnormality of the primary palate bone

Definition: Prominent positioning of the premaxilla in relation to the rest of the maxilla, the facial skeleton, or mandible. Not necessarily caused by an increase in size (hypertrophy of) the premaxilla.
Synonyms: Anterior position of the premaxilla, Anterior position of the primary palate bone, Premaxillary bone excess, Prominence of the intermaxillary bone, Prominence of the primary palate bone, Prominent premaxilla

Definition: Aplasia of a toe. That is, absence of all phalanges of a non-hallux digit of the foot and the associated soft tissues.
Synonyms: Absent toe, Aplasia of toe

Definition: Increased width of the columella.
Synonyms: Columella, broad, Columella, wide, Fullness of columella, Increased width of columella

Definition: A chordoma is a tumors that arises from embryonic remnants of the notochord along the length of the neuraxis. Chordomas generally occur in the sacrum, intracranially at the clivus, or along the spinal axis.
Insertion of the posterior columella below the nasal base.
Synonyms: Columella, low insertion

Definition: Decreased length of the eyelashes (subjective).
Synonyms: Decreased length of eyelashes, Short eyelashes

Definition: Abnormal thickening of the skin localized to the palm of the hand.
Deposition of calcium salts in a tissue or location in which calcification does not normally occur.
The presence of a cyst, fistula, or abscess in the sacrococcygeal region (gluteal crease) characteristically accompanied by hair and skin folds.
A sinus in the coccygeal region (the region of the intergluteal cleft). A pilonidal sinus often contains hair and skin debris.
Synonyms: Pilonidal cyst

Definition: A hair-containing cyst or sinus usually in the coccygeal region.
Synonyms: Sacrococcygeal fistula

Definition: A developmental defect characterized by abnormal connection of one or more pulmonary veins to the superior or inferior vena cava, the right atrium, or the coronary sinus, resulting in a left-to-right shunt of oxygenated blood.
A form of anomalous pulmonary venous return in which not all pulmonary veins drain abnormally. Partial anomalous pulmonary venous return frequently involves one or both of the veins from one lung.
Synonyms: Partial anomalous pulmonary venous connection

Definition: The presence of an additional membrane in the left or right cardiac atrium which results in the subdivision of the affected atrium (and thus in total three atria, whence the name).
Synonyms: Triatrial heart

Definition: A developmental defect of the aortic arch system in which the trachea and esophagus are completely encircled by connected segments of the aortic arch and its branches. This occurs if the normal process of regression and persistence of the bilateral embryonic aortic arches fails.
Synonyms: Vascular ring of aorta

Definition: Marked widening of the trachea and major bronchi that may be predispose to chronic respiratory tract infection.
Marked widening of the major bronchi that may be predispose to chronic respiratory tract infection.
Marked widening of the trachea.
The presence of an abnormally large pelvis.
Synonyms: Large pelvis bone

Definition: Over-sensitivity to certain frequency ranges of sound.
Synonyms: Loudness intolerance, Sensitivity to noise

Definition: Skin dimples are cutaneous indentations that are the result of tethering of the skin to underlying structures (bone) causing an indentation.
Synonyms: Skin dimples

Definition: A subtype of skin dimples occurring in the shoulder region.
Synonyms: Acromial dimple, Bi-acromial dimples, Shoulder dimples

Definition: Redness of the skin, caused by hyperemia of the capillaries in the lower layers of the skin.
Synonyms: Redness of skin or mucous membrane

Definition: A tumor (abnormal growth of tissue) of the uterus.
Synonyms: Uterine tumor, Uterine tumour

Definition: A tumor (abnormal growth of tissue) of a gonad.
Synonyms: Gonadal neoplasia

Definition: The presence of a neoplasm of the urinary system.
A tumor (abnormal growth of tissue) of the genital system.
Synonyms: Genital tumor, Genital tumour

Definition: The presence of a neoplasm of the testis.
Synonyms: Testicular tumor, Testicular tumour

Definition: Underdevelopment of the interstitial (Leydig) cells of the testis. These cells produce testosterone.
Hypertrophy or overdevelopment of the interstitial (Leydig) cells of the testis. These cells produce testosterone.
A digit with two nails, with at least some soft tissue between them.
Synonyms: duplicated nail, Notched nail

Definition: Reduced ability affecting mainly visuospatial cognition which may be tested using pattern construction (for example by Differential Ability Scales, which test a person's strengths and weaknesses across a range of intellectual abilities).
A glioma affecting the cerebellum.
A glioma affecting the brainstem.

A hemangioblastoma is a benign vascular neoplasm that arises almost exclusively in the central nervous system. Hemangioblastomas consist of a tightly packed cluster of small blood vessels forming a mass of up to 1 or 2 cm in diameter.
Synonyms: Haemangioblastoma

Definition: Increased focal pigmentation of the vermilion of the lips.
Synonyms: Ephelis of lip, Labial lentigo, Lip freckle, Lip lentigo

Definition: A neoplasm of the pineal gland.
Lack of paramedian peaks and median notch of the upper lip vermilion.
Synonyms: Absent cupid's bow, Agenesis of cupid's bow, Failure of development of cupid's bow, Lack of cupid's bow, Missing cupid's bow

Definition: Reduced bulkiness of the crease or fold of skin running from the lateral margin of the nose, where nasal base meets the skin of the face, to a point just lateral to the corner of the mouth (cheilion or commissure).
Synonyms: Flat nasolabial fold, Nasolabial crease, hypoplastic, Nasolabial crease, underdeveloped, Nasolabial fold, hypoplastic, Shallow nasolabial fold

Definition: Increased pigmentation, either focal or generalized, of the skin surrounding the vermilion of the lips.
Synonyms: Darkening of skin around the mouth, Increased pigmentation around the mouth

Definition: Inner aspect of the upper lip vermilion (normally apposing the teeth) visible in a frontal view, i.e., the presence of an everted upper lip.
Synonyms: Eclabium of upper lip, Everted prominent upper lip, Everted upper lip, Outward turned upper lip

Definition: Triangular appearance of the oral aperture with the apex in the midpoint of the upper vermilion and the lower vermilion forming the base.
Synonyms: Inverted V-shaped upper lip

Definition: Oral commissures positioned superior to the midline labial fissure.
Synonyms: Upturned corners of mouth, Upturned mouth, Upturned oral commisures

Definition: Gentle upward curve of the upper lip vermilion such that the center is placed well superior to the commissures.
Synonyms: Carp-like mouth, Carp-shaped mouth, Fish mouth, Large, carp-shaped mouth, Wide, carp-shaped mouth

Definition: Visible space between the dental arches in occlusion.
Synonyms: Absence of overlap of upper and lower teeth, Open bite, Open bite between upper and lower teeth

Definition: Tongue extending beyond the alveolar ridges or teeth at rest.
Synonyms: Lingual prolapse, Lingual prominence, Lingual protrusion, Prolapse of tongue, Prominent tongue, Protruding tongue, Tongue protrusion, Tongue sticking out of mouth

Definition: Increased width of the uvula (subjective finding).
Synonyms: Wide uvula

Definition: Increased length of the uvula.
Synonyms: Long palatine uvula

Definition: Decreased width of the uvula.
Synonyms: Narrow palatine uvula

Definition: Decreased length of the uvula.
Synonyms: Hypoplastic uvula, Short palatine uvula

Definition: More than two clockwise hair whorls.
Synonyms: Abnormal number of hair swirls, Abnormal number of hair whorls, Double crown (hair whorls), Extra hair swirls, Extra hair whorl, Supernumary hair swirls, Supernumary hair whorl

Definition: Hair growth from a single point on the scalp in any location other than lateral to the midline and close to the vertex of the skull.
Synonyms: Abnormal location of hair swirl, Abnormal position of hair whorl

Definition: A congenital, hairless plaque consisting of overgrown epidermis, sebaceous glands, hair follicles, apocrine glands and connective tissue. They are a variant of epidermal naevi. Sebaceous naevi most often appear on the scalp, but they may also arise on the face, neck or forehead. At birth, a sevaceous nevus typically appears as a solitary, smooth, yellow-orange hairless patch. Sebaceous naevi become more pronounced around adolescence, often appearing bumpy, warty or scaly.
Synonyms: Naevus sebaceous, Organoid nevus, Sebaceous mole, Sebaceous naevus, Sebaceous nevus

Definition: Epidermal naevi are due to an overgrowth of the epidermis and may be present at birth (50%) or develop during childhood.
A type of nevus sebaceous with a linear form, raised borders and yellowish color.

A generalized tonic seizure is a type of generalized motor seizure characterised by bilateral limb stiffening or elevation, often with neck stiffening without a subsequent clonic phase. The tonic activity can be a sustained abnormal posture, either in extension or flexion, sometimes accompanied by tremor of the extremities.
Synonyms: Generalised hypertonic seizure, Generalised tonic seizure, Generalised tonic seizures, Generalized hypertonic seizure, Generalized tonic seizures

Definition: Atonic seizure is a type of motor seizure characterized by a sudden loss or diminution of muscle tone without apparent preceding myoclonic or tonic event lasting about 1 to 2 seconds, involving head, trunk, jaw, or limb musculature.
Synonyms: Astatic seizure, Astatic seizures, Atonic seizures, Drop attacks, Drop seizures, Hypotonic seizure

Definition: Focal emotional seizure with crying (dacrystic) is characterized by the presence of stereotyped crying, this may be accompanied by lacrimation, sad facial expression and sobbing. The subjective emotion of sadness may or may not be present.
Synonyms: Dacrystic seizure, Dacrystic seizures

Definition: Focal emotional seizure with laughing (gelastic) is characterized by bursts of laughter or giggling, usually without appropriate related emotion of happiness, and described as 'mirthless'.
Synonyms: Gelastic seizure, Gelastic seizures

Definition: A scintillating scotoma is a common visual aura that can preced a migraine, whereby a spot of flickering light near the center of the visual fields occurs. The spot prevents vision, and is thus termed scotoma. The scotoma can extend into one or more shimmering arcs of white or colored flashing lights.
An overlap of the bony plates of the skull in an infant, with or without early closure.
Synonyms: Cranial suture ridges

Definition: Any structural abormality of the fifth cranial nerve.
Synonyms: Abnormal trigeminal nerve morphology, Abnormality of the fifth cranial nerve, Abnormality of the nervus trigeminus

Term: Abnormality of the eleventh cranial nerve
Definition: Abnormality of the eleventh cranial nerve.
Synonyms: Abnormality of cranial nerve XI, Abnormality of the accessory nerve

Term: Abnormality of the twelfth cranial nerve
Definition: Abnormality of the twelfth cranial nerve.
Synonyms: Abnormality of cranial nerve 12, Abnormality of cranial nerve xii, Abnormality of the hypoglossal nerve

Term: Abnormality of the seventh cranial nerve
Definition: Abnormality of the seventh cranial nerve sometimes also referred to as the facial nerve.
Synonyms: Abnormality of the facial nerve

Definition: Intermittent clonic or tonic contraction of muscles supplied by facial nerve. Muscles are relaxed in between contractions.
Synonyms: Spasms on one side of the face

Definition: A reduced ability to discriminate between different temperatures.
Synonyms: Abnormality of temperature sensation, Impaired temperature sensation, Impaired thermal sensitivity, Loss of temperature sensation

Definition: A reduced sense of touch (tactile sensation). This is usually tested with a wisp of cotton or a fine camel's hair brush, by asking patients to say 'now' each time they feel the stimulus.
Synonyms: Abnormal thigmesthesia, Impaired touch sensation, Loss of tactile sensation

Definition: A loss or impairment of the sensation of the relative position of parts of the body and joint position.
Synonyms: Abnormality of proprioception

Definition: Pain is an unpleasant sensation that can range from mild, localized discomfort to agony, whereby the physical part of pain results from nerve stimulation and is often accompanied by an emotional component. This term groups abnormalities in pain sensation presumed to result from abnormalities related to the specific nerve fibers that carry the pain impulses to the brain.
Spontaneous pain is a kind of neuropathic pain which occurs without an identifiable trigger.

Trophic changes is a term used to describe abnormalities in the area of pain that include primarily wasting away of the skin, tissues, or muscle, thinning of the bones, and changes in how the hair or nails grow, including thickening or thinning of hair or brittle nails.
Synonyms: Trophic changes

Definition: A pattern of sensory loss with selective loss of touch sensation and proprioception without loss of pain and temperature, or vice-versa.
An abnormal concentration of copper.
Decreased concentration of ceruloplasmin in the blood.
Synonyms: Decreased serum ceruloplasmin, Decreased serum ceruloplasminA, Hypoceruloplasminaemia, Hypoceruloplasminemia

Definition: An increased concentration of non ceruloplasmin bound copper in the blood.
An increased concentration of copper in the urine.
Synonyms: Increased urinary copper concentration

Definition: An abnormality in cerebral electrical activity recorded along the scalp by electroencephalography (EEG) and being identified at multiple locations (foci).
Synonyms: Multifocal EEG abnormality

Definition: Focal (localized) slow activity reflects focal dysfunction, not diffuse dysfunction (i.e., encephalopathy).
Synonyms: EEG: focal slow activity, EEG: localised slow activity, EEG: localized slow activity

Definition: Multifocal slowing of cerebral electrical activity recorded along the scalp by electroencephalography (EEG).
Diffuse slowing of cerebral electrical activity recorded along the scalp by electroencephalography (EEG).
Synonyms: EEG with generalised slow activity, EEG: generalised slow activity, EEG: generalized slow activity

Term: EEG with persistent abnormal rhythmic activity
Synonyms: EEG: persistent abnormal rhythmic activity

Definition: The presence of complexes of slow spikes and slow waves (<2.5 Hz) in electroencephalography (EEG).
Synonyms: Electroencephalogram demonstrated spike-slow wave discharges

Definition: The presence of complexes of spikes and waves (2.5-3.5 Hz) in electroencephalography (EEG).
The presence of complexes of spikes and waves (>3.5 Hz) in electroencephalography (EEG).

Complexes of spikes (<70 ms) and sharp waves (70-200 ms), which are sharp transient waves that have a strong association with epilepsy, in cerebral electrical activity recorded along the scalp by electroencephalography (EEG).

The burst suppression pattern in electroencephalography refers to a characteristic periodic pattern of low voltage (<10 microvolts) suppressed background and a relatively shorter pattern of higher amplitude slow, sharp, and spiking complexes.
EEG abnormalities (epileptiform discharges) evoked by flashing lights or black and white striped patterns.
Synonyms: Photoparoxysmal response on EEG

Term: EEG with periodic lateralized epileptiform discharges
Definition: Periodic lateralized epileptiform discharges (PLEDs)are periodic, lateralized, and epileptiform. PLEDs show a relatively constant interval between discharges (0.5 to 3 seconds).
Synonyms: EEG: periodic lateralized epileptiform discharges

Term: EEG with generalized low amplitude activity
Definition: An abnormal generalized reduction in amplitude of the cerebral electrical activity recorded along the scalp by electroencephalography (EEG).
Synonyms: EEG with generalised low amplitude activity, EEG: generalised low amplitude activity

Term: EEG with localized low amplitude activity
Definition: An abnormal localized reduction in amplitude of the cerebral electrical activity recorded along the scalp by electroencephalography (EEG).
Synonyms: EEG with localised low amplitude activity, EEG: localised low amplitude activity

Definition: Periodically occurring generalized periodic complexes.
Synonyms: EEG: periodic complexes, Radermecker complexes

Definition: Periodically recurring abnormalities in the EEG.
Synonyms: EEG: periodic abnormalities

Definition: Epileptiform discharges induced by hyperventilation (overbreathing) in cerebral electrical activity recorded along the scalp by electroencephalography (EEG).
A kind of breech presentation in which the hips are flexed and the knees are extended.
A kind of breech presentation in which the hips are flexed and the knees are flexed.
A kind of breech presentation in which one or both hips are extended and one or both of the fetus' feet are pointing down and entering the birth canal.
A type of motor delay characterized by a delay in acquiring the ability to control the fingers and hands.
A delay in the acquisition of the ability to understand the speech of others.
Severe mental retardation is defined as an intelligence quotient (IQ) in the range of 20-34.
Synonyms: Early and severe mental retardation, Intellectual disability, severe, Mental retardation, severe, Severe mental retardation

Definition: An enduring pattern of uncooperative, defiant, and hostile behavior toward authority figures that does not involve major antisocial violations, is not accounted for by the child's developmental stage, and results in significant functional impairment. A certain level of oppositional behavior is common in children and adolescents.
An incomplete closure of the abdominal wall.
Synonyms: Abdominal wall defect, Congenital anterior abdominal wall defect

Definition: A type of ataxia characterized by the impairment of the ability to smoothly perform the elements of a voluntary movement in the appropriate order and speed. With dyssynergia, a voluntary movement appears broken down into its component parts.
A type of dyssynergia affecting eye movements and characterized by the inability to smoothly follow a visual target across the visual field.
A type of dyssynergy characterized by the lack of the ability to smoothly perform the elements of a voluntary movement in the appropriate order and speed.

Incoordination of movement caused by a deficit in the sensory nervous system. Sensory ataxia can be distinguished from cerebellar ataxia by asking the patient to close his or her eyes. Persons with cerebellar ataxia show only a minimal worsening of symptoms, whereas persons with sensory ataxia show a marked worsening of symptoms.
Synonyms: Afferent ataxia, Ataxia, sensory, Spinal ataxia

Definition: An inversion of the T-wave (which is normally positive).
Synonyms: EKG: T-wave inversion

Definition: Atrophy of the cervical segment of the spinal cord.
The presence of xanthomas (intra-and extra-cellular accumulations of cholesterol) extensor tendons (typically over knuckles, Achilles tendon, knee, and elbows).
Synonyms: Tendon xanthomas

Definition: A diagnostic reflex elicited by stimulation of the skin over the surface of the lateral malleolus of the foot. The Chaddock refelx is present if there is extension of one or more or all of the toes with or without fanning of them when the external inframalleolar skin is stimulated. The Chaddock sign, similar to the Babinski sign, is taken to be an indication of disease of the spinocortical (pyramidal) tract.
An abnormal level of a circulating protein in the blood.
Synonyms: Abnormal circulating protein level, Abnormality of circulating protein level

Definition: A type of strabismus in which the fixating eye is always the same one, while the other eye is constantly deviated. Monocular strabismus is to be distinguished from alternating strabismus, in which either of the eyes 'squints' at different times.
Synonyms: Unilateral strabismus

Definition: The presence during the prenatal period of a cystic mass with multiple septa with multiple, asymmetric, thin-walled cysts near the posterior aspect of the neck. Fetal cystic hygroma can be defined as nuchal translucency with or without septations measuring greater than 3.0 mm. Increased NT refers to a measurement above the 95th centile, and the term is used irrespective of whether the collection of fluid is septated or not, and whether it is confined to the neck or envelopes the whole fetus. After 14 weeks, increased NT usually resolves, but in some cases it evolves into nuchal edema or cystic hygromas.
Synonyms: Foetal cystic hygroma

Definition: Nuchal translucency is the sonographic appearance of subcutaneous accumulation of liquid in the back of the fetal neck in the first trimester of pregnancy (11-14 gestational weeks of pregnancy).
An abnormality of the umbilical cord, which is the cord connecting the developing embryo or fetus to the placenta.
Synonyms: Umbilical cord issue

Definition: A congenital disorder of the pulmonary valve in which the orifice of the valve fails to develop.
A congenital disorder of the aortic valve in which the orifice of the valve fails to develop.
Synonyms: Aortic atresia

Definition: Shortening of the extremities affecting primarily the distal parts of the limbs (hands and feet) in relation to the other segments of the limbs.
A disease where there is cellular death (necrosis) of bone components due to interruption of the blood supply.
Synonyms: Aseptic bone necrosis, Aseptic necrosis, Bone infarction, Death of bone due to decreased blood supply, Ischaemic bone necrosis, Ischemic bone necrosis, Osteochondronecrosis, Osteonecrosis

Definition: A joint disorder caused by blood deprivation in the subchondral bone causing the subchondral bone to die in a process called avascular necrosis. The bone is then reabsorbed by the body, leaving the articular cartilage it supported prone to damage. The result is fragmentation (dissection) of both cartilage and bone, and the free movement of these osteochondral fragments within the joint space, causing pain and further damage.
Synonyms: Osteochondrosis dissecans

Definition: Morbus Koehler is a Juvenile aseptic necrosis affecting the Os naviculare pedis.
Morbus Kienboeck is a Juvenile aseptic necrosis affecting the Os lunatum.
Synonyms: Kienboeck's disease, Kienbck's disease, Lunatomalacia

Definition: Morbus Osgood-Schlatter is a Juvenile aseptic necrosis affecting the Tuberositas tibiae.
Synonyms: Osgood Schlatter disease

Definition: A developmental growth retardation of the vertebral end plates that may lead to secondary destruction of the vertebral end plates and protrusion of the nucleus pulposus into the vertebral body (so called Schmorl's nodes as seen on x-rays).
Synonyms: Calve disease, Juvenile osteochondrosis of the spine, Scheuermann disease, Scheuermann kyphosis, Sherman's Disease

Term: Abnormal circulating branched chain amino acid concentration
Definition: Any deviation from the normal concentration of a branched chain family amino acid in the blood circulation.
Any deviation from the normal concentration of phenylalanine in the blood circulation.
Synonyms: Abnormality of phenylalanine metabolism

Term: Abnormal circulating serine family amino acid concentration
Definition: Any deviation from the normal concentration of a serine family amino acid in the blood circulation.
Synonyms: Abnormality of serine family amino acid metabolism

Definition: Any deviation from the normal concentration of glycine in the blood circulation.
An elevated plasma concentration of sarcosine.
Synonyms: High plasma sarcosine levels

Definition: An elevated urinary concentration of sarcosine.
Synonyms: High urine sarcosine levels

Definition: An deviation from the normal concentration of sarcosine in the blood circulation.

Term: Abnormal circulating aspartate family amino acid concentration
Definition: Any deviation from the normal concentration of an aspartate family amino acid in the blood circulation.
Any deviation from the normal concentration of threonine in the blood circulation.
Synonyms: Abnormality of threonine metabolism

Definition: Any deviation from the normal concentration of methionine in the blood circulation.
Synonyms: Abnormality of methionine metabolism

Term: Abnormal circulating glutamine family amino acid concentration
Definition: Any deviation from the normal concentration of a glutamine family amino acid in the blood circulation.
Any deviation from the normal concentration of glutamine in the blood circulation.
An abnormality of a histidine metabolic process.
Synonyms: Abnormality of histidine metabolism

Definition: An increased concentration of histidine in the blood.
Synonyms: High blood histidine level, Histidinemia

Definition: Any deviation from the normal concentration of proline or a proline metabolite in the blood circulation.
Any deviation from the normal concentration of lysine in the blood circulation.
Synonyms: Abnormality of lysine metabolism

Definition: Any deviation from the normal concentration of arginine in the blood circulation.
Synonyms: Abnormality of arginine metabolism

Definition: An increased concentration of valine in the blood.
Synonyms: High blood valine concentration

Definition: An increased concentration of leucine in the blood.
Synonyms: High blood leucine concentration

Definition: Any deviation from the normal concentration of isoleucine in the blood circulation.
An increased concentration of isoleucine in the blood.
Synonyms: High blood isoleucine concentration

Definition: Any deviation from the normal circulation of valine in the blood circulation.
Synonyms: Abnormality of valine metabolism

Term: Abnormal circulating pyruvate family amino acid concentration
Definition: An abnormality of a pyruvate family amino acid metabolic process.
Synonyms: Abnormality of pyruvate family amino acid metabolism

Definition: An abnormality of an alanine metabolic process.
Synonyms: Abnormality of alanine metabolism

Definition: Any deviation from the normal concentration of tyrosine in the blood circulation.
An abnormality of a cysteine metabolic process.
An abnormality of a homocysteine metabolic process.
Zonular cataracts are defined to be cataracts that affect specific regions of the lens.
A 'coral-like' pattern of opacity in the lens of the eye. That is, a cataract with an irregular, stellate form.
A form of cataract in which the lens substance has shrunk, leaving a collapsed, flattened capsule with little or no cortex or epithelium on the lens.
A type of cataract affecting the anterior pole of lens immediately adjacent to ('beneath') the lens capsule.
A cataract that affects the posterior part of the cortex of the lens.
A kind of nuclear cataract characterized by fiberglasslike or needlelike crystals projecting in different directions, through or close to the axial region of the lens.
Synonyms: Fasciculiform cataract, Frosted cataract, Needle-shaped cataract

Definition: An abnormality of divalent inorganic cation homeostasis.
Synonyms: Abnormality of divalent inorganic cation homeostasis

Definition: An abnormality of cation homeostasis.
Synonyms: Abnormality of cation homeostasis

Term: Abnormal blood monovalent inorganic cation concentration
Definition: An abnormality of monovalent inorganic cation homeostasis.
Synonyms: Abnormality of monovalent inorganic cation homeostasis

Definition: An abnormal concentration of sodium.
Synonyms: Abnormal blood Na+ levels, Abnormal circulating Na concentration, Abnormality of sodium homeostasis

Definition: An abnormality of a nucleobase metabolic process.
An increased level of xanthine in the blood circulation.
Synonyms: Increased circulating xanthine concentration

Definition: An increased concentration of xanthine in the urine.
Synonyms: Increased urinary xanthine

Term: Abnormality of the upper urinary tract
Definition: An abnormality of the upper urinary tract.
Synonyms: Abnormality of the upper urinary tract

Term: Abnormality of the lower urinary tract
Definition: An abnormality of the lower urinary tract.
An abnormality of the nasal skeleton.
Synonyms: Abnormality of the nasal skeleton, Anomaly of the nasal skeleton

Definition: An abnormality of the external nose.
Synonyms: Abnormality of the external nose, Anomaly of the external nose

Definition: An abnormality of the nasal bone, comprising the left nasal bone and the right nasal bone.
Synonyms: Abnormality of the nasal bone, Anomaly of the nasal bones

Definition: Absence or underdevelopment of the nasal bone.
Absence of the nasal bone.
Synonyms: Failure of development of the nasal bone, Lack of development of the nasal bone

Definition: A finding of a focus of increased echogenicity upon prenatal ultrasound examination of the fetus. The foci may be present in one or both ventricles. Echogenic intracardiac focus (EICF) is defined as a focus of echogenicity comparable to bone, in the region of the papillary muscle in either or both ventricles of the fetal heart.
Echogenic bowel is defined as fetal bowel with homogenous areas of echogenicity that are equal to or greater than that of surrounding bone.
Synonyms: Echogenic bowel, Echogenic foetal bowel

Definition: An abnormality of the renal pelvis.
Synonyms: Abnormality of the renal pelvis

Definition: Mild pyelectasis is defined as a hypoechoic spherical or elliptical space within the renal pelvis that measures at least 5mm and not more than 10 mm. The measurement is taken on a transverse section through the fetal renal pelvis using the maximum anterior-to-posterior measurement.
Synonyms: Fetal renal pelvic dilatation, Foetal pyelectasis, Foetal renal pelvic dilatation, Mild fetal hydronephrosis, Mild foetal hydronephrosis

Definition: The presence of dilatation of the renal pelvis.

Term: Abnormality of ductus venosus blood flow
Definition: A first-trimester prenatal ultrasound finding of abnormal blood flow in the ductus venosus.

A structural abnormality of the fetal circulation system. Terms in this subhierarchy are restricted to findings that can only be observed in the prenatal period. Other HPO terms can also be used to describe fetal phenotypes.
Synonyms: Abnormality of the fetal cardiovascular system, Abnormality of the fetal circulation system, Abnormality of the foetal cardiovascular system, Abnormality of the foetal circulation system

Term: Abnormality of umbilical vein blood flow
Definition: A first-trimester prenatal ultrasound finding of abnormal blood flow in the umbilical vein.
An abnormality of the fourth ventricle.
Synonyms: Abnormality of the fourth ventricle

Definition: An abnormality of the third ventricle.
Synonyms: Abnormality of the third ventricle

Definition: A kind of ventriculomegaly occurring in the fetal period and usually diagnosed by prenatal ultrasound. Cerebral ventriculomegaly is defined by atrial measurements 10 mm or more. Mild ventriculomegaly (MVM) is defined as measurements between 10 and 15 mm. Measurements are obtained from an axial plane at the level of the thalamic nuclei just below the standard image to measure the BPD (PMID:16100637).
Synonyms: Mild foetal ventriculomegaly

Definition: A form of hydrocephalus in which the flow of cerebrospinal fluid (CSF) within the cerebral ventricular system or in the outlets of the CSF to the arachnoid space is obstructed.
Underdevelopment of the right-sided structures of the heart.
Synonyms: Hypoplastic right heart syndrome, Underdeveloped right heart

Definition: The presence of a dilated urinary bladder.
Fetal megacystis is an abnormally enlarged bladder identified at any gestational age.
Synonyms: Foetal megacystis

Definition: A developmental defect resulting in an obstructing membrane in the posterior male urethra.
Synonyms: Posterior urethral valve

Definition: A bilateral form of agenesis of the kidney.

Congenital pulmonary airway malformation (CPAM) - previously known as congenital cystic adenomatoid malformation (CCAM) - is a relatively rare developmental malformation of the lower respiratory tract. It is a hamartomatous, dysplastic developmental abnormality of the lung characterized by abnormal airway patterning during lung branching morphogenesis and is formed by abnormal branching of the immature bronchioles.
Synonyms: CCAM, Congenital cystic adenomatoid malformation of the lung, Congenital cystic disease of the lung, Cystic adenomatoid lung disease

Definition: The presence of microscopic cystic masses of nonfunctioning pulmonary tissue that lack an obvious communication with the tracheobronchial tree.
A kind of bronchopulmonary sequestration that is incorporated into the normal surrounding lung.
A kind of bronchopulmonary sequestration that is completely discrete from the normal lung and is surrounded by separate pleura.

Term: Absence of stomach bubble on fetal sonography
Definition: By the 14th week of gestation it is nearly always possible to visualized the fluid-filled fetal stomach bubble on prenatal sonography. This term refers to the absence of a normal fetal stomach bubble on fetal ultrasonography performed at around 16 to 20 weeks' gestation.
Synonyms: Absence of stomach bubble on foetal sonography, Absent stomach bubble, Non-visualisation of the fetal stomach

Definition: Any deviation from the normal concentration of a long-chain fatty acid in the blood circulation.
Any deviation from the normal concentration of phytanic acid in the blood circulation.
Synonyms: Abnormal circulating phytanic acid level

Definition: Any deviation from the normal concentration of a fatty acid anion in the blood circulation.
Synonyms: Abnormality of fatty acid anion

Definition: Any deviation from the normal concentration of carnitine in the blood circulation.
An abnormality of liposaccharide metabolism.
An abnormality of glycolipid metabolism.
An abnormality of an erythrocyte cell surface molecule.

Term: Absence of Lutheran antigen on erythrocytes
Definition: Absence of the Lutheran antigen (a type I integral membrane glycoprotein) from the surface of red blood cells.
A kind of anemia characterized by inadequate production of erythrocytes.
Synonyms: Anaemia of inadequate production, Anemia, dyserythropoietic, Defective erythropoiesis, Dyserythropoietic anaemia, Dyserythropoietic anemia, Ineffective erythropoiesis

Definition: An abnormality of myeloid leukocytes.
Synonyms: Abnormality of myeloid leukocytes

Definition: A deviation from the normal count of B cells, i.e., the cells that are formed in the bone marrow, migrate to the peripheral lymphatic system, and mature into plasma cells or memory cells.
Synonyms: Abnormal number of B cells, Abnormal numbers of B cells, Abnormality of B cell count, Abnormality of B cell numbers

Definition: An abnormal decrease from the normal count of B cells.
Synonyms: B cell deficiency, B cell lymphopenia, Decreased B cell count, Low B cell count, Reduction in B cell number

Definition: An abnormal functioning of phagocytosis. Phagocytosis is an elegant but complex process for the ingestion and elimination of pathogens, but it is also important for the elimination of apoptotic cells and hence fundamental for tissue homeostasis. Phagocytosis can be divided into four main steps: (i) recognition of the target particle, (ii) signaling to activate the internalization machinery, (iii) phagosome formation, and (iv) phagolysosome maturation.
A functional abnormality of the immune system.
An abnormal increase or decrease in the level of lipoprotein cholesterol in the blood.
Synonyms: Abnormality of the level of lipoprotein cholesterol

Definition: An abnormal increase in the level of lipoprotein cholesterol in the blood.
An abnormal decrease in the level of lipoprotein cholesterol in the blood.
Synonyms: Lack of fat in blood

Definition: A type of multifactorial inheritance governed by the simultaneous action of many (more than three) gene loci.

A type of multifactorial inheritance governed by the simultaneous action of a few gene loci. It is recommended this term be used for traits governed by three loci, although it is noted that usage of this term in the literature is not uniform.
A type of multifactorial inheritance governed by the simultaneous action of two gene loci.
An abnormality of the morphology or counts of the cells that make up the immune system.
An abnormality of the extrinsic pathway (also known as the tissue factor pathway) of the coagulation cascade.
An abnormality of the intrinsic pathway (also known as the contact activation pathway) of the coagulation cascade.

Term: Abnormality of the common coagulation pathway
Definition: An abnormality of blood coagulation, common pathway.

Term: Abnormal morphology of the abdominal musculature
Definition: An abnormality of the abdominal musculature.
Synonyms: Abnormality of the abdominal musculature

Definition: Involuntary urine leakage synchronous with exertion, or actions such as sneezing, or coughing.
An abnormality of the cerebral subcortex.
Synonyms: Abnormality of the cerebral medulla, Abnormality of the cerebral subcortex

Definition: Abnormality of the striatum, which is the largest nucleus of the basal ganglia, comprising the caudate, putamen and ventral striatum, including the nucleus accumbens.
Synonyms: Abnormality of the neostriatum, Abnormality of the striate nucleus, Abnormality of the striatum

Definition: Any deviation from the normal concentration of a dicarboxylic acid in the blood circulation.
Any deviation from the normal concentration of a monocarboxylic acid in the blood circulation.

Term: Chromosomal breakage induced by ionizing radiation
Definition: Increased amount of chromosomal breaks in cultured blood lymphocytes or other cells induced by treatment with ionizing radiation.
Synonyms: Chromosomal breakage induced by ionising radiation, Increased cellular radiosensitivity, Radiation-induced chromosome instability

Term: Increased susceptibility to spontaneous sister chromatid exchange
Definition: An increase in the number of spontaneous sister chromatid exchanges observed in cell culture of lymphocytes or other cells.

Synonyms: Absent optic tract
Absent/small optic tract, Absent/underdeveloped optic tract

Definition: An abnormal increase of bone mineral density, that is, of the amount of matter per cubic centimeter of bones which is often referred to as osteosclerosis. Osteosclerosis can be detected on radiological examination as an increased whiteness (density) of affected bones.
Synonyms: Increased bone density, Increased bone mineral density, Osteosclerosis, Osteosclerosis of bones

Definition: Abnormally increased formation of dense trabecular bone tissue. Despite the increased density of bone tissue, osteopetrotic bones tend to be more fracture-prone than normal.
Synonyms: Harder, denser, fracture-prone bones

Definition: A severe form of myopia with greater than -6.00 diopters.

A decreased rate of urine production.
An abnormality of renal absorption.

Definition: An abnormality of the intrahepatic bile duct.

Definition: An abnormal conical morphology of the incisor tooth.
Synonyms: Cone shaped front tooth, Conoid incisor, Peg shaped incisors, Peg-shaped incisors, Shark tooth incisor

Definition: The presence of an odontoma.
The presence of one or more teeth additional to the normal number.

Definition: An abnormality of morphology of molar tooth.

Definition: An abnormality of morphology of permanent molar.

Definition: A localized form of developmental hypoplasia of the dental enamel.

Definition: A green staining of teeth.

Definition: An abnormality of premolar tooth.
Synonyms: Abnormality of bicuspid, Abnormality of premolar

Definition: An abnormality of molar tooth.
Synonyms: Abnormality of molar

Definition: An abnormality of canine tooth.
Synonyms: Abnormality of canine, Abnormality of eye tooth

Definition: A tooth that has not erupted because of local impediments (overcrowding or fibrous gum overgrowth).

Definition: An abnormality of morphology of premolar tooth.
Synonyms: Abnormality of bicuspid morphology, Abnormality of premolar morphology, Abnormality of shape of bicuspid, Abnormality of shape of premolar

Definition: Increased size of the incisor tooth.
Synonyms: Increased width of incisor

Definition: An abnormal conical morphology of the primary incisor.
Synonyms: Cone shaped front baby tooth, Conical deciduous incisor, Conoid primary incisor, Primary front shark tooth

Synonyms: Cone shaped maxillary incisor, Cone shaped upper front tooth, Conoid maxillary incisor, Upper front shark tooth

Definition: A form of hypomineralization of enamel characterized by reduced calcification.
Synonyms: Decreased enamel calcification, Poorly calcified tooth enamel

Definition: A form of hypomineralization of enamel characterized by a chalky appearance of the enamel with orange, brown, or white color.

Term: Dentinogenesis imperfecta of primary and permanent teeth
Definition: Developmental dysplasia of dentin or both the primary dentition and the permanent dentition.
Synonyms: Dentinogenesis imperfecta of adult and baby teeth, Dentinogenesis imperfecta of both sets of teeth

Definition: Talon cusp is an accessory cusp located near the cingulum (the portion of the lingual or palatal aspect of the tooth that forms a convex protuberance at the cervical third of the anatomic crown).
Synonyms: Dens evaginatus, Talon cusps

Definition: An abnormality of the incisor characterized by invagination of the enamel, giving a radiographic appearance that suggests a tooth within a tooth.
Synonyms: Dens invaginatus, Tooth within a tooth

Synonyms: Conjoined teeth, Double tooth, Teeth, double, Twinning tooth

Definition: The union of two separately developing tooth germs typically leading to one less tooth than normal in the affected dental arch.
Synonyms: Fused teeth, Fusion of teeth, Joined teeth

Definition: The development of two teeth from a single tooth bud, leading to a larger fused tooth.

Increased size and molar morphology of premolar tooth.
Synonyms: Molar shape of bicuspid, Molar shape of premolar, Molarization of bicuspid

Definition: Maxillary teeth cover the mandibular teeth when biting to an increased degree. The feature is defined as a vertical overlap of the maxillary incisors over the mandibular incisors that exceeds 2 mm.
Synonyms: Increased overlap of upper and lower incisors, Overbite, Supraocclusion

Definition: An abnormal anteroposterior extension of the maxillary teeth beyond the plane of the mandibular teeth upon jaw closure.
Synonyms: Abnormality of horizontal incisor relationship, Protrusion of upper teeth in front of lower teeth

Definition: A loss of myelin from the internode regions along myelinated nerve fibers of the peripheral nervous system.
Synonyms: Demyelination

Definition: A sudden flexion, extension, or mixed extension-flexion of predominantly proximal and truncal muscles that is usually more sustained than a myoclonic movement but not as sustained as a tonic seizure. Limited forms may occur: Grimacing, head nodding, or subtle eye movements. Epileptic spasms frequently occur in clusters. Infantile spasms are the best known form, but spasms can occur at all ages
Synonyms: Epileptic spasms, Salaam convulsion, Salaam convulsions, Salaam seizure, Salaam seizures

Definition: A type of apraxia that is characterized by difficulty or inability to execute speech movements because of problems with coordination and motor problems, leading to incorrect articulation. An increase of errors with increasing word and phrase length may occur.
Synonyms: Apraxia of speech, Verbal dyspraxia

Definition: Unilateral paresis (weakness) with spasticity of the affected muscles and increased tendon reflexes.
Synonyms: Spastic hemiplegia

Definition: An abnormal closure, or atresia of the tubular structure of the intestine.
An abnormal closure, or atresia of the tubular structure of the ileum.

Term: Abnormal left ventricular outflow tract morphology
Definition: An abnormality of the outflow tract of the left ventricle.
Synonyms: Abnormality of the left ventricular outflow tract

Definition: An abnormality in the amount of volume occupied by intravascular blood.
An increase in the amount of intravascular fluid, particularly in the volume of the circulating blood.
Synonyms: Fluid overload in blood

Definition: An decrease in the amount of intravascular fluid, particularly in the volume of the circulating blood.
Synonyms: Depleted blood volume

Definition: Recurrent episodes of ulceration of the oral mucosa, typically presenting as painful, sharply circumscribed fibrin-covered mucosal defects with a hyperemic border.
Synonyms: Recurrent canker sores, Recurrent oral aphthae

Definition: A recurrent form of sinusitis.
Synonyms: Sinusitis, recurrent

Definition: A chronic form of sinusitis.

Inflammation of the tonsils that has occurred repeatedly. The definition of recurrent may vary somewhat, but the criteria used recently as a measure of severity were five or more episodes of true tonsillitis per year, symptoms recurring for at least a year, and episodes that are disabling and that prevent normal functioning. In some cases recurrent tonsillitis may be related to immunosusceptibility. Evidence exists for a genetic predisposition for recurrent tonsillitis.
Synonyms: Recurrent inflammation of tonsils

Term: Abnormality of immune serum protein physiology
Definition: An abnormality of the concentration or function of circulating immune proteins.

Abnormality of the cytokine levels in the blood, i.e., an abnormality of any of the non-antibody proteins made by inflammatory leukocytes and some non-leukocytic cells that affect the behavior of other cells.

An abnormality in the production or cellular release of a cytokine (i.e., any of the non-antibody proteins made by inflammatory leukocytes and some non-leukocytic cells that affect the behavior of other cells).
An impairment in the production by leukocytes of NFKB1-dependent cytokines such as tumor necrosis factor-alpha and interferon-alpha.
An abnormality in the production or cellular release of a chemokine (a class of cytokines).
An abnormality in the production or cellular release of interferons (a class of cytokines).
An abnormality in the production or cellular release of interleukins (a class of cytokines).
Synonyms: Abnormality of IL secretion

Term: Abnormality of tumor necrosis factor secretion
Definition: An abnormality in the production or cellular release of tumor necrosis factor.
Synonyms: Abnormality of cachectin secretion, Abnormality of cachexin secretion, Abnormality of tumour necrosis factor secretion

Definition: An abnormality of the nasal dorsum, also known as the nasal ridge.
Synonyms: Abnormality of the dorsum of nose, Abnormality of the nasal dorsum, Abnormality of the nasal ridge, Anomaly of the nasal ridge

Definition: Nasal ridge curving posteriorly to an imaginary line that connects the nasal root and tip.
Synonyms: Boxer's nasal deformity, Boxer's nose deformity, Concave dorsum of nose, Concave nasal dorsum, Saddle nose, Saddle shaped nasal dorsum, Ski jump nose

Definition: Any morphological abnormality of the skin.
Synonyms: Abnormal skin morphology, Abnormal skin structure

Definition: Any abnormality of the physiological function of the skin.
Synonyms: Abnormality of skin physiology

Definition: The presence of inflammation of the skin. That is, an abnormality of the skin resulting from the local accumulation of fluid, plasma proteins, and leukocytes.
Synonyms: Abnormal tendency to infections of the skin, Inflammatory abnormality of the skin, Skin inflammation

Definition: An abnormality of the morphology of the epidermis.
Synonyms: Abnormality of epidermal morphology

Definition: An abnormality of the melanosomes, i.e., of the cellular organelles in which melanin pigments are synthesized and stored within melanocytes (the cells that produce pigment in the dermis).
A significant descent of the kidney as the patient moves from the supine to the erect position.
Synonyms: Floating kidney, Renal ptosis

Definition: A type of eczema that occurs in the lips and perioral area.
Synonyms: Eczema around the mouth

Definition: A condition characterized by necrosis of the mucosal and submucosal layers of the esophagus not related to ingestion of caustic or other injurious agents. Endoscopically, there is a dark lesion ('black esophagus') distributed in a circumferential manner in the distal one-third of the esophagus with or without exudates. There is involvement of the distal esophagus ending sharply at the gastroesophageal junction.
A bilateral form of fetal pyelectasis.
Synonyms: Bilateral fetal pyelectasia, Bilateral foetal pyelectasia, Bilateral foetal pyelectasis

Definition: Any abnormality of the morphology of the major calices or minor calices of the kidney.
Synonyms: Abnormality of renal calyx morphology

Definition: The presence of a rash (change of color and texture) of the perianal skin.
Synonyms: Perianal rash

Definition: A furuncle (boil) is a skin infection involving an entire hair follicle and nearby skin tissue. Chronic furunculosis refers to recurrent episodes of furuncles, often caused by recurrent staphylococcus infection.
An abnormally increased sensitivity to the effects of ionizing radiation.
Synonyms: Increased sensitivity to ionising radiation

Definition: Mild fever that does not exceed 38.5 degrees centigrade.
Synonyms: Low-grade fever, Mild fever

Definition: Absence or developmental hypoplasia of the sweat glands.
Synonyms: Absent/small sweat glands, Absent/underdeveloped sweat glands

Definition: Absence of the sweat glands.
Synonyms: Absent sweat glands, Lack of sweat glands

Definition: Pale reddish slightly elevated papules and plaques of 0.5-3 cm in diameter and not accompanied by pruritus.
Synonyms: Non-itchy hives

Definition: An abnormality of the skin adnexa (skin appendages), which are specialized skin structures located within the dermis and focally within the subcutaneous fatty tissue, comprising three histologically distinct structures: (1) the pilosebaceous unit (hair follicle and sebaceous glands); (2) the eccrine sweat glands; and (3) the apocrine glands.
Synonyms: Abnormal skin appendage

Definition: Gastric duplication is a usually cystic malformation of gastrointestinal tract, usually attached to the greater curvature of the stomach and has no communication with the stomach.
Synonyms: Gastric duplication cyst

Definition: A spherical hollow structure with a smooth muscle coat, lined by a mucous membrane, and attached to any part of the gastrointestinal tract, from the base of the tongue to the anus.
Synonyms: GI duplication

Definition: A type of cataract (opacification of the lens) that forms during the course of aging.
Synonyms: Clouding of the lens of the eye with age

Definition: A type of age-related cataract that primarily affects the nucleus of the lens.
A type of age-related cataract that primarily affects the cortex of the lens.
A type of age-related cataract consisting of granular opacities occurring mainly in the central posterior cortex just under the posterior capsule.
A seizure that occurs in the context of a brain insult (systemic, toxic, or metabolic) and may not recur when the underlying cause has been removed or the acute phase has elapsed.
A dialeptic seizure is a type of seizure characterised predominantly by reduced responsiveness or awareness and with subsequent at least partial amnesia of the event.
Synonyms: Behavioral arrest seizure with impairment of awareness irrespective of onset, Behavioural arrest seizure with impairment of awareness irrespective of onset, Unknown onset behavioral arrest seizure with impairment of awareness, Unknown onset behavioural arrest seizure with impairment of awareness

Definition: A typical absence seizure is a type of generalised non-motor (absence) seizure characterised by its sudden onset, interruption of ongoing activities, a blank stare, possibly a brief upward deviation of the eyes. Usually the patient will be unresponsive when spoken to. Duration is a few seconds to half a minute with very rapid recovery. Although not always available, an EEG would usually show 3 Hz generalized epileptiform discharges during the event.
Synonyms: Typical absence, Typical absence seizures

Definition: An absence with eyelid myoclonia seizure is a type of generalized non-motor (absence) seizure characterised by forced upward jerking of the eyelids during an absence seizure.
Synonyms: Absence seizures with eyelid myoclonia

Definition: Myoclonic absence seizure is a type of generalized non-motor (absence) seizure characterised by an interruption of ongoing activities, a blank stare and rhythmic three-per-second myoclonic movements, causing ratcheting abduction of the upper limbs leading to progressive arm elevation, and associated with 3 Hz generalized spike-wave discharges on the electroencephalogram. Duration is typically 10-60 s. Whilst impairment of consciousness may not be obvious the ILAE classified this seizure as a generalized non-motor seizure in 2017.
Synonyms: Myoclonic absence, Myoclonic absences

Definition: Atypical absence status epilepticus is a type of generalized non-convulsive status epilepticus without coma that is semiologically a prolonged atypical absence seizure.
Synonyms: Obtundation status

Definition: Typical absence seizures starting before the age of 4 years.
Synonyms: Early onset petit mal seizures

Definition: A type of focal-onset seizure characterized by a motor sign as its initial semiological manifestation.
Synonyms: Focal motor seizures, Localised motor seizure, Localised motor seizures, Localized motor seizure, Localized motor seizures, Partial motor seizure, Partial motor seizures, Segmental motor seizure

Definition: An autonomic seizure is a type of focal non-motor seizure characterized by alteration of autonomic nervous system function as the initial semiological feature.
Synonyms: Focal autonomic seizures

Definition: A focal sensory seizure is a type seizure beginning with a subjective sensation.
Synonyms: Focal sensory seizures, Partial sensory seizure, Sensory aura

Term: Focal sensory seizure with auditory features
Definition: A seizure characterized by elementary auditory phenomena including buzzing, ringing, drumming or single tones as its first clinical manifestation.
Synonyms: Auditory aura, Focal auditory seizure, Focal sensory auditory seizure, Partial auditory seizure

Term: Focal autonomic seizure with epigastric sensation/nausea/vomiting/other gastrointestinal phenomena
Definition: A type of focal autonomic seizure characterised by symptoms or signs pertaining to the gastrointestinal system as the initial semiological feature.
Synonyms: Abdominal aura, Epigastric aura, Epigastric auras, Localised seizure with epigastric sensation, Localized seizure with epigastric sensation, Partial seizure with epigastric sensation, Visceral aura

Term: Focal sensory seizure with gustatory features
Definition: A seizure characterized by taste phenomena including acidic, bitter, salty, sweet, or metallic tastes as its first clinical manifestation.
Synonyms: Focal gustatory seizure, Focal sensory gustatory seizure, Gustatory aura, Gustatory auras, Partial gustatory seizure, Taste hallucinations

Term: Focal sensory seizure with olfactory features
Definition: Seizures characterized by olfactory phenomena as its first clinical manifestation.
Synonyms: Focal olfactory seizure, Olfactory aura, Olfactory auras, Partial olfactory seizure

Term: Focal sensory seizure with somatosensory features
Definition: A seizure characterized by sensory phenomena including tingling, numbness, electric-shock like sensation, pain, sense of movement, or desire to move as its first clinical manifestation.
Synonyms: Focal somatosensory seizure, Partial somatosensory seizure, Somatosensory aura, Somatosensory auras

Term: Focal sensory seizure with visual features
Definition: A seizure characterized by elementary visual hallucinations such as flashing or flickering lights/colours, or other shapes, simple patterns, scotomata, or amaurosis as its first clinical manifestation.
Synonyms: Focal visual seizure, Partial visual seizure, Visual aura, Visual auras

Definition: A type of focal motor seizure characterized by sudden, brief (<100 ms) involuntary single or multiple contraction(s) of muscles(s) or muscle groups of variable topography (axial, proximal limb, distal). Myoclonus is less regularly repetitive and less sustained than is clonus.
Synonyms: Focal myoclonic seizures, Local myoclonic seizures, Localised myoclonic seizure, Localized myoclonic seizure, Partial myoclonic seizure, Partial myoclonic seizures, Segmental myoclonic seizure, Segmental myoclonic seizures

Definition: A type of focal motor seizure characterized by sustained increase in muscle contraction, lasting a few seconds to minutes.
Synonyms: Focal tonic seizures, Local tonic seizures, Localised tonic seizure, Localized tonic seizure, Partial tonic seizure, Partial tonic seizures, Segmental tonic seizure

Definition: Focal seizure with eyelid myoclonia, not eyelid myoclonias in the context of absence seizures.
Synonyms: Eyelid myoclonias

Definition: Generalized clonic seizure is a type of generalized motor seizure characterised by sustained bilateral jerking, either symmetric or asymmetric, that is regularly repetitive and involves the same muscle groups.
Synonyms: Generalised clonic seizure, Generalised clonic seizures, Generalised onset clonic seizure, Generalised-onset clonic seizure, Generalized clonic seizures, Generalized onset clonic seizure, Generalized-onset clonic seizure

Definition: A generalized myoclonic-atonic seizure is a type of generalized motor seizure characterized by a myoclonic jerk followed by an atonic motor component.
Synonyms: Generalised myoclonic-atonic seizure, Myoclonic atonic seizures, Myoclonic-astatic seizure

Definition: A short generalized seizure, of a duration of <15 min, not recurring within 24 h, occurring during a febrile episode not caused by an acute disease of the nervous system intracranial infection or severe metabolic disturbance.
Synonyms: Simple febrile convulsion, Simple febrile seizures, Simple fever fit

Definition: A febrile seizure that has any of the following features: focal semiology (or associated with post-ictal neurologic abnormalities beyond drowsiness, such as a Todd's paresis), prolonged seizure beyond 15 minutes, or recurring (occurring more than once) in a 24 hour period.
Synonyms: Complex febrile convulsion, Complex febrile seizures, Complex fever fit

Definition: A type of focal non-motor seizure characterized by an arrest or pause of activities, freezing, or immobilization as the predominant semiological feature throughout the seizure.
Synonyms: Focal behaviour arrest seizure, Focal hypokinetic seizure, Hypokinetic seizure, Hypokinetic seizures, Localised seizure with behavioural arrest, Localized seizure with behavioral arrest, Partial hypokinetic seizure, Partial seizure with behavior arrest, Partial seizure with behaviour arrest

Definition: A focal seizure characterized at onset by predominantly proximal limb or axial muscles producing irregular sequential ballistic movements, such as pedaling, pelvic thrusting, thrashing, rocking movements.
Synonyms: Hyperkinetic seizures, Localised hyperkinetic seizure, Localized hyperkinetic seizure, Partial hyperkinetic seizure, Segmental hyperkinetic seizure

Definition: A type of focal motor seizure characterised by sustained, forced conjugate ocular, cephalic, and/or truncal rotation or lateral deviation from the midline as the initial semiological manifestation.
Synonyms: Versive seizure, Versive seizures

Definition: An EEG with constitutional variants contains waves that are rare or unusual but not generally pathologic.
EEG background activity at 4-5/second.
EEG dominated by diffuse alpha-waves (8-13Hz).
EEG dominated by diffuse beta-waves (>13 Hz).
Synonyms: Beta wave electroencephalography

Definition: EEG dominated by diffuse beta waves (>13 Hz) with occipitally localized alpha waves (8-13 Hz).
EEG with an amplitude less than 30 microvolts without observable occipital alpha rhythm (8-13 Hz).

Epileptiform activity refers to distinctive EEG waves or complexes distinguished from background activity found in in a proportion of human subjects with epilepsy, but which can also be found in subjects without seizures. Interictal epileptiform activity refers to such activity that occurs in the absence of a clinical or subclinical seizure.
Synonyms: Epileptiform EEG discharges

Term: EEG with hyperventilation-induced focal epileptiform discharges
Definition: Focal epileptiform discharges induced by hyperventilation (overbreathing) in cerebral electrical activity recorded along the scalp by electroencephalography (EEG).

Term: EEG with hyperventilation-induced generalized epileptiform discharges
Definition: Generalized epileptiform discharges induced by hyperventilation (overbreathing) in cerebral electrical activity recorded along the scalp by electroencephalography (EEG).
Synonyms: EEG with hyperventilation-induced generalised epileptiform discharges

Definition: EEG discharges recorded in particular areas of a localized (focal) abnormality in cerebral electrical activity recorded along the scalp by electroencephalography (EEG).
Synonyms: Focal EEG Abnormality

Term: Focal epileptiform discharges with limited propagation to contralateral hemisphere
Definition: Focal epileptiform discharges with spreading to contralateral hemisphere but without secondary generalization.

Term: Focal EEG discharges with propagation to ipsilateral hemisphere
Definition: Focal epileptiform discharges with spreading to the hemisphere on the same side of the brain.

Term: Focal EEG discharges with secondary generalization
Definition: Focal EEG discharges that secondarily spread to both hemispheres and can then be recorded over the entire scalp.
Synonyms: Focal EEG discharges with secondary generalisation

Definition: Epileptiform discharges being identified at multiple locations in both hemispheres.

Term: Uni- and bilateral multifocal epileptiform discharges
Definition: Epileptiform discharges identified at multiple locations temporarily in both hemispheres and temporarily in one hemisphere.
Epileptiform discharges being identified at multiple locations in one hemisphere.
Focal epileptiform discharges of different shapes and frequencies.
EEG with focal sharp transient waves of a duration less than 80 msec.

Term: EEG with series of focal spikes
Definition: Focal spikes occurring for several seconds.

Term: EEG with focal sharp slow waves
Definition: EEG with focal sharp transient waves of a duration between 80 and 200 msec followed by a slow wave.
EEG with focal sharp transient waves of a duration between 80 and 200 msec.
EEG with focal sharp transient waves of a duration less than 80 msec followed by a slow wave.
EEG discharges recorded on the entire scalp typically seen in persons with epilepsy.
Synonyms: EEG with generalised epileptiform discharges

Term: EEG with generalized sharp slow waves
Definition: EEG with generalized sharp transient waves of a duration between 80 and 200 msec followed by a slow wave.
Synonyms: EEG with generalised sharp slow waves

Term: EEG with generalized polymorphic epileptiform discharges
Definition: Generalized epileptiform discharges of different shapes and frequencies.
Synonyms: EEG with generalised polymorphic epileptiform discharges

Definition: EEG with abnormal amplitude.
EEG frequency is abnormally increased.
EEG with abnormally slow frequencies.
EEG showing diffuse slowing without interruption.
Non-continuous diffuse slowing of electroencephalographic patterns.

Term: EEG with generalized slow activity grade 1
Definition: Slowing at frequencies between 7.5 and 8.5 Hz.
Synonyms: EEG with generalised slow activity grade 1

Term: EEG with generalized slow activity grade 2
Definition: Generalized slowing of EEG activity at frequencies between 4-7 Hz.
Synonyms: EEG with generalised slow activity grade 2

Term: EEG with generalized slow activity grade 3
Definition: Generalized slowing of EEG activity at frequencies between 0.5-3 Hz.
Synonyms: EEG with generalised slow activity grade 3

Term: EEG with generalized slow activity grade 4
Definition: EEG without electrical activity.
Synonyms: EEG with generalised slow activity grade 4, Flat line EEG

Definition: Slowing in occipital areas of the scalp EEG.

Term: EEG with photoparoxysmal response grade I
Definition: Occurrence of epileptiform discharges in occipital regions during photic stimulation.

Term: EEG with photoparoxysmal response grade II
Definition: Occurence of epileptiform discharges in occipital and central regions during photic stimulation.

Term: EEG with photoparoxysmal response grade III
Definition: Occurrence of epileptiform discharges in occipital, central, temporal and parietal regions during photic stimulation.

Term: EEG with photoparoxysmal response grade IV
Definition: Occurrence of generalized epileptiform discharges during photic stimulation.
Hypsarrhythmia occurring in one hemisphere.
An abnormal shape of occiput.
Synonyms: Abnormal shape of posterior cranium, Abnormal shape of posterior skull, Abnormal shape of the back of the skull

Term: Abnormal shape of the frontal region
Definition: An abnormal shape of the frontal part of the head.
Synonyms: Abnormal morphology of the frontal region, Abnormal shape of the forehead, Dysmorphic forehead, Dysmorphic frontal region

Definition: Facial height (length) is more than two standard deviations below the mean (objective); or an apparent decrease in the height (length) of the face (subjective).
Synonyms: Decreased height of face, Decreased length of face, Decreased vertical dimension of face, Short face, Short facies, Vertical deficiency of face, Vertical Facial Deficiency, Vertical facial insufficiency, Vertical hypoplasia of face, Vertical insufficiency of face, Vertical shortening of face

Definition: Forward prominence of the entire forehead, due to protrusion of the frontal bone.
Synonyms: Prominence of frontal region, Prominent forehead, Pronounced forehead, Protruding forehead

Definition: Vertical soft tissue creases in the midline of the forehead, often extending from the hairline to the brow, and seen with facial expression or when the face is at rest.
Synonyms: Frontal creases of face, Vertical forehead creases, Vertical forehead rhytids, Vertical forehead wrinkles

Definition: Posterior positioning of the glabella, i.e., of the midline forehead between the supraorbital ridges.
Synonyms: Concave glabella, Deficiency of glabella, Deficient area between the eyebrows, Flat area between the eyebrows, Flat glabella, Hypoplasia of glabella

Definition: Linear vertical groove in the midline of the forehead, extending from hairline to glabella.
Synonyms: Depression of frontal cranial suture, Depression of metopic cranial suture, Frontal suture depression

Definition: Absent eyelids.
Synonyms: Ablepharon of eyelid, Absent eyelids, Agenesis of eyelids, Missing eyelids

Definition: Redundant eyelid skin pressing the eyelashes against the cornea and/or conjunctiva.
Absence or underdevelopment of the eyelid.
Synonyms: Failure of development of eyelid, Hypotrophic eyelid

Definition: An abnormal elevation of the C-reactive protein level in the blood circulation.
Synonyms: Elevated C-reactive protein level

Definition: An eyebrow that extends straight across the brow, without curve.
Synonyms: Flat eyebrow, Horizontal eyebrow, Straight eyebrow

Definition: Regional increase in the width (height) of the eyebrow.
Synonyms: Broad eyebrow, Broad eyebrows, Flared eyebrow, Increased vertical height of eyebrow, Increased vertical thickness of eyebrow

Definition: An eyebrow that extends laterally beyond the orbital rim rather than turning gently downward at that location.
Synonyms: Increased lateral length of eyebrow, Laterally elongated eyebrow, Laterally extended eyebrows

Definition: Eyelashes that draw the attention of the viewer due to increased density and/or length and/or curl without meeting the criteria of trichomegaly.
Synonyms: Prominent eyelashes

Definition: Elevated ridge(s) of skin starting well below the medial aspect of the lower lid that curves gradually upward toward and/or across the nasal bridge.
Synonyms: Infraorbital fold

Definition: Antihelix protrusion directed more anteriorly than laterally, forming a shelf overlying the posterior concha.
Synonyms: Conchal shelf

Definition: No discernible ridge between concha and triangular fossa and helix.
Supernumerary ridge or crus of the ear arising from the antihelix.
Antihelical ridge that forms an acute angle between the antitragus and its bifurcation (stem) instead of a gently curving arc.
Increased width of the inferred cross-section of the inferior crus.
Synonyms: Antihelix, inferior crus, broad

Definition: Increased protrusion of the inferior crus relative to the prominence of the antihelix stem.
Synonyms: Antihelix, inferior crus, prominent, Hyperplastic inferior crus of antihelix, Hypertrophic inferior crus of antihelix

Definition: Decreased protrusion of the inferior crus relative to the prominence of the antihelix stem.
Synonyms: Antihelix, inferior crus, underdeveloped, Hypoplastic inferior crus of antihelix, Hypotrophic inferior crus of antihelix

Definition: Increased protrusion of the antihelical ridge, proximal to its bifurcation, relative to the prominence of the helix.
Synonyms: Hyperplastic antihelix stem, Hypertrophic antihelix stem

Definition: Posterior curving of the antihelix from its origin at the antitragus, traveling initially almost perpendicular to the descending helix and obscuring some of the concha.
Synonyms: Antihelix, stem, serpiginous

Definition: Decreased protrusion of the antihelical ridge, proximal to its bifurcation, relative to the prominence of a normal helix.
Synonyms: Antihelix, stem, underdeveloped

Term: Abnormality of inferior crus of antihelix
Definition: An abnormality of the inferior crus of the antihelix is the lower cartilaginous ridge arising at the bifurcation of the antihelix that ends beneath the fold of the ascending helix, and separates the concha from the triangular fossa.
Synonyms: Abnormality of anterior crus of antihelix

Definition: An abnormality of the stem of the antihelix, which is the part below the bifurcation of the antihelix into the inferior and superior crura.

Term: Abnormality of superior crus of antihelix
Definition: An abnormality of the superior crus of the antihelix is the upper cartilaginous ridge arising at the bifurcation of the antihelix that ends beneath the fold of the ascending helix, and separates the concha from the triangular fossa.
Synonyms: Abnormality of posterior crus of antihelix

Definition: Decreased protrusion of the superior crus relative to the prominence of a normal antihelix stem.
Synonyms: Hypoplastic superior crus of antihelix, Hypotrophic superior crus of antihelix

Definition: Increased protrusion of the superior crus relative to the prominence of a normal antihelix stem.
Synonyms: Hyperplastic superior crus of antihelix, Hypertrophic superior crus of antihelix

Definition: Positioning of the antitragus at an angle perpendicular to the plane of the ear (oriented away from the plane of the ear).
Absence of the anterosuperior prominence of the area between the bottom of the incisura and the inner margin of the antihelix.
Double rather than single peak of the antitragus.
Synonyms: Double antitragus

Definition: Reduction in the anterosuperior prominence of the area between the bottom of the incisura and the inner margin of the antihelix.
Synonyms: Hypoplastic antitragus, Hypotrophic antitragus, Small antitragus

Definition: Invagination of the superior part of the auricle under a fold of temporal skin.
Synonyms: Buried ear, Hidden ear

Definition: A type of cryptotia associated with reduction in size of the antihelix and superior crus.
Synonyms: Type 1 cryptotia

Definition: A type of cryptotia associated with reduction in size of the antihelix and inferior crus that are affected.
Synonyms: Type 2 cryptotia

Definition: Continuum between the tragus and ascending helix, without any evidence of a posterior extension (crus) towards the concha.
Synonyms: Helix, crus, absent

Term: Crus of helix connected to antihelix
Definition: Extension of the ridge of the crus helix across the ear and connection of the crus to the antihelix.
Synonyms: Helix, crus, connected to antihelix

Definition: Curving course of the crus of the helix, approaching or joining the antitragus.
Synonyms: Helix, crus, serpiginous

Term: Tragal bridge of crus of helix
Definition: The anterior origin of the crus encompasses the superior margin of the tragus, the crus overrides the upper portion of the conchal cavum and ends at the antihelix.
Synonyms: Helix, crus, tragal bridge

Term: Expanded terminal portion of crus of helix
Definition: Widening, rather than tapering, of the crus at its posterior border near the antihelix.
Synonyms: Helix, crus, expanded terminal portion

Definition: Small defect of the helical fold that lies at the junction of the superior and descending portions of the helix.
Synonyms: Helix, Darwin notch

Definition: Small expansion of the helical fold at the junction of the superior and descending portions of the helix.
Synonyms: Helix, Darwin tubercle

Definition: Linear, circumferential indentation in the convexity of the outer surface of the helix.
Synonyms: Helix, crimped, Indented helix

Definition: Positioning of the anterior surface of the ear lobe in a more coronal plane than the remainder of the ear.
Synonyms: Forward facing earlobe, Lobe, forward facing

Definition: Interruption between the ascending helix and the crus helix, allowing the ascending helix to be attached directly to the mastoid.
Synonyms: Helix, discontinuous ascending root

Definition: Discontinuity in the convexity of the inferior margin of the lobe.
Synonyms: Cleft earlobe

Definition: Presence of all the normal ear components and the median longitudinal length more than two standard deviations below the mean.
Synonyms: First-degree microtia

Definition: Presence of some auricular structures, but none of these structures conform to recognized ear components.
Synonyms: Third-degree microtia

Definition: Lack of convexity or prominence of the contour of the ridge between the bottom of the incisura and the confluence of the ascending helix and crus helix.
Increased height of the tragal ridge with a shallow indentation at the apex, giving the appearance of a double peak.
Synonyms: Notched tragus, Tragus, bifid

Definition: A complete or partial duplication of the tragus; expected to lie anterior to the normal tragus.
Synonyms: Accesory tragus, Tragus, duplicated

Definition: Increase posterolateral protrusion of the tragus.
Synonyms: Enlarged tragus, Hyperplastic tragus, Hypertrophic tragus, Large tragus, Tragus, prominent

Definition: Decreased posterolateral protrusion of the tragus.
Synonyms: Hypoplastic tragus, Hypotrophic tragus, Small tragus

Definition: Abnormally increased variability in the size of erythrocytes.
Synonyms: Unequal size of red blood cells

Definition: Increased susceptibility to mycobacterial infections, as manifested by recurrent episodes of mycobacterial infection.
Increased susceptibility to mycobacterial avium complex infections, as manifested by recurrent episodes of mycobacterial infection.

Synonyms: Skin vascular malformation

Term: Abnormality of the urinary system physiology
