Synonyms: Secretory adrenal adenoma

Definition: An abnormality of the adenohypophysis, which is also known as the anterior lobe of the pituitary gland.
A reduced ability to secrete adrenocorticotropic hormone (ACTH), a hormone that stimulates the adrenal cortex to secrete of glucocorticoids such as cortisol.
Synonyms: ACTH deficiency, Corticotropin deficiency

Definition: Overproduction of adrenocorticotropic hormone (ACTH), which generally leads secondarily to overproduction of cortisol by the adrenal cortex.
Synonyms: ACTH excess

Definition: A tumor (abnormal growth of tissue) of the adenohypophysis, which is also known as the anterior lobe of the pituitary gland.
Synonyms: Neoplasm of the adenohypophysis, Neoplasm of the pars anterior

Definition: An abnormality of the neurohypophysis, which is also known as the posterior lobe of the hypophysis.
Synonyms: Abnormality of the neurohypophysis

Definition: The presence of a neoplasm (tumour) in the neurohypophysis, which is also known as the posterior lobe of the hypophysis.
Synonyms: Neoplasm of the neurohypophysis

Definition: Abnormal development of the neurohypophysis during embryonic growth and development.
Synonyms: Neurohypophysis dysplasia, Posterior pituitary dysplasia

Definition: A solid, low grade, spindle cell, glial neoplasm of adults that originates in the neurohypophysis or infundibulum. Clinical signs and symptoms include visual disturbance, headache and features of hypopituitarism. Pituicytomas are well-circumscribed, solid masses that can measure up to several centimeters. Histologically, they show a compact architecture consisting of elongate, bipolar spindle cells arranged in interlacing fascicles or assuming a storiform pattern.

An abnormal anatomical location of the posterior lobe of the hypophysis, also known as the neurohypophysis. The posterior pituitary is normally present in the dorsal portion of the sella turcica, but when ectopic is usually near the median eminence. This defect is likely to be due to abnormal migration during embryogenesis.
Synonyms: Ectopic neurohypophysis

Definition: Absence of the neurohypophysis owing to a developmental defect.
Synonyms: Neurohypophysis agenesis

Definition: Underdevelopment of the neurohypophysis.
Synonyms: Neurohypophysis hypoplasia

Definition: A type of pituitary adenoma that produces gonadotropins.
Synonyms: Pituitary gonadotropinoma

Definition: A type of pituitary adenoma that produces growth hormone.
Synonyms: Pituitary somatotropinoma

Definition: A type of pituitary adenoma that is of unknown cellular origin and that lacks immunocytochemical or fine structural markers. Null cell adenomas are not associated with hormone excess.
Synonyms: Clinically silent pituitary adenoma, Hormonally silent pituitary adenoma, Non-functional pituitary adenoma, Silent pituitary adenoma

Definition: A type of pituitary adenoma that produces thyroid stimulating hormone (TSH).
Synonyms: Pituitary thyrotropinoma

Definition: A pituitary tumor with subarachnoid, brain, or systemic metastasis. The diagnosis of a pituitary carcinoma requires evidence of metastatic disease, either outside the central nervous system (CNS) or as separate noncontiguous foci within the CNS.

A spindled-to-epithelioid, oncocytic, nonendocrine neoplasm of the anterior hypophysis that manifests in adults and follows a benign clinical course. Pituitary spindle cell oncocytomas are firm, fibrous, and adherent to surrounding structures and are highly vascular.
A structural abnormality of the parathyroid gland.
A functional abnormality of the parathyroid gland.
Synonyms: Parathyroid dysfunction

Definition: Abnormal embryonic development of the parathyroid gland.
An abnormal anatomical location of the parathyroid gland.

A type of hyperparathyroidism that occurs following kidney transplantation, which is a treatment for secondary hyperparathyroidism. Although kidney transplantation leads to a normalization of serum calcium and parathyroid hormone in most patients. The state of persistent hypercalcemia and hyperparathyroidism is referred to as tertiary hyperparathyroidism.
A type of hypoparathyroidism with circulating antiparathyroid or anti-calcium sensing receptor antibodies indicative of autoimmunity.
A structural abnormality of the thyroid gland.
Synonyms: Abnormal shape of thyroid gland, Abnormality of thyroid morphology

Definition: Enlargement of the thyroid gland related to a singular nodule in the thyroid gland.
Synonyms: Uninodular goitre

Definition: Absence of a lobe of the thyroid gland related to a failure of its embryologic development.
An abnormal growth of parafollicular (C-cells) cells.

Synonyms: Thyrotoxicosis with diffuse goitre
Thyrotoxicosis with toxic multinodular goitre

Term: Thyrotoxicosis with toxic single thyroid nodule

Definition: A type of hypothyroidism due to an insufficient stimulation of an otherwise normal thyroid gland. Central hypothyroidism is caused by either pituitary (secondary hypothyroidism) or hypothalamic (tertiary hypothyroidism) defects.
An elevated concentration of free 3,3',5-triiodo-L-thyronine in the blood circulation.
Synonyms: Increased circulating free triiodothyronine, Increased serum free T3, Increased serum free triiodothyronine, Increased serum fT3

Term: Impaired sensitivity to thyroid stimulating hormone
Definition: Reduced sensitivity of thyroid follicle cells to stimulation by biologically active thyroid-stimulating hormone (TSH).
Synonyms: Thyroid-stimulating hormone receptor defect, TSHR defect

Definition: Gain-of-function thyroid-stimulating hormone receptor (TSHR) defect.
Synonyms: Activating TSHR defect

Definition: Loss-of-function thyroid-stimulating hormone receptor (TSHR) defect.
Synonyms: Inactivating TSHR defect

Definition: Neoplasm categorized according to type of histological abnormality.
Neoplasm categorized according to the anatomical site of origin of the neoplasm.
The presence of an embryonal neoplasm of the kidney that primarily affects children.
Presence of persistent islands of renal blastema in the postnatal kidney, anywhere within a renal lobe (a portion of a kidney consisting of a renal pyramid and the renal cortex above it).
Abnormally persistent foci of embryonal immature blastema located in the superficial cortical region (perilobar).
A type of papillary renal cell carcinoma that is characterized by small cuboidal cells covering thin papillae with a single line of uniform nuclei and small nucleoli.
A renal tumor originating from an oncocyte, which is an epithelial cell characterized by an excessive amount of mitochondria, resulting in an abundant acidophilic, granular cytoplasm.

Synonyms: Abnormality of facial soft tissue, Anomaly of facial soft tissue

Definition: Posterior positions and/or vertical shortening of the infraorbital and perialar regions, or increased concavity of the face and/or reduced nasolabial angle.
Synonyms: Decreased size of midface, Flat midface, Hypoplasia of midface, Midface deficiency, Midface hypoplasia, Midface retrusion, Midface, flat, Retrusive midface, Underdevelopment of midface

Definition: Increased size of the parotid gland.
Synonyms: Hyperplasia of parotid gland, Increased size of parotid gland

Definition: A benign (noncancerous) tumorlike malformation made up of an abnormal mixture of cells and tissues that originates in the tongue.
Synonyms: Lingual hamartoma

Definition: Visually assessable vertical indentation, cleft, or depression of the nasal bridge, ridge and tip.
Synonyms: Bifid nasal bridge, Indentation or clefting of the nose

Definition: A functional abnormality of a skeletal muscle.
Synonyms: Abnormality of muscle physiology, Issue with muscle function

Definition: A structural abnormality of a skeletal muscle.
Synonyms: Abnormal muscle morphology, Abnormality of muscle morphology, Abnormally shaped muscle, Issue with muscle structure

Definition: Atrophy (wasting) affecting primary type 1 muscle fibers. This feature in general can only be observed on muscle biopsy.
Synonyms: Type 1 muscle fibre atrophy

Definition: Decreased intensity of the patellar reflex (also known as the knee jerk reflex).
Synonyms: Decreased knee jerk reflex, Decreased patellar reflexes

Definition: A type of myotonia that worsens with repeated muscle contractions.

A reduced ability to distinguish tactile sensations at points that are very close to one another. This can be tested by using special calipers whose points can be set from 2mm to several centimeters apart.
A reduced ability to identify precisely the site of a touch. This test is usually carried out by asking a patient, whose eyes are closed or covered, to touch the same site with a fingertip.
Synonyms: Impaired topognosis, Impaired touch localisation

Definition: Impaired ability to recognize letters or numbers drawn by an examiner's fingertip on the patient's skin (the patients eyes are closed or covered throughout this examination).

Lipofuscin (age pigment) is a brown-yellow, electron-dense, autofluorescent material that accumulates progressively over time in lysosomes of postmitotic cells, such as neurons and cardiac myocytes. This term pertains if there is an increase in the accumulation of lipofuscin (also known as autofluorescent lipoprotein) more than expected for the age of the patient.
An increased level of hypoxanthine in the urine.

A congenital defect in the skull, whereby there is a protrusion of part of the cranial contents through a congenital defect in the cranium, usually covered with skin or mucous membrane. The term encephalocele refers to a subclass of these lesions in which brain tissue protrudes through the defect.
An encephalocele located between bregma and lambda.

Basal encephalocele is an encephalocele that occurs along the cribriform plate or through the sphenoid bone. The mass may appear in the nasal cavity, nasopharynx, epipharynx, sphenoid sinus, posterior orbit, or pterygopalatine fossa. The important distinction from other types is that no external tumor is visible except in those rare instances of herniations so large that they protrude through the mouth or nares.

Synonyms: Naso-frontal encephalocele

Definition: A cleft of the muscular (soft) portion of the palate that is covered by mucous membrane. Soft-palate submucous clefts are characterized by a midline deficiency or lack of muscle tissue.
Synonyms: Partial thickness cleft soft palate, Submucous cleft velum

Definition: Absence of the normal opening of the choana (the posterior nasal aperture) as a result of an obstructing choanal membrane that may be thin and strandlike or thick and pluglike.
An abnormality of one or more of the set of bones that make up the facial skeleton.
Synonyms: Abnormality of facial skeleton, Anomaly of facial skeleton

Definition: Increased width of the midpoint of the mandible (mental protuberance) and overlying soft tissue.
Synonyms: Broad chin, Increased width of chin, Increased width of menton region, Wide chin

Definition: Horizontal crease or fold situated below the vermilion border of the lower lip and above the fatty pad of the chin, with the face at rest.
Synonyms: Chin with horizontal crease, Chin with horizontal furrow, Chin with horizontal groove, Chin with horizontal sulcus, Horizontal chin skin cleft, Horizontal menton crease

Definition: H-shaped crease in the fat pad of the chin.
Synonyms: Chin with H-shaped crease, Chin, H-Shaped Crease, Chin, H-shaped groove, H-shaped dimple of the chin

Definition: Prominence of a triangular soft tissue area of the philtrum with the apex to the columella.
Synonyms: Philtrum, Tented

Definition: Narrow ridge in the midline of the philtral groove.
Synonyms: Philtrum with central raphe, Philtrum with midline ridge, Philtrum, midline raphe

Definition: Absence of the usual parallel position of philtral ridges.
Synonyms: Asymmetric philtral columns, Asymmetric philtral ridges, Malaligned philtral columns, Philtral Ridges, Malaligned

Definition: Pit in the midline of the philtral groove.
Synonyms: Central sinus of philtrum, Philtrum, Midline Sinus

Definition: Distance between the philtral ridges, measured just above the vermilion border, more than 2 standard deviations below the mean. Alternatively, an apparently decreased distance between the ridges of the philtrum.
Synonyms: Decreased breadth of philtrum, Decreased horizontal dimension of philtrum, Decreased transverse dimension of philtrum, Decreased width of philtrum, Philtrum, Narrow, Thin philtrum

Definition: Abnormality of the oral mucosa.
Synonyms: Abnormality of lining of mouth, Abnormality of mucosa of mouth, Abnormality of oral mucosa, Abnormality of oral mucous membrane

Definition: Nasal tip positioned to one side of the midline.
Synonyms: Asymmetry of nasal tip, Asymmetry of tip of nose, Crooked nasal tip, Crooked tip of nose, Deviated nasal tip, Deviated tip of nose, Nasal tip, deviated

Definition: Decrease in width of the nasal tip.
Synonyms: Narrow nasal tip, Narrow tip of nose, Nasal tip, narrow, Nasal tip, pinched, Pinched nasal tip, Pinched tip of nose, Thin nasal tip, Thin tip of nose

Definition: Positioning of the nasal tip inferior to the nasal base.
Synonyms: Drooping nasal tip, Hooked tip of nose, Low hanging nasal tip, Nasal tip, overhanging, Overhanging nasal tip

Definition: A noninflammatory, progressive occlusion of the intracranial carotid arteries owing to the formation of netlike collateral arteries arising from the circle of Willis.
Congenital absence of the scaphoid..
Synonyms: Missing scaphoid bone

Definition: Delayed maturation and calcification of the talus.
Detectable but decreased IgA levels that are more than 2 standard deviations below normal age-adjusted means.
Localized thickening and tightness of the skin of the fingers or toes.
A deviation from the normal count of T cells.
Synonyms: Abnormal number of T cells, Abnormality of T cell number

Definition: A functional anomaly of T cells.
A potentially lethal cardiac arrhythmia characterized by an extremely rapid, hemodynamically unstable ventricular tachycardia (150-300 beats/min) with a large oscillating sine-wave appearance.
An abnormality of the form, structure, or size of the skeletal system.
Synonyms: Abnormality of skeletal morphology, Abnormally shaped skeletal

Definition: An abnormality of the function of the skeletal system.
Synonyms: Abnormality of musculoskeletal physiology

Definition: An abnormality of the appendicular skeletal system, consisting of the of the limbs, shoulder and pelvic girdles.
Short (hypoplastic) second metatarsal bone.
Synonyms: Short 2nd long bone of foot

Definition: A benign, painful, tumor of bone characterized by the formation of osteoid tissue, primitive bone and calcified tissue.
A bone tumor composed of cellular spindle-cell stroma containing scattered multinucleated giant cells resembling osteoclasts.
Synonyms: Giant cell tumour of bone

Definition: A type of abdominal pain that comes and goes in waves, most often starting and ending suddenly and being of severe intensity.
Any anomaly in the formation of bone or of a bony substance, or the conversion of fibrous tissue or of cartilage into bone or a bony substance.
Inflammation of the parotid gland.
Accumulation of blood within the pericardial sac.

Accumulation of chyle (the whitish fluid taken up by the lacteals in the intestine, consisting of an emulsion of lymph and triglyceride fat thatpasses into the veins by the thoracic duct) in the pericardium. Chylopericardium is generally caused by obstruction of or trauma to the thoracic duct.
Accumulation of serous fluid (pale yellow and transparent fluid) in the pericardial sac.
Accumulation of blood in the peritoneal cavity owing to internal hemorrhage.
Abnormal accumulation of fluid leading to swelling of the pharynx.
Synonyms: Pharyngeal oedema, Swollen throat, Throat swelling

Definition: An appetite for and the persistent ingestion of non-food substances such as clay. In order to diagnose pica, this behavior must have persisted over a period of at least one month.
A discrete mass of neoplastic monoclonal plasma cells either in the bone marrow or in an extramedullary location.
Decreased activity of coagulation factor IX. Factor IX, which itself is activated by factor Xa or factor VIIa to form factor IXa, activates factor X into factor Xa.
Synonyms: Low factor IX activity

Definition: A type of keratitis characterized by inflammation in pinpoint areas of the corneal epithelium.
The presence of spots or rounded patches of abnormally increased density of metaphyseal bone.
Synonyms: Dappled metaphyseal sclerosis

Definition: Both lungs have three lobes. Normally, the left lung has two lobes, whereas the right lung has three lobes.
Synonyms: Bilateral trilobed lungs

Definition: Any structural anomaly of the connective tissue bundles in the extracellular matrix of bone tissue that are composed of collagen, and play a role in tissue strength and elasticity.
Any anomaly in the formation of the bony substance of the sternum.
Synonyms: Abnormal maturation of breastbone, Sternal ossification center abnormalities, Sternal ossification centre abnormalities

Definition: An abnormally increased diphosphate(4-) concentration in the blood. Diphosphate(4-), as ester with two phosphate groups, is also known as pyrophosphate.
An anomaly of the ilium ala. This is the large expanded portion of the ilum which bounds the greater pelvis laterally.
Synonyms: Abnormality of the wing of the ilium

Definition: Pain in the lower back and hip radiating in the distribution of the sciatic nerve.
Any anomaly in the function of thrombocytes.
Abnormal response to arachidonic acid as manifested by reduced or lacking aggregation of platelets upon addition of arachidonic acid.
Abnormal response to ristocetin as manifested by reduced or lacking aggregation of platelets upon addition of ristocetin.
Abnormal response to thrombin or thrombin mimetics as manifested by reduced or lacking aggregation of platelets upon addition of thrombin (or thrombin mimetics).
Abnormal number of platelets per volume of blood. In a healthy adult, a normal platelet count is between 150,000 and 450,000 per microliter of blood.
Low platelet count following administration of unfractionated or (less commonly) low-molecular weight heparin.
An anomaly in platelet form, ultrastructure, or intracellular organelles.
Synonyms: Abnormal shape of platelets

Definition: Anomalous size of platelets. Most normal sized platelets are 1.5 to 3 micrometers in diameter. Large platelets are 4 to 7 micrometers. Giant platelets are larger than 7 micrometers and usually 10 to 20 micrometers.
Average platelet volume above the upper limit of the normal reference interval.
Synonyms: Large platelets

Definition: Presence of reduced amount of a membrane protein on the cell membrane of platelets. This feature is typically measured by flow cytometry.
Decreased cell membrane concentration of the glycoprotein complex Ib-IX-V.
An acute form of disseminated intravascular coagulation. Acute DIC can occur following sudden exposure of blood to procoagulants, with the compensatory hemostatic mechanisms becoming overwhelmed.
Decreased cell membrane concentration of glycoprotein VI.
Decreased cell membrane concentration of P2Y12 receptor.
An anomaly of alpha or dense granules or platelet lysosomes.
Abnormal bleeding of the umbilical stump following separation of the cord at approximately 7-10 days after birth.
Bleeding from vessels of the various tissues of the eye.
Synonyms: Bleeding from the eye, Haemorrhage of the eye

Definition: Bleeding in the anterior chamber of the eye.
Hemorrhage from the vessels of the choroid.
Synonyms: Choroid haemorrhage, Choroidal haemorrhage, Choroidal hemorrhage

Definition: Bleeding sufficiently severe as to require red cell transfusion (WHO Grade 3 or 4).
Synonyms: Bleeding requiring red cell transfusion

Term: Bleeding with minor or no trauma
Definition: Significant bleeding or hemorrhage without significant precipitating factor.
Synonyms: Bleeding with minor or no trauma, Easy bleeding

Definition: Prolonged or protracted bleeding following an invasive procedure or intervention.
Synonyms: Prolonged bleeding following procedure

Definition: Significant maternal haemorrhage/blood loss following deilvery of a child.
Synonyms: Bleeding post-delivery, Post-partum haemorrhage

Definition: A reduced concentration of vitamin K.
Number of leukocytes per volume of blood beyond normal limits.
Synonyms: Abnormal white blood cell count

Term: Impaired thromboxane A2 agonist-induced platelet aggregation
Definition: Abnormal response to thromboxane as manifested by reduced or lacking aggregation of platelets upon addition of thromboxane A2 receptor agonists.

Term: Anemia due to reduced life span of red cells
Definition: A type of anemia related to a reduction in the average life span of red blood cells in the peripheral circulation, which is normally around 120 days.
Synonyms: Anaemia due to reduced life span of red cells

Definition: Bleeding beneath the mucous membrane that lines the inner surface of the eyelid.
Synonyms: Subconjunctival haemorrhage

Definition: Increased number of neutrophils circulating in blood.
Synonyms: Increased blood neutrophil counts

Definition: An abnormality of the level of activity of circulating fibrinogen.
Increased concentration of fibrinogen in the blood.
Decreased concentration of fibrinogen in the blood.
Synonyms: Low fibrinogen activity, Low fibrinogen level

Definition: Qualitatively abnormal fibrinogen.
Synonyms: Dysfibrinogenaemia

Definition: Anomaly in the level or the function of hemoglobin, the oxygen-carrying protein of erythrocytes.
Synonyms: Abnormal haemoglobin, Abnormal Hb

Definition: Hemoglobin H (HbH) contains four beta-globin chains. It is normally not present at all in blood, but may make up about 1-40 percent of all hemoglobin in HbH disease, a subform of alpha thalassemia.
Synonyms: Haemoglobin H, HbH haemoglobin, Hemoglobin H

Definition: Hemoglobin F (HbF) contains two globin alpha chains and two globin gamma chains. It is the main form of hemoglobin in the fetus during the last seven months of intrauterine development and in the half year of postnatal life. In adults it normally makes up less than one percent of all hemoglobin. This term refers to an increase in HbF above this limit. In beta thalassemia major, it may represent over 90 percent of all hemoglobin, and in beta thalassemia minor it may make up between 0.5 to 4 percent.
Synonyms: Increased haemoglobin F, Increased hemoglobin F, Persistence of haemoglobin F, Persistence of HbF

Definition: Hemoglobin A (HbA) contains two globin alpha chains and two globin beta chains. HbA is normally the main adult hemoglobin, representing about 96-98 percent of all hemoglobin. This term represents a decreased in the proportion of HbA below this limit, and can be seen in various forms of thalassemia.
Synonyms: Reduced haemoglobin A, Reduced HbA

Definition: A reduction in the ratio of production of beta globin to that of alpha globin. This is the major abnormality in the various forms of beta thalassemia.
A reduction in the ratio of production of alpha globin to that of beta globin. This is the major abnormality in the various forms of alpha thalassemia.
Missing radius bone on one side only associated with congenital failure of development.
Abnormally flat shape of the heads of the metacarpal bones.
Synonyms: Flattened head of long bone of hand

Term: Shortening of all phalanges of fingers
Definition: Abnormal reduction in length affecting all phalanges.
Synonyms: Shortening of all finger bones

Definition: An anomaly of a metacarpophalangeal joint.
Synonyms: Abnormality of metacarpophalangeal joint, Abnormality of the knuckle

Definition: An anomaly of the glenoid fossa, also known as the glenoid cavity, which is the articular surface of the scapula that articulates with the head of the humerus.
Excessive, increased hair growth located in the lumbar region.
Excessive, increased hair growth located in the thoracic region.
Abnormal calcification in the cardiovascular system.
Atrophy of the extensor digitorum longus muscles, which mediate extension of the toes.
Underdevelopment (hypoplasia) of the fifth toe.
Synonyms: Short fifth toe, Short little toe, Short pinkie toe, Short pinky toe

Definition: Bending or curvature of a fourth toe in the tibial direction (i.e., towards the big toe).
Accumulation of pus in the pleural cavity.
Synonyms: Pyothorax

Definition: A type of pleural effusion with a transudate (extravascular fluid with low protein content and a low specific gravity). Pleural effusions can be classified as transudates or exudates based on Light's criteria, which classify an effusion as exudate if one or more of the following are present: (1) the ratio of pleural fluid protein to serum protein is greater than 0.5, (2) the ratio of pleural fluid lactate dehydrogenase (LDH) to serum LDH is greater than 0.6, or (3) the pleural fluid LDH level is greater than two thirds of the upper limit of normal for serum LDH.

A type of pleural effusion with a exudate (extravascular fluid that has exuded out of a tissue or its capillaries due to injury or inflammation). Pleural effusions can be classified as transudates or exudates based on Light's criteria, which classify an effusion as exudate if one or more of the following are present: (1) the ratio of pleural fluid protein to serum protein is greater than 0.5, (2) the ratio of pleural fluid lactate dehydrogenase (LDH) to serum LDH is greater than 0.6, or (3) the pleural fluid LDH level is greater than two thirds of the upper limit of normal for serum LDH.

Term: Abnormal activity of mitochondrial respiratory chain
Definition: An increased or decreased activity of the mitochondrial respiratory chain.

Term: Decreased activity of mitochondrial complex I
Definition: A reduction in the activity of the mitochondrial respiratory chain complex I, which is part of the electron transport chain in mitochondria.

Term: Decreased activity of mitochondrial complex III
Definition: A reduction in the activity of the mitochondrial respiratory chain complex III, which is part of the electron transport chain in mitochondria.

Term: Decreased activity of mitochondrial ATP synthase complex
Definition: A reduction in the activity of the mitochondrial proton-transporting ATP synthase complex, which makes ATP via oxidative phosphorylation, and is sometimes described as Complex V of the electron transport chain.
Proximal mislocalization of the big toe from its normal position.
Synonyms: Proximal placement of big toe, Proximally placed halluces

Definition: One or more digit that appears disproportionately short compared to the hand/foot, whereby either the entire digit or a specific phalanx is shortened.
Synonyms: Short digit

Definition: Developmental hypoplasia (shortening) of proximal phalanx of toe.
Synonyms: Short innermost toe bone

Term: Hypersegmentation of proximal phalanx of third finger
Definition: Presence of an additional phalanx-like bone, producing an extra, wedge-shaped bone at the base of the proximal phalanx of the third finger.

Synonyms: Hyperelastic chest skin, Stretchable chest skin

Definition: An anomaly of the cerebellar peduncles. The superior, middle, and inferior cerebellar peduncles emerge from the cerebellum. The superior cerebellar penduncles connect the cerebellum to the midbrain, the middle cerebellar peduncles connect the cerebellum to the pons, and the inferior cerebellar peduncle connects the medulla spinalis and medulla oblongata with the cerebellum.
Synonyms: Abnormality of the cerebellar peduncle

Definition: An anomaly of the superior cerebellar peduncle.
Synonyms: Abnormality of the superior cerebellar peduncle

Definition: Increased length of the superior cerebellar peduncle.
Synonyms: Long cerebellar peduncle, Long cerebellar peduncles

Definition: Abnormal outpouching or sac-like dilatation in the wall of the inferior mesenteric artery or superior mesenteric artery .
Decreased concentration of urate in the urine.
A decreased concentration of total carnitine in the blood.
Synonyms: Decreased plasma total carnitine

Definition: Underdeveloped nails of the fifth toes.
Synonyms: Small fifth toenail, Underdeveloped fifth toenail

Definition: A soft tissue continuity in the A/P axis between fingers 3 and 4.
An abnormality of the shape of the thoracic vertebra T12 such that it is wedge-shaped (narrow towards the front).
Synonyms: Anterior wedging of the 12th thoracic vertebra, Wedge-shaped 12th thoracic vertebra

Definition: An abnormality of the shape of the lumbar vertebra L2 such that it is wedge-shaped (narrow towards the front).
Increased concentration of SO3(2-), i.e., sulfite, in the urine.
Increased concentration of thiosulfate(2-) in the urine.
A type of vasculitis (inflammation of blood vessel walls) that affects blood vessels that are smaller than arteries, i.e., arterioles, venules, and capilllaries.

Bronchiolitis obliterans organizing pneumonia (BOOP) is and interstitial lung abnormalitiy characterized histopathologically by plugs of granulation tissue lying within small airways, alveolar ducts, and alveoli and by chronic inflammatory cell infiltration in alveolar walls. Patients with BOOP generally present with subacute illness, including shortness of breath, fever, malaise, and weight loss.
Synonyms: BOOP, Bronchiolitis obliterans organising pneumonia, Cryptogenic organising pneumonia, Cryptogenic organizing pneumonia

Definition: Inflammation and fibrosis of the bronchioles leading to partial or complete obstruction of these airways.
Synonyms: Constrictive bronchiolitis, Obliterative bronchiolitis

Definition: An infection of the upper or lower respiratory tract.
Synonyms: Respiratory infection, Respiratory tract infection

Definition: A history of repeated acute infections of the upper or lower respiratory tract.
Synonyms: Acute respiratory tract infection

Definition: Acute inflammation of the lung due to an infection.
Inflammation of the bronchioles.
Pneumonia due to the aspiration (breathing in) of food, liquid, or gastric contents into the upper respiratory tract.
An acute episode of pneumonia due to the aspiration (breathing in) of food, liquid, or gastric contents into the upper respiratory tract.
Lung parenchymal involvement with lymphoma.
Diffuse benign transformation of the hepatic parenchyma into small regenerative nodules with minimal or no fibrosis.
Synonyms: Nodular transformation of liver, Noncirrhotic nodulation, Partial nodular transformation of liver

Definition: The presence of multiple granulomas in the liver as based on pathological examination. Granulomas are small 0.5 to 2 mm collections of modified macrophages called epithelioid cells usually surrounded by lymphocytes.

A lymphoproliferative abnormality of the intestine characterized by numerous visible mucosal nodules measuring up to, and rarely exceeding, 0.5 cm in diameter Histologically, hyperplastic lymphoid follicles with large germinal centres are seen in the lamina propria and superficial submucosa. There is enlargement of the mucosal B cell follicles caused by hyperplasia of the follicle centres; surrounded by a normal appearing mantle zone. Disease may involve the stomach, the entire small intestine, and the large intestine.

An abnormality of the pectoral muscle, comprising the pectoralis major, a thick, fan-shaped muscle of the anterior chest and the pectoralis minor, a thin, triangular muscle situated underneath the pectoralis major.
Synonyms: Abnormal pec muscles

Definition: A small hole through the whole thickness of the retina.
Synonyms: Retinal tear, Torn retina

Term: Unilateral hypoplasia of pectoralis major muscle
Definition: Hypoplasia (underdevelopment) of the pectoralis minor on only one side of the chest.
Synonyms: Small pec muscle on one side, Underdeveloped pec muscle on one side

Definition: Focal proliferation of glial cells in the substantia nigra.

Absence of any measurable level of sperm in his semen, resulting from a defect in the production of spermatozoa in the testes. This can be differentiated from obstructive azoospermia on the basis of testicular biopsy.
Synonyms: Testicular azoospermia

Definition: Absence of any measurable level of sperm in his semen, resulting from post-testicular obstruction or retrograde ejaculation. This can be differentiated from obstructive azoospermia on the basis of testicular biopsy.

Absence of any measurable level of sperm in his semen, due to a hypothalamic or pituitary abnormality diagnosed with hypo-gonadotropic-hypogonadism. The diagnosis is made on the basis of low LH and FSH levels and low or normal testosterone levels.
History of repeated intermittent involuntary muscle contractions that were painful.
Any deviation from the normal concentration of citrulline in the blood circulation.
An increased concentration of citrulline in the blood.
A reduced concentration of copper in the blood.
Synonyms: Copper deficiency, Hypocupremia, Reduced serum copper

Definition: Impaired ability to eat related to problems gathering food and getting ready to suck, chew, or swallow it.
Synonyms: Feeding difficulties, Feeding problems, Poor feeding

Definition: An elevated concentration of luteinizing hormone in the blood.
Synonyms: Elevated LH level, Elevated luteinizing hormone, Increased circulating luteinizing hormone level

Definition: Amyloid deposition in the walls of leptomeningeal and cortical arteries, arterioles, and less often capillaries and veins of the central nervous system.

An exaggerated whealing tendency when the skin is stroked, that is, formation of red, itchy bumps and lines on the skin as a result of pressure on the skin (for instance, stroking the skin with a pen or tongue depressor).
Synonyms: Dermatographism, Dermographism, Skin writing

Definition: Abnormally low glucose concentration in the cerebrospinal fluid.
Synonyms: Decreased CSF glucose, Low glucose levels in cerebral spinal fluid

Definition: Repeated episodes of sudden-onset and transient lethargy.
Replacement of bone marrow by fibrous tissue.
Partial or complete loss of hearing following ingestion of aminoglycoside antibiotics.
An increased concentration of catecholamine in the urine.
Synonyms: Elevated urinary catecholamines

Definition: An increased concentration of homovanillic acid in the urine.
An increased concentration of vanillylmandelic acid in the urine.
An increased concentration of dopamine in the urine.
Synonyms: Elevated urinary dopamine

Definition: Gallstones composed primarily of cholesterol, usually about 2-3 cm in length with an oval form and a yellow or green/brown color.
Gallstones composed primarily of bilirubin and calcium salts (calcium bilirubinate) with a low cholesterol concentration.
A type of pigment gallstone that is hard and black, containing calcium carbonate and calcium phosphates.
A type of pigment gallstone that is brown, containing calcium fatty acids. These stones are softer than black pigment gallstones.
Failure of formation of the lumen of the gallbladder, often associated with gallbladder hypoplasia.
Synonyms: Gallbladder atresia

Definition: Clay colored stools lacking bile pigment.
Synonyms: Acholia, Clay colored stools, Clay coloured stools, Discolored, acholic stools

Definition: Formation of abnormal, extraskeletal bony tissue, i.e., the presence of bone in soft tissue where bone normally does not exist.
Synonyms: Ectopic bone formation, Heterotopic ossification

Definition: Formation of abnormal bony tissue within muscle tissue.
Synonyms: Calcification of muscle tissue

Definition: Formation of abnormal bony tissue within tendon tissue.
Formation of abnormal bony tissue within ligament tissue.
A functional abnormality of neutrophils.
A deviation from the normal range of neutrophil cell counts in the circulation.
Synonyms: Abnormal neutrophil cell number

Definition: An abnormal form or size of neutrophils.
A reduction in the ability of neutrophils to kill bacteria.
An abnormality of the interatrial septum.
Synonyms: Abnormal interatrial septum morphology, Abnormality of the atrial septum

Definition: A bulging of the interatrial septum towards one side. In adults, atrial septal aneurysm can be defined as a protrusion of the aneurysm of >10 mm beyond the plane of the atrial septum as measured by transesophageal echocardiography.

Increased activity of coagulation factor V, Factor V, which is activated to factor Va by means of minute amounts of thrombin (and inactivated by larger amounts of thrombin). Activated factor V (fVa) is a cofactor in the formation of the prothrombinase complex.
Synonyms: Elevated factor V activity, Plasma factor V elevated

Definition: Abnormally increased level of blood lactate following a meal.
An increased concentration of glucose in the blood following a meal.
A persecutory delusion of supposed hostility of others.
Synonyms: Paranoia

Definition: EEG with generalized sharp transient waves of a duration less than 80 msec.
Synonyms: EEG with generalised spikes

Definition: EEG with repetitive generalized sharp transient waves of a duration less than 80 msec.
Synonyms: EEG with generalised polyspikes

Definition: Affective, mnemonic or composite perceptual auras with subjective qualities similar to those experienced in life but are recognized by the subject as occurring outside of actual context.
Synonyms: Experiential aura, Experiential auras

Definition: Affective auras with subjective qualities similar to those experienced in life but are recognized by the subject as occurring outside of actual context.
Synonyms: Affective aura, Affective auras, Emotional aura

Term: Focal cognitive seizure with deja vu/jamais vu
Definition: A focal cognitive seizure characterized by memory phenomena such as feelings of familiarity (deja vu) and unfamiliarity (jamais vu) as the initial semiological manifestation.
Synonyms: Mnemonic aura, Mnemonic auras

Definition: A subjective feeling that an experience which is occurring for the first time has been experienced before.
Synonyms: Deja vu

Definition: A subjective feeling that an experience which has occurred before is being experienced for the first time.
Synonyms: Jamais vu

Definition: A focal cognitive seizure characterized by hallucination as the initial semiological manifestation.
Synonyms: Hallucinatory aura, Hallucinatory auras

Definition: A focal cognitive seizure characterized by an alteration of actual perception involving visual, auditory, somatosensory, olfactory, and/or gustatory phenomena as the initial semiological manifestation.
Synonyms: Illusory aura, Illusory auras

Term: EEG with central focal spike waves
Definition: EEG with focal sharp transient waves in the central region, i.e., focal sharp waves of a duration less than 80 msec followed by a slow wave.

Term: EEG with frontal focal spike waves
Definition: EEG with focal sharp transient waves in the frontal region, i.e., focal sharp waves of a duration less than 80 msec followed by a slow wave.

Term: EEG with occipital focal spike waves
Definition: EEG with focal sharp transient waves in the occipital region, i.e., focal sharp waves of a duration less than 80 msec followed by a slow wave.

Term: EEG with parietal focal spike waves
Definition: EEG with focal sharp transient waves in the parietal region, i.e., focal sharp waves of a duration less than 80 msec followed by a slow wave.

Term: EEG with temporal focal spike waves
Definition: EEG with focal sharp transient waves in the temporal region, i.e., focal sharp waves of a duration less than 80 msec followed by a slow wave.
EEG with focal sharp transient waves of a duration less than 80 msec in the central region.
EEG with focal sharp transient waves of a duration less than 80 msec in the frontal region.
EEG with focal sharp transient waves of a duration less than 80 msec in the occipital region.
EEG with focal sharp transient waves of a duration less than 80 msec in the parietal region.
EEG with focal sharp transient waves of a duration less than 80 msec in the temporal region.
Complete dislocation of the lens of the eye.
Synonyms: Dislocated lens, Dislocated lenses

Definition: Aorta descends on right instead of on the left.
Synonyms: Right-sided aortic arch

Definition: Persistence of blood flow through the ductus venosus for longer than the normal time after birth.

A congenital defect of the vasculature such that there is a shunt (by-pass) of blood directly from the portal vein to the vena cava (i.e., the blood from the portal vein is not filtered through the liver).
Elevated concentration of galactose in the urine.
Synonyms: Increased urinary galactose level

Definition: Elevated concentration of galactose in the blood.
Deviation from the normal concentration of ornithine in the blood circulation.
Increased concentration of ornithine in the blood.
Synonyms: High blood ornithine levels

Definition: An abnormal accumulation of fluid and swelling in the tissues of the larynx.
Synonyms: Laryngeal oedema

Definition: A benign tumor of the liver of presumably epithelial origin.
Synonyms: Hepatic adenoma, Liver cell adenoma

Definition: An abnormal concentration of a hormone in the urine.
Synonyms: Abnormality of urine hormone level

Definition: Abnormally increased concentration of cortisol in the urine.
Synonyms: High urine cortisol level
Lipomatous tumour

Definition: Benign neoplasia derived from lipoblasts or lipocytes of white or brown fat. May be angiomatous or hibernomatous.
Synonyms: Fatty lump, Noncancerous fatty lump

Definition: Presence of a lipoma in the region of the sacrum.
Malignant neoplasms which probably originate in primitive mesenchymal stem cell populations differentiating down a lipomatous pathway.

Multiple, localized or widespread, asymptomatic or inflammatory dermal cysts involving the pilosebaceous units. Lesions can appear anywhere on the body, but steatocystoma multiplex is more commonly involved with those areas of the skin with a high density of developed pilosebaceous units (e.g., the axilla, groin, neck, and proximal extremities).
Wasting of the sternocleidomastoid muscle, the muscle in the anterior part of the neck that acts to flex and rotate the head.
Wasting of the pectoral muscles, i.e., of the pectoralis major and pectoralis minor.
Synonyms: Wasting of pec muscles

Definition: Corneal guttata are droplet-like accumulations of non-banded collagen on the posterior surface of Descemet's membrane. The presence of focal thickenings of Descemet's membrane histologically named guttae. Cornea guttata can be easily diagnosed in vivo and ex vivo by means of specular microscopy as it gives dark areas where no endothelial cells are visible.
Synonyms: Corneal endothelial guttata

Definition: Presence of folds in the Descemet membrane, which is the basement membrane of the endothelial (inner) cell layer of the cornea. Descemet membrane folds are generally a manifestation of inflammation or edema of the cornea.
Abnormal accumulation of fluid and swelling of the stroma of cornea.
Synonyms: Corneal stromal oedema
Decreased fertility in males

Definition: A type of asthma in which aspirin and other nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drugs (NSAIDs) that inhibit cyclooxygen-ase 1 (COX-1) exacerbate bronchoconstriction.
Synonyms: Aspirin-induced asthma

Definition: Rhythmic, involuntary sinusoidal oscillations of one or both eyes. The waveform of pendular nystagmus may occur in any direction.

Seesaw nystagmus is a type of pendular nystagmus where a half cycle consists of the elevation and intorsion of one eye, concurrently with the depression and extortion of the fellow eye. In the other half cycle, there is an inversion of the ocular movements.
Presence of multiple yellowish-white lesions of various size and configuration on the retina not related to vascular lesions.
Inability to elicit tendon reflexes in the upper limbs.
A visual defect characterized by the inability to see as clearly in bright light as in dim light. The word hemeralopia literally means day blindness.
Synonyms: Day blindness

Definition: A kind of focal dystonia characterized by forceful contractions of the face, jaw, and/or tongue causing difficulty in opening and closing the mouth and often affecting chewing and speech.
Synonyms: Cranial dystonia

Definition: A form of focal dystonia that affects the vocal cords, associated with involuntary contractions of the vocal cords causing interruptions of speech and affecting the voice quality and often leading to patterned, repeated breaks in speech.
Synonyms: Spasmodic dysphonia

Definition: An extreme form of generalized edema with widespread and massive edema due to effusion of fluid into the extracellular space.
Synonyms: Extreme generalised oedema, Extreme generalized edema

Definition: Hypoglycermia following a meal (or more generally, after intake of glucose).
Synonyms: Low blood sugar after a meal, Postprandial hypoglycemia

Definition: A reduced concentration of calcitriol in the blood. Calcitriol is also known as 1,25-dihydroxycholecalciferol or 1,25-dihydroxyvitamin D3.
Synonyms: Low serum 1,25-dihydroxycholecalciferol, Low serum 1,25-dihydroxyvitamin D3

Definition: A reduced concentration of calcifediol in the blood. Calcifediol is also known as calcidiol, 25-hydroxycholecalciferol and 25-Hydroxyvitamin D3.
Synonyms: Decreased 25-hydroxyvitamin D3, Low serum 25-hydroxycholecalciferol, Low serum calcidiol, Low serum calcifediol

Definition: Malignant tumor of melanocytes of the choroid. The classic appearance of choroidal melanoma is a pigmented dome-shaped or collar button-shaped tumor with an associated exudative retinal detachment. Choroidal melanoma is usually pigmented, but can be variably pigmented and even amelanotic (non-pigmented).
Malignant tumor of melanocytes of the ciliary body.
The presence of a melanoma of the skin.
A type of melanoma that is flat and irregular in shape and color, with different shades of black and brown.
A type of melanoma that starts as a raised area that is usually dark blackish-blue or bluish-red but may not have any color.

A subtype of melanoma in situ that typically develops on sun-damaged skin. The lesion is typically a large, irregularly pigmented macule that has developed from an ordinary lentigo (a small pigmented spot on the skin with a clearly-defined edge). Change to a malignant lentigo typically takes place over 20 years or more, and many patients accept the change as a consequence of aging.

A type of cutaneous melanoma localized to the palm, sole, or beneath the nail (subungual melanoma). Acral lentiginous melanoma starts as a slowly-enlarging flat patch of discoloured skin and usually displays a size above 6 mm and often several centimetres or more in diameter upon diagnosis and variable pigmentation with a mixutre of colors including brown, and blue-grey, black and red. The surface of the lesion is initially smooth but later in the course may become thicker and irregular, and may ulcerate or bleed.
Excretion of oligosaccharides conjugated to sialic acid in the urine.
Synonyms: Increased urinary sialyloligosaccharides

Definition: A fluid filled cavity that develops with a bone.
Synonyms: Bone cyst, Bone cysts

Definition: Radiographic features include a dilated, radiolucent lesion typically located eccentrically within the metaphyseal portion of the bone, with fluid levels visible on magnetic resonance imaging.
A benign fluid filled simple cyst of bone filled with serous fluid.
Presence of multiple cystic changes in multiple areas or multiple bones.
Synonyms: Multiple bony cystic lesions

Definition: Increased concentration of disaccharide in the urine.
Increased excretion of glycopeptides in the urine. Glycopeptides are peptides with carbohydrate moieties covalently attached to the side chains of the amino acid residues.
Synonyms: High urine glycopeptide levels

Definition: Excretion of excess amounts of aspartylglucosamine in the urine.
Synonyms: High urine aspartylglucosamine levels

Definition: An increased concentration of keratan sulfate in the urine.
Synonyms: Keratan sulphate excretion in urine

Definition: An increased concentration of chondroitin sulfate (CHEBI:37397) in the urine.
Synonyms: Chondroitin sulphate excretion in urine

Definition: Any deviation from the normal concentration in the blood circulation of acylcarnitine, which is produced by reversible esterification of the 3-hydroxyl group of carnitine.
Synonyms: Abnormal circulating esterified carnitine concentration

Definition: Excretion of urine with an acid pH, i.e., having an increased hydrogen ion concentration.
Synonyms: Acidic urine

Definition: An abnormal distribution of N-acylglycines in the urine. There are numerous different N-acylglycines, and this term refers to pathological alterations in their level or distribution.

An abnormality of the pupillary light reaction characterized by a marked slowing of the light reaction of usually just one pupil. The pupil tends to be relatively dilated, and there is reduced accommodation.
Synonyms: Adie pupil, Adie's tonic pupil

Definition: An abnormality of mental functioning affecting the personality and behavioural tendencies of an individual and characterized by a rigid and unhealthy pattern of thinking and behavior. The definition of a personal disorder implies that the abnormality is not the result of damage or insult to the brain or from another psychiatric disorder.

A personality disorder characterized by impulsive behavior and unpredictable and capricious mood. Affected individuals show a liability to outbursts of emotion and an incapacity to control the behavioural explosions.
Synonyms: BPD

Definition: A personality disorder characterized by shallow and labile affectivity, self-dramatization, theatricality, exaggerated expression of emotions, suggestibility, egocentricity, self-indulgence, lack of consideration for others, easily hurt feelings, and continuous seeking for appreciation, excitement and attention.
Blockade of impulses at a focal site along the course of a motor axon.
Any anomaly of the conduction of motor nerve impulses in the central nervous system.
Atrophy of the cerebellum affecting primarily the granular cell layer.
An abnormally increased size of the cerebellum compared to other brain structures.
Atrophy of the cerebellum affecting primarily the Purkinje cell layer.
Nuclear or cytoplasmic aggregates that show positive staining with antibodies against ubiquitin within cells of the brain.

Term: Abnormality of skeletal muscle fiber size
Definition: Any abnormality of the size of the skeletal muscle cell.
Synonyms: Abnormality of skeletal muscle fibre size

Definition: The presence of 10 or more white cells per cubic millimeter in a urine specimen, 3 or more white cells per high-power field of unspun urine, a positive result on Gram staining of an unspun urine specimen, or a urinary dipstick test that is positive for leukocyte esterase.
Synonyms: High urine neutrophil count

Definition: An abnormal color of the urine, that is, the color of the urine appears different from the usual straw-yellow color.
Synonyms: Abnormal urinary color, Abnormal urinary colour, Abnormal urine color, Abnormal urine colour

Definition: An anomaly in the surface contour of mitochondria.
A deviation from the normal odor of the urine.
Synonyms: Abnormal urinary odor, Abnormal urinary odour, Abnormal urine smell

Definition: Arterial inflammation.
Synonyms: Inflammation of artery
Abnormality of pancreas morphology, Abnormally shaped pancreas

Definition: An anomaly of the function of the pancreas.
A functional anomaly of the acinar gland portion of the pancreas that secretes digestive enzymes.
Synonyms: Abnormal exocrine pancreatic function

Definition: A function abnormality of the endocrine pancreas.
A deviation from the normal size of the pancreas.
Synonyms: Abnormal pancreas size

Definition: Dislocation of many joints.
A congenital inclusion cysts that arises from ectodermal cells that normally form skin cells being left behind in the nervous system during development.

A congenital inclusion cysts that arises from the inclusion of ectodermally committed cells at the time of neural tube closure (3rd-5th week of embryogenesis). The capsule of dermoid cysts consists of simple epithelium supported by collagen. In thicker parts, the lining is supplemented with dermis containing hair follicles, sebaceous glands, and apocrine glands.

Term: Edema of the dorsum of feet
Definition: An abnormal accumulation of fluid beneath the skin on the back of the feet.
Synonyms: Edema of dorsum of feet, Oedema of dorsum of feet, Oedema of the dorsum of feet

Definition: An abnormal catecholamine concentration in the blood.
Synonyms: Catecholamine levels abnormal

Definition: An abnormal concentration of creatinine in the blood.
Synonyms: Abnormal blood creatinine level, Abnormal circulating creatinine level, Creatinine levels abnormal

Definition: An abnormally reduced amount of creatinine in the blood.
Synonyms: Decreased serum creatinine, Low blood creatinine level, Reduced creatinine levels

Definition: A deviation from the normal number of mitochondria per cell.

An anomaly of the mitochondrion, the membranous cytoplasmic organelle the interior of which is subdivided by cristae. The mitochondrion is a self replicating organelle that is the site of tissue respiration.
Atrophy of the parietal cortex.
Atrophy of the occipital cortex.
Disproportionate shortening of the proximal segment of the leg (i.e. the femur).
Increased width of the cross sectional diameter of the fibula.
Synonyms: Thick fibula, Thick fibulae, Wide calf bone, Wide fibula

Definition: A type of glaucoma defined by an open, normal appearing anterior chamber angle and raised intraocular pressure,
A type of glaucomatous optic neuropathy in an eye that has evidence of angle closure (i.e. significant iridotrabecular contact).
Underdevelopment of the pons.
Synonyms: Pontine hypoplasia

Definition: An abnormality of the concentration of a glucocorticoid in the blood.
An abnormality of the concentration of corticosterone in the blood.
Synonyms: Abnormality of circulating corticosterone level

Definition: A deviation from the normal concentration of creatine in the blood circulation. Creatine is a derivative of glycine having methyl and amidino groups attached to the nitrogen. Creatine is naturally produced from amino acids, primarily in liver and kidney, and acts as an energy source for cells, primarly for muscle cells.
Synonyms: Abnormality of creatine metabolism

Definition: A carcinoma of the endometrium, the mucous lining of the uterus.
Inflammation of the liver.
Synonyms: Liver inflammation

Definition: Deviation from normal concentration of albumin in the blood.
Synonyms: Abnormal albumin level

Definition: Elevation in the concentration of albumin in the blood.
Synonyms: High blood albumin levels, Hyperalbuminaemia

Definition: A carcinoma of the larynx.
Synonyms: Cancer of the larynx, Laryngeal cancer

Definition: Abnormally increased levels of methemoglobin in the blood. In this form of hemoglobin, there is an oxidized ferric iron (Fe +3) rather than the reduced ferrous form (Fe 2+) that is normally found in hemoglobin. Methemoglobin has a reduced affinity for oxygen, resulting in a reduced ability to release oxygen to tissues.
Increased concentration of methylmalonic acid in the urine.
Synonyms: High blood methylmalonic acid levels, Methymalonicaciduria

Definition: Inflammation of the uveal tract in which inflammation affects the anterior chamber, vitreous, retina or choroid.
Inflammation of the uveal tract in which the primary site of inflammation is the anterior chamber.
Inflammation of the uveal tract in which the primary site of inflammation is the retina or choroid.
Synonyms: Choroiditis

Definition: Inflammation of the uveal tract in which the primary site of inflammation is the vitreous.
A cancer of the prostate.
Synonyms: Prostatic cancer

Definition: A cancer arising in any part of the stomach.
Synonyms: Gastric cancer

Definition: Increased concentration of uracil in the urine.
Synonyms: High urine uracil levels

Definition: Death of cells in the basal ganglia.

Term: Abnormality of bone marrow stromal cells

Definition: An anomaly of erythroid lineage cells, that is, of the erythropoietic cells in the lineage leading to and including erythrocytes.
Synonyms: Abnormality of cells of the erythroid lineage

Definition: A deviation from the normal count of erythroid precursor cells, that is, erythroid lineage cells in the bone marrow.
Increased count of erythroid precursor cells, that is, erythroid lineage cells in the bone marrow.
Decreased count of erythroid precursor cells, that is, erythroid lineage cells in the bone marrow.
Synonyms: Erythroblastopenia

Definition: An anomaly of cells involved in the formation of a granulocytes, that is, of the granulocytopoietic cell.
Synonyms: Abnormality of cells of the granulocytic lineage

Definition: Decreased number of granulocyte precursors in the bone marrow.
A subtype of ductal pancreatic carcinoma that is thought to originate from squamous metaplasia of pancreatic ductal epithelium.
Synonyms: Squamous cell carcinoma of the pancreas

Definition: Any structural anomaly of megakaryocytes. Mature blood platelets are released from the cytoplasm of megakaryocytes, which are bone-marrow resident cells.
Synonyms: Abnormality of cells of the megakaryocyte lineage

Definition: Any structural anomaly of a myeloid mononuclear recirculating leukocyte that can act as a precursor of tissue macrophages, osteoclasts and some populations of tissue dendritic cells.

Term: Abnormality of multiple cell lineages in the bone marrow

Definition: Decreased quantity or activity of von Willebrand factor. Von Willebrand factor mediates the adhesion of platelets to the collagen exposed on endothelial cell surfaces.

Term: Reduced quantity of Von Willebrand factor
Definition: Decreased quantity of von Willebrand factor.
Myelodysplasia with dysplastic changes in two or more of the myeloid lineages: erythroid, granulocytic, megakaryocytic.
Myelodysplasia with dysplastic changes in two of the myeloid lineages: erythroid, granulocytic, megakaryocytic.
Abnormality/dysplasia of a single myeloid cell (erythroid, granulocytic, or megakaryocytic).
The presence of blood in the pleural space.
Splitting of the retinal layers in the macula.
Synonyms: Retinoschisis involving the fovea

Definition: An decrease in the level of triglycerides in the blood.
Synonyms: Decreased circulating Tg levels, Decreased plasma Tg levels, Low blood triglyceride levels

Definition: Inability to experience pleasure activities usually found enjoyable.
Reduced ability of the cornea to respond to stimulation.
Synonyms: Corneal hypaesthesia, Corneal hypesthesia, Reduced corneal sensation

Definition: Phagocytosis by macrophages of erythrocytes, leukocytes, platelets, and their precursors in bone marrow and other tissues.
Atrophy of the cerebral subcortical white and gray matter, termed subcortical atrophy, reflects loss of nerve cells in the basal ganglia or fibers in the deep white matter.
A separation (dissection) of the layers of the carotid artery wall.
A separation (dissection) of the layers of the internal carotid artery wall.
A separation (dissection) of the layers of the intracranial portion of the internal carotid artery wall.
A separation (dissection) of the layers of the external carotid artery wall.
A separation (dissection) of the layers of the common carotid artery wall.
A dilatation (balooning or bulging out of the vessel wall) of a carotid artery.
A clinical sign indicating a lapse of posture and is usually manifest by a bilateral flapping tremor at the wrist, metacarpophalangeal, and hip joints.
A developmental defect resulting in the presence of fewer than the normal number of digits.
Repetitive and compulsive picking of skin which results in tissue damage.
Synonyms: Compulsive skin picking, Dermatillomania

Definition: A phenomenon in which persons repetitively pull out their own hair, resulting in noticeable hair loss.
Synonyms: Trichotillomania

Definition: Habitual striking of one's own head against a surface such as a mattress or wall of a crib.
Synonyms: Head-banging

Definition: Habitual biting of one's own body.
Habitual biting of one's own fingernails.
Synonyms: Nail-biting, Onychophagia, Onychophagy

Definition: Habitual clasping and squeezing of the hands.
Habitual repetitive movement of the body.
An increase in heart rate with standing of 30 beats per minute or more.
Synonyms: Postural tachycardia

Definition: A tumor arising from glia in the central nervous system with macroscopic regions of necrosis and hemorrhage. Microscopically, glioblastoma multiforme is characterized by regions of pseudopalisading necrosis, pleomorphic nuclei and cells, and microvascular proliferation.
Synonyms: Glioblastoma

Definition: Poor anticoagulant response to activated protein C. A plasma is termed 'APC resistant' when the addition of exogenous APC fails to prolong its clotting time in an activated partial thromboplastin time assay.
Synonyms: Activated protein C resistance

Definition: An anomaly of the natural killer cell, which is a lymphocyte that can spontaneously kill a variety of target cells without prior antigenic activation via germline encoded activation receptors. It also regulates immune responses via cytokine release and direct contact with other cells.
Synonyms: Abnormal NK cells, Abnormality of natural killer cells

Definition: A functional anomaly of the natural killer cell.
Reduced ability of the natural killer cell to function in the adaptive immune response.

A form of focal dystonia affecting the face and especially the jaw that is induced by the act of speaking. It is an involuntary contraction of the masticatory muscles, resulting in dysarthria or dysphagia.
Synonyms: Abnormal craniofacial muscle tone

Definition: A disorder of large arteries, in particular the aorta, characterized by an accumulation of basophilic ground substance in the media with cyst-like lesions associated with degenerative changes of collagen, elastin and the vascular smooth muscle cells.
Synonyms: Arterial cystic medial necrosis

Definition: Malfunction of a peripheral nerve resulting from mechanical compression of the nerve roots from internal or external causes and leading to a conduction block or axonal loss.
A squamous cell carcinoma that originates in the oropharnyx.
Presence of multiple hyperplastic polyps in the colon. Hyperplastic polyps are generally about 5 mm in size and show hyperplastic mucosal proliferation.
An elevated concentration of high-density lipoprotein cholesterol (HDL) in the blood.
Synonyms: High blood HDL level, Hyperalphalipoproteinemia, Increased circulating high-density lipoprotein levels

Definition: Injury to the median nerve caused by its entrapment at the wrist as it traverses through the carpal tunnel. Clinically, constrictive median neuropathy is characterized by pain, paresthesia, and weakness in the median nerve distribution of the hand.

Term: Entrapment neuropathy of the ulnar nerve at elbow
Definition: An entrapment neuropathy of the ulnar nerve in the cubital tunnel (in the elbow) characterized by numbness in the ring and little fingers and weakness of the intrinsic muscles in the hand.
An increased concentration of protoporphyrins in erythrocytes.
Excessive vomiting in early pregnancy, leading to the loss of 5% or more of body weight.
A type of lymphoma characterized microscopically by multinucleated Reed-Sternberg cells.
Synonyms: Hodgkin disease, Hodgkin's lymphoma

Definition: A type of lymphoma that originates in T-cells.
Synonyms: T cell lymphoma

Definition: A type of lymphoma that originates in B-cells.
Synonyms: B cell lymphoma

Definition: A type of T-cell lymphoma that exhibits malignant infiltration of the skin.
A type of T-cell lymphoma that is characterized by so-called hallmark cells with a pleomorphic appearance that express the CD30 antigen, are lobulated, and have indented nuclei.
Transient episodes of weakness of the arm, leg, and in some cases the face on one side of the body.
Uneven rhythm of breathing.
Synonyms: Irregular respiratory rhythm

Definition: An abnormal pattern of respiration characterized by cycles of respiration that are increasingly deeper then shallower with possible periods of apnea. Affected patients may display a 10 to 20 second episode of hypoventilation or apnea, followed by respiration of increased depth and frequency over the course of about one minute. The cycle repeats every 45 seconds to 3 minutes.
Synonyms: Cheyne-Stokes breathing, Periodic respiration

Definition: A type of tumor of the pancreatic beta cells that secretes excess insulin and can result in hypoglycemia.
Synonyms: Pancreatic insulinoma

Definition: The presence of more than 5 juvenile polyps of the colon. The term juvenile polyps refer to a special histopathology and not the age of onset as the polyp might be diagnosed at all ages. The juvenile polyp has a spherical appearance and is microscopically characterized by overgrowth of an oedematous lamina propria with inflammatory cells and cystic glands.
A type of headache characterized by repeated attacks of unilateral pain lasting 15 to 180 minutes and associated with local autonomic signs.
An anomaly of clotting factor II, which is known as prothrombin, a vitamin K-dependent proenzyme that functions in the blood coagulation cascade.
An increase in the concentration of bile acid in the blood.
A fungal infection of the toenails or fingernails that tends to cause the nails to thicken, discolor, disfigure, and split.
Recurrent infection involving the vulva, vagina, and adjacent crural areas, whereby the causative agent belongs to the genus Candida.
Any structural anomaly of the acrosome resulting in a round sperm head.
An anomaly of the mobility of ejaculated sperm.
Synonyms: Abnormal sperm motility

Definition: An abnormal reduction in the mobility of ejaculated sperm.
Synonyms: Asthenospermia, Reduced sperm motility

Definition: A lack of mobility of ejaculated sperm.
Synonyms: Nonmotile sperm

Definition: Juvenile myelomonocytic leukemia (JMML) is a lethal myeloproliferative disease of young childhood characterized clinically by overproduction of myelomonocytic cells and by the in vitro phenotype of hematopoietic progenitor hypersensitivity to granulocyte-macrophage colony-stimulating factor.
Synonyms: Juvenile myelomonocytic leukaemia

Definition: Any structural anomaly of the kidney.
Synonyms: Abnormal kidney morphology, Abnormally shaped kidney, Kidney malformation, Kidney structure issue, Renal malformation, Structural anomalies of the renal tract, Structural kidney abnormalities, Structural renal anomalies

Definition: An abnormal functionality of the kidney.
Synonyms: Abnormal kidney function, Abnormal renal function, Abnormality of renal physiology, Kidney function issue, Renal functional abnormality

Definition: An abnormally increased or reduced amount of fluid filtered out of plasma through glomerular capillary walls into Bowman's capsules per unit of time.
Synonyms: Abnormal GFR

Definition: An abnormal reduction in the volume of fluid filtered out of plasma through glomerular capillary walls into Bowman's capsules per unit of time.
Synonyms: Decreased GFR, Impaired renal creatinine clearance, Reduced creatinine clearance

Definition: An abnormal rise in the volume of water filtered out of plasma through glomerular capillary walls into Bowman's capsules per unit of time.
Synonyms: Increased GFR

Definition: The deposition of calcium phosphate microliths within the seminiferous tubules.

An entrapment neuropathy of the suprascapular nerve, presenting with shoulder weakness confined to the supraspinatus muscle (this muscle initiates shoulder abduction) or to the infraspinatus (this muscle externally rotates the arm), as well as with pain in the posterior part of the shoulder and upper periscapular region.
Synonyms: Suprascapular nerve entrapment

Definition: Increased concentration of porphobilinogen in the urine.

A type of soft tissue sarcoma with a histological appearance reminiscent of alveoli because of its reticulated fibrous stroma enclosing groups of sarcoma cells, which resemble epithelial cells and are enclosed in alveoli walled with connective tissue.
An erythematous eruption commonly associated with drug reactions or infection and characterized by inflammatory nodules that are usually tender, multiple, and bilateral.

The presence of multiple epithelioid cell granulomas consist of highly differentiated mononuclear phagocytes (epithelioid cells and giant cells) and lymphocytes, not exhibiting caseation (a form of necrosis in which the tissue changes into a dry, amorphous mass said to resemble cheese).
A type of blistering that affects the skin of the tibial region.
Synonyms: Pretibial epidermolysis bullosa

Definition: The presence of multiple hemangiomas in the arachnoid.
A breach of the capsule of the spleen.
Synonyms: Ruptured spleen, Splenic rupture

Definition: Persistence of immune complexes in the blood circulation.
Reduced number of primary teeth.
Synonyms: Failure of development of some deciduous teeth, Failure of development of some primary teeth, Partial anodontia of deciduous teeth, Partial anodontia of primary teeth

Definition: The presence of a teratoma in the ovary.
Narrowing of the urethra associated with inflammation or scar tissue.

A type of headache that last hours with continuous pain of mild or moderate intensity, bilateral location, a pressing/tightening (non-pulsating) quality and that is not aggravated by routine physical activity such as walking or climbing stairs.
Synonyms: Tension-type headache

Definition: An increased white blood cell count in the cerebrospinal fluid.
Synonyms: Cerebrospinal fluid pleocytosis, Increased leukocyte count in CSF

Definition: A type of retinal detachment associated with a retinal tear, that is, with a break in the retina that allows fluid to pass from the vitreous space into the subretinal space between the sensory retina and the retinal pigment epithelium.

A type of retinal detachment arising from damage to the outer blood-retinal barrier that allows fluid to access the subretinal space and separate the neurosensory retina from the retinal pigment epithelium.
Synonyms: Serous retinal detachment

Definition: Decreased time between the start of the Q wave and the end of the T wave as measured by the electrocardiogram (EKG).
Blood clot formed within muscle tissue following leakage of blood into the tissue.
Synonyms: IM hematoma, Intramuscular haematoma, Intramuscular haemorrhage, Intramuscular hemorrhage

Definition: Marked decrease in the number of granulocytes.
A type of agranulocytosis related to ingestion of a specific medication.
An increased concentration of chloride in the sweat.
Synonyms: Elevated sweat chloride, Elevated sweat Cl, Elevated sweat Cl-

Definition: An increased concentration of urocanic acid in the urine.
Synonyms: High urine urocanic acid levels

Definition: Increased plasma concentrations of chylomicrons, the large lipid droplet (up to 100 mm in diameter) of reprocessed lipid synthesized in epithelial cells of the small intestine and containing triacylglycerols, cholesterol esters, and several apolipoproteins.
Synonyms: Hyperchylomicronemia, Increased chylomicrons, Increased circulating chylomicron levels

Definition: Absence of transferrin, a protein that transports iron, in the blood.

An abnormal increase in intracellular lipid droplets In a muscle. The number and size of these drops can increase with somd disorders of lipid metabolism affecting muscle. See PMID 20691590 for histological images.
Atrophy of the levator palpebrae superioris, the extraocular muscle that elevates the superior eyelid.
Atrophy of the superior rectus, the extraocular muscle whose primary function is to elevate the globe.
Synonyms: Rectus superior atrophy

Definition: A structural or developmental anomaly of any of the tissues involved in the genital system.
Synonyms: Abnormal genital system morphology

Definition: Anomaly of primary or secondary sexual development or characteristics.
Development of the reproductive system is inconsistent with the chromosomal sex.
Reduced ability to control the movement of the eye associated with damage to the third cranial nerve (the oculomotor nerve).
Anosmia for one particular odor.
Increased time for the PR interval (beginning of the P wave to the beginning of the QRS complex).
Synonyms: Electrocardiographic long PR interval, Lengthened PR interval on EKG

Definition: An electrocardiographic anomaly of the ST segment, which is the segment that connects the QRS complex and the T wave. The ST segment normally has a duration of 80 to 120 ms, is flat and at the same level (isoelectric) as the PR and TP segment.
An electrocardiographic anomaly in which the ST segment is observed to be located inferior to the isoelectric line.
An electrocardiographic anomaly in which the ST segment is observed to be located superior to the isoelectric line.
A structural anomaly of the respiratory system.
Any structural anomaly of the pseudostratified ciliated epithelium that lines much of the conducting portion of the airway, including part of the nasal cavity and larynx, the trachea, and bronchi.
A malignant tumor of the bone which always arises in the medullary tissue, occurring more often in cylindrical bones.
Synonyms: Ewing's sarcoma

Term: Dynein arm defect of respiratory motile cilia
Definition: An anomaly of the dynein arms of motile cilia. This feature is usually appreciated by electron microscopy.

Absence of the outer dynein arms of respiratory motile cilia, which normally are situated outside of the peripheral microtubules of motile cilia. This feature is usually appreciated by electron microscopy.

Absence of the inner dynein arms of respiratory motile cilia, which normally are situated within the peripheral microtubules of motile cilia. This feature is usually appreciated by electron microscopy.

Term: Abnormal axonemal organization of respiratory motile cilia
Definition: Abnormal arrangement of the structures of the axoneme, which is the cytoskeletal structure that forms the inner core of the motile cilium and displays a canonical 9+2 microtubular pattern of motile cilia studded with dynein arms.
Synonyms: Abnormal axonemal organisation of respiratory motile cilia

Term: Absent inner and outer dynein arms
Definition: Complete absence of the dynein arms of respiratory motile cilia, that is, absence of the inner and the outer dynein arms, which normally are situated inside and outside of the peripheral microtubules of motile cilia. This feature is usually appreciated by electron microscopy.

Term: Abnormal central microtubular pair morphology of respiratory motile cilia
Definition: A structural anomaly of the two central microtubules of motile cilia with a 9+2 microtubuluar configuration.
Any functional anomaly of the respiratory motile cilia.

Any anomaly of the normal motility of motile cilia. Evaluation of ciliary beat frequency and ciliary beat pattern requires high-speed videomicroscopy of freshly obtained ciliary biopsies that are maintained in culture media under controlled conditions.

Term: Absent central microtubular pair morphology of respiratory motile cilia
Definition: Absence of the two central microtubules of motile cilia with a 9+2 microtubuluar configuration.
A deviation from the normally well coordinated pattern of intracellular and intercellular synchrony of motile cilia. Dyskinetic cilia usually beat out of synchrony relative to neighboring cilia.
Synonyms: Lack of coordinated beating of respiratory cilia

Definition: A periodic beat-to-beat variation in the amplitude or shape of the T wave in an EKG.

Term: Absent respiratory ciliary axoneme radial spokes
Definition: Absence of the radial spokes of the axoneme of the respiratory cilium.
A liposarcoma that contains myxomatous tissue.
Any anomaly in the amount of glycogen in muscle tissue.
A decreased amount of glycogen in muscle tissue.
Intermittent episodes of increased resistance to the passage of air in the upper airway.
The J wave is a positive convex deflection that occurs at the junction of the QRS complex and ST segment, the J-point.
Synonyms: EKG J waves, Osborne waves

Term: Increased carotid artery intimal medial thickness
Definition: An increase in the combined thickness of the intima and media of the carotid artery.

Term: Autosomal dominant inheritance with paternal imprinting
Definition: A type of autosomal dominant inheritance involving a gene that is imprinted with paternal silencing.

Term: Autosomal dominant inheritance with maternal imprinting
Definition: A type of autosomal dominant inheritance involving a gene that is imprinted with maternal silencing.

Inflammation of the flexor digitorum tendon, often associated with the Kanavel signs: (i) finger held in slight flexion, (ii) fusiform swelling, (iii) tenderness along the flexor tendon sheath, and (iv) pain with passive extension of the digit.
Synonyms: Trigger finger

Definition: An abnormally reduced concentration of glycine in the blood.
Synonyms: Low blood glycine levels

Definition: Any deviation from the normal concentration of serine in the blood circulation.
Reduced concentration of serine in the blood.
Synonyms: Low blood serine levels

Definition: A form of amyloidosis that affects the liver.
Extravasation of chyle into the peritoneal cavity.
Synonyms: Chyloperitoneum

Definition: An exanthema consisting of widespread pink-to-red macules (flat spots of 2-10 mm in diameter) or papules (red bumps) that blanch with pressure. The macules and papules may cluster and merge to form sheets over several days.
Reduced size of the Distal epiphysis of femur.
Synonyms: Small end part of outermost thighbone

Definition: Reduced size of the proximal epiphysis of the tibia.
Synonyms: Small end part of innermost shankbone, Small end part of innermost shinbone

Definition: An abnormal functionality of the hypothalamus.
Any structural anomaly of the hypothalamus.
Synonyms: Abnormal shape of hypothalamus, Abnormality of hypothalamus morphology, Abnormality of the hypothalamus

Definition: Decreased secretion of luteinizing hormone-releasing hormone by the hypothalamus.
A tumor (abnormal growth of tissue) of the head and neck region with origin in the lip, oral cavity, nasal cavity, paranasal sinuses, pharynx, or larynx.
Synonyms: Head and neck tumor, Head and neck tumour

Definition: A tumor (abnormal growth of tissue) of the face.
Synonyms: Face tumor, Face tumour

Definition: A congenital defect with an abnormal joining of the gums of the upper and lower jaw.
Synonyms: Fusion of gums, Fusion of the gingiva, Gingival synechia, Partial fusion of the gums, Synechia of the gums, Upper and lower gums fused together

Definition: An abnormal pigmentation pattern of the external genitalia.
Abnormality of the occipital bone of the skull.
Synonyms: Abnormality of the occipital bone

Definition: Reduced diameter of the middle phalanx of finger.
Synonyms: Slender middle bone of finger

Definition: Reduced diameter of the distal phalanx of finger.
Synonyms: Slender outermost bone of finger

Definition: Reduced diameter of the proximal phalanx of finger.
Synonyms: Slender innermost bone of finger

Definition: Increased length of the middle phalanx of finger.
Synonyms: Long middle bone of finger

Definition: Increased length of the distal phalanx of finger.
Synonyms: Long outermost bone of finger

Definition: Failure of the ureter to undergo development.
