Abnormal transferrin isoform profile consistent with a type II congenital disorder of glycosylation.
Synonyms: Abnormal isoelectric focusing of serum transferrin, type II pattern, Isoelectric focusing of serum transferrin consistent with CDG type II, Type 2 transferrin isoform profile

Definition: Infection of the brain parenchyma with herpes simplex virus, resulting in inflammation of the brain parenchyma with neurologic dysfunction.
Synonyms: Herpes encephalitis

Definition: An anomaly of the arch of aorta.
Synonyms: Abnormality of the aortic arch

Definition: Underdevelopment of the arch of aorta.
Synonyms: Aortic arch hypoplasia, Underdeveloped aortic arch

Term: Coarctation of the descending aortic arch
Definition: Narrowing or constriction of the aorta localized to the region of the descending trunk of arch of aorta.
An anomaly of the process of rib bone formation.
Ribs that are increased in width and taper to the posterior ends.
A reduced level of the complement component C9 in circulation.
Synonyms: Decreased serum C9

Definition: The presence of amyloid deposition in the superficial dermis.

An anomaly in the number of monocytes, which are myeloid mononuclear recirculating leukocyte that can act as a precursor of tissue macrophages, osteoclasts and some populations of tissue dendritic cells.
Synonyms: Abnormal monocyte number

Definition: An increased number of circulating monocytes.
Synonyms: High blood monocyte number

Definition: An decreased number of circulating monocytes.
Synonyms: Low blood monocyte number

Definition: Bony swelling of the distal interphalangeal joint (DIP) associated with the formation of osteophytes (calcific spurs) of the articular (joint) cartilage that are visible radiographically.
Bony swelling of the proximal interphalangeal joint (PIP) associated with the formation of osteophytes (calcific spurs) of the articular (joint) cartilage that are visible radiographically.
A neoplasm containing histiocytes.
Any neoplasm composed of fibrous tissue.
Inflammation of the sacroiliac joint, generally accompanied by lower back pain.
Synonyms: Sacroiliitis

Definition: A distinct type of headache characterized by piercing, throbbing, or electric-shock-like chronic pain in the upper neck, back of the head, and behind the ears, usually on one side.
Lack of skin pigmentation (coloring) of the abdomen.
Lack of skin pigmentation (coloring) of the arms and legs.
An increased concentration of 2-hydroxyglutaric acid in the urine.
Inflammation surrounding hair follicles.
Synonyms: Perifollicular inflammation

Definition: Myoclonus that occurs during the initial phases of sleep.
A leukemia that originates from a myeloid cell, that is the blood forming cells of the bone marrow.
Synonyms: Myeloid leukaemia

Definition: A myelodysplastic/myeloproliferative neoplasm which is characterized by persistent monocytosis, absence of a Philadelphia chromosome and BCR/ABL fusion gene, fewer than 20 percent blasts in the bone marrow and blood, myelodysplasia, and absence of PDGFRA or PDGFRB rearrangement.
Synonyms: Chronic myelomonocytic leukaemia

Definition: An anomaly of the celiac artery.
Synonyms: Abnormal coeliac artery morphology, Abnormality of the celiac artery, Abnormality of the coeliac artery

Definition: Compression of the celiac artery.
Synonyms: Coeliac artery compression

Definition: An odontogenic tumor of the cementum of tooth.
A vascular tumor of the skin and subcutaneous tissues and characterized by slow angiomatous proliferation.
Synonyms: Angioblastoma, Angioblastoma of Nakagawa, Hypertrophic hemangioma, Progressive capillary hemangioma, Tufted hemangioma

Definition: An inflammation of the kidney involving the parenchyma of kidney, the renal pelvis and the kidney calices.
A structural abnormality of the autonomic nervous system.
A functional abnormality of the autonomic nervous system.
Synonyms: Autonomic dysfunction, Autonomic dysregulation, Dysautonomia

Definition: An abnormal regulation of the sweat glands by the sympathetic nervous system associated with abnormal perspiration.
Synonyms: Sudomotor sympathetic dysfunction

Definition: Impairment of bile flow due to obstruction in large bile ducts outside the liver.
An abnormality of the metabolism of folic acid, which is also known as vitamin B9.
An anomaly in the processes involved in the maintenance of an internal equilibrium.
Any anomaly in the utilization of energy (calories).
Synonyms: Abnormal energy expenditure

Definition: An increase in the number of calories used per unit time.
A reduction in the number of calories used per unit time.
A pituitary prolactin cell adenoma of less than 10 mm diameter.
A pituitary prolactin cell adenoma of more than 10 mm diameter.
Abnormally reduced concentration of ferritin, a ubiquitous intracellular protein that stores iron, in the blood.
Synonyms: Decreased plasma ferritin, Decreased serum ferritin, Low ferritin level, Reduced serum ferritin

Definition: Isolated patches of hardened skin (scleroderma).
An anomaly of a glycosylation process, i.e., a process involved in the covalent attachment of a glycosyl residue to a substrate molecule.

An anomaly of a protein glycosylation process, i.e., of a protein modification process that results in the addition of a carbohydrate or carbohydrate derivative unit to a protein amino acid, e.g. the addition of glycan chains to proteins.

An anomaly of protein N-linked glycosylation, i.e., an abnormality of the protein glycosylation process in which a carbohydrate or carbohydrate derivative unit is added to a protein via a nitrogen atom in an amino acid residue in a protein.

Term: Decreased galactosylation of N-linked protein glycosylation
Definition: A reduction in the amount of galactose residues of N-glycans.

Term: Abnormal sialylation of N-linked protein glycosylation
Definition: An anomaly of the addition of sialic acids to N-linked glycans.

Term: Decreased sialylation of N-linked protein glycosylation
Definition: Decreased addition of sialic acids to N-linked glycans.

Term: Increased sialylation of N-linked protein glycosylation
Definition: Increased addition of sialic acids to N-linked glycans.

Term: Abnormal fucosylation of protein N-linked glycosylation
Definition: An anomaly of the addition of fucose sugar units to N-linked glycans.

Term: Decreased fucosylation of N-linked protein glycosylation
Definition: Decreased addition of fucose sugar units to N-linked glycans.

Term: Increased fucosylation of N-linked protein glycosylation
Definition: Increased addition of fucose sugar units to N-linked glycans.

Term: Abnormal mannosylation of N-linked protein glycosylation
Definition: An anomaly of the addition of mannose to N-linked glycans.

Term: Decreased mannosylation of N-linked protein glycosylation
Definition: Reduced addition of mannose to N-linked glycans.

Term: Increased mannosylation of N-linked protein glycosylation
Definition: Increased addition of mannose to N-linked glycans.

An anomaly of protein O-linked glycosylation, i.e., of the process in which a carbohydrate or carbohydrate derivative unit is added to a protein via the hydroxyl group of a serine or threonine residue.

Term: Abnormal fucosylation of O-linked protein glycosylation
Definition: An anomaly of the addition of fucose sugar units to O-linked glycans.

Term: Decreased fucosylation of O-linked protein glycosylation
Definition: A reduction of the addition of fucose sugar units to O-linked glycans.

Term: Increased fucosylation of O-linked protein glycosylation
Definition: Increased addition of fucose sugar units to O-linked glycans.

Term: Abnormal sialylation of O-linked protein glycosylation
Definition: An anomaly of the addition of sialic acids to O-linked glycans.

Term: Decreased sialylation of O-linked protein glycosylation
Definition: An reduced addition of sialic acids to O-linked glycans.
A decreased concentration of potassium(1+) in the urine.
Synonyms: Decreased urinary K, Hypokaliuria, Hypokaluria, Low urine potassium levels

Definition: An abnormally decreased phosphate concentration in the urine.
Synonyms: Low urine phosphate levels

Definition: Projection of the tip of the dens more than 5 mm above a line joining the hard palate to the posterior lip of the foramen magnum (Chamberlain's line) or the tip of the dens is greater than 7 mm above McGregor's line (the back of the hard palate to the lowest point of the occipital squama).
Bony defects situated along the cranial suture lines or at the junction of the bone plates of the skull.
Absence of concavity or convexity of the face when viewed in profile.
Synonyms: Flat face, Flat facial profile, Flat facial shape, Flat facies

Definition: Large or prominent malar surface of the zygomatic bone of the skull, which is convex and forms the prominence of the 'cheek bones'.
Synonyms: Cheekbone prominence, Malar hypertrophy, Prominence of cheekbone, Pronounced cheekbone

Definition: Abnormally anterior positioning of the infraorbital and perialar regions, or increased convexity of the face, or increased nasolabial angle. The midface includes the maxilla, the cheeks, the zygomas, and the infraorbital and perialar regions of the face
Synonyms: Midface hyperplasia, Midfacial excess, Midfacial prominence

Definition: A structural anomaly of the globe of the eye, or bulbus oculi.
Synonyms: Abnormal eye structure, Abnormality of the globe, Abnormally shaped eye

Definition: A functional anomaly of the eye.
Synonyms: Abnormal eye physiology

Definition: Edema (swelling) of the bulbar conjunctiva.
Abnormal smallness of the lens.
Synonyms: Small lens

Definition: Partial or complete loss of vision in one half of the visual field of one or both eyes.
Synonyms: Hemianopsia

Definition: A subjective feeling of tiredness characterized by a lack of energy and motivation.
Synonyms: Fatigue, Tired, Tiredness

Definition: An altered ability of any enzyme or their cofactors to act as catalysts. This term includes changes due to altered levels of an enzyme.
Reduced carnitine O-palmitoyltransferase level, leading to a reduced activity of the reaction: palmitoyl-CoA + L-carnitine = CoA + L-palmitoylcarnitine.
A delay in the development of skills required to feed oneself in the toddler period (between one and three years of age).
Pattern of blood flow in the heart that deviates from the normal circuit of the circulatory system from the left side of the heart to the right.
Pattern of blood flow in the heart that deviates from the normal circuit of the circulatory system from both right side of the heart to the left and vice versa.
Inflammation of the nasal mucosa with nasal congestion.
Synonyms: Nasal inflammation

Definition: The distal interphalangeal joint and/or the proximal interphalangeal joint of the fingers or toes cannot be extended to 180 degrees by either active or passive extension.
Synonyms: Permanent flexion of the finger or toe

Definition: Aplasia of the hallux, that is, a development defect such that the big toe does not develop.
Synonyms: Absent big toe, Agenesis of the halluces, Aplasia of the hallux, Missing big toe

Definition: Inflammation of the large airways in the lung including any part of the bronchi from the primary bronchi to the tertiary bronchi.
Inflammation of the large airways of the lung with rapid onset and short course usually associated with cough, mucus production, shortness of breath, wheezing, and chest tightness.
Muscular hypotonia of one or more limbs.
A small tear in the thin, moist tissue (mucosa) that lines the anus. It appears as a crack or slit in the mucous membrane of the anus.
Reduced intensity of muscle tendon reflexes in the upper limbs. Reflexes are elicited by stretching the tendon of a muscle, e.g., by tapping.
Reduced intensity of muscle tendon reflexes in jaw.
Synonyms: Mandibular hyporeflexia

Definition: An allergy is an immune response or reaction to substances that are usually not harmful.
Synonyms: Allergy

Definition: Allergy to iodine contrast media used in radiological studies.
An allergy experienced at a particular time of year when trees or grasses pollinate and elicit an allergic reaction.
Synonyms: Seasonal allergy

Definition: A motility disorder characterized by biliary colic in the absence of gallstones with a reduced gallbladder ejection fraction.
The presence of atheromas or atherosclerotic plaques in the aorta.
Synonyms: Atherosclerosis of the aorta, Atherosclerotic changes of aorta

Definition: An abnormal accumulation of interstitial fluid in the soft tissues of the limbs.
Synonyms: Peripheral oedema

Definition: A type of ulcer that is caused when an area of skin is subject to pressure over a prolonged period of time, ranging in range in severity from patches of discolored skin to open wounds that expose the underlying bone or muscle. The most common sites are the sacrum, coccyx, heels and the hips.
Synonyms: Bedsore, Decubitus Ulcer, Pressure Sore, Pressure ulcer

Definition: An abnormal concentration of aldolase in the serum. Aldolase is an enzyme responsible for converting fructose 1,6-bisphosphate into the triose phosphates dihydroxyacetone phosphate and glyceraldehyde 3-phosphate.
A deviation from normal of the concentration of 2-oxoglutaric acid in the urine.
Synonyms: Abnormal urinary 2-oxoglutarate level, Abnormality of urine alpha ketoglutarate concentration

Definition: A greater than normal concentration of 2-oxoglutaric acid in the urine.
Synonyms: Elevated urinary 2-oxoglutarate, Increased urine alpha-ketoglutarate concentration

Definition: A lower than normal concentration of 2-oxoglutaric acid in the urine.
Synonyms: Decreased urinary 2-oxoglutarate

Definition: A deviation from normal of the concentration of citrate(3-) in the urine.
Synonyms: Abnormal urine citrate concentration, Abnormal urine citric acid concentration

Definition: A lower than normal concentration of citrate(3-) in the urine.
Synonyms: Decreased urine citrate concentration

Definition: A greater than normal concentration of citrate(3-) in the urine.
Synonyms: Increased urine citrate concentration

Definition: A type of spastic paraparetic gait in which the muscle tone in the adductors is marked. It is characterized by hypertonia and flexion in the legs, hips and pelvis accompanied by extreme adduction leading to the knees and thighs hitting, or sometimes even crossing, in a scissors-like movement. The opposing muscles (abductors) become comparatively weak from lack of use.
Synonyms: Scissor gait, Scissor walk, Scissors gait

Definition: The deposition of calcium salts in the parenchyma of the renal medulla (innermost part of the kidney).
The deposition of calcium salts in the parenchyma of the renal cortex (the outer portion of the kidney between the renal capsule and the renal medulla).

A type of anemia resulting from suppression of erythropoiesis with little or no abnormality of leukocyte or platelet production. Erythroblasts are virtually absent in bone marrow; however, leukocyte and platelet production show little or no reduction.
Synonyms: Red cell aplasia

Definition: The onset of growth of pubic hair at an earlier age than normal.
Synonyms: Premature pubic hair growth

Definition: Onset of adrenarche at an earlier age than usual.
The presence of a V-shaped indentation (notch) in the primary central incisor.
Synonyms: Notched front baby tooth, Notched front deciduous tooth, Notched front primary tooth, Syphilitic primary incisor

Definition: Wasting or decrease in size of all or part of the duodenum.
An abnormality of the partial pressure of oxygen or carbon dioxide in the arterial blood.
Synonyms: Abnormal blood gas level

Definition: Abnormally elevated blood carbon dioxide (CO2) level.
Synonyms: High blood carbon dioxide level, Hypercarbia

Definition: Abnormally reduced blood carbon dioxide (CO2) level.
Synonyms: Hypocarbia, Reduced carbon dioxide in the blood

Definition: An abnormally low level of blood oxygen.
Synonyms: Low blood oxygen level

Definition: An abnormally high level of blood oxygen.
Amniotic fluid containing the earliest stools of a mammalian infant.
Synonyms: Meconium staining of amniotic fluid, Meconium-stained amniotic fluid

Definition: Congenital lack of the skin of prepuce of penis, that is, of the double-layered fold of skin and mucous membrane that covers the glans penis.
Synonyms: Absent foreskin, Aposthia

Definition: Overgrowth of the choroid plexus.
Synonyms: Choroid plexus hypertrophy

Definition: The inability of the colon to modify stool to an acceptable consistency and move the stool from the cecum to the rectosigmoid area at least once every three days.
An inflammation of the choroid and retina.
An ulcer of the colon due to pressure and irritation from retained fecal masses.

Optic disc drusen are acellular, calcified deposits within the optic nerve head. Optic disc drusen are congenital and developmental anomalies of the optic nerve head, representing hyaline-containing bodies that, over time, appear as elevated, lumpy irregularities on the anterior portion of the optic nerve.
Synonyms: Optic nerve head drusen

Definition: An increased degree of femoral version, which is defined as the angular difference between axis of femoral neck and transcondylar axis of the knee. Thus, femoral anteversion is an inward twisting of the femur that causes the knees and feet to turn inward.
Synonyms: Excessive femoral anteversion, Increased femoral neck anteversion, Internally rotated hips

Definition: Protruding heel bone, or calcaneus.
Synonyms: Prominent heel bone

Term: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the cerebral white matter
Definition: Absence or underdevelopment of the cerebral white matter.
Synonyms: Absent/small cerebral white matter, Absent/underdeveloped cerebral white matter

Definition: Underdevelopment of the cerebral white matter.
Intermittent and recurrent bouts of a subjective feeling of tiredness characterized by a lack of energy and motivation.
Subjective feeling of tiredness characterized by a lack of energy and motivation that persists for six months or longer.
Synonyms: Chronic extreme exhaustion, Chronic fatigue

Definition: An abnormality of actions or reactions of a person taking place during interactions with others.
Synonyms: Abnormal social behavior, Abnormal social behaviour

Definition: A failure to meet one or more age-related milestones of social behavior.
Synonyms: Delayed social development

Definition: Reduction in length of the ventral (lower) skin of prepuce of penis.
Coronary disease that has not progressed to the point of causing significant occlusion (blockage) of the coronary arteries.
Synonyms: Non-occlusive coronary artery disease

Definition: A structural anomaly of the gallbladder.
Synonyms: Abnormal gallbladder structure, Abnormal shape of gallbladder

Definition: A functional anomaly of the gallbladder.
A functional abnormality of the biliary tree.
A structural abnormality of the biliary tree.
Synonyms: Anomaly of the biliary tract

Definition: Reduced motility through the sphincter of Oddi, resulting in impedance of bile and pancreatic juice flow from the common bile duct into the duodenum.
Reduced motility of the gallbladder with reduced emptying fraction.
A structural abnormality of the brain, which has as its parts the forebrain, midbrain, and hindbrain.
Synonyms: Abnormal shape of brain, Abnormality of the brain

Definition: Partial or complete wasting (loss) of brain tissue that was once present.
Synonyms: Brain degeneration, Brain wasting

Definition: A reduced concentration of 5-methyltetrahydrofolate(2-) in the cerebrospinal fluid (CSF). 5-methyltetrahydrofolate is the active folate metabolite.
Synonyms: Low CSF 5-methyltetrahydrofolate, Reduced CSF 5-methyltetrahydrofolate concentration

Definition: Any anomaly in the process by which myelin sheaths are formed and maintained around neurons.
Delayed myelination.
Inflammation of the synovial membrane of the sacroiliac joint.
Constipation for longer than three months with fewer than 3 bowel movements per week, straining, lumpy or hard stools, and a sensation of anorectal obstruction or incomplete defecation.
Synonyms: Chronic constipation, Infrequent bowel movements

Definition: Constipation of sudden onset and lasting for less than three months.
A feeling of uneasiness and restlessness in the legs after going to bed (sometimes causing insomnia).
A chronic loss of wrist joint motion on the right and left sides.
A chronic loss of wrist joint motion on one side only.
Calcification, that is, pathological deposition of calcium salts in the tunica media of arteries.
Calcification, that is, pathological deposition of calcium salts in the tunica media of medium-sized (muscular or distributive) arteries.
Calcification, that is, pathological deposition of calcium salts in the tunica media of small arteries.
A headache disorder that occurs exclusively at night, waking the affected individual from sleep.
Synonyms: Alarm clock headache

Definition: A structural anomaly of the inferior portion of the vermis of cerebellum.
The presence of bacteria in the urine.
Synonyms: Bacteria in urine, High urine bacteria

Definition: Involuntary and irregular twitches of the chin.
Synonyms: Geniospasm

Definition: An above normal level of saturation of serum transferrin with iron.
A below normal level of saturation of serum transferrin with iron.
An increased level of iron in liver tissues.
Synonyms: Increased iron concentration in liver, Increased liver iron level

Definition: Longstanding impairment in ventilation such that the partial pressure of carbon dioxide (PaCO2) is elevated above the upper limit of the reference range (more than 45 mm Hg), with a normal or near-normal pH secondary to renal compensation and an elevated serum bicarbonate levels (more than30 mEq/L).

Sudden onset of impairment in ventilation such that the removal of carbon dioxide by the respiratory system is less than the production of carbon dioxide in the tissues, leading to an elevation of the partial pressure of carbon dioxide (PaCO2) above the normal limits (more than 45 mm Hg) with an accompanying acidemia (pH less than 7.35).
Longstanding abnormal acid accumulation or depletion of base.
Infantile spasms represent a subset of "epileptic spasms". Infantile Spasms are epileptic spasms starting in the first year of life (infancy).

An ophthalmologic sign in young children resulting from upward-gaze paresis. In this condition, the eyes appear driven downward, the sclera may be seen between the upper eyelid and the iris, and part of the lower pupil may be covered by the lower eyelid.
Synonyms: Setting-sun eye phenomenon, Sun setting eyes, Sunsetting eye

Definition: Increased width of the skin of vermilion border region of upper lip.
Synonyms: Full lips, Increased volume of lip, Increased volume of lip vermillion, Plump lips, Prominent lips, Thick lips

Definition: A turning outward of the lip or lips, that is, eversion of the lips.
Synonyms: Eclabium, Everted lips, Outward turned lips

Definition: Wasting of the tongue.
Synonyms: Atrophy of the tongue, Lingual atrophy, Lingual wasting, Wasting of the tongue

Definition: Complete obstruction of a carotid artery.
Synonyms: Obstructed carotid artery

Term: Decreased circulating level of specific antibody
Definition: The presence of normal overall immunoglobulin levels with deficiency of specific immunoglobulins directed against a specific antigen or microorganism.
Synonyms: Abnormal specific antibody response, Decreased specific antibody in blood, Specific antibody deficiency

Definition: The presence of normal overall immunoglobulin levels with deficiency of specific immunoglobulins directed against pneumococci.
Synonyms: Low pneumococcal antibody titer, Specific pneumococcal antibody deficiency

Definition: A wavering, unsteady voice that reflects involuntary and approximately sinusoidal oscillation of motor unit firings of laryngeal muscles. Vocal tremor results in low frequency modulations of voice frequency or amplitude and intermittent voice instability.
Synonyms: Shakey voice, Vocal tremor

Definition: Bony fusion of the mandibular condyle to the base of the skull, resulting in limitation of jaw opening.
Synonyms: Ankylosis of temporomandibular joint, Freezing of jaw joint, Freezing of the temporomandibular joint, Rigidity of the temporomandibular joint, Temporomandibular joint fusion

Definition: Noises from the temporomandibular joint during mandibular movement (e.g., chewing). Temporomandibular joint crepitus is often described as a clicking, popping, grating sound.
Synonyms: Jaw joint crepitus

Definition: An anomaly of cerebral veins.
Synonyms: Abnormality of cerebral veins

Definition: A congenital malformation of veins which drain normal brain characterized by a caput medusae or an umbrellalike convergence of multiple venules on a single, or occasionally multiple, enlarged parenchymal or medullary vein, like the trunk of a tree or the shank of an umbrella. This dilated terminal vein penetrates the cortex to drain either (a) superficially to cortical veins or sinuses, (b) deeply to subependymal veins of the lateral ventricle and then into the galenic system, (c) to the fourth ventricle and then to the pontomesencephalic vein, or (d) to the precentral cerebellar vein and into the galenic system.
Synonyms: Developmental Venous Anomaly

Definition: A venous angioma of the frontal lobe of the brain.
Defective structure, size or content of alpha granules, platelet organelles that contain several growth factors destined for release during platelet activation at sites of vessel wall injury.

Defective structure, size or content of dense granules, platelet organelles that contain granules proaggregatory factors such as adenosine diphosphate (ADP), adenosine triphosphate (ATP), ionized calcium, histamine and serotonin.

An anomaly of the invaginations of the surface membrane that form the open canalicular system (OCS). The OCS serve as the pathway for transport of substances into the cells and as conduits for the discharge of alpha granule products secreted during the platelet release reaction.
Inflammation of the spinal cord.
Synonyms: Inflammation of spinal cord

Definition: An arachnoid cyst located at the margin of the cerebellum and pons.
An arachnoid cyst located within the ventricular system.

An arachnoid cyst that progressively enlarges from an abnormality in the membrane of Liliequist or in the interpeduncular cistern, and typically, expands from the prepontine space, displacing the floor of the third ventricle upwards, the pituitary stalk and optic chiasm upwards and forwards, and the mammillary bodies upwards and backwards.
Inflammation of adipose tissue.
Synonyms: Inflammation of adipose tissue, Inflammation of fat tissue

Definition: An anomaly of the intracellular membrane complexes known as the dense tubular system.
Narrowing or constriction of the inner surface (lumen) of a cerebral artery.
Synonyms: Narrowing of a cerebral artery

Definition: Narrowing or constriction of the inner surface (lumen) of the middle cerebral artery.
Narrowing or constriction of the inner surface (lumen) of the anterior cerebral artery.
Narrowing or constriction of the inner surface (lumen) of the posterior cerebral artery.
A decrease in the maximum amount of negative pressure a person can generate during an inhalation.
A decrease in the maximum amount of pressure of expired air achieved by a person after a full inspiration.
A complication of pregnancy and delivery in which the umbilical cord wraps around the fetal neck once or multiple times.

A separation of the layers within the wall of the descending aorta. Tears in the intimal layer result in the propagation of dissection (proximally or distally) secondary to blood entering the intima-media space.
Synonyms: Type B aortic dissection

Definition: A wartlike (with multiple small elevated projections) papule.
Synonyms: Papillomatous papule

Definition: An anomaly of the white matter of brainstem.
Synonyms: Abnormality of the brainstem white matter

Definition: An anomaly of the internal capsule, which is an area of white matter in the brain that separates the caudate nucleus and the thalamus from the putamen and the globus pallidus.
An anomaly of the pituitary gland.
Synonyms: disorder of pituitary gland

Definition: A deviation from the normal size of the pituitary gland.
An abnormally increased size of the pituitary gland.
An abnormally decreased size of the pituitary gland.
Reduced strength of the orbicularis oculi, the circumorbital muscle in the face that closes the eyelid.
Synonyms: Weakness of orbicularis oculi muscles

Definition: A visual anomaly in which images appear distorted. A grid of straight lines appears wavy and parts of the grid may appear blank.
An abnormally decreased amount of thyroxin-binding globulin (TBG) in blood. TBG is responsible for carrying the thyroid hormones thyroxine (T4) and 3,5,3'-triiodothyronine (T3) in the bloodstream.
An increased amount of cerebrospinal fluid (CSF) in the subarachnoid space.
Synonyms: Extra-axial CSF accumulation

Definition: A pale yellow discoloration of the temporal (lateral) portion of the optic disc.
A pale yellow discoloration of the entire optic disc.
An unpleasant sensation characterized by physical discomfort (such as pricking, throbbing, or aching) localized to the arm.
Synonyms: Upper limb pain

Definition: An unpleasant sensation characterized by physical discomfort (such as pricking, throbbing, or aching) localized to the leg.
Synonyms: Leg pain, Lower limb pain

Definition: Reduced ability to flex the femur, that is, to pull the knee upward.

Term: Tetralogy of Fallot with pulmonary atresia
Definition: An extreme form of tetralogy of Fallot characterized by absence of flow from the right ventricle to the pulmonary arteries.
An abnormally decreased amount of catalase level.
An anomaly of the circle of Willis, also known as the cerebral arterial circle.
Synonyms: Abnormality of the cerebral arterial circle

Definition: Underdeveloped posterior communicating artery.

Increased dimensions of the Virchow-Robin spaces (also known as perivascular spaces), which surround the walls of vessels as they course from the subarachnoid space through the brain parenchyma. Perivascular spaces are commonly microscopic, and not visible on conventional neuroimaging. This term refers to an increase of size of these spaces such that they are visible on neuroimaging (usually magnetic resonance imaging). The dilatations are regular cavities that always contain a patent artery.
Synonyms: Dilated Virchow-Robin spaces, Perivascular spaces

Definition: Congenital absence of the optic nerve.
Synonyms: Absent optic nerve, Aplastic optic nerve

Definition: A form of telangiectasis characterized by a central elevated red dot the size of a pinhead, representing an arteriole, with numerous small blood vessels that radiate out thereby resembling the legs of a spider. Characteristically, compression of the central arteriole causes the entire lesion to blanch, and the lesion quickly refills once the compression is released.

Reluctance or refusal of a child to be breastfed or eat, manifested as gagging, vomiting, turning head away from food, or avoidance of sensation in or around the mouth (i.e. toothbrushing or face-washing).
A deviation from the normal discoid platelet shape.
An anomalous location and arrangement of platelet alpha granules.
A lack of platelet alpha granules. This typically results in the grey appearance of platelets in giemsa stained blood smears.
Synonyms: Gray platelets, Grey platelets

Definition: A deviation from the normal contents of the platelet alpha granules, which normally contain hemostatic proteins such as fibrinogen, von Willebrand factor, and growth factors such as platelet-derived growth factor.
A deviation from the normal count of alpha granules per thrombocyte.

A deviation from the normal contents of the platelet alpha granules, which normally contain adenosine triphosphate (ATP), adenosine diphosphate (ADP), serotonin, calcium, and pyrophosphate, which are secreted when platelets are activated.
A deviation from the normal count of dense granules per thrombocyte.
An unpleasant sensory and emotional experience associated with actual or potential tissue damage, or described in terms of such damage.
Synonyms: Pain

Definition: Persistent pain, usually defined as pain that has lasted longer than 3 to 6 months.
Synonyms: Chronic pain, Long-lasting pain

Definition: Pain due to a stimulus that does not normally provoke pain.

Painful sensations elicited by a nonpainful cutaneous stimulus such as a light touch or gentle stroking over affected areas of the body. Sometimes referred to as hyperpathia or hyperalgesia. Often perceived as an intense burning, dyesthesias may outlast the stimulus by several seconds.
Synonyms: Dysaesthesia, Hyperalgesia, Hyperpathia

Definition: An anomaly in the communication from a neuron to a target across a synapse. This is a four step process, comprising (i) synthesis and storage of neurotransmitters; (ii) neurotransmitter release; (iii) activation of postsynaptic receptors by the neurotransmitter; and (iv) inactivation of the neurotransmitter. Thus, this term is defined as an anomaly of neurotransmitter metabolic process.
Synonyms: Abnormality of neurotransmitter metabolism

Definition: The presence of circulating autoantibodies to anticardiolipin in the mother.
A detrimental reaction to a food, beverage, food additive, or compound found in foods that produces symptoms in one or more body organs and systems that is not mediated by an immune reaction.
Synonyms: Food intolerance, Non-allergic food hypersensitivity

Definition: A detrimental reaction to the presence of gluten in food, which may include abdominal pain, fatigue, headaches and paresthesia, or celiac disease.
Synonyms: Gluten intolerance, Gluten sensitivity

Definition: A type of lymphoma characterized microscopically by the absence of multinucleated Reed-Sternberg cells.
An epidermoid cyst in the armpit.
Synonyms: Armpit cyst

Definition: Hemorrhage between the skull and periosteum of a newborn resulting from rupture of blood vessels that cross the periosteum.
Synonyms: Cephalohaematoma

Definition: Thickened nails without deformity.
The presence of hemosiderin in the urine.
An increased concentration of fructose 1,6-bisphosphate aldolase in the serum.
An decreased concentration of fructose 1,6-bisphosphate aldolase in the serum.
A deviation from equal (50%) inactivation of each parental X chromosome in maternal cells.
Anomalous movements of the eyes that occur without the subject wanting them to happen.
Muscle fibers degeneration resulting in fatty replacement of skeletal muscle fibers
Synonyms: Skeletal muscle fatty infiltration

Definition: A lipoma (a benign tumor composed of adipose tissue) located in the conjunctiva.
The presence of varices (enlarged and convoluted blood vessels) in the colon.
Lack of specific granules in neutrophils.
Presence of an elevated number of projections from nuclei of neutrophils. These projections can have the shape of hooks, tags, or clubs.
A thumbnail that is diminished in length and width, i.e., underdeveloped thumb nail.
Synonyms: Small thumbnail, Underdeveloped thumbnail

Definition: Absence of thumb nail.
Absent nail of big toe.
Synonyms: Absent big toe nail, Absent nail of big toe

Definition: Increased concentration of beta-alanine in the blood.
Synonyms: High blood beta-alanine levels, Hyperbetaalaninemia

Term: EEG with centrotemporal focal spike waves
Definition: EEG with focal sharp transient waves in the centrotemporal region of the brain (also known as the central sulcus), i.e., focal sharp waves of a duration less than 80 msec followed by a slow wave.
A ratio of serum triiodothyronine (T3) to thyroxine (T4) in the blood that deviates from normal.
A ratio of serum triiodothyronine (T3) to thyroxine (T4) in the blood that is higher than normal.
A ratio of serum triiodothyronine (T3) to thyroxine (T4) in the blood that is lower than normal.
The presence of an aortic valve with one instead of the normal three cusps (flaps).

Stop of growth at the epiphyseal plate the hyaline cartilage plate in the metaphysis at one or more long bones in the hand, at an earlier than normal age, resulting in growth arrest and shortening of the involved bone.

Stop of growth at the epiphyseal plate the hyaline cartilage plate in the metaphysis at one or more long bones in the foot, at an earlier than normal age, resulting in growth arrest and shortening of the involved bone.

Stop of growth at the epiphyseal plate the hyaline cartilage plate in the metaphysis at one or more long bones in the tibia, at an earlier than normal age, resulting in growth arrest and shortening of the involved bone.

Stop of growth at the epiphyseal plate the hyaline cartilage plate in the metaphysis at one or more long bones in the fibula, at an earlier than normal age, resulting in growth arrest and shortening of the involved bone.

Stop of growth at the epiphyseal plate the hyaline cartilage plate in the metaphysis at one or more long bones in the radius, at an earlier than normal age, resulting in growth arrest and shortening of the involved bone.

Stop of growth at the epiphyseal plate the hyaline cartilage plate in the metaphysis at one or more long bones in the ulna, at an earlier than normal age, resulting in growth arrest and shortening of the involved bone.
Edema in the region of the Lower eyelid.
Synonyms: Cellulitis of lower eyelid, Fullness of lower eyelid, Lower eyelid oedema, Puffiness of lower eyelid, Swelling of lower eyelid

Definition: First period after the age of 15 years.
Synonyms: Delayed start of first period

Definition: A type of mesenchymal tissue cell tumor that exhibits epithelial differentiation, which most frequently arises in the extremities.
Synonyms: Malignant synovioma

Definition: A partial duplication of the ureter where the duplicated ureters fuse to a single ureter before their insertion into the bladder.
Synonyms: Partially duplicated ureter

Definition: A complete duplication of the ureter, where the duplicated ureters have separate insertions into the bladder.

A type of proximal renal tubulopathy characterized by resorption defects leading to glycosuria, aminoaciduria, tubular proteinuria, renal hypophosphatemia, and urate tubular hyporeabsorption with bicarbonate loss and resulting acidosis.

Increased numbers of mesangial cells per glomerulus, defined as more than 3 nuclei fully surrounded by matrix in one or more mesangial areas, not including perihilar region, on a standard 3-micron-thick tissue section, best evaluated on periodic acid-Schiff (PAS) stain.
Synonyms: Mesangial proliferation

Definition: A structural anomaly of the nephron.
Synonyms: Abnormality of the nephron

Definition: The presence of complement 3 deposits in the glomerulus.
Synonyms: Renal C3 deposition

Definition: Decreased thickness of the glomerular basement membrane (GBM), measured from endothelial to visceral epithelial plasma membrane and mainly attributable to a decrease in thickness of the lamina densa, generally to an overall thickness more than 2 standard deviations less than that of the normal mean GBM thickness for health age- and sex matched individuals. May be focal or diffuse, although the term thin GBMs generally implies thinning of over 50% of GBMs.
A type of glomerulonephropathy characterized by thickening of the basement membrane and deposition of immune complexes in the subepithelial space.
Synonyms: Membranous glomerulonephritis

Definition: The presence of minimal changes visible by light microscopy but flattened and fused podocyte foot processes on electron microscopy in a person with nephrotic range proteinuria.
Synonyms: Minimal change disease, Minimal change nephropathy

Definition: The presence of calcium- and phosphate-containing calculi (stones) in the kidneys.
Synonyms: Ca phosphate nephrolithiasis, Ca phosphate urolithiasis, Ca2+ phosphate nephrolitiasis, Ca2+ phosphate urolithiasis

Definition: An isolated cyst of the kidney.
Synonyms: Simple kidney cyst, single cortical cyst, Solitary renal cyst

Definition: A bilateral form of developmental dysplasia of the kidney.
One sided hypoplasia of the kidney.
Synonyms: Small kidney on one side, Underdeveloped kidney on one side

Definition: Two sided hypoplasia of the kidney.
Atrophy of the kidney.
Synonyms: Kidney degeneration

Definition: A two-sided form of atrophy of the kidney.
Synonyms: Bilateral kidney degeneration

Definition: Hematuria that is visible upon inspection of the urine.
Synonyms: Bloody urine, Gross hematuria

Definition: A form of nephrotic syndrome that does not respond to treatment with steroid medication, defined as persistent proteinuria despite 60mg/m2 or 2mg/kg for 8 weeks, after insuring no infection or non-adherence to medication.
Synonyms: SRNS

Definition: A form of nephrotic syndrome that does not respond to any immunosuppresive treatment.
An abnormal amount of urine production.
An abnormality in the concentration of electrolytes in the urine.
Synonyms: Urinary electrolyte imbalance

Definition: Increased concentration of albumin in the urine.
Severely increased amount of excretion of protein in the urine, defined as 3.5 grams per day or more in adults and 40 mg per meter-squared body surface area per hour in children.
The presence of moderately increased concentrations of albumin in the urine, defined as and albumin-creatinine ratio (ACR) of 30 to 299 mg/gm (3.4 to 34 mg/mmol).
Synonyms: High urine albumin levels, Microalbuminuria

Definition: Mildly increased levels of protein in the urine (150-500 mg per day in adults).
Moderately increased levels of protein in the urine (500-1000 mg per day in adults).
Severely increased levels of protein in the urine (1000-3000 mg per day in adults).
Synonyms: Severly high blood protein levels

Definition: An abnormal concentration of potassium(1+) in the urine.
Synonyms: Abnormal urine K concentration

Definition: An abnormal phosphate concentration in the urine.
An abnormal concentration of chloride in the urine.
Synonyms: Abnormal urine Cl concentration, Abnormal urine Cl- concentration

Definition: An decreased concentration of chloride in the urine.
Synonyms: Decreased urinary chloride, Low urine chloride levels

Definition: High urine chloride in the presence of hypochloridemia.
Synonyms: Kidney chloride wasting, Renal Cl wasting, Renal Cl- wasting

Definition: An abnormal concentration of sodium in the urine.
Synonyms: Abnormal urine Na concentration, Abnormal urine Na+ levels

Definition: An abnormally decreased sodium concentration in the urine.
Synonyms: Low urine sodium levels

Definition: An increased concentration of sodium(1+) in the urine.
Synonyms: Increased urinary sodium

Definition: An abnormally increased sodium concentration in the urine in the presence of hyponatremia.
Synonyms: Kidney sodium wasting, Renal Na wasting, Renal Na+ wasting

Definition: An abnormal concentration of magnesium the urine.
Synonyms: Abnormal urine magnesium concentration

Definition: An increased concentration of magnesium the urine.
An decreased concentration of magnesium the urine.
Synonyms: Decreased urine magnesium, Low urine magnesium levels

Term: Abnormality of urinary uric acid level
Definition: Abnormal amount of urate in the urine.
Abnormal concentration of sulfate in the urine.
Synonyms: Abnormal urinary sulphate concentration

Definition: Elevated concentration of SO4(2-), i.e., sulfate, in the urine.
Synonyms: Increased urinary sulphate

Definition: An anomalous finding in the examination of the urine for cells.
The presence of renal casts (cylindrical, cigar-shaped structures produced by the kidney in certain disease states) in the urine.
Synonyms: Urinary casts

Definition: Presence of leukocyte casts (cylindrical structures produced by the kidney in certain disease states) in the urine.
Synonyms: White blood cell casts

Definition: Presence of erythrocyte casts (cylindrical structures produced by the kidney in certain disease states) in the urine.
Synonyms: Red blood cell casts, Urinary erythrocyte cast

Definition: A cyst located along the allantois canal.
Presence of a many diverticula (sac or pouch) in the wall of the urinary bladder.
Synonyms: Multiple pouches in bladder wall

Definition: A developmental anomaly associated with the failure of rectum, vagina, and bladder to separate.
Developmental anomaly in which the vagina, bladder, and rectum fuse resulting in a common channel.
Synonyms: Cloacogenic bladder

Definition: Functional anomaly of the kidney persisting for at least three months.
Synonyms: Chronic kidney disease

Definition: A type of chronic kidney disease with normal or increased glomerular filtration rate (GFR at least 90 mL/min/1.73 m2).
A type of chronic kidney disease with mildly reduced glomerular filtration rate (GFR 60-89 mL/min/1.73 m2).
A type of chronic kidney disease with moderately reduced glomerular filtration rate (GFR 30-59 mL/min/1.73 m2).
A type of chronic kidney disease with severely reduced glomerular filtration rate (GFR 15-29 mL/min/1.73 m2).
Synonyms: Stage 4 chronic kidney disease

Definition: Deposition of fibrillar material that can be found on all anterior segment structures bathed by aqueous humor.

Term: Abnormal suspensory ligament of lens morphology
Definition: An anomaly of the suspensory ligament of lens, also known as the ciliary zonule. These ligaments represent a series of fibers connecting the ciliary body and lens of the eye, holding the lens in place.
Synonyms: Abnormality of the suspensory ligament of lens, Abnormality of zinn's membrane, Ciliary zonule abnormality, Zonule of zinn abnormality

Definition: Tremulousness (trembling) of the lens of the eye.
Synonyms: Phacodonesis, Trembling eye lens

Definition: An anomaly of the trabecular meshwork, which is the porelike structure surrounding the entire circumference of the anterior chamber at the base of the cornea and near the ciliary body. The trabecular mesh work is responsible for draining the aqueous humor into the canal of Schlemm.
Synonyms: Abnormality of the trabecular meshwork

Term: Pigment deposition in the trabecular meshwork
Definition: Accumulation of abnormal amounts of pigment within the trabecular meshwork.
An anomaly in the amount of force per unit area exerted by the intraocular fluid within the eye.
Synonyms: Abnormal eye pressure, Abnormal intraocular pressure

Definition: A difference in the amount of intraocular pressure in the right and left eye.
Shedding of the pigment granules that normally adhere to the back of the iris into the aqueous humor.
Reduction in the amount of blood flow to the iris.
Blockage of the retinal vein.
High urine calcium in the presence of hypocalcemia.
Synonyms: Kidney Ca wasting, Kidney Ca2+ wasting, Kidney calcium wasting, Renal Ca wasting, Renal Ca2+ wasting

Definition: A functional anomaly of the nervous system.
Synonyms: Abnormality of nervous system physiology

Definition: A structural anomaly of the nervous system.
Synonyms: Abnormal shape of nervous system, Abnormality of nervous system morphology

Definition: A deviation from the norm of the intracranial pressure.
A reduction of the pressure inside the cranium (skull) and thereby in the brain tissue and cerebrospinal fluid.
Synonyms: Intracranial hypotension

Definition: Cerebellar agenesis is defined by the near complete absence of cerebellar tissue with only remnants of the anterior vermis, flocculus, and/or middle cerebellar peduncles.
Decreased amount of pigmentation in the fovea centralis.
An elevated concentration of lactate in the caudate nucleus. This finding can be elicited by magnetic resonance spectroscopy imaging.
Increase in size of a peripheral nerve. This finding can be appreciated by palpation along the axis of the nerve.

A testis that is located at the upper scrotum or lower inguinal canal and that can be made to descend completely into the scrotum without resistance by manual reduction but returns to its original position by the cremasteric reflex.
Synonyms: Retractile testicle

Definition: Any anomaly of the inflammatory response, a response to injury or infection characterized by local vasodilation, extravasation of plasma into intercellular spaces and accumulation of white blood cells and macrophages.
Synonyms: Abnormal inflammatory response

Definition: An abnormal reduction in the inflammatory response to injury or infection.
Synonyms: Decreased inflammatory response

Definition: A abnormal increase in the inflammatory response to injury or infection.

Polymicrogyria (an excessive number of small gyri or convolutions) that is maximal in perisylvian regions (the regions that surround the Sylvian fissures), which may be symmetric or asymmetric and may extend beyond perisylvian regions. The Sylvian fissures often extend posteriorly and superiorly.
Synonyms: Frontoparietal polymicrogyria

Definition: A severe form of gait ataxia such that an affected person cannot walk at all.
Asthma attacks following exercise.
Synonyms: Exercise-induced asthma

Definition: Severe asthma unresponsive to repeated courses of beta-agonist therapy such as inhaled albuterol, levalbuterol, or subcutaneous epinephrine.
Synonyms: Acute severe asthma

Definition: Abnormal concentration of dopamine in the cerebrospinal fluid (CSF).
Synonyms: Abnormal CSF dopamine level

Definition: Increased concentration of dopamine in the cerebrospinal fluid (CSF).
Decreased concentration of dopamine in the cerebrospinal fluid (CSF).

A functional brain anomaly detectable by positron emission tomography (PET). PET scanning is a method for functional brain imaging, and its measurements reflect the amount of brain activity in the various regions of the brain.
Synonyms: Abnormal brain PET scan

Term: Abnormal brain FDG positron emission tomography
Definition: An anomaly detectable in [18F]-fluorodeoxyglucose (FDG) positron emission tomography (PET) brain scans. Glucose uptake measured with FDG-PET is a marker of neuronal metabolic activity.
Synonyms: Abnormal brain FDG PET scan

Definition: Reduced uptake of [18F]-fluorodeoxyglucose (FDG) in the prefrontal cortex as measured by positron emission tomography (PET) brain scan.
Reduced uptake of [18F]-fluorodeoxyglucose (FDG) in the thalamus as measured by positron emission tomography (PET) brain scan.
Reduced uptake of [18F]-fluorodeoxyglucose (FDG) in the hypothalamus as measured by positron emission tomography (PET) brain scan.
Reduced uptake of [18F]-fluorodeoxyglucose (FDG) in the parietal cortex as measured by positron emission tomography (PET) brain scan.

Term: Mildly reduced left ventricular ejection fraction
Definition: A small reduction in the fraction of blood pumped from the left ventricle with each cardiac cycle. The normal range in adults is at least 50 percent, and a mild reduction is defined as 40-49 percent.
Synonyms: Mildly reduced ejection fraction

Definition: A diminution of the volumetric fraction of blood pumped out of the ventricle with each cardiac cycle.
Synonyms: Reduced ejection fraction

Term: Moderately reduced left ventricular ejection fraction
Definition: A medium reduction in the fraction of blood pumped from the left ventricle with each cardiac cycle, defined as a left ventricular ejection fraction of 30-39 percent.
Synonyms: Moderately reduced ejection fraction

Term: Severely reduced left ventricular ejection fraction
Definition: A large reduction in the fraction of blood pumped from the left ventricle with each cardiac cycle. The normal range in adults is at over 50 percent, and a severe reduction is defined as less than 30 percent.
Synonyms: Severely reduced ejection fraction

Term: Regional left ventricular wall motion abnormality
Definition: An abnormal motion of a segment of the left ventricle during the cardiac cycle.

Synonyms: Neurocardiogenic syncope, Reflex syncope, Situational syncope

Definition: An exaggerated response to carotid sinus baroreceptor stimulation resulting in syncope from transient diminished cerebral perfusion.
Syncope following a quick change in position from lying down to standing.
Poverty of behavior and speech output, lack of initiative, loss of emotional responses, psychomotor slowing, and prolonged speech latency.
Synonyms: Aboulia

Definition: Akinetic mutism is essentially characterized by a total absence of spontaneous behavior and speech occurring in the presence of preserved visual tracking.
A failure to develop of the upper vagina.
Synonyms: Absent upper vagina

Definition: A failure to develop of the lower part of the vagina.
Synonyms: Absent lower vagina, Agenesis of the lower vagina

Definition: An abnormal build up of iron (Fe) in brain tissue.
Synonyms: Brain iron deposition, Iron accumulation in brain

Definition: An anomalous build up of copper (Cu) in the brain.
Synonyms: Brain copper accumulation, Copper accumulation in brain

Definition: An anomalous build up of iron (Fe) in the substantia nigra.

An increase in the distance between vertebral pedicles, which are the two short, thick processes, which project backward, one on either side, from the upper part of the vertebral body, at the junction of its posterior and lateral surfaces.
An anomaly of the pineal gland,a small endocrine gland in the brain that produces melatonin.
A structural abnormality of the pineal gland.
Synonyms: Abnormality of pineal morphology

Definition: Accumulation of calcium salts in the pineal gland.
A glial uniloculated or multiloculated fluid-filled sac that either reside within or completely replace the pineal gland.
An abnormal increase or decrease in the quantity of three-dimensional space taken up by the pineal gland.
An abnormal reduction in the quantity of three-dimensional space taken up by the pineal gland.
An abnormal elevation in the quantity of three-dimensional space taken up by the pineal gland.
Failure to develop of the pineal gland, defined clinically as the absence of the pineal gland with no indication of the pineal gland even having been present.
A functional abnormality of the pineal gland.
An anomaly in the amount or timing of melatonin secretion by the pineal gland. Note that melatonin is also synthesized by multiple tissues outside of the pineal gland.
A darker than expected T2 signal on magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) of the thalamus. This term refers to a diffuse hypointensity affecting the entire thalamus.
A darker than expected T2 signal on magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) of the thalamus. This term refers to a localized hypointensity affecting a particular region of the thalamus.
A lighter than expected T2 signal on magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) of the thalamus. This term refers to a localized hyperintensity affecting a particular region of the thalamus.
Deviation from the normal range of size of the thalamus.
An increase in the quantity of space occupied by the thalamus.
A reduction in the quantity of space occupied by the thalamus.
A deviation from normal signal on magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) of the thalamus.
Decreased size of the basal ganglia.
Focal proliferation of glial cells in the cerebellum.
A structural abnormality of a diaphysis of the leg.
Synonyms: Anomaly of shaft of long bone of lower limb

Definition: A functional anomaly of the large intestine.
A sudden, irresistible need to have a bowel movement.
Synonyms: Faecal urgency, Fecal urgency

Definition: A repeated, painful urge to defecate without excreting stool.
Abnormality in the space in the meninges beneath the arachnoid membrane and above the pia mater that contains the cerebrospinal fluid.
Synonyms: Abnormality of the subarachnoid space

Definition: An increase in size of the anatomic space between the arachnoid membrane and pia mater.
Synonyms: Enlarged subarachnoid space

Term: Abnormal metabolic brain imaging by MRS
Definition: An anomaly of metabolism in the brain identified by magnetic resonance spectroscopy (MRS).

Term: Elevated brain choline level by MRS
Definition: An increase in the level of choline-containing compounds in the brain identified by magnetic resonance spectroscopy (MRS).

Term: Elevated brain lactate level by MRS
Definition: An increase in the level of lactate in the brain identified by magnetic resonance spectroscopy (MRS).

Term: Reduced brain N-acetyl aspartate level by MRS
Definition: A decrease in the level of N-acetyl aspartate in the brain identified by magnetic resonance spectroscopy (MRS).
Synonyms: Reduced brain N-acetyl aspartate level by magnetic resonance spectroscopy

Term: Abnormal brain choline/creatine ratio by MRS
Definition: A deviation from normal in the ratio of choline to creatine in the brain identified by magnetic resonance spectroscopy (MRS).
Excessive growth of a nail laterally into the nail fold.
Synonyms: Ingrown nail

Definition: A delay in the process of formation and maturation of the epiphysis of one or more vertebrae.
The presence of a mild form of hearing impairment.
Synonyms: Mild hearing impairment

Definition: The presence of a moderate form of hearing impairment.
Synonyms: Moderate hearing impairment

Definition: A severe form of hearing impairment.
Synonyms: Severe deafness, Severe hearing impairment, Severe hearing loss

Definition: A profound (essentially complete) form of hearing impairment.
Synonyms: Profound hearing impairment

Definition: The presence of a moderate form of conductive hearing impairment.
Synonyms: Conductive hearing loss, moderate

Definition: A severe form of conductive hearing impairment.
Synonyms: Conductive hearing loss, severe

Term: Morphological abnormality of the gastrointestinal tract
Definition: Abnormal structure of the gastrointestinal tract.
Synonyms: Abnormal shape of the digestive system, Morphological abnormality of the GI tract, Morphological anomaly of the digestive system

Term: Functional abnormality of the gastrointestinal tract
Definition: Abnormal functionality of the gastrointestinal tract.
Synonyms: Functional abnormality of the GI tract, GI dysfunction

Definition: Tumor (An abnormal mass of tissue resulting from abnormally dividing cells) of the nasal cavity.
Synonyms: Nasal neoplasm, Nasal tumor, Nasal tumour, Neoplasia of the nose, Nose cancer, Tumor of the nose, Tumour of the nose

Definition: A vascular malformation resulting from a developmental error of venous tissue composed of dysmorphic channels lined by flattened endothelium and exhibiting slow turnover. A venous malformation may present as a blue patch on the skin ranging to a soft blue mass. Venous malformations are easily compressible and usually swell in thewhen venous pressure increases (e.g., when held in a dependent position or when a child cries). They may be relatively localized or quite extensive within an anatomic region.
Synonyms: Venous malformations

Definition: Impaired conduction of cardiac impulse occurring anywhere along the conduction pathway.
Disturbance in the atrial activation that is caused by transient failure of impulse conduction from the sinoatrial node to the cardiac atria.
Edema in the region of the upper eyelid.
Synonyms: Cellulitis of upper eyelid, Fullness of upper eyelid, Puffiness of upper eyelid, Swelling of upper eyelid, Upper eyelid oedema

Definition: A soft tissue continuity in the A/P axis between two digits that extends distally to at least the level of the proximal interphalangeal joints, or a soft tissue continuity in the A/P axis between two digits that lies significantly distal to the flexion crease that overlies the metacarpophalangeal or metatarsophalangeal joint of the adjacent digits.
Synonyms: Cutaneous syndactyly of digits, Syndactyly, cutaneous

Definition: An abnormally decreased potassium concentration in the blood occurring periodically with a return to normal between the episodes.
Synonyms: Recurrent low potassium

Definition: An abnormal localized widening (dilatation) of the thoracic aorta.
A concentric abnormal localized widening (dilatation) of the descending thoracic aorta that involves the full circumference of the vessel wall
An eccentric abnormal localized widening (dilatation) of the descending thoracic aorta that involves only a portion of the circumference of the vessel wall
Absence of the tongue owing to a developmental abnormality.
Synonyms: Absence of tongue, Failure of development of tongue

Definition: Abnormal anatomic location of the anterior pituitary gland.
An abnormality of the anus or rectum.
A flat, distinct, discolored area of skin less than 1 cm wide that does not involve any change in the thickness or texture of the skin.
Synonyms: Flat, discolored area of skin, Flat, discoloured area of skin

Definition: Low blood glucose is accompanied by elevated levels of ketone bodies in the body.
Synonyms: Ketotic low blood sugar

Definition: A sudden, audible expulsion of air from the lungs through a partially closed glottis, preceded by inhalation.
Synonyms: Cough, Coughing

Definition: A profound delay in the achievement of motor or mental milestones in the domains of development of a child.
Synonyms: Global developmental delay, profound

Definition: A discrete abnormal tissue mass that protrudes into the lumen of the small intestine and is attached to the intestinal wall either by a stalk, pedunculus, or a broad base.
Agenesis of canine tooth.
Synonyms: Absent canines, Failure of development of canine, Failure of development of eye tooth

Definition: Failure to develop of the small intestine.
Synonyms: Small bowel agenesis, Undeveloped small intestine

Definition: A tumor of the skin or mucous membrane with finger-like projections.
Absence of a testis from the scrotum on one side owing to failure of the testis or testes to descend through the inguinal canal to the scrotum.
Synonyms: Cryptorchidism, unilateral

Definition: Fingernail that appears thin when viewed on end.
Synonyms: Thin fingernail

Definition: Excessive fat around the stomach and abdomen.
Synonyms: Abdominal obesity, Central obesity

Definition: Failure of the femur to develop.
Synonyms: Absent femur, Absent thighbone, Aplasia of the femur

Definition: Distance between the medial and lateral canthi is more than 2 SD below the mean for age (objective); or, apparently reduced length of the palpebral fissures.
Synonyms: Decreased height of palpebral fissure, Short opening between the eyelids, Short palpebral fissures

Definition: Toenail that appears thin when viewed on end.
Synonyms: Thin toenail

Definition: A deviation from normal signal on magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) of the brainstem.
A lighter than expected T2 signal on magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) of the brainstem. This term refers to a localized hyperintensity affecting a particular region of the brainstem.
A darker than expected T2 signal on magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) of the brainstem. This term refers to a localized hypointensity affecting a particular region of the brainstem.
A darker than expected T2 signal on magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) of the brainstem. This term refers to a diffuse hypointensity affecting the entire brainstem.

Term: Abnormal basal ganglia MRI signal intensity
Definition: A deviation from normal signal on magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) of the basal ganglia.

Term: Focal T2 hypointense basal ganglia lesion
Definition: A darker than expected T2 signal on magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) of the basal ganglia. This term refers to a localized hypointensity affecting a particular region of the basal ganglia.
A darker than expected T2 signal on magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) of the basal ganglia. This term refers to a diffuse hypointensity affecting all of the basal ganglia.
Increased amount of myelin in the central nervous system.
Abnormal increase in size of the brainstem.
An increased polymorphonuclear cell count in the cerebrospinal fluid.

A structural anomaly of a neuron. Neurons are electrically excitable cells that transmit signals throughout the body. Neurons employ both electrical and chemical components in the transmission of information. Neurons are connected to other neurons at synapses and connected to effector organs or cells at neuroeffector junctions.
Synonyms: Abnormal neuron shape, Abnormal neuronal morphology

Definition: Neurodevelopmental delay (NDD) refers to delays in the maturation of the brain and central nervous system; infants and young children with NDD may experience delays in the development of one or more skills including gross motor abilities, fine-motor coordination, language abilities and ability to solve increasingly complex problems.
Synonyms: NDD

Definition: A deviation from normal of the neurological development of a child, which may include any or all of the aspects of the development of personal, social, gross or fine motor, and cognitive abilities.

A reduced ability to participate in the back and forth flow of social interaction, which is normally characterized by an influence of the behavior of one person on the behavior of another person who is in conversation with the first.
A developmental anomaly in which the mastoid process fails to form and is thus found to be congenitally absent.
Synonyms: Absent mastoids, Failure of development of mastoid, Mastoid agenesis

Definition: The presence of atrophy (wasting) of the cerebral white matter.
A sudden attack of dyspnea that occurs while the affected person is at rest.
Synonyms: Paroxysmal dyspnoea

Definition: A sensation of breathlessness in the recumbent position, relieved by sitting or standing.
An increase in size of the anatomic space between the arachnoid membrane and pia mater in the region surrounding the cerebellum.
An increase in size of the anatomic space between the arachnoid membrane and pia mater in the region surrounding the cerebrum.
A deviation from normal size of the placenta.
Respiratory failure in the newborn.
Synonyms: Asphyxia neonatorum

Definition: A deviation from normal of the length of the arm span (length from one end of an individual's arms measured at the fingertips to the other when raised parallel to the ground at shoulder height at a one-hundred eighty degree angle)
Synonyms: Abnormal arm span

Definition: Decreased length of the arm span (length from one end of an individual's arms measured at the fingertips to the other when raised parallel to the ground at shoulder height at a one-hundred eighty degree angle).
Synonyms: Reduced arm span

Definition: Increased length of the arm span (length from one end of an individual's arms measured at the fingertips to the other when raised parallel to the ground at shoulder height at a one-hundred eighty degree angle).
Synonyms: Increased arm span

Term: Abnormal upper to lower segment ratio
Definition: A deviation from normal of the relation between the upper and the lower segment of the body, where the lower segment is defined as the length between the top of pubic symphysis to floor, and the upper segment is defined as the top of head to top of pubic symphysis.

Term: Reduced upper to lower segment ratio
Definition: Decreased ratio between the upper and the lower segment of the body, where the lower segment is defined as the length between the top of pubic symphysis to floor, and the upper segment is defined as the top of head to top of pubic symphysis. Consider the term Disproportionate tall stature (HP:0001519) if tall stature is also present.

Term: Increased upper to lower segment ratio
Definition: Elevated ratio between the upper and the lower segment of the body, where the lower segment is defined as the length between the top of pubic symphysis to floor, and the upper segment is defined as the top of head to top of pubic symphysis.
A lacy pattern or iris pigmentation that resembles the spokes of a bicycle wheel.
A structural anomaly of the ciliary body.
Synonyms: Abnormality of the ciliary body

Definition: A tumor (abnormal growth of tissue) of the retina.
A glial tumor of the retinal nerve fiber layer arising from a retinal astrocyte.
Hearing loss that occurs acutely and resolves completely.
A tumor (abnormal growth of tissue) of the ear.
Synonyms: Ear tumor, Ear tumour

Definition: A type of hearing impairment affecting primarily the middle frequencies of sound (1000 Hz to 3000 Hz).
A type of nephrogenic rest associated with multiple lesions in the periphery of the renal lobe.
Synonyms: Perilobar nephrogenic rests

Definition: A type of nephrogenic rest usually representing single lesions within the renal lobe, renal sinus, or calyceal walls.
Synonyms: Intralobar nephrogenic rests

Definition: Inflammation of the connective and adipose tissues surrounding the kidney.
Chronic loss of joint motion in a finger due to structural changes in non-bony tissue.
Synonyms: Flexion deformity of finger

Definition: Repeated infections of the urinary bladder.
Synonyms: Recurrent bladder infections

Definition: Repeated episodes of pyelonephritis.
A net-like pattern of increased pigmentation of the oral cavity.
Synonyms: Mottled pigmentation of oral mucosa, Reticulate pigmentation of oral mucous membrane

Definition: Underdevelopment of the heel bone.
Synonyms: Hypoplastic calcaneus, Small heel bone, Underdeveloped heel bone

Definition: An anomaly in the process of intramembranous ossification by which flat bones (cranial bones of the skull, i.e., the frontal, parietal, occipital, and temporal bones, and the clavicles) are formed.
Synonyms: Abnormal intramembranous bone ossification

Definition: An anomaly of the process of formation of bone in the humerus.
Synonyms: Abnormal maturation of long bone in upper arm

Term: Absent ossification of thoracic vertebral bodies
Definition: A lack of bone mineralization of one or more body of thoracic vertebra.
A kinked appearance of the brainstem, i.e., an exaggerated flexure.
Synonyms: Kinked brain stem

Definition: Multiple areas of darker than expected signal on magnetic resonance imaging emanating from the cerebral white matter that surrounds the cerebral ventricles.
Synonyms: Periventricular cerebral white matter hypodensities

Definition: A morphological abnormality of the optic disc, i.e., of the portion of the optic nerve clinically visible on fundoscopic examination.

An elevation in the ratio of the diameter of the cup of the optic disc to the total diameter of the disc. The optic disc has an orange-pink rim with a pale centre (the cup) that does not contain neuroretinal tissue. An increase in this ratio therefore may indicate a decrease in the quantity of healthy neuroretinal cells.
Synonyms: Elevated cup to disc ratio, Increased cup disc ratio

Definition: A benign or malignant neoplasm arising from the lymphatic vessels.
Synonyms: Lymphatic vessel tumor, Lymphatic vessel tumour

Definition: Infiltration of smooth muscle-like cells in lymph vessels as well as the lung (pleura, alveolar septa, bronchi, pulmonary vessels and lymphatics as well as lymph nodes, especially in posterior mediastinum and retroperitoneum). Focal emphysema can develop because of airway narrowing, and the thoracic duct may be obliterated. Pulmonary lymphangiomyomatosis may lead to multiple small cysts with a hamartomatous proliferation of smooth muscle in their walls.
Synonyms: Pulmonary myomatosis

Definition: One-sided weakness of the muscles of facial expression and eye closure.
Synonyms: Facial droop, Paralysis of one side of the face, Unilateral facial muscle paralysis, Unilateral facial muscle weakness, Unilateral facial paralysis, Unilateral facial weakness, Weakness of one side of the face

Definition: A cranial suture that is in addition to canonical membrane-covered openings in the incompletely ossified skull of the fetus or newborn infant.
Synonyms: Extra cranial suture, Supernumary cranial suture

Definition: Bigonial distance (lower facial width) more than 2 standard deviations below the mean (objective); or an apparently decreased width of the lower jaw (mandible) when viewed from the front (subjective).
Synonyms: Narrow jaw, Narrow lower face, Narrow lower jaw, Narrow mandible

Definition: Bigonial distance (lower facial width) more than 2 SD above the mean (objective); or an apparently increased width of the lower jaw (mandible) when viewed from the front (subjective).
Synonyms: Broad jaw, Broad lower face, Broad mandible, Wide jaw, Wide mandible

Definition: Inequality of refractive power of the two eyes.
Disruption of the epithelial layer of the cornea with involvement of the underlying stroma.
Synonyms: Corneal ulcer, Corneal ulcerations

Definition: Transmission of light through the iris as visualized upon slit lamp examination or infrared iris transillumination videography. The light passes through defects in the pigmentation of the iris.
A fleshy, tube-like structure usually located in the midline of the face or just to one side of the midline.
Insertion of the posterior columella superior to the nasal base.
Synonyms: Columella, high insertion

Definition: An anomaly of the nasal base, which can be conceived of as an imaginary line between the most lateral points of the external inferior attachments of the alae nasi to the face.
Synonyms: Abnormal nasal base, Abnormality of base of nose, Anomaly of base of nose, Anomaly of nasal base

Definition: Decreased distance between the attachments of the alae nasi to the face.
Synonyms: Decreased width of base of nose, Decreased width of nasal base, Narrow base of nose, Narrow nasal base, Thin base of nose, Thin nasal base

Definition: Increased distance between the attachments of the alae nasi to the face.
Synonyms: Broad base of nose, Broad nasal base, Increased width of base of nose, Increased width of nasal base, Wide base of nose, Wide nasal base

Definition: Increased width of the nasal ridge.
Synonyms: Broad dorsum of nose, Broad nasal dorsum, Increased width of dorsum of nose, Increased width of nasal dorsum, Increased width of nasal ridge, Nasal ridge, wide, Wide dorsum of nose, Wide nasal dorsum, Wide nasal ridge

Definition: Increased bulk of tissue alongside the nose. The fullness can be caused by both bony and soft tissues.
Synonyms: Fullness of tissue around the nose, Laterally built up nose, Paranasal fullness, Thick paranasal tissue, Thick tissue around the nose

Definition: Underdevelopment of the breast on one side only.
Synonyms: One underdeveloped breast

Definition: Underdevelopment of the breast on both sides.
Synonyms: Two underdeveloped breasts

Definition: Underdevelopment of part or all of the female external reproductive organs (which include the mons pubis, labia majora, labia minora, Bartholin glands, and clitoris).
Synonyms: Underdeveloped female external genitalia

Definition: A predominantly right ventricular variant of isolated noncompaction cardiomyopathy.
A type of cardiomyopathy characterized anatomically by deep trabeculations in the ventricular wall, which define recesses communicating with the main ventricular chamber.
Synonyms: Noncompaction of the ventricular myocardium, Spongiform cardiomyopathy

Definition: Noncompaction cardiomyopathy that affects both ventricles.
Inflammation of the myocardium.
Synonyms: Inflammation of heart muscle

Definition: A loss of the ability to move the vocal fold on both sides.
Decreased strength of the vocal fold on one side.
Decreased strength of the vocal fold on both sides.

This subontology is designed to provide terms to characterize and specify the phenotypic abnormalities defined in the Phenotypic abnormality subontology, with respect to severity, laterality, age of onset, and other aspects.
Synonyms: Phenotypic modifier

Definition: The intensity or degree of a manifestation.
Synonyms: Intensity

Definition: Having a relatively minor degree of severity. For quantitative traits, a deviation of between two and three standard deviations from the appropriate population mean.
Synonyms: Mild

Definition: Having a medium degree of severity. For quantitative traits, a deviation of between three and four standard deviations from the appropriate population mean.

Having a minor degree of severity that is considered to be on the boundary between the normal and the abnormal ranges. For quantitative traits, a deviation of that is less than two standard deviations from the appropriate population mean.
Synonyms: Borderline

Definition: Having a high degree of severity. For quantitative traits, a deviation of between four and five standard deviations from the appropriate population mean.
Synonyms: Severe

Definition: Having an extremely high degree of severity. For quantitative traits, a deviation of more than five standard deviations from the appropriate population mean.
Synonyms: Profound

Definition: The anatomical localization of the specified phenotypic abnormality.
The localization with respect to the side of the body of the specified phenotypic abnormality.
Being present on both sides of the body.
Being present on only the left or only the right side of the body.
Being located on the right side of the body.
Synonyms: Right-sided

Definition: Being located on the left side of the body.
Synonyms: Left-sided

Definition: The pattern by which a phenotype affects one or more regions of the body.
Affecting all regions without specificity of distribution.
Synonyms: Generalised

Definition: Being confined or restricted to a particular location.
Synonyms: Localised, Localized

Definition: Localized away from the central point of the body.
Synonyms: Outermost

Definition: Localized close to the central point of the body.
The presence of an increased number of twists and turns of the retinal blood vessels.
Synonyms: Tortuous retinal vessels

Definition: A benign or malignant neoplasm that arises from the hair follicles, sebaceous glands, or sweat glands.
Synonyms: Skin adnexal neoplasm, Skin adnexal tumor, Skin adnexal tumour

Definition: An uncontrolled autonomous cell-proliferation originating in a hair follicle, which is an epidermal adnexal structures responsible for hair growth.
A benign tumour originating from the outer root sheath of the hair follicle.
Synonyms: Tricholemmoma

Definition: Presence of a unitary trichilemmoma, a benign tumour originating from the outer root sheath of the hair follicle.
Presence of multiple trichilemmomata, a benign tumour originating from the outer root sheath of the hair follicle.
Synonyms: Multiple trichilemmomas

Definition: Epilepsia partialis continua (also called Kojevnikov's or Kozhevnikov's epilepsia) is a type of focal motor status epilepticus characterized by repeated stereotyped simple motor manifestations such as jerks, typically of a limb or the face, recurring every few seconds or minutes for extended periods (days or years).
Synonyms: Epilepsia partialis continua of Kojevnikov, Kojevnikov's epilepsia, Kozhevnikov's epilepsia

Definition: The narrowing or partial blockage of a portion of the small intestine.
Synonyms: Narrowing of small intestine

Definition: Bleeding from the small intestine.
Synonyms: Small intestinal bleeding, Small intestinal haemorrhage, Small intestinal hemorrhage

Definition: Abnormal small intestinal contractions, such as spasms and intestinal paralysis related to the loss of the ability of the gut to coordinate muscular activity because of endogenous or exogenous causes.
A narrowing of a segment of colon whereby bowel continuity is maintained.
Synonyms: Narrowing of the colon, Stenosis of the colon

Definition: Hepatic fibrosis that reaches from a portal area to another portal area.
Hypospadias with location of the urethral meatus in the scrotum.
Hypospadias with location of the urethral meatus in the middle of the inferior shaft of the penis.
Increased pigmentation (skin color) of the scrotum.
Synonyms: Hyperpigmentation of the scrotum, Hyperpigmented scrotum, Increased pigmentation in scrotum
