Term: Abnormal uridine diphosphate glucose-4-epimerase level in red blood cells
Definition: An abnormality in uridine diphosphate glucose-4-epimerase level in red blood cells. Uridine diphosphate glucose-4-epimerase catalyzes the reaction: UDP-glucose = UDP-galactose.
Synonyms: Abnormal UDP-glucose 4-epimerase level in RBCs, Abnormal UDP-glucose 4-epimerase level in red blood cells

Term: Increased uridine diphosphate glucose-4-epimerase level in red blood cells
Definition: An increase in uridine diphosphate glucose-4-epimerase level in red blood cells. Uridine diphosphate glucose-4-epimerase catalyzes the reaction: UDP-glucose = UDP-galactose.
Synonyms: Increased UDP-glucose 4-epimerase level in RBCs, Increased UDP-glucose 4-epimerase level in red blood cells

Term: Decreased uridine diphosphate glucose-4-epimerase level in red blood cells
Definition: A decrease in uridine diphosphate glucose-4-epimerase level in red blood cells. Uridine diphosphate glucose-4-epimerase catalyzes the reaction: UDP-glucose = UDP-galactose.
Synonyms: Decreased UDP-glucose 4-epimerase level in RBCs, Decreased UDP-glucose 4-epimerase level in red blood cells

Definition: Increased concentration of urate in the cerebrospinal fluid.
Synonyms: Elevated CSF urate concentration, Increased cerebrospinal fluid urate

Definition: Detection of barbiturate metabolites such as phenobarbital in meconium.
Detection of barbiturate metabolites such as phenobarbital in the hair.
Detection of barbiturate metabolites such as phenobarbital in the stool.
Detection of barbiturate metabolites such as phenobarbital in the gastric fluid.
An increase in the length of time required for food to pass through the intestines.
Any deviation from the normal concentration of nicotinurate in the blood.
Synonyms: Abnormal circulating N-nicotinoylglycine level, Abnormal circulating nicotinurate level

Definition: An increased amount of nicotinurate in the blood.
Synonyms: Increased circulating N-nicotinoylglycine level

Definition: Detection of methadone or its metabolite 2-ethylidene-1,5-dimethyl-3,3- diphenylpyrrolidine (EDDP) in plasma or serum.
Detection of cotinine, an alkaloid found in tobacco and the predominant metabolite of nicotine, in plasma or serum.
A reduced concentration of folic acid, which is also known as vitamin B9 in the cerebrospinal fluid.
Synonyms: Folate deficiency in cerebrospinal fluid

Definition: An abnormality in any umbilical cord measurement performed after birth, such as the blood gas level.

Term: Abnormal blood gas level in cord blood

Definition: An abnormally high level of blood oxygen in the cord blood.
Synonyms: High cord blood oxygen level

Definition: An abnormally low level of blood oxygen in the cord blood.
Synonyms: Low cord blood oxygen level

Definition: Abnormally elevated blood carbon dioxide (CO2) level in the cord blood.
Synonyms: High cord blood carbon dioxide level

Definition: Abnormally decreased blood carbon dioxide (CO2) level in the cord blood.
Synonyms: Low cord blood carbon dioxide level

Definition: An abnormal concentration of 5-methyltetrahydrofolate in the blood.
Synonyms: Abnormal serum methylfolate Level

Definition: A decreased concentration of 5-methyltetrahydrofolate in the blood.
Synonyms: Reduced serum methylfolate Level

Term: Hypoplasia of maxilla relative to mandible
Definition: Abnormally small dimension of the maxilla (upper jaw) relative to the mandible (lower jaw).
Synonyms: Disorder of maxillary and mandibular dental arch relationship

Term: Hypoplasia of mandible relative to maxilla
Definition: Abnormally small dimension of the mandible (lower jaw) relative to the maxilla (upper jaw).
Synonyms: Disorder of mandibular and maxillary dental arch relationship

Term: Increased anti-dairy protein IgE antibody level
Definition: Increased level of IgE antibody against dairy proteins, including casein, alpha-lactalbumin, beta-lactoglobulin or bovine serum albumin contained in cow, sheep or goat milk and milk products.

Term: Increased anti-animal protein IgE antibody level
Definition: Increased level of IgE antibody against animal proteins, such as albumins that are present in animal hair, dander, shed skin, saliva and urine.
Synonyms: Increased level of anti-animal protein IgE antibody

Definition: Increased level of IgE antibody against seafood, including fish, shrimp, lobster, crab, squid and abalone.
Synonyms: Increased level of anti-seafood IgE antibody

Term: Increased anti-dust mite IgE antibody level
Definition: Increased level of IgE antibody against dust mites, such as house dust mites.
Synonyms: Increased level of anti-dust mite IgE antibody

Definition: Increased level of IgE antibody against bacteria.
Synonyms: Increased level of anti-bacteria IgE antibody

Definition: Increased level of IgE antibody against a drug or class of drugs, such as antibiotics.
Synonyms: Increased level of anti-drug IgE antibody

Definition: Increased level of IgE antibody against feathers, which could be indicative of an allergy against feathers themselves, or mite allergens present in feathers.

Term: Increased anti-food allergen IgE antibody level
Definition: Increased level of IgE antibody against proteins found in foods, such as milk, egg, soy, wheat, peanut, treenut, fish, and shellfish.
Synonyms: Increased level of anti-food allergen IgE antibody

Term: Increased anti-plant based food allergen IgE antibody level
Definition: Increased level of IgE antibody against a plant based food allergen, including vegetables and fruits.
Synonyms: Increased level of anti-plant based food allergen IgE antibody

Definition: Increased level of IgE antibody against gluten, a protein found in wheat, barley, and rye.
Synonyms: Increased level of anti-gluten IgE antibody

Term: Increased anti-nut food product IgE antibody level
Definition: Increased level of IgE antibody against nut food products such as peanuts or tree nuts, such as hazelnuts, walnuts, cashews, and almonds.
Increased level of IgE antibody against eggs, including egg whites, egg yolks, and egg proteins such as ovoalbumin and ovomucoid.
Increased level of IgE antibody against fungus, such as molds like zygomycota, ascomycota and deuteromycota.
Synonyms: Increased anti-fungal IgE antibody level, Increased anti-fungus IgE antibody level

Term: Increased anti-meat allergen IgE antibody level
Definition: Increased level of IgE antibody against meat, such as mammalian meat, including beef or pork, or poultry, like duck or chicken.

Increased level of IgE antibody against parasites, such as helminths (parasitic worms, such as Ascaris lumbricoides, Trichuris trichiura, Ancylostoma duodenalis, Necator americanus, Strongyloides stercoralis) or parasites such as Toxoplasma gondii.
Increased level of IgE antibody against antigens from insects such as moths, mosquitos, or cockroaches.
Increased level of IgE antibody against venom from insects such as bees, wasps, hornets, yellowjackets.

Term: Increased anti-plant product IgE antibody level
Definition: Increased level of IgE antibody against antigens from plants and products derived from plants, such as wood or pollen.
Detection of norcotinine, a metabolite of nicotine, in urine.
An abnormal deviation from normal levels of IgA immunoglobulin in blood.
Synonyms: Abnormal IgA level in blood

Definition: An abnormal deviation from normal levels of IgE immunoglobulin in blood.
Synonyms: Abnormal IgE level in blood

Definition: An abnormal deviation from normal levels of IgG immunoglobulin in blood.
Synonyms: Abnormal IgG level in blood

Definition: An abnormal deviation from normal levels of IgM immunoglobulin in blood.
Synonyms: Abnormal IgM level in blood

Definition: An abnormal deviation from normal levels of IgD immunoglobulin in blood.
Synonyms: Abnormal IgD level in blood

Definition: An abnormally decreased level of immunoglobulin D (IgD) in blood.
Synonyms: Decreased IgD, Decreased IgD in blood, IgD deficiency

Definition: An abnormally increased level of immunoglobulin D in blood.
Synonyms: Elevated IgD, Elevated serum IgD, IgD hypergammaglobulinemia, Increased IgD level, Increased levels of IgD, Increased serum IgD

Term: Increased anti-animal dander IgE antibody level
Definition: Increased level of IgE antibody against animal dander, tiny scales shed from animal skin or hair, such as from pet dogs or cats.
Synonyms: Increased level of anti-dander IgE antibody

Term: Increased anti-house dust mite IgE antibody level
Definition: Increased level of IgE antibody against house dust mites, a common allergen.
Synonyms: Increased anti-house dust IgE antibody level, Increased level of anti-house dust IgE antibody

Definition: Increased level of IgE antibody against galactose-alpha-1, 3 galactose (alpha-gal), a carbohydrate found in mammalian meat.
Synonyms: Increased anti-galactose-alpha-1, 3 galactose IgE antibody level

Definition: An abnormality in the cleavage of L-selectin during the process of guiding neutrophils to the site of infection. Proteolytic cleavage of L-selectin results in rapid shedding from the cell surface, which has a role in neutrophil rolling and accumulation at the site of infection.
Neutropenia with an absolute neutrophil count (ANC) less than 1,500,000,000/L lasting for more than 3 months.
Chornic neutropenia arising from an impaired proliferation and maturation of myeloid progenitor cells in the bone marrow.
Synonyms: Myeloid maturation arrest in bone marrow

Term: Cyclic neutropenia in myeloid maturation arrest in bone marrow
Definition: Cyclic neutropenia arising from an impaired proliferation and maturation of myeloid progenitor cells in the bone marrow.
A transient reduction in the number of neutrophils in the peripheral blood. Transient neutropenia is most commonly associated with viral infections, but other causes include drugs and autoimmunity.
Transient neutropenia caused by an infection, such as with a virus, bacteria or protozoan.
An increased number of neutrophils circulating in the blood during an infection, such as with a bacteria, virus or fungus.
An increased number of neutrophils circulating in the blood in the absence of an infection. Factors contributing to neutrophilia could include inflammation or congenital disorders.
Fusion of the liver with the lung.
Synonyms: Hepatic pulmonary fusion

Definition: The presence of an asymmetrical gluteal crease, the horizontal crease formed by the inferior aspect of the buttocks and the posterior upper leg.
Synonyms: Asymmetrical buttock crease, Asymmetrical gluteal sulcus, Asymmetrical horizontal gluteal crease

Definition: A widely spaced gap between the fourth toe and the fifth (pinky) toe.
Synonyms: Wide space between the 4th and 5th toe

Definition: A functional abnormality affecting the lower cranial nerves, which include the paired 9th (glossopharyngeal), 10th (vagal), 11th (accessory) and 12th (hypoglossal) cranial nerves.
Synonyms: Abnormal lower cranial nerve function

Definition: An anomaly of metabolism or structure of the brain identified by imaging.
Synonyms: Abnormal brain imaging

Definition: A hemangioma, a benign tumor of the vascular endothelial cells, located in the airway, typically below the vocal chords, that can cause severe obstruction of the airway.
Synonyms: Airway hemangioma

Definition: A hemangioma, a benign tumor of the vascular endothelial cells, located in the upper part of the larynx (voice box) including the epiglottis; the area above the vocal cords.
A hemangioma arising from within visceral structures, the internal organs of the body.
A hemangioma, a benign tumor of the vascular endothelial cells, located in the intestines, which includes the bowel.
Synonyms: Bowel hemangioma, Intestinal hemangiomas

Definition: A hemangioma, a benign tumor of the vascular endothelial cells, that is located in the spleen.
Synonyms: Splenic hemangioma

Definition: A hemangioma, a benign tumor of the vascular endothelial cells, that is located in the upper lip.
A hemangioma, a benign tumor of the vascular endothelial cells, that is located in the esophagus.
A hemangioma, a benign tumor of the vascular endothelial cells, that is located in the glottic or supraglottic regions.
Synonyms: Throat hemangioma

Definition: A hemangioma, a benign tumor of the vascular endothelial cells, that is located in the vulva.
A hemangioma, a benign tumor of the vascular endothelial cells, that is located in the retropharyngeal space, the portion of the peripharyngeal space that is located posterior to the pharynx.
A hemangioma, a benign tumor of the vascular endothelial cells, that is located in the paraspinal muscular region, the muscles next to the spine.
A spinal cord hemangioma located in the lumbosacral spine region.
Synonyms: Lumbar/sacral hemangioma

Definition: An abnormality of the sternum that presents at birth as a ventral sternal non-union defect, due to an abnormality of the fusion of the layers of the skin. It presents as a scar-like line that extends upward from the umbilicus (belly button).
Synonyms: Midline supraumbilical raphe

Definition: A sternal pit is a small indentation or dimple in the skin overlying the sternum of the chest. In some cases, the skin defect can be linear, extending several inches over the sternum.
A fluid-filled sacs that develop on or near the pituitary gland.
Synonyms: Cyst of the pituitary gland

Definition: Partial or complete wasting (loss) of the pituitary gland.
Synonyms: Atrophic pituitary, Pituitary gland atrophy

Definition: Onset of disease manifestations before adulthood, defined here as before the age of 15 years, but excluding neonatal or congenital onset.
Synonyms: Onset before adulthood, Paediatric onset

Definition: A heterogeneous group of symptoms that are localized in the epigastric region. Typical dyspeptic symptoms include postprandial fullness, early satiation, epigastric pain and epigastric burning, but other upper gastrointestinal symptoms such as nausea, belching or abdominal bloating often occur.
Synonyms: Indigestion

Definition: A deviation from the normal concentration of amylase in the blood, an enzyme which helps digest glycogen and starch. It is produced mainly in the pancreas and salivary glands.
Synonyms: Abnormal circulating amylase level

Definition: Detection of acetaminophen in the blood.
Synonyms: Positive blood paracetamol test, Positive blood Tylenol test

Definition: Detection of norpropoxyphene in the blood, a major metabolite of the opioid analgesic drug dextropropoxyphene.
Detection of methadone or its metabolite 2-ethylidene-1,5-dimethyl-3,3- diphenylpyrrolidine (EDDP) in meconium.
Detection of molindone in the blood, an antipyschotic used for treatment of schizophrenia.
Synonyms: Positive blood Moban test

Definition: A hemangioma, a benign tumor of the vascular endothelial cells, that is located in the intrathoracic or chest region.
Synonyms: Chest hemangioma

Definition: Increased level of amylase in the blood, an enzyme which helps digest glycogen and starch. It is produced mainly in the pancreas and salivary glands.
Synonyms: Increased circulating amylase level

Definition: Decreased level of amylase in the blood, an enzyme which helps digest glycogen and starch. It is produced mainly in the pancreas and salivary glands.
Synonyms: Decreased circulating amylase level

Definition: Detection of norpropoxyphene in urine.
Opposing or not responding to instructions or external stimuli.

An abnormal level of isohemagglutinin in the blood. An isohemagglutinin refers to the naturally occurring antibodies in the ABO blood group system (i.e., anti-A in a group B person, anti-B in a group A person, and anti-A, anti-B, and anti-A,B in a group O person).
Synonyms: Abnormal level of natural antibody to blood group agents, Abnormal natural antibody level to blood group antigens in blood (isohemagglutinin)

Definition: Absent or undetectable level of isohemagglutinin. An isohemagglutinin refers to the naturally occurring antibodies in the ABO blood group system (i.e., anti-A in a group B person, anti-B in a group A person, and anti-A, anti-B, and anti-A,B in a group O person).
Synonyms: Absent natural antibody to blood group agents, Complete or near-complete absence of isohemagglutinins

Term: Decreased specific antibody response to protein vaccine
Definition: A reduced ability to synthesize postvaccination antibodies against proteins in vaccines, as measured by antibody titer determination following vaccination.

Term: Complete or near-complete absence of specific antibody response to tetanus vaccine
Definition: The inability to synthesize postvaccination antibodies against a tetanus antigen, as measured by antibody titer determination following vaccination.

Term: Complete or near-complete absence of specific antibody response to hepatitis B vaccine
Definition: The inability to synthesize postvaccination antibodies against a hepatisis B antigen, as measured by antibody titer determination following vaccination.

Term: Partial absence of specific antibody response to tetanus vaccine
Definition: A reduced ability to synthesize postvaccination antibodies against a tetanus antigen, as measured by antibody titer determination following vaccination.

Term: Partial absence of specific antibody response to hepatitis B vaccine
Definition: A reduced ability to synthesize postvaccination antibodies against a hepatitis B antigen, as measured by antibody titer determination following vaccination.

Term: Decreased specific antibody response to polysaccharide vaccine
Definition: A reduced ability to synthesize postvaccination antibodies against polysaccharides in vaccines, as measured by antibody titer determination following vaccination.

Term: Complete or near-complete absence of specific antibody response to unconjugated pneumococcus vaccine
Definition: The inability to synthesize postvaccination antibodies against a pneumococcus antigen, as measured by antibody titer determination following vaccination.

Term: Partial absence of specific antibody response to unconjugated pneumococcus vaccine
Definition: A reduced ability to synthesize postvaccination antibodies against a pneumococcus antigen, as measured by antibody titer determination following vaccination.

Term: Decreased specific antibody response to protein-conjugated polysaccharide vaccine
Definition: A reduced ability to synthesize postvaccination antibodies against protein-conjugated polysaccharides in vaccines, as measured by antibody titer determination following vaccination.

Term: Complete or near-complete absence of specific antibody response to Haemophilus influenzae type b (Hib) vaccine
Definition: The inability to synthesize postvaccination antibodies against a Haemophilus influenzae type b (Hib) antigen, as measured by antibody titer determination following vaccination.

Term: Complete or near-complete absence of specific antibody response to meningococcus vaccine
Definition: The inability to synthesize postvaccination antibodies against a meningococcus antigen, as measured by antibody titer determination following vaccination.

Term: Partial absence of specific antibody response to Haemophilus influenzae type b (Hib) vaccine
Definition: A reduced ability to synthesize postvaccination antibodies against a Haemophilus influenzae type b (Hib) antigen, as measured by antibody titer determination following vaccination.

Term: Partial absence of specific antibody response to meningococcus vaccine
Definition: A reduced ability to synthesize postvaccination antibodies against a meningococcus antigen, as measured by antibody titer determination following vaccination.
Detection of methadone and its metabolites in the stool.

Term: Decreased specific antibody response to infection
Definition: A reduced ability to synthesize antibodies against antigens from an infectious agent or pathogen (such as bacteria, viruses, parasites, etc.), as measured by antibody titer determination following infection.
A increased concentration of alpha-aminoadipic acid in the urine.

Definition: An abnormal form or size of neutrophils in the cerebrospinal fluid.

Definition: An abnormal decrease in the concentration of sialylated N-glycans on glycoproteins.
Synonyms: Decreased concentration of sialylated N-glycans on glycoproteins

Definition: An abnormal concentration of high-mannose N-glycans on glycoproteins.
Synonyms: Abnormal high-mannose N-glycans on glycoprotein concentration

Definition: An abnormal increase in the concentration of high-mannose N-glycans on glycoproteins.
Synonyms: Increased high-mannose N-glycans on glycoprotein concentration

Definition: An abnormal decrease in the concentration of high-mannose N-glycans on glycoproteins.
Synonyms: Decreased high-mannose N-glycans on glycoprotein concentration

Definition: An abnormal in the concentration of core 1 O-glycans on glycoproteins.
Synonyms: Abnormal concentration of T-antigen

Definition: An abnormal increase in the concentration of core 1 O-glycans on glycoproteins.
Synonyms: Increased T-antigen concentration

Definition: An abnormal decrease in the concentration of core 1 O-glycans on glycoproteins.
Synonyms: Decreased T-antigen concentration

Definition: Hypoglycosylation of alpha-dystroglycan with O-mannosyl glycans. Alpha-dystroglycan is a functional target of O-mannosyl glycosylation and functional glycosylation of alpha-DG is essential in its interaction with the extracellular matrix.
Synonyms: Reduced O-mannosyl glycans on alpha-dystroglycan

Definition: An abnormal increase in the concentration of monosialylated core 1 O-glycans on glycoproteins.
Synonyms: Increased sialyl T-antigen concentration

Definition: An abnormal decrease in the concentration of monosialylated core 1 O-glycans on glycoproteins.
Synonyms: Decreased sialyl T-antigen concentration

Definition: An abnormal increase in the concentration of disialylated core 1 O-glycans on glycoproteins.
Synonyms: Increased disialyl T-antigen concentration

Definition: An abnormal increase in the concentration of globoside Gb4.
Synonyms: Increased globoside Gb4 concentration

Term: Increased hepatitis A virus antibody level
Definition: An abnormally increased level of immunoglobulin against hepatitis A virus in the blood.
An abnormal increase in the concentration of glycolipid globoside Gb3.
Synonyms: Increased globoside Gb3 concentration

Term: Increased hepatitis B virus antibody level
Definition: An abnormally increased level of immunoglobulin against hepatitis B virus in the blood.
The absence of ganglioside GM3.

Term: Increased hepatitis C virus antibody level
Definition: An abnormally increased level of immunoglobulin against hepatitis C virus in the blood.
An abnormal increase in the concentration of Tn antigen on glycoproteins.
Synonyms: Increased O-GalNac on glycoprotein concentration

Term: Abnormal proportion of naive CD4 T cells
Definition: Any abnormality in the proportion of naive CD4 T cells relative to the total number of T cells.
Synonyms: Abnormal proportion of CD4+CD45RA+ cells, Abnormal proportion of naive thymus-derived CD4-positive, alpha-beta T cells

Term: Abnormal proportion of naive CD8 T cells
Definition: Any abnormality in the proportion of naive CD8 T cells relative to the total number of T cells.

Term: Increased proportion of naive CD4 T cells
Synonyms: Elevated proportion of naive CD4 T cells, Increased proportion of CD4+CD45RA+ cells, Increased proportion of naive thymus-derived CD4-positive, alpha-beta T cells

Term: Increased proportion of naive CD8 T cells
Definition: An abnormally increased proportion of naive CD8 T cells relative to the total number of T cells.
Synonyms: Elevated proportion of naive CD8 T cells, Elevated proportion of naive thymus-derived CD8-positive, alpha-beta T cells

Term: Decreased proportion of naive CD8 T cells
Definition: An abnormally reduced proportion of naive CD8 T cells relative to the total number of T cells.
Synonyms: Reduced proportion of naive CD8 T cells, Reduced proportion of naive thymus-derived CD8-positive, alpha-beta T cells

Term: Decreased proportion of naive CD4 T cells
Definition: An abnormally reduced proportion of naive CD4 T cells relative to the total number of T cells.
Synonyms: Decreased proportion of CD4+CD45RA+ cells, Decreased proportion of naive thymus-derived CD4-positive, alpha-beta T cells, Reduced proportion of naive CD4 T cells

Term: Abnormal proportion of CD4-positive, alpha-beta memory T cells
Definition: An abnormal proportion of CD4-positive, alpha-beta memory T cells compared to the total number of T cells in the blood. These cells have the phenotype of CD45RO-positive and CD127-positive. This cell type is also described as being CD25-negative, CD44-high, and CD122-high.

Term: Abnormal proportion of CD8-positive, alpha-beta memory T cells
Definition: An abnormal proportion of CD8-positive, alpha-beta memory T cells compared to the total number of T cells in the blood. A CD8-positive, alpha-beta T cell with memory phenotype is CD45RO and CD127-positive. This cell type is also described as being CD25-negative, CD44-high, and CD122-high.

Term: Abnormal proportion of central memory CD4-positive, alpha-beta T cells
Definition: An abnormal proportion of central memory CD4-positive, alpha-beta memory T cells compared to the total number of T cells in the blood. These cells have the phenotype of CCR7-positive, CD127-positive, CD45RA-negative, CD45RO-positive, and CD25-negative.

Term: Abnormal proportion of effector memory CD8-positive, alpha-beta T cells
Definition: An abnormal proportion of effector memory CD8-positive, alpha-beta memory T cells compared to the total number of T cells in the blood. These cells have the phenotype of CCR7-negative, CD127-positive, CD45RA-negative, CD45RO-positive, and CD25-negative.

Term: Abnormal proportion of central memory CD8-positive, alpha-beta T cells
Definition: An abnormal proportion of central memory CD8-positive, alpha-beta memory T cells compared to the total number of T cells in the blood. These cells have the phenotype CCR7-positive, CD127-positive, CD45RA-negative, CD45RO-positive, and CD25-negative.

Term: Decreased proportion of CD8-positive, alpha-beta memory T cells
Definition: Decreased proportion of CD8-positive, alpha-beta memory T cells compared to the total number of T cells in the blood. A CD8-positive, alpha-beta T cell with memory phenotype is CD45RO and CD127-positive. This cell type is also described as being CD25-negative, CD44-high, and CD122-high.

Term: Decreased proportion of CD4-positive, alpha-beta memory T cells
Definition: Decresaed proportion of CD4-positive, alpha-beta memory T cells compared to the total number of T cells in the blood. These cells have the phenotype of CD45RO-positive and CD127-positive. This cell type is also described as being CD25-negative, CD44-high, and CD122-high.

Term: Decreased proportion of central memory CD4-positive, alpha-beta T cells
Definition: A reduced proportion of central memory CD4-positive, alpha-beta memory T cells compared to the total number of T cells in the blood. These cells have the phenotype of CCR7-positive, CD127-positive, CD45RA-negative, CD45RO-positive, and CD25-negative.
Synonyms: Decreased proportion of CD4+ central memory cells, Decreased proportion of CD4-positive central memory cells, Decreased proportion of central memory CD4+, alpha-beta T cell, Reduced proportion of CD4+ central memory cells

Term: Decreased proportion of central memory CD8-positive, alpha-beta T cells
Definition: A reduced proportion of CD8-positive, alpha-beta central memory T cells compared to the total number of T cells in the blood. These cells have the phenotype CCR7-negative, CD127-positive, CD45RA-negative, CD45RO-positive, and CD25-negative.

Term: Decreased proportion of effector memory CD8-positive, alpha-beta T cells
Definition: A reduced proportion of CD8-positive, alpha-beta effector memory T cells compared to the total number of T cells in the blood. These cells have the phenotype CCR7-negative, CD127-positive, CD45RA-negative, CD45RO-positive, and CD25-negative.

Term: Increased proportion of CD4-positive, alpha-beta memory T cells
Definition: An abnormally elevated proportion of CD4-positive, alpha-beta memory T cells compared to the total number of T cells in the blood. These cells have the phenotype of CD45RO-positive and CD127-positive. This cell type is also described as being CD25-negative, CD44-high, and CD122-high.

Term: Increased proportion of CD8-positive, alpha-beta memory T cells
Definition: An abnormally elevated proportion of CD8-positive, alpha-beta memory T cells compared to the total number of T cells in the blood. These cells have the phenotype CD45RO and CD127-positive. This cell type is also described as being CD25-negative, CD44-high, and CD122-high.

Term: Increased proportion of central memory CD4-positive, alpha-beta T cells
Definition: An abnormally elevated proportion of central memory CD4-positive, alpha-beta memory T cells compared to the total number of T cells in the blood. These cells have the phenotype of CCR7-positive, CD127-positive, CD45RA-negative, CD45RO-positive, and CD25-negative.
Synonyms: Elevated proportion central memory CD4-positive, alpha-beta T cells, Elevated proportion of CD4+ central memory cells, Increased proportion of CD4+ central memory cells, Increased proportion of central memory CD4+, alpha-beta T cell

Term: Increased proportion of effector memory CD4-positive, alpha-beta T cells
Definition: An abnormally elevated proportion of effector memory CD4-positive, alpha-beta memory T cells compared to the total number of T cells in the blood. These cells have the phenotype CCR7-negative, CD127-positive, CD45RA-negative, CD45RO-positive, and CD25-negative.

Term: Increased proportion of effector memory CD8-positive, alpha-beta T cells
Definition: An increased proportion of effector memory CD8-positive, alpha-beta T cells compared to the total number of T cells in the blood. These cells have the phenotype CCR7-negative, CD127-positive, CD45RA-negative, CD45RO-positive, and CD25-negative.

Term: Increased proportion of central memory CD8-positive, alpha-beta T cells
Definition: An increased proportion of central memory CD8-positive, alpha-beta T cells compared to the total number of T cells in the blood. These cells have the phenotype CCR7-positive, CD127-positive, CD45RA-negative, CD45RO-positive, and CD25-negative.
Saccular dilatation of the terminal bronchioles.
Synonyms: Bronchiolectasia

Definition: Detection of lead in the blood.
Synonyms: Increased blood lead level

Definition: Absence of the sebaceous gland, the holocrine gland that secretes sebum into the hair follicles, or in hairless areas into ducts.
Synonyms: Absence of sebaceous glands

Definition: Applies to a sign or symptom that is exacerbated in the evening as compared to the day.
An abnormality of the frontal bone.
Synonyms: Abnormality of the bone of the forehead, Abnormality of the frontal bone

Definition: An abnormality of the lacrimal bone.
An abnormality of the palatine bone.
Synonyms: Abnormality of the palatine bone

Definition: An abnormality of the ethmoid bone
Synonyms: Abnormality of ethmoid bone

Definition: An eyelash that emerges from the underside (conjunctiva) of the upper or lower eyelid.
A partial or complete adhesion of the palpebral conjunctiva of the eyelid to the bulbar conjunctiva of the eyeball.
Synonyms: Eyelid adhesion to globe of eye, Eyelid stuck to eyeball

Definition: The presence of more than the normal number of eyelids.
Synonyms: Extra eyelid

Definition: Developmental hypoplasia of the eyelid.
Synonyms: Decreased size of eyelid, Hypoplasia of the eyelid, Hypoplastic eyelid, Underdevelopment of eyelid

Definition: Abnormal shortness of the vertical dimensions of the eyelids.
Synonyms: Abnormally small eyelid

Definition: An abnormality of the palpebral conjunctiva.
Failure to complete ossification (maturation and calcification) of the palatine bone.
Lack of formation of the palatine bone.

Term: Abnormality of musculature of soft palate
Definition: An abnormality of one or more of the five muscles of the soft palate.
Synonyms: Abnormality of soft palate muscles

Term: Abnormal morphology of musculature of pharynx
Definition: An abnormality of any of the muscles of the pharynx.
Synonyms: Abnormality of muscles of the pharynx, Abnormality of musculature of pharynx, Abnormality of pharyngeal musculature, Abnormality of pharynx musculature

Term: Abnormality of tensor veli palatini muscle
Definition: An abnormality of the tensor veli palatini muscle
An abnormality of the uvular muscle
Synonyms: Abnormality of musculus uvulae

Definition: An abnormality of the muscles of the structure of the nose.
Synonyms: Abnormality of muscle of nose, Abnormality of musculature of the nose, Abnormality of nasal musculature

Term: Abnormality of muscle of facial expression
Definition: An abnormality of any of the muscles of facial expression, which are innervated by the seventh (VII) cranial nerve and control facial expression.
Synonyms: Abnormality of muscle of facial expression, Abnormality of musculature of facial expression

Term: Abnormality of levator labii superioris alaeque nasi muscle
Definition: An abnormality of the levator labii superioris alaeque nasi muscle.
An abnormality of the common carotid arteries, which provide the arterial supply to the head and neck and give rise to the internal carotid artery and the external carotid artery.
Synonyms: Abnormality of the common carotid artery

Definition: An abnormality of the sphenoid sinus, one of the mucosa-lined, normally air-filled paranasal sinuses of the bones of the skull. The sphenoid sinus is located within the sphenoid bone.
Synonyms: Abnormality of the sphenoidal sinus

Definition: An abnormality of the maxillary sinus, one of the mucosa-lined, normally air-filled paranasal sinuses of the bones of the skull. The maxillary sinus is located within the skeleton of the midface, lateral to the nasal cavity.
Synonyms: Abnormality of the antrum of Highmore, Abnormality of the maxillary antrum, Abnormality of the upper jaw sinus

Definition: An abnormality of an external jugular vein of the neck.
Two-sided or bilateral weakness of the muscles of facial expression and eye closure.
Synonyms: Bilateral facial muscle paralysis, Bilateral facial muscle weakness, Bilateral facial paralysis, Paralysis of both sides of the face, Weakness of both sides of the face

Definition: Abnormally increased dimension of the maxilla, especially relative to the mandible, resulting in a malocclusion or malalignment between the upper and lower teeth or in anterior positioning of the nasal base, increased convexity of the face, increased nasolabial angle, or increased width (transverse dimension of the maxilla.
Synonyms: Big maxilla, Big upper jaw, Hyperplasia of upper jaw, Increased size of maxilla, Increased size of upper jaw, Large maxilla, Large upper jaw, Maxillary excess, Maxillary hyperplasia, Maxillary macrognathia, Maxillary prominence, Prominent maxilla, Prominent upper jaw, Upper jaw bone excess, Upper jaw excess

Definition: An abnormality of the premaxilla (the embryonic structure that forms the anterior part of the maxilla) causing it to appear relatively large in size compared to the other parts of the maxilla or other facial structures.
Synonyms: Hyperplasia of the intermaxillary bone, Hyperplasia of the primary palate bone, Increased size of premaxilla, Increased size of the primary palate bone, Large premaxilla, Large primary palate bone, Premaxillary excess, Primary palate bone excess

Definition: A perceived unpleasant smell given off by the body.
Synonyms: BO, Body odor, Body odour, Bromhidrosis, Bromidrosis, Osmidrosis

Definition: Pain in and around the anus or rectum (perianal region).
Synonyms: Anal pain, Rectal pain

Definition: Inflammation of the urethra.
Multiple cysts along the pupillary margin that appear as spherical or tear-drop-shaped pigmented lesions or wrinkled masses emerging from the pupillary border of the iris.
Golden brown or gray deposits with a clockwise, whorl-like distribution in the inferior interpalpebal portion of the cornea.
Synonyms: Vortex keratopathy

Definition: It is a rare, slowly growing tumor of the cerebellum, a gangliocytoma sometimes considered to be a hamartoma, characterized by diffuse hypertrophy of the granular layer of the cerebellum.
A rounded, puffy face with fat deposits in the temporal fossa and cheeks, a double chin.
Synonyms: Moon face, Puffy face, Puffy facies

Definition: A deviation from the normal circulating concentration of the normal gonadotropin-releasing hormone (GnRH). Intermittent GnRH secretion from the hypothalamus acts upon its receptor in the anterior pituitary to regulate the production and release of the gonadotropins, follicle-stimulating hormone (FSH) and luteinizing hormone (LH).
Synonyms: Abnormality of GnRH level, Abnormality of gonadotropin-releasing hormone level

Definition: Secretion of gonadotropin-releasing hormone that does not occur in a pulsatile fashion.
Synonyms: Absence of GnRH pulsatility

Definition: Abnormal test result of cardiovascular physiology.
Abnormal results of a MRI for the heart.
Synonyms: Abnormal cardiac magnetic resonance imaging, Abnormal heart MRI

Definition: Abnormal results from the diagnostic tests resulting from cardiac catheterization.
Synonyms: Abnormal cardiac cath

Definition: Abnormal results of exercise on heart function.
Synonyms: Abnormal cardiac exercise test, Abnormal treadmill test

Term: Abnormal resting energy expenditure from metabolic cart test
Definition: Resting energy expenditure (REE) can be measured with indirect calorimetry using a metabolic cart, which is used to measure the oxygen consumption (VO2) and carbon dioxide production (VCO2).
Synonyms: Abnormal metabolic cart test

Definition: Abnormal blood test results measuring creatine kinase (CK), CK-MB, troponin (TROPI), myoglobin, and/or cardiac enzymes.

Term: Reduced brain gamma-aminobutyric acid level by MRS
Definition: An decreased level of gamma-aminobutyric acid in the brain identified by magnetic resonance spectroscopy (MRS).
A deviation from the normal concentration of dehydroepiandrosterone in the circulation.
Synonyms: Abnormal serum androstenolone level, Abnormal serum dehydroepiandrosterone level, Abnormal serum DHEA

Definition: Absence of shoulder muscles.
Synonyms: Absent shoulder muscle

Term: Aplasia of the musculature of the pelvis
Definition: Absence of the musculature of the pelvis.

Term: Hypoplasia of the musculature of the pelvis
Definition: Underdevelopment of the musculature of the pelvis.
Congenital absence of the colon
Synonyms: Absence of the colon, Aplasia of the colon

Definition: Deposition of large, diffuse cotton wool amyloid plaques (CWPs) lacking a dense core and associated neuritic changes.
Synonyms: CWPs

Definition: Change in normal glycogen storage content.
An elevation in bone density in one or more carpal bones of the hand.
Abnormality of the structure and branching of the dendrites of a neuron.
Synonyms: Aberrant neuronal branching, Abnormal neuronal branching

Definition: Any abnormality in the proportion natural killer subsets relative to the total number of natural killer cells.
Blockage of the nasolacrimal sac.
A mass of granulation tissue in response to chronic dacryocystitis as polypoid formations or they follow accidental injury, from probing and as a reaction to retained foreign bodies in the sac.
Benign tumor of the nasolacrimal sac.
The malignant epithelial neoplasm with papillary growths in the nasolacrimal sac.
An abnormality of the conjuctiva and ocular surface caused by conjunctival inflammation and associated with scarring.
Synonyms: Cicatricial conjunctivitis, Cicatrizating conjunctivitis, Conjunctival cicatricial conjunctivitis

Definition: A benign tumor composed of adipose tissue and dense connective tissue usually located near the temporal fornix.
Synonyms: Conjunctival lipodermoid

Definition: A condition where one or both of the two principal meridians focus in the front of the retina when the eye is at rest.
A term to describe when farsightedness is masked when the accommodative muscles are used to increase the focusing power of the eye.
Synonyms: Latent hyperopia

Definition: With the eyes in primary position, the sclera is visible above the superior corneal limbus.
An elevation of the eyelid above the normal level in the primary position.
A unilateral or bilateral eyelid retraction due to midbrain lesions.
Inflamation of the eyelid due to overactivity of the sebaceous gland.
A type of lymphoma that involves the nasolacrimal sac.
A very common condition in which the extreme end of the nasolacrimal duct underneath the inferior turbinate fails to complete its canalization in the newborn period.
An avascular or abnormally vascularized retina that occurs in premature infants and can lead to blindness.
The retinal vessels stop and then a linear flat white line is present that usually runs the circumference of the vascular retina.
Synonyms: ROP stage 1

Definition: The accumulating neovascularization thickens and manifests as a linear bump. The neovascularization remains along the surface of the retina and does not extend off the retina into the cortical vitreous.
Synonyms: ROP stage 2

Definition: The neovascularization accumulates at the edge of the vascularized retina and extends into the vitreous (also called extra retinal fibrosis proliferation). In cases of Zone 2 and Zone 3, this may be sausage shaped. In more posterior Zone 1 disease, the stage 3 can appear as a direct extension of the normal retinal vessels but extending tangentially over the avascular retina.
Synonyms: ROP stage 3

Definition: Scar tissue that forms a continuous sheet coming up from the edge of the vascularized retina. This scar tissue can grow toward the vitreous base/posterior lens capsule resulting in traction, distortion, and even detachment.
Synonyms: ROP stage 4

Definition: A detachment that involves the peripheral retina that does not extend into the macula.
Synonyms: ROP stage 4a

Definition: A detachment that involves the peripheral retina that involves the macula itself. The detachment usually starts in the temporal periphery although can also involve the nasal retina as well.
Synonyms: ROP 4b

Definition: Funnel detachment from the retina with generally traction in all four quadrants.
Synonyms: ROP stage 5

Definition: An open funnel detachment of the retina with generally traction in all four quadrants.
Synonyms: ROP stage 5a

Definition: A closed funnel detachment of the retina with generally traction in all four quadrants.
Synonyms: ROP stage 5b

Definition: Retinopathy which extends from the center of the optic disc to twice the distance from the center of the optic disc to the center of the macula.
Synonyms: ROP zone 1

Definition: Retinopathy which extends centrifugally from the edge of zone I to the nasal ora serrata.
Synonyms: ROP zone II

Definition: Retinopathy which is a residual crescent of retina anterior to zone II.
Synonyms: ROP zone III

Definition: Venous dilatation and arteriolar tortuosity of the posterior retinal vessels and may later increase in severity to include iris vascular engorgement, poor pupillary dilatation (rigid pupil), and vitreous haze. This definition has been further refined in the later clinical trials in which the diagnosis of plus disease could be made if sufficient vascular dilatation and tortuosity are present in at least 2 quadrants of the eye.
Synonyms: ROP plus

Definition: As vascular abnormalities of the posterior pole that are insufficient for the diagnosis of plus disease but that demonstrate more arterial tortuosity and more venous dilatation than normal.
Synonyms: ROP pre-plus

Definition: A retinopathy with a 50% likelihood of progressing to retinal detachment. Threshold disease is considered to be present when stage 3 retinopathy of prematurity (ROP) is present in either zone I or zone II, with at least 5 continuous or 8 total clock hours of disease, and the presence of plus disease.
Synonyms: ROP threshold

Definition: High risk patients who were in Zone 1 (no Plus or stage 3) or Zone 2 with Plus or stage 3 but not both.
Synonyms: ROP prethreshold

Definition: The difference between total and manifest myopia.
A type of ectropion associated with orbicularis muscle weakness caused by cranial nerve VII palsy.

A conjuctival lesion composed of adipose tissue and dense connective tissue. Such choristomas of dermal elements are normally found at the outer canthus, and have a gelatinous appearance. Classically, there is an indistinct posterior border (with the lesion frequently extending into the orbit) and a well-demarcated anterior border several millimetres posterior to the limbus.
Eccentric fixation in which the angle of eccentricity equals the objective angle of deviation.
Any deviation from the normal ocular alignment.
An incomitant tendency for an occluded eye to elevate and extort which resolves on uncovering.
A change in horizontal ocular alignment, unrelated to accommodation, that is brought about solely by a change in the balance of visual input from the two eyes.
A type of vertical tropia in which, when one eye is fixing, the other eye is deviated upwards.
A type of vertical phoria in which, in dissociation, the occluded eye deviates upwards.
A type of vertical tropia in which, when one eye is fixing, the other eye is deviated downwards.
A type of vertical phoria in which, in dissociation, the occluded eye deviates downwards.

The term pseudophakia refers to having an artificial lens implanted after the natural eye lens has been removed. During cataract surgery the natural cloudy lens is replaced by an pseudophakia intraocular lens (IOL).
Having a characteristic appearance of a slate gray area of pigmentation within the disc margins that commonly appears along the inferotemporal or temporal neuroretinal rim areas.
Synonyms: Optic nerve grey crescent, Temporal gray pigmentary crescent, Temporal grey pigmentary crescent

Definition: Thinning in the layers of the retina and retinal pigment epithelium around the optic nerve.
Loss of pigment in the fovea centralis.
A benign tumour of meningothelial cells of the meninges that usually occurs in middle age. It is typically unilateral and there is an association with neurofibromatosis type 2.
A capillary hemangioma surrounding the eyeball but within the orbit.
Synonyms: Peri-ocular capillary hemangioma

Definition: A hamartoma of lymph vessels that usually presents in childhood. It tends to increase in size with head-down posture and with the Valsalva manoeuvre. Superficial lesions are visible as transilluminable cystic spaces of the lid or conjunctiva that may also contain blood. Deep lesions may cause gradual proptosis or present acutely with orbital pain and reduced vision due to haemorrhage.

A mesenchymal tumour that is considered to be the commonest primary orbital malignancy in children. Histologically, it may be differentiated into embryonal, alveolar, and pleomorphic types. It is usually intraconal or within the superior orbit.

Primary food allergies primarily occur as a result (most likely) of gastrointestinal sensitization to predominantly stable food allergens (glycoproteins). A secondary food allergy develops after primary sensitization to airborne allergens (e. g., pollen allergens) with subsequent reactions (due to cross-reactivity) to structurally related often labile allergens in (plant) foods.
Synonyms: Food allergy, IgE-mediated food allergy, Immunoglobulin E-mediated food allergy

Definition: Latex allergy is an IgE-mediated immediate hypersensitivity response to natural rubber latex (NRL) protein with a variety of clinical signs ranging from contact urticaria, angioedema, asthma, and anaphylaxis.
Food-induced anaphylaxis is a severe, potentially fatal, systemic allergic reaction that occurs suddenly after contact with an allergy-causing food.
A form of anaphylaxis that is triggered by exposure to venom.
Presence of xenobiotic in stool.
Presence of a xenobiotic in meconium.
Presence of xenobiotic in hair.
Presence of a xenobiotic in plasma and/or serum.
Presence of a xenobiotic in gastric fluid.
Abnormal decrease in diastolic blood pressure.
Synonyms: Decreased diastolic BP, Reduced diastolic blood pressure

Definition: Abnormal decrease in systolic blood pressure.
Synonyms: Decreased systolic BP, Reduced systolic blood pressure

Definition: Elevated systolic blood pressure without an elevated blood pressure.
A decrease in diastolic blood pressure (<60 mmHg) without a decrease in systolic blood pressure (> or = to 100 mmHg).
Detection of cocaine or its major metabolite, benzoylecgonine, in urine.
Detection of barbiturate metabolites such as Phenobarbital in urine.
Detection of delta-9-tetrahydrocannabinol (THC) or other cannabinoid metabolites in urine.
Synonyms: Positive urine marijuana test, Postive urine pot test

Definition: Detection of benzodiazepine metabolites, primarily nordiazepam, oxazepam, and temazepam, in urine.
Detection of amphetamine or its metabolites in urine.
Detection of opioids or opioid metabolites in urine.
Abnormal concentration of urobilinogen present in the stool.
An increased amount of urobilinogen present in the stool.
Detection of barbiturate metabolites such as Phenobarbital in blood.
Abnormal concentration of urate in the cerebrospinal fluid (CSF).
A decreased amount of valine in the blood.
Synonyms: Low blood valine concentration

Definition: An decreased concentration of tyrosine in the blood.
Synonyms: Decreased tyrosine in blood, Low blood tyrosine concentration

Definition: An increased amount of tryptophan in the blood.
Synonyms: High blood tryptophan concentration, Increased tryptophan in blood

Definition: A decreased amount of tryptophan in the blood.
Synonyms: Decreased tryptophan in blood, Low blood tryptophan concentration

Definition: A decreased amount of threonine in the blood.
Synonyms: Decreased circulating threonine levels, Decreased threonine blood levels, Low blood threonine concentration

Definition: An increased amount of serine in the blood.
Synonyms: Elevated circulating serine levels, High blood serine levels, Increased serine blood concentration

Definition: A decreased amount of proline in the blood.
Synonyms: Decreased blood proline levels, Low blood proline concentration

Definition: A decreased amount of hydroxyproline in the blood.
Synonyms: Decreased hydroxyproline in the blood, Low level of hydroxyproline in the blood

Definition: A decreased amount of phenylalanine in the blood.
Synonyms: Decreased blood phenylalanine, Low blood phenylalanine

Definition: A decreased amount of lysine in the blood.
Synonyms: Decreased blood lysine, Low blood lysine levels

Definition: Decreased amount of leucine in the blood.
Synonyms: Decreased blood concentration of leucine, Low blood leucine levels

Definition: A decreased amount of isoleucine in the blood.
Synonyms: Decreased blood isoleucine concentration, Low blood isoleucine levels

Definition: A decreased amount of histidine in the blood.
Synonyms: Decreased blood histidine concentration, Low blood histidine levels

Definition: Decreased amount of glutamine in the blood.
Synonyms: Decreased blood glutamine concentration, Low blood glutamine level

Definition: Any deviation from the normal concentration of glutamate in the blood circulation.
Synonyms: Abnormality of glutamate metabolism

Definition: An increased amount of glutamate in the blood.
Synonyms: High blood glutamate levels, Increased blood glutamate concentration

Definition: A decreased amount of glutamate in the blood.
Synonyms: Decreased blood glutamate concentrations, Low blood glutamate levels

Definition: An increased amount of cystine in the blood.
Synonyms: High blood cystine levels, Increased blood cystine concentraions

Definition: A decreased amount of cystine in the blood.
Synonyms: Decreased blood cystine concentration, Low blood cystine levels

Definition: An increased amount of arginine levels in the blood.
Synonyms: High blood arginine levels, Increased blood arginine concentration

Definition: A decreased amount of alanine in the blood.
Synonyms: Decreased blood alanine concentration, Low blood alanine levels

Definition: Any deviation from the normal concentration of asparagine in the blood circulation.
Synonyms: Abnormality of asparagine metabolism

Definition: An increased amount of asparagine in the blood.
Synonyms: High blood asaparagine levels, Increased blood asparagine concentration

Definition: A decreased amount of asparagine in the blood.
Synonyms: Decreased blood asparagine concentration, Low blood asparagine levels

Definition: Any deviation from the normal concentration of aspartate in the blood circulation.
Synonyms: Abnormal circulating aspartate concentration

Definition: An increased concentration of aspartic acid in the blood circulation.
Synonyms: High blood aspartic acid levels, Increased blood aspartic acid, Increased level of circulating aspartic acid

Definition: Any deviation from the normal concentration of carnosine in the blood circulation.
Synonyms: Abnormality of carnosine metabolism

Term: Increased level of carnosine in blood
Definition: An increased amount of carnosine in the blood.
Synonyms: High blood carnosine levels, Increased blood carnosine concenrtation

Term: Decreased level of carnosine in blood
Definition: A decreased amount of carnosine in bood.
